title: Apply Amazon’s DevOps culture to your team
description: In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon helps its developers rapidly release and iterate software while maintaining industry-leading standards on security, reliability, and performance. Learn about the culture of two-pizza teams and how to maintain a culture of DevOps in a large enterprise. Also, discover how to help build such a culture at your own organization.
tags: DevSecOps; DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

Attendees will learn real-world use cases demonstrating significant time and cost savings compared to manual approaches. Whether you're looking to streamline API upgrades, migrate frameworks, or enforce coding standards, this session will provide a glimpse into the future of scalable, automated code transformations.

description: AWS provides services that enable the creation, deployment and maintenance of application infrastructure in a programmatic, descriptive, and declarative way. These services provide rigor, clarity, and reliability to application development. Join this session to learn about the new features and improvements for AWS infrastructure as code with AWS CloudFormation and AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) and discover how they can benefit your team.

tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Build trustworthy AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails [REPEAT]
description: Discover how Automated Reasoning checks in Amazon Bedrock Guardrails enhance the trustworthiness of AI applications. In this workshop, we will showcase the synergy between automated reasoning and generative AI to create highly reliable systems, delivering up to 99% verification accuracy. Through hands-on exercises, learn to use the Automated Reasoning checks console and APIs to create and refine policies, then use them to validate your AI application outputs. Dive into a customer support assistant use case that combines various Amazon Bedrock features, including Knowledge Bases, Flows, and Guardrails, to deliver robust and trustworthy solutions.

description: In this hands-on session, attendees will explore how AI can transform a software development team’s work. Attendees will learn how AI agents integrate seamlessly with existing tools and workflows, leveraging deep contextual understanding to tackle challenges like technical debt, performance optimization, and operational campaigns. We'll cover the key features that enable transparent collaboration, continuous learning, and adaptive automation. Attendees will leave with an understanding of how AI-driven development tools can revolutionize the software delivery lifecycle. Whether you're a developer, engineering manager, or technology leader, this session will show you the future of autonomous software development.

Most developers spend less than an hour per day writing code. So why do focus so much attention on using AI to write code faster? In this session you will learn how Amazon Q Developer can help you with every stage of the SDLC.

title: Generative AI Architecture Rodeo
description: Ready for a high stakes architectural challenge? The challenge: design a production ready system using AWS Generative AI services to ingest and process millions of multilingual documents spanning invoices, purchase orders, financial statements and more. Your solution must minimize hallucinations, meet strict privacy requirements, and deliver an end-to-end pipeline for validation and processing by integrating with various enterprise systems. Learn how to boost inference, enforce governance, ensure resiliency, and optimize costs in globally compliant architectures. Teams will be formed onsite, where AWS Subject matter experts will guide you through a gamified live challenge to design and build solutions where trade-offs deciding the ultimate Rodeo championship team.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Textract
tags: Business Intelligence; Generative AI; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Data Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Breaking down data silos and unifying data across numerous data sources is a challenging task. AWS is changing the future of analytics with zero-ETL data integration and query federation across different sources, services, applications, and multi-cloud environments. Join us to dive deep into how AWS zero-ETL approaches can help you simplify your data integration landscape.  Find out how you can perform analytics and machine learning without moving or transforming your data.
services: Amazon SageMaker; AWS Glue; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Mastering automated, zero-downtime software deployments
description: Unlock the power of seamless, risk-free deployments with this insightful chalk talk. Discover how to leverage AWS services like AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS AppConfig to automate safe, hands-off deployments to Amazon EC2, Amazon ECS, and AWS Lambda across multiple accounts and Regions at scale. Explore zero-downtime deployment strategies and learn best practices for reducing risk when deploying to AWS. Whether you’re a seasoned DevOps professional or just starting your cloud journey, this talk equips you with the tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes, ensuring reliability and minimizing disruptions.
services: AWS AppConfig; AWS CodeBuild; AWS CodePipeline
tags: DevSecOps; DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Maximizing uptime: Itaú’s mission-critical mainframe migration to AWS
description: Dive deep into Itaú Bank's implementation for migrating core banking authorization from mainframe to AWS, targeting 1,000 TPS per account with sub-100ms latency. As one of Latin America's largest banks serving 98 million clients and processing 100 million daily transactions, Itaú will share advanced Amazon DynamoDB optimization strategies, partitioning patterns, and anti-patterns. Learn practical solutions for managing concurrent transactions through exclusive threading models, cell-based architecture with account sharding, and distributed consistency approaches for high-volume financial workloads. We'll examine techniques for maintaining 99.99% uptime while ensuring transaction accuracy and balance consistency, and explore parallel system validation strategies for seamless migration execution.
speakers: Eduardo Bortoluzzi; Edinei Piovesan; Wilson de Oliveira
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
tags: Resilience; Customer Enablement; Architecture; Data Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Modernize CI/CD with GitHub and AWS CodePipeline
description: In this workshop, learn how to build modern continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines using GitHub and AWS CodePipeline through the AWS Management Console. Learn how to work with monorepos and branching strategies. Explore advanced features such as automatic rollbacks, pipeline parameters, stage level conditions, and concurrent execution modes to improve your pipeline performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-account and multi-region deployments at scale
description: Many AWS customers are implementing multi-account strategies to more easily manage their cloud infrastructure and improve their security and compliance postures. In this chalk talk, learn about various options for deploying resources into multiple accounts and AWS regions using various tools.
tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Multi-Agent Collaboration with Amazon Bedrock Agentcore for Advanced SecOps
description: In this code talk session, we'll explore how multi-agent collaboration powered by Amazon Bedrock Agentcore transforms security and vulnerability management for SecOps teams. We'll demonstrate how specialized agents working in concert can automate vulnerability assessment and building remediation patches using AgenticAI. Through practical code examples, we'll show how to architect a resilient security system where agents share context on vulnerabilities, identified servers that are potentially impacted and create remediation artifacts to deploy the changes. Join us to learn how this approach reduces response times, improves threat intelligence, and creates a more robust security posture through intelligent agent orchestration.
tags: Generative AI; DevSecOps; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; New to AWS; Interactive

Join this talk to learn how GitHub with Q Developer can take your development processes to the next level.

title: Simplify cloud infrastructure creation with the AWS CDK
description: AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) is an open source software development framework for defining cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation. In this chalk talk, we’ll explore AWS CDK and how it can simplify infrastructure creation. Through code examples and diagrams, see how AWS CDK lets you use familiar programming languages for declarative infrastructure definition. Learn about the levels of the CDK constructs and how to use powerful higher-level abstractions to provision complex application architecture.
tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Test your web and mobile applications with AWS Device Farm
description: AWS Device Farm is an application testing service that helps you improve the quality of your web and mobile applications by testing them across an extensive range of desktop browsers and real mobile devices without having to provision and manage any testing infrastructure. This workshop provides hands-on guidance for software engineers, quality assurance engineers, software testers, platform engineers, and architects on how to get started using Device Farm to test your applications hosted in the AWS Cloud. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Innovation & Transformation; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Top Tips for Getting the Most Out of AWS CloudFormation
description: AWS CloudFormation helps you manage your AWS infrastructure as code, increasing automation and supporting infrastructure-as-code best practices. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into the topic of optimizing your experience with AWS CloudFormation. Learn about several more recently added capabilities and best practices designed to improve productivity and accelerate your dev/test cycle for rapid infrastructure-as-code development. Whether you're a seasoned DevOps professional or earlier in your AWS CloudFormation journey, this session will equip you with new tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes.
speakers: Kevin DeJong; Kawsar Kamal; Momo Kornher
tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: What’s new in fullstack AWS app development
description: Web developers need to deliver differentiating experiences to more users faster than ever before. To build secure, reliable, and scalable applications at 10x speed requires solutions that empower developers to get started easily, ship quickly, and iterate rapidly. In this breakout, we'll share exciting updates on how AWS Amplify is evolving to meet the needs of modern 10x web developers.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: .NET cloud journey: Migration & modernization strategies
description: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore proven strategies for migrating and modernizing .NET applications on AWS. We'll sketch architectural patterns ranging from Windows rehosting to cloud-native transformations using containers and serverless. Navigate the AWS service landscape for different .NET workloads through real-world examples that balance performance, scalability, and cost. Come prepared with your questions — we'll collaboratively design AWS architectures based on your requirements.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Containers; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: A complete guide to Amazon EVS: Unlock AWS scale for VMware workloads
description: Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) is your fastest path to run VMware workloads on AWS, eliminating the need to replatform or refactor. Discover how Amazon EVS helps you unlock AWS scale and agility while maximizing existing VMware investments and skillsets. Explore core building blocks and guidance on self-managing or leveraging AWS Partners for your environments. We'll cover strategies for customizing your virtualization stack in the cloud, including integration with storage, backup, and disaster recovery solutions. Through a live demo, we'll showcase intuitive deployment workflows and share the latest service innovations to provide you with more choice and flexibility.
services: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP; Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC); Amazon Elastic VMware Service (EVS)
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; VMware; Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: A day in the life of an AWS WAF administrator
description: From sunrise alerts to sunset cost reports, the AWS WAF administrator’s day is never dull. Join us as we follow a fictional (but all-too-relatable) admin navigating setup, fine-tuning rules, building dashboards, and taming budgets - while outsmarting emerging threats before they bite. You’ll see how to adapt quickly to shifting traffic, uncover hidden risks, and make data-driven decisions without breaking the bank - or the application. Packed with tips, real-world examples, and a dash of bot traffic, this session turns the daily grind of web application protection into a well-architected adventure (edited)
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Advertising & Marketing; Professional Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: A decade of API Gateway: Architecting the future of API Management
description: As organizations integrate AI agents with existing systems, they must revisit strategies for API building, management, and governance. This session demonstrates how AWS services and features help implement effective API strategies throughout the complete lifecycle, highlighting key considerations at each stage and tools available to ensure successful implementation. We'll cover practical approaches in API design, development, and management to address the needs of both traditional users and AI agents. You will learn real-world implementation patterns and tools that ensure successful API management and governance in environments where agents interact alongside human developers.
tags: Generative AI; Serverless; Application Integration; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

description: ML teams often struggle with fragmented tools and disconnected solutions that slow down AI development. title: A leaders guide to accelerating large-scale migration
description: In this session, hear about a simplified and streamlined approach to cloud migration based on real-world experience leading successful all-in migrations to AWS and guiding hundreds of other organizations on their enterprise migration journeys. Get insight that seeks to challenge conventional wisdom, and hear about what’s been proven to work as well as some common pitfalls to avoid. Learn how you can help get employees invested, create forcing functions for innovation, and build accountability, while managing uncertainty and achieving a faster, cheaper, and more efficient migration process. The time to migrate is now.
tags: Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to achieving compliance through software excellence
description: Traditional software development often resembles a manufacturing assembly line, where code passes from one developer to the next, creating idle time and fragmented documentation that fails to meet modern compliance demands. Modern application development offers a better way to simultaneously enhance productivity and satisfy regulatory requirements. Through integrated tooling and practices—including Git version control and automated testing—organizations can maximize developer productivity while naturally producing documentary proof that serves as compliance evidence. This session features real-world examples from leaders who have successfully leveraged these practices to meet critical compliance standards (FDA 21 CFR Part 11, ISO 13485, GMP Annex 11).
tags: Culture of Security; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to advanced mental models and mechanisms
description: To build a lasting, performant corporate culture, you need not only strong mental models to guide your employees and help them make decisions but also the right mechanisms to operationalize company values and mental models—and to help them persist. This session examines why organizational culture erodes over time, dives into the organizational artifacts that reinforce existing cultural patterns, and shares some of the best practices that help create strong mechanisms, using examples from Amazon’s own journey.
tags: Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to advanced team structures in an agentic world
description: As AI agents transform the workplace, organizations must adapt their structures and methodologies to harness new opportunities. The probabilistic nature of AI requires continuous iteration and intelligent oversight, creating new ways of working across business functions. To thrive, organizations must combine clear capability assessment with agile planning while leveraging their unique domain expertise and data assets. This keynote explores how leadership is evolving to meet these needs, covering new organizational models and roles that coordinate human-AI hybrid teams. Leaders will learn strategies for balancing rapid decision-making with strategic oversight, finding the optimal mix of centralized guidance and decentralized innovation.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to agentic AI
description: In a landscape of rapid AI evolution and daily headlines, senior leaders need clarity on what Agentic AI means for their business. This session cuts through the noise to provide a practical understanding of autonomous AI agents and their strategic implications for your organization. We will demystify Agentic AI and focus on what matters most to leaders. We will share how both management and architecture models will need to evolve to get value out of the autonomous AI systems.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to AI powered FinOps
description: The convergence of FinOps principles and generative AI is providing  organizations new ways they better manage cloud spending and investment strategises.  This session will discuss how organizations  are  successfully  deploying  generative AI to automate anomaly detection, enhance resource allocation, and convert complex cloud financial data into actionable insights. Attendees will learn practical strategies for implementing AI-driven FinOps practices, measuring ROI on generative AI investments, and developing a comprehensive roadmap for intelligent cloud cost management.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Advisor / Consultant; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to AI strategy and implementation
description: As generative and agentic AI transform business models, leaders must architect new operating models that bridge technology capabilities with business value. This advanced session reveals proven approaches for scaling AI from experiments to enterprise-wide value creation. Learn to shape AI-driven business strategies, design advanced decision systems, and build governance frameworks that accelerate adoption while managing risk. Leaders will leave with practical guidance to orchestrate AI capabilities and organizational transformation, execute their vision, drive innovation, and deliver quantifiable returns through scaled AI deployment.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to cloud-native application modernization
description: Legacy applications run mission-critical processes, but increasingly limit innovation and organizational agility through outdated architectures. This session equips leaders with frameworks to refactor applications into cloud-native solutions while preserving business operations. Successful modernization requires answering strategic questions: why modernize, at what cost, how to modernize, what risks exist, and when to act. Learn how to define scope, prioritize features, and reskill teams through proven organizational models. Discover adaptive governance that replace traditional project management to deliver incremental value while managing inherent modernization risks. Leaders will explore how generative AI accelerates application analysis and migration, reducing modernization timelines.
speakers: Matthias Patzak; Sree Ratnasinghe; Trey Tharp
tags: Architecture; Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to data strategy in the era of agentic AI
description: In Formula 1, victories depend on turning millions of data points into winning decisions. Organizations can apply this same precision to unlock value from underutilized data assets. Drawing from F1's model, we present a three-part framework for data excellence: customer-focused decisions, dynamic people- powered strategies, and market-responsive structures. Learn practical approaches to evolve your data strategy into a business advantage in the AI era.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to emerging technologies: From insight to rapid action
description: Your executive team is asking about agentic AI, quantum computing, and edge systems. Will you be caught on the back-foot, or are you ready with insights and a strategic roadmap? This session moves beyond definitions, offering a systematic framework for technology leaders to proactively evaluate, prioritize, and act on emerging innovations. Learn to build a dynamic technology radar tailored to your business objectives and implement a practical 90-day plan to move from insight to execution. Using real-world examples, this guide will help you shift from a reactive responder to a strategic advisor who anticipates disruption and drives competitive advantage.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A leaders guide to navigating multicloud strategies and decisions
description: As organizations seek to accelerate their cloud migration and transformation, some find themselves in situations where they have to manage IT operations in a multicloud environment, or simply decide whether and how to adopt a multicloud strategy in the first place. Leaders must consider how operating multiple cloud environments impacts business outcomes and their ability to innovate.  In this session, the AWS Enterprise Strategy team will share unique insights and prescriptive guidance for successfully navigating multicloud decisions and difficulties gleaned from thousands of engagements with leading organizations and extensive research into how multicloud impacts cloud adoption and transformation.
tags: Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Business Executive; IT Executive; Senior Leaders; Lecture-style

title: A modern approach to application migration with Amazon VPC Lattice
description: Modernizing legacy apps? It doesn't have to be a "big bang". Discover how to use Amazon VPC Lattice and AWS services to drive a smooth, step-by-step migration. Learn proven patterns for breaking down monoliths into microservices without disrupting your business. Through real-world examples, we will  explore secure communication, multi-account setups. We will show how IP overlap is easily handled, and may even be an asset for Amazon EKS cluster upgrades.
speakers: Yécine Allouache; Jamie Wenzel; Ryan McDonough
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Innovation & Transformation; Application Integration; Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: A new dawn for operations: More intelligent, secure, and efficient
description: The recent shifts in technology have created both opportunities and challenges, with organizations asking: how can we leverage generative AI to improve operational efficiency, manage workloads across AWS, multicloud, and hybrid environments, and improve security? Join us to discover the latest operations innovations, designed with cutting-edge technologies, to help you enhance application performance, reduce costs, automate governance and compliance, strengthen security posture, and achieve greater resilience across environments. Through demos and customer spotlights, learn how you can transform your operations to become more intelligent, secure, and efficient.
tags: Cloud Operations; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: A practical guide for meeting regulatory resilience requirements
description: Organizations worldwide must demonstrate their operational resilience to meet regulatory requirements like DORA, NIS2, and RegSCI. These regulations are aimed at ensuring organizations have incident detection and disaster recovery plans to prevent disruptions and maintain business continuity. In this chalk talk, you'll learn how to use AWS services to assess and prove your compliance in regulated industries like financial services and healthcare. We'll explore practical applications of the D-CAT tool, AWS Fault Injection Service experiment reports, resilience assessments in AWS Resilience Hub, and live dashboards in Amazon Application Recovery Controller  to help you evaluate and document your regulatory readiness.
services: AWS Fault Injection Service; AWS Resilience Hub; Amazon Application Recovery Controller
tags: Resilience; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Interactive

title: A practical guide to Amazon S3 data protection and recovery [REPEAT]
description: Learn step-by-step methods to protect your critical Amazon S3 data against accidental deletion, ransomware, and corruption. This chalk talk provides hands-on guidance for implementing essential safeguards through S3 Versioning, Cross-Region Replication, and Object Lock configurations. You’ll get practical examples to immediately strengthen your data protection strategy, from lifecycle policies to advanced immutability controls, and learn how you can achieve rapid recoverability from any scenario at any scale. Whether you’re meeting compliance requirements or ensuring business continuity, you’ll leave with actionable steps to build a robust defense for your S3 environment.
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Resilience; Security & Identity; Storage; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Learn step-by-step methods to protect your critical Amazon S3 data against accidental deletion, ransomware, and corruption. title: A practical guide to implement cost-effective governance controls
description: This chalk talk shows you how to reduce operational costs while maintaining robust security and compliance monitoring. Learn proven strategies to optimize your implementations without compromising governance. Through real-world scenarios, discover how organizations successfully reduced monitoring costs while meeting compliance requirements using services like AWS Config and AWS CloudTrail. Walk away with actionable best practices for building cost-effective, scalable architectures. Bring your questions!
speakers: Nicole Klatt; Shivam Patel; Pawel Zawadzki
tags: Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: A practitioner’s guide to data for agentic AI
description: In this session, gain the skills needed to deploy end-to-end agentic AI applications using your most valuable data. This session focuses on data management using processes like Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and provides concepts that apply to other methods of customizing agentic AI applications. Discover best practice architectures using AWS database services like Amazon Aurora and OpenSearch Service, along with analytical, data processing and streaming experiences found in SageMaker Unified Studio. Learn data lake, governance, and data quality concepts and how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Bedrock Knowledge Bases, and other features tie solution components together.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon Bedrock; Amazon OpenSearch Service
tags: Agentic AI; Analytics; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: A strategic guide to AWS compute options for your AI/ML workload
description: AWS offers high performaing GPU instances for AI workload, including g6 optimized for vision workloads, g5 and g6e optimized for LLM inference, p4 and p5 optimized for model training, and the latest p6 optimized for large scale training and inference. Choosing the right GPUs is important for the performance, cost, and scalability of any AI project. In this talk, we will dive deeper into the architectural differentiators, including TFLOPs, memory capacity and bandwidth, the role of specialized cores, and the impact of data precision on both training and inference. You will learn practical frameworks for matching GPUs to specific tasks.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Interactive

title: A tale of two transactions
description: If you are curious how transactions are processed differently in Amazon Aurora DSQL versus Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, join Marc Brooker, AWS VP and Distinguished Engineer, as he dives into how transactions are processed in these two databases – right down to the code level. You’ll understand how each database handles multiple transactions accessing or changing the data at the same time, why they use different approaches, and what that means for your architectures. You’ll leave with a deep intuition for what makes database workloads scale and ability to think about how to apply those lessons to your architectures and code.
services: Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL; Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Accelerate & automate secure data transfers at scale with AWS DataSync
description: Accelerate your cloud journey by moving your data to AWS quickly and securely with AWS DataSync. In this session, discover best practices for how to move your data at scale with increased performance. Hear a success story from PathAI, an AWS customer whose platform enables AI-powered digital pathology solutions, and learn how they used DataSync to build scalable AI workflows across a global network of hospitals and labs.
speakers: Jeff Bartley; Tugba Goksel; Aditya Dhoot
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Accelerate .NET application modernization with generative AI
description: Dreading the complexity and costs of migrating legacy .NET applications? Learn how you can automate and offload tedious manual tasks and port .NET Framework applications to cross-platform .NET using generative AI. Break free of the security issues, rising license costs, and challenges with scaling -- all while freeing your teams to focus on high-impact features that deliver business value.
speakers: Rafa Reyes; Derek Desjardins; Ryan Purugganan; Venugopalan Vasudevan; Matt Dimich
tags: Innovation & Transformation; DevOps; Developer Tools; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Accelerate AI model fine-tuning and deployment with SageMaker HyperPod [REPEAT]
description: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod accelerates FM development through purpose-built infrastructure. In this session, learn how to leverage HyperPod recipes for efficient LLM customization and use inference operators to deploy models on EKS clusters. Walk through fine-tuning a Llama 8B model using optimized recipes, eliminating weeks of manual configuration, then deploy from S3 using vLLM container while setting up autoscaling and observability. Experience hands-on implementation of distributed training optimizations and simplified LLM deployment using NVIDIA GPU instances. Join us to discover how you can efficiently train, fine-tune, and deploy models on HyperPod compute resources while maximizing utilization across the entire model lifecycle.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Accelerate AI workloads with UltraServers on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod
description: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod streamlines compute and workload scheduling and management, allowing you to have access to compute resources faster and optimize spend more intelligently. In this session, we will demonstrate how, in a few quick steps, you can specify your preferred UltraServer instance type, desired amount, duration of your workload, and preferred start date and then watch HyperPod provision the infrastructure and run the workloads automatically. Learn to maximize compute resource utilization with HyperPod, and how HyperPod provides advance resiliency and maximizes performance with topology aware scheduling and comprehensive, multi-layered recovery for UltraServers.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Accelerate analytics and AI with an open and secure lakehouse architecture
description: Data lakes, data warehouses, or both? Join this session to explore how to build a unified, open, and secure data lakehouse architecture, fully compatible with Apache Iceberg, in Amazon SageMaker. Learn how the lakehouse breaks down data silos and opens your data estate offering flexibility to use your preferred query engines and tools that accelerate time to insights. Learn about recent launches that improve data interoperability and performance, and enable large language models (LLMs) and AI agents to interact with your data. Discover robust security features, including consistent fine-grained access controls, attribute-based access control, and tag-based access control that help democratize data without compromises.
services: Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

description: In this session, learn how to rapidly design and deploy APIs using Amazon Q Developer CLI, OpenAPI, and Amazon API Gateway. You'll create a complete API from scratch, leveraging AI-assisted code generation and best practices, including the use of MCP Servers. Configure advanced features like caching, rate limiting, and payload validation with simple CLI commands. Discover how Amazon Q Developer CLI streamlines the process from OpenAPI specification to fully functional API, enabling faster development and consistent deployments. Leave with practical skills to revolutionize your API creation workflow. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Leticia Dornelas; Mike Ellis; Raphael Lima; Ricardo Marques; Matthew de Anda

title: Accelerate app authorization with the latest Cedar tools  [REPEAT]
description: In 2025 Cedar released new open source tooling to help accelerate building authorization capabilities into applications. In this hands-on session you'll work directly with Cedar's latest open source tools, including a Cedar schema generator, Express and Spring Boot framework integrations, and the Cedar Analysis CLI. You'll implement policy-based authorization by building a real application, learning how to generate schemas, integrate Cedar with your preferred application framework, and validate authorization policies. Leave with practical knowledge and best practices for implementing authorization using Cedar in your own applications.
speakers: Matt Eglin; Samuel Folkes; Rickard Loefstroem; Abdu Mahmoudi; Trevor Schiavone

In addition, explore Express One Zone's unique value for analytics customers and real-world examples on caching, checkpointing, and streaming ingest workloads and performance levels.

description: As organizations migrate containerized workloads, they often face operational challenges and disruptions. Amazon EKS Auto Mode simplifies this transition, addressing common hurdles when moving to Amazon EKS. This session demonstrates how Auto Mode streamlines the shift from traditional environments or alternative orchestration solutions. Through practical examples, learn how Amazon EKS Auto Mode automates cluster provisioning, scaling, and management, enabling your team to seamlessly migrate applications rather than be tied down by infrastructure operations. title: Accelerate data discovery with object metadata in Amazon S3
description: Learn how Amazon S3 Metadata automatically generates rich metadata for your S3 objects in near real-time. We’ll show how S3 Metadata creates a queryable metadata layer that transforms how you discover and manage your data. Watch as we explore and filter objects based on attributes like object creation time and storage class to streamline data preparation for analytics, real-time inference, building automated storage dashboards, and more. Whether you’re managing large-scale data lakes or optimizing data discovery, you’ll get practical insights into metadata-driven data management.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)

title: Accelerate data migrations to AWS
description: Understanding which data to migrate—and why—is crucial for a successful migration to AWS. In this chalk talk, we’ll explore the process of data discovery and workload analysis to drive accurate, workload-aligned migration planning. Through real-world examples, we’ll examine metadata, usage pattern analysis, data locality, and data classification approaches across DAS, NAS, SAN, and hybrid environments. You'll learn how to align migration strategies with AWS storage services, ensuring the best fit for each workload while laying the foundation for your cloud journey.

title: Accelerate Drug Discovery R&D at Scale with AWS
description: 19 of the top 20 pharma companies run their compute on AWS. Drug discovery research and development (R&D) involves various techniques, such as microscopy imaging, molecular dynamics simulation, and virtual screening. These techniques require the management and processing of petabytes of data and have heterogeneous compute requirements.Researchers are also incorporating generative AI to predict protein structures and drive scientific discovery with incorporation of scientific literature findings. Come learn from the AWS Solutions Architects working daily to solve these compute problems on cloud. Bring your questions - this interactive session will dive deep into real-world solutions through whiteboarding and discussion.

title: Accelerating SaaS Data integrations with Agentic AI [REPEAT]
description: Enterprises struggle with data silos that fragment information across isolated systems, causing unreliable analytics and compliance risks. Traditional integration methods—ETL, APIs, manual mapping—suffer from inconsistencies, format conflicts, and require months of configuration. Learn how a cloud-native Agentic AI Platform on AWS, powered by Amazon Nova and Amazon Bedrock, transforms SaaS data integration from months-long manual processes to autonomous operations completed in days. We'll share architectural blueprints and actionable patterns for creating a unified single source of truth, maintaining security and governance standards, and transitioning from manual, rule-based integration to intelligent, context-aware data management that scales with growing SaaS portfolios.
tags: SaaS; Automation; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Accelerating Smart Product SDLC with Amazon Q Developer
description: Smart product developers and product managers face demands for rapid development cycles, quick response to customer needs, and continuous product improvement, all while managing the complexity of integrating hardware and software. This session showcases the capabilities of Amazon Q Developer, demonstrating an HMI system and fleet management dashboard with over 99% AI-generated code. This example illustrates how AI can enhance every aspect of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), from initial research and planning to deployment. This session explores how Amazon Q Developer brings breakthrough solutions across all SDLC phases, resulting in reduced development time, improved code quality, and accelerated innovation.
speakers: Ken Muramatsu; Tadashi Yamamoto; Kohei Yoshikawa
tags: Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Automotive; Manufacturing & Industrial; Interactive

title: Accelerating SQL Server modernization on AWS with agentic AI [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk explores how organizations can modernize their SQL Server environments on AWS by combining advanced migration strategies with the latest generative AI capabilities. Learn how AWS uses generative AI to automate and optimize complex schema conversions—rewriting stored procedures and business logic for cloud-native targets with minimal manual intervention. Engage in interactive discussions and white boarding on designing end-to-end architectures that unlock operational agility, cost savings, and next-generation AI-driven insights.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Accelerating sustainability compliance with AI-powered document review
description: Sustainability regulations require extensive documentation reviews, creating bottlenecks in compliance workflows. RAPID (Review & Assessment Powered by Intelligent Documentation) transforms this process using AI with a human-in-the-loop approach. This solution dramatically accelerates certification and regulatory compliance document reviews - processes traditionally requiring significant expert review hours. RAPID structures complex regulatory checklists, applies AI to identify compliance issues, and maintains human oversight for critical decisions. The solution's serverless architecture enables organizations to start small and scale efficiently, reducing review time while improving assessment quality. Learn how RAPID helps organizations overcome administrative barriers and focus resources on implementing sustainable practices rather than paperwork.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Lambda
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Sustainability; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Government; Manufacturing & Industrial; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Accelerating the Connected Future: EDA for the unpredictable
description: Join us to learn how BMW RemoteServices transformed their backend to a fully Serverless Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) to meet increased scaling demands and improve innovation velocity whilst maximizing cost efficiency. We share insights into the architecture supporting BMW's next generation of vehicles, Neue Klasse, and explore strategies for breaking down monolithic applications into flexible, event-driven microservices. This architecture, featuring various AWS Serverless services, demonstrates how to orchestrate loosely coupled services into discrete blocks of business logic.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Lecture-style

title: Accelerating the shift from batch to real-time streaming [REPEAT]
description: In today's fast-paced environment, timely insights from data are crucial for organizations to maintain a competitive edge and respond effectively to market and customer demands. This chalk talk explores the transformative shift from traditional batch processing to stream processing, enabling real-time data- driven decision-making. Attendees will gain insights into key streaming concepts, architectural patterns, challenges, and best practices for a seamless migration journey. Through a compelling use case demonstrating the benefits of transitioning to real-time data processing with AWS streaming services, participants will acquire a roadmap for embracing stream processing, unlocking agility, responsiveness, and competitive advantage.
services: Amazon Kinesis; Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Accelerating Vehicle Innovation: ML & HPC Best Practices
description: Discover how Toyota is transforming product development by migrating HPC and ML workloads to AWS. Partner Deloitte will showcase the customer success story and demonstrate how EC2 GPU-powered and HPC instances accelerate development cycles from months to weeks while improving performance. This session dives into architectures that enable robotics research, complex simulations, and predictive analytics for safer, more efficient engineering. Whether modernizing legacy environments or building new HPC workflows, you’ll gain practical insights into designing high-performance solutions with AWS’s latest compute innovations and best practices.
speakers: Andrea Rodolico; Francesco Ruffino; Bram De Schouwer; Ingrid Torres Lopes
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon FSx for Lustre; AWS ParallelCluster
tags: Quantum Technologies; Customer Enablement; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Manufacturing & Industrial; Interactive

title: Accelerating workload modernization using next generation agentic AI
description: This session will focus on how AWS is leveraging generative AI tools to accelerate the migration and modernization of workloads either to AWS or running on AWS. This session will explore the latest agentic AI tools from for VMware, .Net, Mainframe, Java, and SQL Server. Additionally, we will cover how these tools are enabling AWS Partners to integrate with AWS tools, and third party ISV tools.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: Achieve multicloud FinOps visibility [REPEAT]
description: Organizations with multicloud environments need to implement FinOps practices that help manage costs across cloud providers. In this session, discover how to implement unified multicloud cost reporting using the FinOps Open Cost and Usage Specification (FOCUS) Dashboard and Amazon QuickSight. Learn practical approaches for consolidating diverse billing data formats, creating automated data collection pipelines, and securing sensitive financial information. We'll demonstrate how to use visualization and AI to identify actionable insights from billing data. Walk away with strategies for data export configuration, automation, and dashboard customization techniques that help drive informed financial decisions for teams across multicloud environments.
speakers: Soham Majumder; Yuriy Prykhodko; JR Storment
tags: Cost Optimization; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: Actionable controls for improving governance and compliance
description: Organizations often struggle to translate complex regulatory requirements into practical controls while maintaining continuous compliance and security assurance. Learn how to transform compliance frameworks into actionable AWS controls through effective gap analysis and control mapping. This session shows how to leverage AWS Control Tower, AWS Security Hub, AWS Config, and AWS Audit Manager to build and maintain a scalable governance strategy. We'll explore real-world examples of mapping common controls across multiple frameworks, implementing automated compliance checks, and creating custom control deployments. Discover how to streamline compliance reporting while maintaining continuous security assurance across your AWS organization.
services: AWS Config; AWS Control Tower; AWS Organizations
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Identity & Access Management; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Active defense strategies using AWS Al/ML services [REPEAT]
description: This workshop will help you learn how to develop and deploy active defense strategies, such as deception, using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker. Gain hands-on experience developing AI-driven responses for security operations. You will learn how to develop adaptive responses that mimic what an actor may be trying use against you. Discover implementation patterns for prompt engineering, deployment strategies, and monitoring methodologies. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI

description: In this code-first session, we demonstrate how to add agentic AI capabilities and augment a legacy application using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and the Amazon Strands Agents SDK. We will showcase how to leverage existing APIs and Lambda functions as the backbone for your agentic AI experience. title: Address digital sovereignty with hybrid cloud solutions
description: As organizations scale innovative solutions globally, they need to navigate complex digital sovereignty requirements. This session explores how AWS can help you accelerate global scaling while meeting regulatory obligations. We'll compare various sovereign infrastructure options with a focus on AWS Local Zones, AWS Dedicated Local Zones, AWS Outposts, and AWS European Sovereign Cloud. Learn how to choose the best option for your sovereign needs and architect applications for data residency and resiliency. Discover how to implement security controls to regulate how data can be stored, processed, and transferred, and how to prevent unauthorized data access.
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Edge Computing; Global Infrastructure; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Government; Telecommunications; Enterprise; Interactive

description: Dive deep into advanced security architectures for AI workloads, exploring how to protect your workload against sophisticated attack vectors. Through technical demonstrations, we'll implement secure architectures for AI workloads, covering identity, fine-grained access policies, and secure foundation model deployment patterns. Learn how to harden generative and agentic AI applications using AWS security capabilities, implementing least-privilege controls, and building secure architectures at scale.
services: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Network Firewall; AWS WAF
tags: Generative AI; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Advanced authorization patterns for secure serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to tackle complex authorization challenges in multi-tenant serverless SaaS applications using modern declarative security controls on AWS. This session demonstrates how to implement efficient tenant isolation and access management using AWS Verified Permissions and Cedar policies across serverless and container architectures. Through PDP/PEP patterns, discover how to externalize security controls from application code, enabling better maintainability and scalability. We'll explore practical implementations of RBAC/ABAC policies for tenant-specific security requirements while adhering to zero-trust principles. Perfect for architects and developers building robust, scalable security controls in their SaaS applications.

title: Advanced AWS Network Security : Building Scalable Production Defenses [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, master AWS network security techniques to defend against today's most critical threats. Learn to implement layer 7 capabilities and deep packet inspection using AWS Network Firewall and Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall, securing both internet-bound and internal traffic flows. Gain practical experience in configuring scalable, reliable filtering to combat zero-day attacks and ransomware, while also implementing sophisticated east-west traffic controls to prevent lateral movement. Through real-world scenarios, you'll learn to leverage IDS/IPS filtering, domain-based controls, and principle of least privilege using fully managed AWS services. Leave equipped to build resilient network defenses against modern cyber threats.
services: Amazon GuardDuty; Amazon Route 53; AWS Network Firewall
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Advanced data modeling for Amazon ElastiCache
description: This session delves into the intricacies of Amazon ElastiCache data modeling using the purpose-built Valkey data types to optimize application performance and scalability. Explore the use of strings, sets, sorted sets, hashes, bitmaps, and geospatial indexes to model complex relationships and solve use cases such as caching, session store, feature store, real-time analytics, geospatial applications, and rate limiters.
tags: Open Data; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Advanced data modeling with Amazon DynamoDB
description: Amazon DynamoDB is a popular choice for modern applications because it’s a serverless database that provides single-digit millisecond performance at any scale. Optimizing your usage of DynamoDB requires a different approach to data modeling than traditional relational databases. In this session, AWS Data Hero Alex DeBrie shows you advanced techniques to help you get the most out of DynamoDB. Learn how to “think in DynamoDB” by learning the DynamoDB foundations and principles for data modeling. Further, learn practical strategies and DynamoDB features to handle difficult use cases in your application.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Advanced data resiliency: Recovery strategies for AWS storage [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, you'll implement advanced recovery and data protection strategies for Amazon S3, Amazon EFS, and Amazon EBS with AWS Backup. Using a financial services application architecture, build data resilience solutions and execute step-by-step recovery procedures against simulated cyber threats. Configure advanced protection mechanisms for ransomware and insider threats, then test recovery scenarios at scale. Through hands-on exercises, orchestrate complex recovery operations across multiple services, validate restored data integrity, and deploy AWS-native security features to strengthen your storage recovery capabilities.
services: Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS); Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Backup
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Agentic AI & Data Foundations Keynote
description: Join Swami Sivasubramanian, Vice President of Agentic AI, to learn how Agentic AI is poised to transform the way we live and work. In this keynote you’ll hear about the tools and services you can use to build, deploy, and run secure, reliable, and scalable agents on AWS. We will also dive deep into the engineering innovations that power your agentic systems and give you a glimpse of the future.

title: Agentic AI advancements in customer experience with Amazon Connect
description: Amazon Connect transforms routine interactions into memorable moments by seamlessly embedding AI across every customer touchpoint - built from the ground up as a unified solution that's been cloud and AI-native since day one. By driving seamless coordination between human and AI agents, it preserves context across every interaction to drive differentiated customer experiences. Join this session with Pasquale DeMaio, VP of Customer Experience, on how Amazon Connect is revolutionizing contact centers through agentic AI. Hear from your peers as they share their firsthand experience and best practices, illustrating the real-world impact and benefits of AI-powered customer service.
speakers: Pasquale DeMaio; Bamba Diouf; James Boswell; Darren Miles

title: Agentic AI beyond the cloud: Building autonomy at the edge
description: As humanity pushes the limits of remote deployments, terrestrially and extra-terrestrially, unique engineering challenges arise. The far edge can be disconnected, denied, intermittent, and limited; constraining hardware size, weight, power, and network connectivity. IWe'll explore building and deploying autonomous AI agents at the edge using small language models. Through interactive whiteboarding and hardware examples, we dive into hardware considerations, model selection, and optimization strategies for AI in resource constrained environments. Join us and learn how to tackle the unique challenges of deploying autonomous AI agents at the edge; enabling intelligent operations from the depths of remote mines to deep space.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Agentic AI for Autonomous Networks: AgentCore Design Patterns in Action [REPEAT]
description: Join us for a deep dive into design patterns that customers like BT Group are implementing to transform telecom networks into intent-driven autonomous systems. Learn how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, its services, and tools enable customers to achieve scalable session isolation, convert telemetry into agent-ready tools, maintain persistent context graphs, and provide execution transparency—essential prerequisites for production deployments at scale. We'll conclude with a whiteboarding session showcasing reference architectures that guide telecom customers toward autonomous Dark NOC operations, including closed-loop RCA, service impact analysis, predictive anomaly suppression, and closed-loop orchestration.

title: Agentic AI for Vehicle Diagnostics and Root Cause Analysis
description: In this session, attendees will learn to build an advanced multi-agent diagnostic system for automotive troubleshooting using the Generative AI Application Builder on AWS solution. Leveraging Strands Agents SDK and Model Context Protocol (MCP), participants will create collaborative AI agents that analyze vehicle data, perform diagnostics, and generate repair recommendations. The system integrates with repair manuals via Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) , estimates costs, and maintains safety guardrails. By deploying this solution with Amazon Bedrock models, attendees will experience how AI agents can revolutionize complex vehicle diagnostics, enhancing efficiency for service technicians and engineers.
speakers: Mukit Bin Momin; Simon Krol; Michael Lin; Tim Mekari; Dekshitha Ravikumar

title: Agentic AI for VMware migrations with AWS Transform for VMware
description: Accelerate your VMware migration journey with AWS Transform, the first agentic AI service for large-scale VMware workload migrations to Amazon EC2. Discover how to migrate from on-premises VMware infrastructure to a modernized, cloud-native architecture while overcoming challenges like evolving licensing models and vendor lock-in. Meet the team behind AWS Transform and see a live demonstration showcasing automated application discovery, dependency mapping, network translation, wave planning, and server migration with optimized EC2 instance selection. Learn practical approaches to streamline large-scale migrations and modernize VMware workloads to AWS with greater speed and confidence.
speakers: Patrick Kremer; Sean Lewis; Rajesh Rathod
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Transform

Whether building agent hierarchies, workflow agents, or decision engines, gain actionable guidance on making agentic AI both effective and trustworthy on AWS. title: Agentic Code Generation for Industrial Analytics and Predictive Maintenance
description: Plant floor personnel face daily challenges monitoring critical equipment in real-time. While they possess deep operational expertise, they depend on IT teams for monitoring solutions and complex data analysis - creating delays and inefficiencies. Through live coding demonstrations, this session shows how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Code Interpreter and Strands Agents enable operations teams to ask 'Analyze our motor's vibration patterns for maintenance scheduling' and watch the system generate and execute Python code using pandas, scipy, and scikit-learn for predictive analytics. We'll demonstrate IoT SiteWise data retrieval, AI-generated analytics, and MCP tools for work order creation - transforming natural language into executable machine learning that closes the operational loop without requiring data science expertise.
tags: Interactive

title: Agentic CustomerOps: Improving the SaaS service experience with AI
description:
In today's SaaS landscape, personalized customer service has become essential for business success. This interactive code talk session shows how to use Generative AI and intelligent agents to transform customer interactions in a multi-tenant SaaS platform.
We'll guide you through building a scalable system featuring specialized AI chatbots with tenant isolation and security. Using Amazon Q Developer/Kiro, you'll learn to implement critical operational metrics, analyze user engagement patterns, and deploy tenant-specific services that automatically scale with demand. Our demonstration encompasses weather services and travel booking showcasing practical applications of AI-enhanced customer service automation. 
Join us to discover how to create a secure, scalable, and intelligent customer service experience that meets the demands of modern SaaS applications.
speakers: Jean Malha; Sunil Ramachandra; Kilian Ruess
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

description: Financial institutions traditionally rely on time-consuming, manual review processes for Know Your Customer (KYC) compliance. Discover how autonomous AI agents can revolutionize KYC processes throughout the customer lifecycle, from onboarding to ongoing monitoring, by simultaneously orchestrating document verification, sanctions screening, and risk assessment. Explore practical implementation patterns for a multi-agent system using Amazon Bedrock Agents, Amazon Bedrock Data Automation, and AWS Step Functions to reduce processing time from days to hours while ensuring regulatory compliance. Dive deep into best practices for agentic AI system architectures that establish decision audit trails and explain autonomous compliance decisions to regulators.

title: Agentic tenant isolation: Securing multi-tenant agent resources
description: Agents introduce all new security considerations into the footprint of a SaaS environment. Multi-tenant agents must interact of range of resources as part of their intelligence and workflows, touching MCP servers, memory, data, tools, and models. Each of these interactions could be applying tenant context. In this chalk talk, we’ll look at how tenant context is applied to these interaction in a model that enforces tenant isolation. This gets even more complex in a multi-agent environment where our isolation must span interaction with third-party agents. The goal here is to look across these various interactions and outline strategies or applying tenant isolation policies to these different scenarios.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Agentic video summarization for autonomous content creation at scale [REPEAT]
description: Master the creation of intelligent video summarization systems using AWS agent-based architecture. Video summarization requires sophisticated analysis of visual scenes, audio cues, dialogue, and temporal context to identify compelling segments. In this session, learn to build flexible AI agents that orchestrate multimodal analysis modules, automatically adapting to different content types from news to sports. Practice implementing dynamic workflows that analyze visual, audio, and contextual elements to generate compelling summaries. Experience how this agentic AI solution eliminates rigid pipelines while enabling scalable, personalized content creation.
speakers: Vu San Ha Huynh; Wei Teh
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Tech Explorer; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Interactive

title: Agentic Workflows: How Salesforce Manages 1000+ Clusters
description: As Kubernetes environments grow increasingly complex, platform teams struggle with the escalating challenges of managing multi-tenant clusters efficiently. This session presents a groundbreaking approach to Kubernetes operations, leveraging generative AI and multi-agent collaboration to create a self-healing, intelligent cluster management system. Drawing from real-world implementations, the session will demonstrate how Salesforce were able to manage and troubleshoot over 1,000 Kubernetes clusters using intelligent agents, dramatically reducing mean time to identify (MTTI) and mean time to resolve (MTTR).

title: Agile governance: Deploy AWS Control Tower in your current environment
description: How do you extend governance over your AWS environment in production without disrupting existing workloads? AWS Control Tower is the place to set up a well-architected, multi-account environment to govern your AWS workloads, and works hand in hand with AWS Organizations. title: AI-powered troubleshooting: From chaos to Well-Architected [REPEAT]
description: In this Builders session, you will tackle a complex scenario at Unicorn Rentals, where performance issues plague a struggling application. Using Amazon Q on both console and CLI, you will troubleshoot and optimize a poorly designed architecture featuring scaling bottlenecks and database inefficiencies. Learn how to apply Well-Architected principles to enhance performance, security, and cost efficiency while maintaining service availability under pressure. You'll experience the perfect blend of technical problem-solving and practical learning as you transform Unicorn Rentals' infrastructure from architectural nightmare to cloud exemplar. This challenge emphasizes AI-assisted troubleshooting while testing your AWS optimization skills in an engaging, hands-on environment.
speakers: Maria de las Nieves Cornier; Danilo Gouveia; Rainer Moeller; Alfredo Pena; Michael Schmid; Michael Schmidt
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Well-Architected Framework; DevOps; Architecture; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: AIOps Revolution: How iHeart slashed incident response time by 60% with Bedrock
description: When performance incidents strike entertainment businesses, downtime affects reputation and revenue. Traditional troubleshooting consumes time gathering logs and coordinating remediation. Discover how iHeartMedia transformed incident response using Amazon Bedrock to build an intelligent agent monitoring alerts from NewRelic, PagerDuty, and CloudWatch, automatically collecting diagnostics and initiating EKS remediation with minimal human intervention. We'll cover implementation approaches, remediation strategies, and building AI "memory" systems. Join us to see how this approach has slashed incident response time by 60% and is advancing the future of self-healing infrastructure.
speakers: Sudipta Ghosh; Serkan Haytac; Harish Kumar Nagraj
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Generative AI; Migration & Modernization; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Lecture-style

title: Amazon AI Shopping Assistant: Key Learnings from Customer Interactions
description: Join us to explore key insights from launching and scaling Rufus, Amazon's AI-powered shopping assistant. We'll share practical lessons learned while evolving from initial deployment to supporting millions of customer interactions worldwide. Discover how we optimized inference performance, processed multimodal data, and distributed global traffic loads. Learn what worked, what didn't, and how we adapted our approach across critical areas to deliver an exceptional shopping experience.
tags: Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Interactive

title: Amazon Aurora DSQL: A developer's perspective [REPEAT]
description: In this live coding session, we'll show you how to work with Amazon Aurora DSQL from a developer's perspective. We'll develop a sample application to highlight some of the ways developing for Aurora DSQL is different than PostgreSQL. We'll cover authentication and connection management, optimistic concurrency transaction patterns, primary key selection, analyzing query performance, and best practices.
tags: Resilience; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Amazon Aurora DSQL: A developer's perspective [REPEAT]
description: In this live coding session, we'll show you how to work with Amazon Aurora DSQL from a developer's perspective. title: Amazon Aurora HA and DR design patterns for global resilience
description: Amazon Aurora is a serverless relational database with unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and DSQL. Aurora provides managed high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) capabilities in and across AWS Regions. In this session, explore the Aurora HA and DR capabilities and discover design patterns that enable the development of resilient applications. Learn how to establish in-Region and cross-Region HA and DR using Aurora features including Multi-AZ deployments and Aurora Global Database, and how Aurora DSQL multi-Region clusters provides the highest level of availability and application resilience.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore & MCP for Automated Telecom Service Assurance [REPEAT]
description: This Agentic AI system leverages Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, Strand Agents, and MCP to automate telecom service assurance through multi-agent collaboration. AgentCore's primitives—memory persistence, orchestration of multi-step tasks, gateway integration, tools and security—enable AI agents to autonomously manage network operations using service data. The system, trained on historical tickets and network metrics, autonomously detects anomalies, diagnoses issues, and orchestrates remediation with minimal human intervention. Implementation results show 30% faster ticket resolution, 40% ticket reduction, and 3% lower customer churn, addressing critical industry challenges where network issues cause 50% of service calls and contribute to 15% of customer churn.
speakers: Nameet Dutia; Sean Lambert; Rabindra Shakya; Albeda Siddique; Vijay Veggalam
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Telecommunications; Hands-on; Interactive

Learn about Bedrock Flows, design agents with knowledge bases and guardrails, and about creating inline agents for dynamic configurations. Explore multi-agent collaboration patterns and leverage AgentCore’s modular services for secure, scalable AI solutions.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Amazon Braket Hubs - Accelerating R&D in national quantum initiatives
description: Quantum computers are used to accelerate research and scientific discovery in academia. Around the world, national and regional quantum initatives are creating local quantum computing research hubs, with the goal to foster vibrant ecosystems of researchers, startups, and enterprises to accelerate the development and application of quantum technology. In this talk you will hear how AWS is working with quantum computing hubs to develop secure and scalable research environments and provide access to state-of-the-art quantum technologies.
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Amazon Braket: Get hands-on with quantum computing [REPEAT]
description: Amazon Braket provides access to quantum computing hardware and simulators to speed up scientific research and software development for quantum computing. Join this workshop to implement your first quantum algorithm and gain hands-on experience with running quantum circuits on gate-based devices and simulators. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Jagadeesh Pusapadi; Sebastian Stern; Tyler Takeshita

title: Amazon DocumentDB for expert practitioners
description: As a fully managed database service for native document data model enterprise workloads, Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) removes the undifferentiated heavy lifting of operating a database so that you can focus your time on delivering value for your customers. In this chalk talk, dive deep into the implementation details and trade-offs of features to improve compression and performance while lowering cost for various workloads.
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Amazon ECS observability patterns and design decisions [REPEAT]
description: Join us for an interactive discussion on observability solutions for Amazon ECS workloads. We'll walk through implementation patterns for ECS tasks, demonstrate getting insights from logs, and building custom dashboards. Learn how to integrate AWS X-Ray, CloudWatch Container Insights, and Amazon CloudWatch generative AI features to achieve deep visibility into your applications. We'll cover key design decisions including metric collection strategies, log correlation, trace sampling, and alerting. Bring your specific use cases as we'll workshop real-world scenarios, discuss trade-offs between different observability approaches, and share architectural best practices for debugging, tracking deployments, and optimizing resource utilization in ECS.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Fargate

Walk away with actionable insights on meeting recovery objectives and leveraging native AWS tools alongside third-party solutions for a bulletproof EFS data strategy.

title: Amazon EKS Auto Mode: Evolving Kubernetes ops to enable innovation
description: Amazon EKS Auto Mode fully automates Kubernetes cluster management for compute, storage, and networking on AWS. In this session, discover how EKS Auto Mode reduces operational complexity through automatically provisioned infrastructure, managed core add-ons, streamlined upgrades, and seamless integration with AWS services. EKS Auto Mode continuously selects optimal EC2 instance types, dynamically scales resources, and optimizes costs to efficiently utilize compute. This session includes a demo of creating new clusters, explores the latest enhancements and features, and previews upcoming capabilities. Learn how Amazon EKS Auto Mode enables teams to focus on innovation rather than cluster infrastructure management.
speakers: Alex Kestner; Sai Vennam; Daniel Levine
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Kubernetes; Developer Tools; Open Source; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style
