description: Explore diverse architectures for deploying workloads on Amazon EKS with Amazon ECR. Learn about secure software supply chain automation options including CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (using Terraform and CDK), and GitOps patterns with Argo CD. Understand how these approaches complement each other from developer, architect, and operations perspectives. Get insights on selecting the right deployment strategy based on team structure and skillsets, and discover how to effectively combine DevOps and GitOps patterns to match your organization's needs. Gain practical knowledge on implementing these strategies to enhance your development workflow, improve collaboration, and accelerate your software delivery.

title: Amazon EVS deep dive: Advanced networking and storage architecture
description: Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) provides you with choice, flexibility, and control as your build your virtualization stack in the cloud. If you're ready to learn advanced patterns, tips, and tricks for you environments, join this deep dive to help you master architecture patterns as you build your EVS environments. We'll explore network architecture patterns in-depth, explaining inter-VPC communication approaches, and advanced networking strategies. We'll also cover advanced storage architecture patterns to help you scale and optimize performance and costs.
services: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC); Amazon Elastic VMware Service (EVS)
tags: VMware; Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Amazon EVS deep dive: Strategic migration planning
description: Join this interactive technical session to learn how you can start running your VMware workloads on AWS with Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS). Discover how to strategically plan and architect EVS environments to set the foundation for a successful migration. We'll dive into technical prerequisites, capacity planning strategies, and host placement options. We'll share best practices in integrating your preferred storage, backup, and disaster recovery solutions to Amazon EVS, along with how you can leverage other AWS services to make the most out of running your VMware workloads in the cloud.
services: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP; Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC); Amazon Elastic VMware Service (EVS)
tags: VMware; Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Amazon FSx Intelligent-Tiering: Technical deep dive and best practices
description: Discover how FSx Intelligent-Tiering delivers fully elastic file storage with automatic cost savings. In this session, we'll explore the architecture behind automated data movement, performance, and elastic storage scaling capabilities. You'll see how file systems automatically adapt to changing workloads while maintaining high performance with sub-millisecond latencies and millions of IOPS. We'll examine caching mechanisms and the relationship between file system I/O and request operations. You'll learn how to monitor performance using CloudWatch metrics and implement SSD caching for performance-intensive workloads.
services: Amazon FSx; Amazon FSx for Lustre; Amazon FSx for OpenZFS
tags: Data Protection; Monitoring & Observability; Cost Optimization; Cloud Operations; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Amazon GameLift Streams Powers Bandai Namco Entertainment's Metaverse
description: Bandai Namco Entertainment built their Gundam metaverse into a globally scalable cloud streaming platform using Amazon GameLift Streams, serving 20+ countries with browser-based access. This session explores achieving minimal session startup times and cost efficiency through dynamic capacity management across 6 AWS regions with real-time demand optimization. The presentation covers multi-runtime architecture designed to enable both high-performance metaverse experiences and instant browser-based access, as well as network performance visualization. Additionally, we'll showcase Amazon Anywhere integration that create immersive shopping experiences within the metaverse, bridging virtual and physical commerce. Attendees will gain insights into dynamic scaling strategies and multi-region deployment.
speakers: Kenta Komoriya; Masamichi Tanaka; Natsuhiro Maruyama; Daisuke Omori
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Internet of Things; Customer Enablement; Industry Solutions; Games; Lecture-style

title: Amazon Keyspaces live migration best practices with HBO Max
description: Amazon Keyspaces (for Apache Cassandra) is a globally scalable, serverless database service with a 99.999% availability SLA. In this session, learn how the HBO Max team delivers seamless playback for over 120 million viewers across 77 countries, managing tens of billions of records and millions of requests per minute during global events like the Olympics and premieres such as House of the Dragon. Discover how the team built a multi-region architecture with Keyspaces, implemented a dual-writes architecture and a custom data-loading tool to migrate from Apache Cassandra with zero downtime, and eliminated infrastructure management while reducing costs by 40% using flexible capacity modes.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Keyspaces (for Apache Cassandra); Amazon Kinesis
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams under the hood
description: Discover how AWS is changing data streaming with Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for infrastructure and operations. This session will explore recent innovations in how Kinesis Data Streams enables you to build robust, scalable data streaming applications that can handle millions of events per second. Join this session to see how you can leverage Amazon Kinesis Data Streams to build scalable, resilient data streaming applications for faster insights and improved decision-making.
services: Amazon Kinesis; Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Analytics; Migration & Modernization; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Amazon Linux: latest features and AWS optimizations
description: Amazon Linux is the most popular operating system on AWS. In this session, you will learn about the latest updates such as Amazon Linux Desktop, Kernel 6.12, FIPS, and package updates. We will share the roadmap and lifecycle updates so that you can prepare for upgrades and migrations.
tags: Compute; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Amazon Q Apps: Power RCM, Member Engagement, & Drug Safety Management
description: Join us as we explore how Amazon Q Apps, a feature of Amazon Q Business, can help knowledge workers streamline critical tasks across healthcare and life sciences organizations. In this workshop, you'll discover how Amazon Q Apps transforms healthcare operations across multiple domains: converting fragmented revenue cycle data into intelligent intervention engines; streamlining how payers identify high-utilization members; and revolutionizing pharmacovigilance by detecting safety signals earlier than conventional systems. Through guided exercises, you'll learn how Amazon Q Apps turns healthcare insights into automated, measurable business outcomes, providing you with actionable ways to implement these solutions in your organization.
speakers: Chris Haddad; Ramakant Joshi; Avni Patel; Mike Steward
tags: Business Intelligence; Automation; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Amazon Q Developer CLI, a lightning-fast coding experience
description: Join us for an interactive session exploring the agentic capabilities of the Amazon Q Developer CLI. Learn how to leverage custom agents that uses the information across native and MCP server-based tools to read and write files locally, call AWS APIs, run bash commands, and write code, all while adapting to your feedback in real-time. We'll cover best practices for agentic development, and real-world use cases for implementing Amazon Q Developer CLI into your existing workflows.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Amazon S3 performance: Architecture, design, and optimization
description: Go behind the scenes of Amazon S3 performance architecture while learning practical optimization strategies. We'll explore how S3's internal systems manage massive throughput, handle concurrent requests, and balance loads across its distributed infrastructure. Dive deep into the technical foundations - from request routing and partitioning strategies to caching mechanisms - that enable S3 to power demanding workloads like real-time analytics and ML training. You'll learn how to leverage this architectural understanding to make informed storage class selections, implement performance-enhancing patterns, and design applications that maximize S3's capabilities.
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Architecture; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Amazon S3 security and access control best practices
description: Building a robust data security strategy begins with choosing the right storage foundation. Amazon S3 provides security settings and granular access controls to suit any workload. In this session, learn about the fundamentals of S3 security and dive deep into the latest enhancements in usability and functionality. Explore options for access control, encryption, monitoring, auditing, and remediation. Discover best practices for data security and access control in S3.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)
tags: Application Security; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Security & Identity; Storage; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Amazon S3 security: Implementing controls, policies & audit systems [REPEAT]
description: Amazon S3 provides security settings and granular access controls to suit virtually any workload. In this workshop, learn how to manage access and define scalable user and resource-based policies using Amazon S3 access management tools. Learn techniques for monitoring and auditing data to find out who is accessing what data, from where, and when. Through practical scenarios, learn how to apply various S3 security tools and capabilities to meet diverse security requirements. Gain expertise in implementing robust security measures, from basic access controls to advanced audit systems, suitable for any workload complexity.

title: Amazon S3 Tables architecture, use cases, and best practices
description: Explore Amazon S3 Tables architecture and latest features that improve data lake performance. Learn proven optimization strategies, automated maintenance capabilities, and simplified security controls that reduce operational overhead while scaling efficiently. Discover how Indeed is actively modernizing their data infrastructure through an ambitious migration of 80 petabytes from Hive to S3 Tables, achieving significant performance gains and cost reductions. Through real-world use cases and architectural deep-dives, understand how S3 Tables transforms analytics workloads from petabyte-scale processing to real-time dashboards and complex ETL pipelines. You'll gain practical knowledge for table design, cost optimization, and performance tuning to accelerate query speeds and reduce infrastructure costs in your data architecture.
speakers: Aditya Kalyanakrishnan; Yuri Zarubin; Min Li
tags: Open Data; Innovation & Transformation; Machine Learning; Analytics; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio for Public Sector [REPEAT]
description: This hands-on workshop lets participants explore three real-world public sector use cases-Healthcare, Education, and Government—using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. Participants will choose one of the three scenarios, work with domain-specific datasets, and build a machine learning model using Amazon SageMaker, AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, Amazon Q, and Amazon Bedrock. Activities include setting up a SageMaker domain, querying and processing data, assigning permissions using AWS Lake Formation, and generating insights. The workshop includes three personas: administrator,  data scientist (publishing data), and an ML engineer (building the model). Amazon Q will be used throughout the workshop as an assistant for participants.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Education; Government; Public Sector; Hands-on; Interactive

Participants will choose one of the three scenarios, work with domain-specific datasets, and build a machine learning model using Amazon SageMaker, AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, Amazon Q, and Amazon Bedrock. Activities include setting up a SageMaker domain, querying and processing data, assigning permissions using AWS Lake Formation, and generating insights. The workshop includes three personas: administrator,  data scientist (publishing data), and an ML engineer (building the model). Amazon Q will be used throughout the workshop as an assistant for participants.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Education; Government; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Amazon's finops: Cloud cost lessons from a global e-commerce giant
description: Get an insider's view of FinOps at Amazon from the AWS Cloud Economics team. Drawing from experience supporting thousands of internal teams, we'll share battle-tested strategies for building a cost-aware culture and scaling cloud financial management. Learn how Amazon approaches cost allocation, leverages AWS tools, and drives optimization across its complex enterprise. You'll leave with practical approaches and proven best practices that can be applied to organizations of any size.
tags: Business Intelligence; Cost Optimization; Learning from Amazon; Analytics; Cloud Operations; Data Engineer; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Retail & Consumer Goods; Lecture-style

title: Amazon’s World Famous Chicken Wing Eating Competition
description: Join us at Midday Madness for Amazon's World Famous Chicken Wing Eating Competition, where brave competitors will face off at 6:00 PM (competitors must line up by 5:30 PM) to devour as many wings as possible in this epic battle of appetite and endurance – whether you're ready to compete for glory or just want to cheer on the contestants, this is one of re:Invent's most memorable and exciting spectacles.

title: An insider’s look into architecture choices for Amazon DynamoDB
description: To overcome the performance and scale limitations of relational databases, AWS built Amazon DynamoDB to deliver consistent single-digit millisecond performance at any scale for the most demanding applications on the planet. In this session, learn about the architecture choices for Amazon DynamoDB. Gain a better understanding of when to use DynamoDB and why DynamoDB is used by over one million AWS customers, and powers hundreds of applications that exceed half a million requests per second. Leave with a new perspective on how to design your own applications.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: An unexpected journey building AWS MCP Servers
description: This session explores the evolution from generic AI coding assistants to AWS-intelligent development tools through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Attendees will learn how MCP transforms AI assistants by injecting AWS-specific context, best practices, and service knowledge directly into development workflows. We'll demonstrate using 25+ open-source AWS MCP servers that provide real-time access to CDK patterns, cost analysis, Amazon Bedrock capabilities, and infrastructure guidance. Through live demos and examples, you'll discover how to configure and leverage existing MCP servers that understand AWS services. Leave with practical skills to enhance your AI assistants for accelerated serverless and AI application development.
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Agentic AI; Application Integration; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Engineer; DevOps Engineer; System Administrator; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Analyze blockchain data with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: In this session, learn how to leverage Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and large language models (LLMs) for blockchain data analysis through natural language prompts. With guidance from AWS experts on Web3, you will create an AI-powered interface that queries blockchain data across major networks, leveraging datasets from the AWS Public Blockchain Data initiative. This hands-on builders’ session will equip you with practical knowledge to combine generative AI and Web3 technologies, enabling you to explore on-chain transactions, digital assets, and smart contracts through intuitive prompt-driven interactions. You must bring a laptop to participate.
speakers: Forrest Colyer; Everton Fraga; Simon Goldberg; John Liu; Varsha Narmat; Yinal Ozkan
tags: Blockchain; Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Academic / Researcher; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Software & Internet; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Angry Birds Meets GenAI: Transforming Rovio's Asset Creation with AWS
description: Explore how Rovio, the creator of Angry Birds, is reimagining game asset creation using AWS’s generative AI services. Learn how they built a custom image generation pipeline using SageMaker Training Jobs, EC2 g6e instances, and SageMaker Endpoints to accelerate content creation while preserving brand identity. The session will also highlight how Rovio uses Amazon Bedrock and Claude in adjacent creative workflows. With real examples from Angry Birds Dream Blast, discover how Rovio balances creative control, scalability, and production efficiency using a multi-service GenAI approach.
tags: Generative AI; Customer Enablement; Industry Solutions; Games; Lecture-style

title: Another Axiom: Migrating the backend for hit game Gorilla Tag to AWS
description: Learn how leading VR gaming studio Another Axiom modernized their backend infrastructure by building a custom backend platform with AWS. Follow their journey from a patchwork of legacy vendor systems to a scalable, future-proof solution that powers all their games. Explore how they optimized performance, costs, and observability, with Amazon Fargate and AWS Graviton Processors, Amazon Aurora, and CloudWatch APM. This talk explores architectural decisions, performance bottlenecks, and cost optimization techniques that enabled seamless scaling while maintaining an immersive experience for 100k+ peak concurrent players.
tags: Customer Enablement; Games; Lecture-style

title: Anthology boosts contact center efficiency with AI
description: AI is helping customer experience teams improve productivity through automation of repetitive tasks, call summarization, and proactively surfacing relevant customer information. Learn how AI-powered Amazon Connect is driving significant improvements for end-customer self-service, agents, and supervisors. Hear from Anthology — a leader in Education Technology — as they share implementation journeys and recent successes, diving into how AI-powered analytics helped improve the efficiency and impact of their self-service experiences and human agent coaching.
speakers: Kathy Huffstetler; Sandeep Rao; Richa Batra
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Anti-Money Laundering Multi-agent Orchestration with AWS Strands
description: Learn how to build a production-ready, serverless Anti-Money Laundering (AML) system using AWS Strands SDK and Anthropic's Claude model in Amazon Bedrock. The architecture features eight specialized agents (Perception, Context, News, Reasoning, Risk, Action, Audit, Learning) orchestrated for intelligent financial crime detection. Through live demonstrations, see semantic reasoning beyond rule-based detection, real-time API integration, and cost-effective serverless deployment using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Deployment. Experience high-risk transaction processing, Strands SDK integration with Claude's semantic analysis, and complete multi-agent coordination. Gain realtime understanding on building LLM-powered compliance systems with explainable AI decisions and regulatory compliance.
speakers: Ayyanar Jeyakrishnan; Vivek Raja; Bhuvaneswari Subramani
tags: Responsible AI; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: API Gateway Authorization Strategies [REPEAT]
description: In this session, we will dive into various API Gateway authorization strategies, including Cognito User Pools, Amazon Verified Permissions, Lambda Custom Authorizers, IAM Authorizers, and machine-to-machine scenarios. Through hands-on examples, you'll learn how to implement each strategy and understand their trade-offs. By the end, you'll have an understanding of when to use each authorizer type, empowering you to secure your APIs more effectively while minimizing complexity. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Victor Kazuyuki Shinya; David Lamb; Paul Nobuo Okada; Josh Rodgers; Archana Venkitaramanan

title: Apollo Tyres Accelerates Engineering Workflows with HPC on AWS
description: Apollo Tyres transformed their engineering workflows by migrating to AWS High Performance Computing (HPC). This move integrated simulation applications with design tools, improving performance by up to 59% and reducing costs by over 60%. The company built their infrastructure using AWS ParallelCluster, Amazon DCV for seamless remote workstation access, and FSx for ONTAP storage. Their implementation includes the Tachyon platform for self-service job management, enabling engineers to submit and monitor simulation jobs efficiently. The session covers architecture decisions, instance selection strategies, and practical solutions for common migration challenges including network latency and storage optimization.
speakers: Alex Francois-Saint-Cyr; Gautam Kumar; Shailender Gupta
services: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP; AWS ParallelCluster; NICE DCV
tags: Industry Solutions; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Application modernization challenge [REPEAT]
description: Showcase your modernization skills in this hands-on workshop. Following AWS's modernization pathways, you'll decompose monoliths into microservices using AWS Lambda, transition to managed databases, containerize workloads with Amazon ECS and EKS, and implement DevOps practices using AWS CI/CD tools. Leveraging AWS's 'Move to AI' pathway, you'll learn how to integrate Amazon Bedrock and foundation models to build modern applications. In this team-based event, score points by completing modernization challenges in provided AWS accounts while using Amazon Q Developer to accelerate your efforts. Laptop required for participation.

description: Explore modern application networking observability on AWS through comprehensive monitoring and troubleshooting capabilities. This session demonstrates how Amazon VPC Lattice access logs empower both network/platform teams and developers with enhanced visibility into distributed applications. Through practical examples and real-world scenarios, learn essential techniques for implementing end-to-end monitoring, rapidly detecting and resolving network issues, and optimizing application performance. Don’t forget to bring questions!

description: Modern applications present complex challenges in managing secure communication across distributed architectures. Learn to implement and configure both service-to-service and service-to-resource communications while working with resource gateways and configurations using Amazon VPC Lattice and AWS PrivateLink. This experience provides a comprehensive understanding of how to architect secure, scalable application connectivity solutions.

description: Explore the intersection of AI and FinOps in this advanced session. First, discover how Amazon Q can simplify AWS cost management by analyzing trends, explaining spend, and recommending optimizations like rightsizing and Savings Plans. Then, dive into FinOps for AI- learn how to track and control generative AI costs across Amazon EC2, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Bedrock, and more. We'll share architecture patterns, cost-saving strategies, and real-world examples to help you build scalable, production-ready AI solutions while staying on budget. title: Approaches to layered security on Amazon VPC [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, discover proven methodologies that will help you build a secure Amazon VPC. Using a hands-on approach, you will explore Amazon VPC features such as subnets, security groups, flow logs, and routing. Next, you will learn how to add additional layers of security to your VPC. This includes securing ingress and egress VPC traffic using services like Amazon Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall, AWS Network Firewall, Amazon VPC Traffic Mirroring, AWS WAF, and more. You must bring your laptop to participate, so don't leave home without it.

title: Architect for Zero Trust in AWS [REPEAT]
description: Discover how to implement comprehensive zero trust architectures in AWS using native services and best practices. This technical session explores identity-centric security, microsegmentation strategies, and least-privilege access patterns across applications, networks, and data. Learn to leverage AWS IAM, Security Hub, Network Firewall, and CloudWatch to create defense-in-depth security architectures. We’ll demonstrate practical implementations of zero trust principles including continuous verification, explicit permission management, and real-time threat detection. Perfect for security architects and cloud engineers looking to build modern security architectures that assume breach and verify explicitly. Leave with actionable blueprints for implementing zero trust across your AWS environment.

description: Managing observability across distributed and multicloud environments remains a significant challenge for many organizations. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll explore how AWS fully managed open source observability services can solve your most pressing observability problems. We'll showcase reference architectures for high-cardinality metrics, log analytics, and distributed tracing. Bring your specific use cases as we whiteboard solutions for handling large-scale metrics collection, unified alerting strategies, and correlating telemetry across your infrastructure. Leave with practical approaches to implement a comprehensive observability strategy tailored to your environment.

title: Architecting Agentic AI for Supply Chain: Data-to-Decision Patterns [REPEAT]
description: Supply chains across industries face challenges with inconsistent data and complex decision workflows. This session covers designing agentic AI workflows that autonomously interpret operational data—such as sales and inventory—to drive key decisions like restocking and pricing. Learn how to prepare data with Amazon SageMaker, build reasoning agents using Bedrock, and orchestrate workflows with AgentCore. We discuss managing uncertain AI outputs through fallback logic and human-in-the-loop reviews. Through discussion, you'll uncover best practices for building scalable, reliable agentic automation driven by trusted data in supply chain operations. Leave with architectural patterns that balance automation with appropriate human oversight.

description: Explore how organizations can transform mission-critical operations using generative AI through the lens of the UK Met Office's journey. This session provides an in-depth look at a dual-model approach using Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs), achieving 62% and 52% accuracy respectively. Examine architectural patterns for complex data processing using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and AWS CDK, with insights into fine-tuning Amazon Nova models for precise maritime forecasting. description: Join us to explore Amazon Q Business and Q Apps, power features that transform business process automation and app development. Learn how Amazon Q Apps low-code/no-code platform enables rapid creation of enterprise applications without extensive coding We'll cover implementation strategies across business functions, from HR to operations, showing how these tools drive digital transformation and operational efficiency. Master building generative AI applications to gain competitive advantage in today's dynamic business landscape.
tags: Interactive

title: Architecting circular systems with generative AI on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Discover how you can combine generative AI and generative design on AWS to accelerate circular economy initiatives. In this chalk talk, we’ll walk through how services like Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker and AWS Lambda can rapidly prototype reuse scenarios, create synthetic data, simulate material lifecycles, and optimize designs for sustainability constraints. We’ll whiteboard an evolving architecture that integrates real-time environmental data and domain knowledge to continuously evaluate circular opportunities - from energy recapture and zero-waste manufacturing to remanufacturing and sustainable packaging. Learn how generative design simulates thousands of alternatives and generative AI turns insights into scalable, actionable solutions.

title: Architecting Compliant GenAI Systems for Healthcare Workflows
description: Healthcare organizations need to streamline clinical workflows without compromising accuracy or compliance. Manual verification of ICD-10 codes leads to costly, inefficient radiology billing processes. This code talk demonstrates how a leading medical university implemented hybrid generative AI to automate clinical coding. Through code examples, learn to use Amazon Bedrock for AI predictions with custom rule-based validation engines to eliminate hallucinations. Explore architectures combining domain-specific knowledge bases, HIPAA-compliant checkpoints, and scalable monitoring. Discover best practices for scaling infrastructure, managing model drift, and integrating human validation. Leave with practical knowledge for deploying generative AI in billing-critical healthcare workflows where precision and compliance drive success.

The demonstration covers real-time inventory management, automated order processing, and AI-powered customer interactions, showcasing practical patterns for building and deploying scalable frontend architectures.

description: Firewalls are essential for cloud security, but which one is right for your workload? In this chalk talk, you’ll learn about firewall services available on AWS, including web application firewalls, network firewalls, and DNS firewalls. Explore architecture patterns that combine multiple firewall products for comprehensive protection. Bring your architecture and let’s discuss how these services can improve your security posture.

title: Architecting for data protection and compliance with Amazon ECS [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations running containerized workloads need to ensure that they are meeting stringent data protection and compliance requirements, including those pertaining to the HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules for securing protected health information (PHI). This builders' session focuses on how you can use Amazon ECS and other AWS services to run container applications containing PHI. Learn best practices with Amazon ECS, Amazon ECR, AWS Fargate, Amazon GuardDuty, and more.
speakers: Arindam Chattopadhya; Allie Fortman; Guy Loewy; Dipen Nepal; Muz Syed
services: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Fargate

title: Architecting for data protection and compliance with AWS Backup
description: Join to discuss proven architecture patterns for building ransomware-resilient AWS Backup solutions. We will explore immutability with Vault Lock and logically air-gapped vaults, and dive deep into KMS best practices: when to use AWS-owned and Customer Managed Keys, how to rotate keys without breaking restores, how to configure key policies for least privilege, and how to implement cross-account trust for backup copies. We’ll discuss multi-account, multi-region backup topologies, automated recovery testing for DR validation, and designing for GDPR and regulatory compliance. You will leave with practical patterns to implement secure, scalable, audit-ready backup architectures aligned with industry best practices.
tags: Resilience; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Architecting for Digital Sovereignty: From Foundation to Practice
description: Join this chalk talk that bridges security fundamentals with practical architecture strategies for implementing digital sovereignty in the cloud. Through real-world examples from the United Arab Emirates Cybersecurity Council and the upcoming AWS European Sovereign Cloud, we'll explore how organizations can use AWS sovereignty features effectively. We'll cover practical architectural patterns for data residency, operational control, and security measures that help customers maintain full control of their data. Perfect for cloud architects and security teams, this session will show you how to design solutions that balance sovereignty requirements with cloud advantages, illustrated with examples from government and enterprise deployments.
services: AWS CloudTrail; AWS Control Tower; AWS Firewall Manager
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Architecting for hypergrowth: Scaling to 200 million users with Skyscanner
description: Building systems that scale from thousands to millions of users requires strategic architectural decisions at each growth stage. Learn proven approaches for scaling infrastructure through Skyscanner's transformation from data center to global cloud architecture. Explore key decision points for scaling up versus out, implementing effective caching strategies, and evolving monoliths into services. Through Skyscanner's implementation of cellular architecture on Amazon EKS, discover how to architect systems that maintain performance and reliability while scaling to hundreds of millions of users.
speakers: Christine Chao; Skye Hart; Paul Gillespie
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Containers; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Architecting for sustainable IT at scale
description: Explore how organizations can build and scale applications on AWS with sustainability in mind. This session covers architectural principles for carbon-efficient cloud workloads, including right-sizing resources, leveraging AWS Graviton-based instances, and adopting managed services. Learn how to measure and optimize the sustainability of your workloads using the AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool and CloudWatch.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon EC2 - Graviton
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Sustainability; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Financial Services; Government; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Architecting Intelligent Supply Chains with Multi-Agent Orchestration
description: Discover how to build an intelligent supply chain orchestration system using Amazon Bedrock and Strands Agents SDK. In this chalk talk, we'll dive deep into designing a multi-agent system that automatically responds to supply chain disruptions. Learn how specialized agents for logistics, inventory and transportation work together to generate and execute optimal responses to supply chain challenges. We'll explore real-world scenarios, demonstrate chain-of-thought reasoning, and show integration with AWS Supply Chain and third-party systems.
tags: Business Intelligence; Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Architecting large-scale migrations with Fannie Mae and the NRO
description: What does it take to migrate some of the largest, most complex enterprise and federal workloads to the cloud without disrupting mission operations or compromising security? In this session, discover how the National Reconnaissance Office and Fannie Mae architected and executed mission-scale migrations to AWS. You will learn strategies for designing secure, resilient, and cost-efficient architectures; approaches to maintaining continuity of operations during complex cutovers; and how to lay a cloud-native foundation that enables modernization and emerging technologies like generative AI. Walk away with practical insights you can apply to your own migration and transformation initiatives.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Architecting multi-agent systems with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: Many production AI applications require specialized agents working together: from agentic RAG systems that iteratively refine searches to enterprise workflows that decompose complex tasks. In this chalk talk, we'll explore proven multi-agent design patterns using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: hierarchical (orchestrator routing to specialists), collaborative (agents contributing complementary expertise), competitive (multiple agents proposing solutions), and peer-to-peer (resilient handoffs between agents). Through practical examples like multi-step research workflows and agentic RAG implementations, you'll learn how AgentCore handles complex multi-agent systems and state management while maintaining observability, security, latency, cost, and accuracy in production deployments.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

In this session, we will dive deep into practical approaches to multicloud data strategy, such as data mesh architecture and materialized views. description: This session demonstrates how to create sign language translation systems using Strands Agents, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, and the Alexa AI Multi-Agent SDK. The presentation covers two key implementations: broadcast content transformation into real-time sign language avatars and interactive conversational agents enabling two-way sign language communication with voice systems. Technical deep-dives explore AWS' agentic infrastructure for compute management, observability, and secure multi-agent orchestration. Live demonstrations showcase practical applications for deaf and hard-of-hearing users to interact with Alexa+ through sign language, demonstrating accessible AI technology in action.

Through Amazon.com's real-world implementation, examine patterns for managing large-scale deployments while maintaining high availability. This session provides practical strategies for architecting reliable deployment systems at scale.

title: Architecting resilient global networks with Project Kuiper
description: Project Kuiper's Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite constellation transforms how organizations architect global connectivity solutions. Explore how Kuiper's advanced network—featuring antennas, space lasers, ground gateways, and intelligent routing—integrates with AWS services for robust, low-latency solutions. Learn architectural patterns for enhancing application resilience, implementing secure remote data transfer, and optimizing edge computing performance. Discover real-world solutions for critical challenges such as maintaining connectivity during disasters, securing remote operations, and extending compute to the network edge, enabling global reach and improved reliability.

title: Architecting resilient multicloud operations, feat. Monzo Bank
description: When organizations choose a multicloud strategy to address their resilience needs, they often face challenges in areas such as data consistency, service isolation, and long term testing and maintenance. Join this session to learn about Monzo Bank's resilience journey in implementing a strategic multicloud architecture that offers a practical and efficient approach to operational resilience. We'll dive deep into Monzo's Stand-in Platform, which runs critical banking services on a different cloud provider alongside their primary AWS infrastructure. You'll learn practical patterns for maintaining service availability, managing data consistency trade-offs, and implementing resilient multicloud architectures.
speakers: Bruno Emer; Clark Richey; Andrew Lawson
tags: Resilience; Architecture; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Lecture-style

title: Architecting Security at Scale with AWS Cloud Governance [REPEAT]
description: Implementing consistent cloud governance and security capabilities across a growing AWS estate challenges many organizations, often leading to fragmented controls and security gaps. Learn how to develop and implement a comprehensive governance strategy that scales with your business needs as well as your security requirements. Using ransomware protection as a practical example, we'll explore how to architect a multi-account environment that balances security with operational flexibility. Discover how AWS Control Tower, IAM Identity Center, AWS Organizations, AWS Config, Amazon GuardDuty and AWS Backup work together to implement security controls at scale. Walk away with actionable insights on designing and deploying a secure foundation that not only protects against modern threats but maintains the agility your business demands.

We'll explore real-world solution architectures and examine the technical considerations for deploying workloads across various scenarios. We'll analyze EC2 GPU instance families and their optimal use cases, discuss architectural trade-offs, and explore cost optimization strategies using different provisioning models. In this session, discover how to combine cost-optimized, fully elastic vector storage delivered by Amazon S3 Vectors with multimodal embedding models in Amazon Bedrock to extract and index visual and audio semantics at scale. Learn how to leverage S3 Vectors with popular AWS AI services to power AI-driven applications that can efficiently search through large vector datasets. title: Architectures for Hybrid Quantum-Classical Workflows at Scale
description: Quantum computers are expected to solve some of today’s most demanding computational problems by working in tandem with classical computers. The breadth of AWS services and advanced compute capabilites provide customers with the flexibility to architect a wide range of purpose-built solutions for their quantum computing workflows. In this chalk talk, we'll explore several architectures enabling hybrid quantum-classical computing at scale, integrating Amazon Braket with AWS Batch, AWS ParallelCluster, and AWS Parallel Computing Service. We'll discuss use cases that leverage GPU-accelerated Amazon EC2 instances and the NVIDIA CUDA-Q platform facilitating the integration of CPUs, GPUs, and quantum processing units.
services: Amazon Braket; AWS Batch; AWS Parallel Computing Service
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Enterprise; Interactive

Through live coding examples, you'll see how policy validation and analysis, powered by automated reasoning, can minimise deployment of unwanted IAM policies. While security teams oversee organizational security posture, developers create applications needing permissions. Watch as we code the solution for enabling developer speed with security through delegated IAM policy authoring. Through interactive demonstrations, you'll learn how cfn-policy-validator and GitHub Actions can automatically validate and analyze IAM policies to uphold security when permitting developers policy authoring abilities. Follow along with the code as we show you how to enable developer speed without compromising security posture.

title: Autonomous DBOps: Agentic AI for maintaining databases [REPEAT]
description: Maintaining performance for Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS often requires manual effort, such as tuning queries, managing indexes, and handling alerts. In this builders' session, learn how to leverage agentic AI solutions implementing LLM-powered autonomous agents to monitor, diagnose, and optimize relational databases in real time. We will demonstrate how AI agents can analyze slow query logs, recommend or apply tuning actions, and trigger intelligent alerts using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Cloudwatch, AWS Lambda, and Amazon Systems Manager. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Sudhir Amin; Dustin Brown; Vijay Karumajji; Paola Lorusso; Veerendra Nayak
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Administrator; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Autonomous Live-Ops: AI Agents for Dynamic Gaming Experiences
description: To: Learn how to automate live-ops using AI agents that analyze player behavior and generate dynamic recommendations in real-time. We’ll demonstrate configuring Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to orchestrate intelligent agents that analyze engagement metrics and provides real-time segmentation and campaign recommendations . Attendees will build a working prototype that acts as a foundation for building an autonomous live-ops workflow that provides impactful insights while reducing the overhead of managing traditional live-ops platforms. This hands-on workshop showcases the newly launched Bedrock AgentCore service with interchangeable AI models, perfect for live-ops engineers seeking to reduce manual operations while increasing player retention and engagement.
tags: Generative AI; Industry Solutions; Games; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Autonomous Web3 agents on AWS
description: In this code talk, we will demonstrate how to leverage Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Strands Agents SDK to build a crypto AI agent that can query real-time and historical blockchain data to perform analysis, execute on-chain transactions using integrated wallets, and more. Learn how to build an agent programmatically that can retrieve data from topic-specific knowledge bases, query historical public blockchain data provided by Open Data on AWS, query for real-time data, and sign blockchain transactions with AWS KMS
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS); AWS Lambda
tags: Blockchain; Agentic AI; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Interactive

title: Autonomy in Defense: Scaling Innovation for Mission Outcomes
description: Mission autonomy isn’t a future vision—it’s happening now. Join this session to explore the real-world journey to autonomous operations using AWS’s four-phase mission autonomy flywheel: from digital engineering and secure edge deployment to real-time AI-driven operations and post-mission optimization. Featuring a special guest from the U.S. Submarine Forces, you’ll hear firsthand how AWS is enabling autonomy at the tactical edge—underwater, under pressure, and at speed. Walk away with reference architectures, implementation strategies, and lessons learned on scaling autonomy across domains to accelerate decision-making and mission outcomes.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Autoscale EC2 Instances with Amazon EventBridge
description: This lab demonstrates automated EC2 instance management using Amazon EventBridge and Lambda. Learn to create EventBridge rules that trigger Lambda functions in response to Auto Scaling events and scheduled maintenance. Practice configuring cron-based schedules for instance reboots, monitoring Auto Scaling activities through CloudWatch logs, and testing event-driven automation. Ideal for DevOps engineers implementing automated infrastructure management.
services: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling; Amazon EventBridge; AWS Lambda
tags: Training & Certification; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Autoscaling patterns for production workloads on Amazon ECS
description: Effective autoscaling is critical for optimizing Amazon ECS cost and performance across your containerized workloads. This session explores comprehensive scaling strategies covering both at the application and compute layer. We'll examine application autoscaling techniques including target tracking policies, custom metric definitions, step scaling configurations, and predictive scaling capabilities. On the infrastructure side, you'll learn to leverage capacity providers and cluster autoscaling to dynamically manage compute resources. You'll discover how to implement scaling architectures that automatically respond to demand fluctuations while maintaining optimal resource utilization and minimizing costs across your containerized application portfolio.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Application Auto Scaling
tags: Management & Governance; Automation; Containers; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; System Administrator; Interactive

title: AWS & GenAI Power CDG's Telecom Software Modernization Journey
description: Learn how AWS transformed a telecommunications software business in an era where reliable broadband connectivity is essential to daily life. Through AWS Enterprise Support and the Partner Program, Communications Data Group (CDG) achieved 100% year-over-year growth while modernizing solutions for telecom operators. AWS's 24/7 technical support and expertise in cloud architecture, generative AI, and business intelligence enabled CDG's next-generation platform. The session shows how CDG improved efficiency, demonstrating how AWS helps providers scale, manage costs, and enhance customer experiences.
tags: Industry Solutions; Advisor / Consultant; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Telecommunications; Small & Medium Business; Lecture-style

title: AWS Agent for SAP Invoice Automation
description: This session covers the application of an agentic workflow, leveraging Amazon Bedrock Agent and Amazon Nova, to optimize a common SAP process: vendor invoice processing. Traditional SAP invoice handling often involves manual data entry, error-prone matching, and approval bottlenecks. By integrating Amazon Textract for intelligent document processing and Bedrock's large language models for reasoning, an agentic solution can automate data extraction, verification, discrepancy handling, and approval routing. This results in reduced manual effort, improved accuracy, faster processing times, lower costs, and enhanced visibility within the SAP environment, ultimately fostering stronger vendor relationships.
services: AWS Control Tower; AWS Security Hub; AWS Transit Gateway
tags: Global Infrastructure; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Identity & Access Management; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: AWS AI League: Building  intelligent AI Agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: Dive into the future of AI in this competitive workshop where you'll create intelligent agents using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Choose between our no-code UI interface or build directly with AgentCore to develop agents that tackle real-world technical challenges. Experience hands-on learning through dynamic gameplay with live leaderboards while mastering prompt engineering, safety guardrails, and performance optimization. Whether you're avid AI developers and architects eager to gain practical experience with production-grade agentic AI, regardless of LLM experience level.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: AWS AI League: Learn, compete and innovate in the ultimate AI showdown
description: Learn, compete and innovate in the ultimate AI showdown. Participate for prizes, glory, and a chance to advance to the AWS AI League Championship Finals. In this hands-on workshop you’ll compete head-to-head in customizing smarter and more accurate AI models. You’ll tackle real-world challenges as you generate synthetic datasets, experiment with model customization, and fine-tune foundation models to improve accuracy, clarity, and relevance. You’ll learn just how accessible and cost-effective AI customization can be. Top performers in this session qualify for the AWS AI League Championship Finals and compete for the $25,000 prizepool. Whether you’re chasing the championship or simply sharpening your AI expertise, this session delivers practical, scalable techniques you can apply immediately. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Parth Desai; Vu Le; Vincent Oh; Alee Whitman
services: Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Nova; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: AWS AI League: Model customization made easy - PART 1
description: In this hands-on workshop you’ll compete head-to-head with other builders to customize AI models. You’ll tackle real-world challenges as you generate synthetic datasets, experiment with model customization, and fine-tune models to improve accuracy, clarity, and relevance. You’ll learn just how accessible and cost-effective AI customization can be. Whether you’re chasing the championship or simply sharpening your AI expertise, this session delivers practical techniques you can apply immediately. You must bring your laptop to participate
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Developer Community

title: AWS Backup clean room recovery: Comprehensive resilience framework
description: In this technical deep-dive session, discover how AWS Backup provides a comprehensive data resilience framework for organizations facing evolving cyber threats. Learn how AWS Backup's key features, including automated restore testing, index search capabilities, and logical air-gapped vaults, can be leveraged in multi-account strategies to enhance backup isolation and recovery. Learn to design robust architectures that utilize these AWS Backup capabilities to create a secure, isolated environment for backup recovery, mimicking the concept of a "clean room" in traditional disaster recovery scenarios.
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: AWS Backup unlocked: strategies for at-scale data protection
description: Many organizations have barely scratched the surface of what's possible with AWS Backup at enterprise scale. This chalk talk delves into advanced strategies for building comprehensive data protection that spans your entire AWS estate. We'll navigate the data protection journey—from baseline automated backups to sophisticated air-gapped solutions with automated restore testing. Discover how to leverage AWS Organizations for centralized control, implement logical air-gaps for cyber resilience, and ensure compliance across accounts and regions. Whether you're looking to scale your AWS Backup implementation or architect cutting-edge solutions, you'll gain expert insights to transform your data protection practice. Join us to master techniques that elevate your organization's security posture using AWS Backup.
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: AWS Cloud Technical Essentials
description: The bootcamp session covers the fundamental AWS concepts related to compute, database, storage, networking, monitoring, and security. You will start working in AWS through hands-on course experiences. The course covers the concepts necessary to increase your understanding of AWS services, so that you can make informed decisions about solutions that meet business requirements. Throughout the course, you will gain information on how to build, compare, and apply highly available, fault tolerant, scalable, and cost-effective cloud solutions.
tags: Training & Certification

title: AWS Cloud WAN MCP Server: Transform network operations with GenAI
description: Ready to experience the power of debugging network issues through natural language queries? Discover how AWS Cloud WAN's Model Context Protocol (MCP) server leverages Generative AI to redefine network operations. In this session, learn how to use common, complex scenarios including trace network paths using natural language queries, analyzing AWS Cloud WAN Core Network policies through simple prompts, and troubleshoot global routing with AI-assisted intelligent analysis. Perfect for network professionals who want to explore streamlining their AWS infrastructure management while embracing the future of AI-powered networking tools.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: AWS detection and response innovations that drive security outcomes
description: Discover how the latest AWS detection and response capabilities can help secure your cloud environment more effectively. Learn practical ways to achieve integrated security outcomes through enhanced threat detection, automated vulnerability management, and streamlined response—all at scale. We'll show you how to use AWS security services to protect workloads and data, centralize security monitoring, manage security posture continuously, and unify security data, while leveraging generative AI for security operations. Walk away with actionable insights for integrating AWS detection and response services to strengthen and simplify security across your AWS environment.
services: Amazon GuardDuty; Amazon Inspector; AWS Security Hub
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: AWS disaster recovery strategies [REPEAT]
description: Prepare for the unexpected in this disaster recovery (DR) builders session. We'll work on an application to implement the DR strategy that aligns to the recovery objectives of your business: Backup and restore, pilot light, warm standby, or AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (AWS DRS). We'll cover services such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, AWS CloudFront, AWS DRS, AWS Fault Injection Service, and AWS Backup. We will also explore ways to test and validate your chosen approach. You'll leave with practical insights for building the right DR strategy for your business.
speakers: Rodrigo Asensio; Joe Chapman; Mark Jaggers; Yanzhu Ji; Nick Kniveton; Sudeesh Veettil
services: Amazon Aurora; AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery; Amazon Application Recovery Controller
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Management & Governance; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Hands-on; Interactive

title: AWS European Sovereign Cloud: From concept to reality
description: Join AWS experts Colm and Addy for an in-depth look at the AWS European Sovereign Cloud. Explore this new, independent infrastructure's dedicated architecture, EU-based operations, operational controls coupled with governance and legal framework that powers this cloud. Learn how this cloud solution is built, operated, and secured entirely within Europe.
services: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM); AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Lecture-style

title: AWS European Sovereign Cloud: Your 20-Minute Essential Guide
description: Discover AWS's European Sovereign Cloud, designed to meet the evolving data sovereignty requirements and regulatory landscape of the European Union. In this concise 20-minute session, we'll explore the key features, architectural principles, and unique value propositions of this purpose-built cloud solution. Learn how AWS addresses data residency, operational autonomy, and compliance requirements while maintaining the same level of security, reliability, and innovation you expect from AWS. Whether you're a business leader, architect, or compliance professional operating in Europe, this session will equip you with essential knowledge to navigate the future of sovereign cloud computing.
tags: Data Protection; Digital Sovereignty; Resilience; Cloud Operations; Databases; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: AWS for healthcare analytics: accelerating time to insights
description: In today's data-driven healthcare landscape, organizations must rapidly transform diverse data sources into actionable insights that improve patient outcomes and accelerate operational efficiency. This session showcases how AWS' integrated analytics capabilities can deliver unmatched price-performance for every analytics workload, from data processing and SQL analytics to streaming and business intelligence. Through real-world healthcare examples, learn how AWS' built-in governance and scalability enable organizations to build secure, efficient analytics pipelines that accelerate time-to-insight. Ideal for data practitioners, IT decision-makers, and executives evaluating enterprise analytics platforms to drive their data-driven transformation.
tags: Business Intelligence; Analytics; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Interactive

title: AWS for VMware migrations: Successes, roadmaps, & strategies
description: Are you looking to migrate your VMware on-premises environment to AWS and seeking how other IT leaders completed their migration? This session brings together migration trailblazers who’ve been there. Hear firsthand how different global organizations accelerated their cloud journeys, from planning to execution. Speakers share the trusted tools, strategies, and lessons that streamlined their transitions, helping you get insights to guide your own migration. Plus, get a glimpse into their modernization roadmaps and innovation strategies. Whether you’re just starting or overcoming hurdles, you’ll gain actionable insights to drive your own cloud transformation.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon Elastic VMware Service (EVS); AWS Transform
tags: VMware; Well-Architected Framework; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: AWS fundamentals for the accidental SQL Server database administrator
description: With over 200 fully featured services on AWS, it can be challenging for database administrators to ramp up. In this chalk talk, learn how to map DBA tasks to cloud architect roles. Learn about networking, security, high availability, and disaster recovery for SQL Server versions up to 2025. Discover how to use generative AI services like Amazon Q Business and Amazon Q Developer with your deployments and queries. Learn to choose the right services, secure and cost-optimize workloads. Come prepared with your questions.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Customer Enablement; Migration & Modernization; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Administrator; Interactive

Your team will use the latest capabilities in AWS WAF and AWS Shield to mitigate distributed HTTP floods, web exploits, and malicious bots that disrupt the experience of your customers. This event offers a risk-free environment where teamwork is paramount as you work together under pressure. Watch a real-time scoreboard as your team works through each level of the game. The most effective team will earn a prize at the end!

Whether you are an AI enthusiast or just getting started and looking to build your AI skillset, this GameDay will put your AI skills to the ultimate test. description: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in AI-assisted developer tooling from AWS. Dive into a live AWS environment where you will 10x your engineering skills with AI as you onboard as a new software engineer at a fictional startup. You will leverage and build skills while working with AI-powered coding assistants and other tools as you plan prompts, surface specs, review requirements, and tackle tasks to vibe code your way to the top of the leaderboard. Race against time to transform old codebases, automate ops, and even ship straight to prod! Whether you are a seasoned coder or just starting your cloud journey, this GameDay will put your dev skills to the ultimate test. This session features integrated use cases with New Relic.

description: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in advanced cloud architecture on AWS. Whether you are a seasoned architect or an aspiring cloud professional, this GameDay will challenge your ability to create resilient, efficient cloud solutions when it counts. description: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in cloud security on AWS. Defend your cloud infrastructure in a real AWS environment as you navigate this high-stakes security challenge. You will leverage and build skills in detection and response, zero-trust architectures, and ensure compliance while maintaining operational stability. Face off against real-world security scenarios with sophisticated attack patterns — where the attacks may even originate from other teams participating in the GameDay! This session features integrated use cases with SentinelOne.

title: AWS Generative AI Innovation Center driving enterprise success with AWS Partners
description: This session reveals proven pathways to generative AI and agentic AI success, drawn from the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center's experience with thousands of customer implementations. As organizations move beyond initial AI experiments to broad-scale deployment, they face critical challenges in customizing models with proprietary data, managing costs, and scaling autonomous agents across the enterprise. We'll showcase how the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center's production-first methodology and Partner Innovation Alliance (PIA) create opportunities with partners to build joint solutions. In particular, we will discuss the VALUE (Velocity Acceleration for Leveraging Unified Enterprise-AI) framework, which helps organizations overcome these challenges and achieve measurable business outcomes.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: AWS Global Startup Program - how to accelerate your GTM success
description: Discover how to leverage the AWS Global Startup Program to accelerate your success partnering with AWS. If you are a startup ISV and looking to reach more AWS customers, join this session to learn best practices and strategies to accelerate your results partnering with AWS.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Software & Internet; Startup; Lecture-style

title: AWS Graviton: The best price performance for your AWS workloads
description: AWS Graviton-based Amazon EC2 instances provide the best price performance for workloads in Amazon EC2. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Graviton processor and learn about its workload performance, energy efficiency, and software offerings. Learn about common use cases, best practices to optimize your workloads across various applications, customer success stories, and how you can accelerate your AWS Graviton journey.
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: AWS Jam: DevOps & Modernization - Sponsored by LaunchDarkly
description: Are you looking to enhance your AWS DevOps and modernization skills? We’ll provide hands-on environments where you can improve applications and implement DevOps best practices. What are the limitations of the current solution? How can you use multiple AWS services to modernize your architectures? Whether you're new to AWS or a seasoned Cloud Ninja, this Jam is your chance to demonstrate your skills and learn new ones. Structured for all experience levels, our sessions include guided exercises, helpful clues, and support from AWS experts to boost your application modernization and DevOps knowledge. Team up, compete with others, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. With expert guidance every step of the way, all you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a competitive spirit.
tags: DevOps; Interactive

title: AWS Jam: Generative AI - Sponsored by Nvidia
description: Having the right data is just the start—knowing how to use AWS services to unlock the power of Generative AI is the real challenge. In this hands-on Jam, you’ll team up to solve real-world Gen AI and Agentic AI scenarios using tools like Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker AI. Whether you’re exploring prompt engineering or building with foundation models, challenges are designed for all skill levels. Compete against other teams, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. AWS experts will be available to guide you, and helpful clues will keep you moving forward. All you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a little competitive spirit to take on this Gen AI challenge.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Interactive

title: AWS Jam: Security- Sponsored by PaloAlto Networks and Fortinet
description: In this session, we’ll provide incident response scenarios where you can build new skills and sharpen existing ones by working through simulated security incidents. Can you identify what caused the breach? What would you do differently? How can you use AWS services to architect and prevent incidents from happening again? Whether you're new to AWS, new to security, or experienced in both, this session is for you. Our guided exercises and AWS experts will support learners of all levels. Team up, compete against others, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. With expert guidance and helpful clues along the way, all you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a competitive spirit to take on the challenge.
tags: Training & Certification; Security & Identity; Interactive

title: AWS KMS over the decade: How architecture evolved to earn customer trust
description: Data privacy and sovereignty requirements continue to drive cloud security innovation. This deep dive session traces AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) evolution since inception; from solving fundamental key management challenges to supporting complex regulatory and compliance requirements. Learn about the AWS KMS architecture, operational processes, and technical controls that are in place and how it all comes together to help ensure customer trust. Gain insights into AWS European Sovereign Cloud and how its utilization of partitions and its corporate governance model provide you with stronger security assurance and sovereignty needs.
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: AWS Lambda performance tuning: Best practices and guidance [REPEAT]
description: In this session, you learn about opportunities to optimize your Serverless applications built with AWS Lambda. We'll discuss optimizations in the function configuration and within your function code. This session also covers how you can best measure and tune your function's performance by configuring memory to get the right application performance. You also hear best practices for initialization logic and reuse to enable fast startup and fast execution of your functions.

description: Discover how Hybrid Edge solutions help organizations deliver low-latency experiences globally. You will learn how AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts extend cloud infrastructure beyond AWS Regions across multiple industries, from media/gaming to financial services. Verifone will share how they transformed their global payment ecosystem, managing 35 million terminals with innovative edge computing. Dive into strategies for deploying point-of-sale (POS) software using multi-tier architectures. Whether you're managing global operations or optimizing performance, this session provides actionable insights to enhance end-user experiences with AWS edge solutions.

title: AWS Marketplace growth through product-led growth and international expansion
description: Discover how to accelerate your product-led growth (PLG) strategy and expand globally through AWS Marketplace. This session provides practical insights into optimizing digital customer acquisition, streamlining the buying experience, and localizing purchasing experiences. Learn to leverage AWS Marketplace capabilities to drive self-service subscriptions, shorten sales cycles, and obtain global operational fluidity. We'll cover best practices for listing optimization, pricing strategies, and key actionable insights to help with your international reach.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: AWS Marketplace seller workshop: Publish, update, and manage products
description: In this workshop, choose between hands-on labs for new sellers just starting or labs for experienced sellers looking to optimize their operations in AWS Marketplace. Sellers just starting out can explore publishing AI agents, virtual machines, containers, or SaaS-based products. Established sellers can learn about API-enabled automation for their delivery pipelines and other integrations with AWS Marketplace. The part of the workshop intended for established sellers requires a registered seller account with an existing published product. For new or interested sellers, an active AWS account is required. This workshop is intended for AWS Partners. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Automation; Application Integration; Business Applications; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Hands-on; Interactive

title: AWS migration journey: 2025 itinerary for Microsoft workloads
description: Ready to take your Microsoft migration journey to the next level in a world of AI-based tools? Join us for a session that showcases migration tools, mechanisms, and best practices supporting your Microsoft ecosystem. Whether you're migrating Active Directory, File Servers, Application Servers, or SQL databases, discover how to transform your landscape with precision and confidence on AWS. Learn firsthand how these services and solutions streamline complex migrations, reduce manual effort, and accelerate your migration journey.
speakers: Mangesh Budkule; Sassan Hajrasooliha; Adi Simon
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); AWS Application Migration Service
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

description: Navigate the complexities of enterprise cloud migration with insights gained from thousands of successful AWS transformations. This technical deep-dive examines critical planning phases: from initial discovery and environment assessment to building robust migration plans. Explore AWS Transform's capabilities for accelerated analysis while building comprehensive technical and business strategies. Learn the art of creating executable migration plans backed by real-world examples and proven methodologies.
