title: AWS Networking Fundamentals: Connect, secure and scale
description: Dive into AWS networking foundations, starting with the fundamentals of Amazon VPC in a single Region. Learn essential skills for IPv4 and IPv6 selection, subnetting, routing, DNS, and security before scaling to global, multi-Region architectures. In this session, explore various VPC connectivity methods, hybrid network integration, and secure traffic management techniques. Discover how to implement private remote access for cloud resources and optimize service-to-service communication while building zero trust architectures. Whether new to AWS or wanting to expand networking building blocks, this session delivers practical insights into best practices and proven architecture patterns for establishing global connectivity.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: AWS SAM Beyond the Basics - Powered by Amazon Q Developer
description: Join us for an interactive chalk talk where we'll collaboratively uncover the lesser-known capabilities of AWS SAM for local serverless development, enhanced by Amazon Q Developer. Together, we'll explore how SAM can revolutionize your local development workflow beyond its well-known deployment features. Through group discussion and live diagramming, we'll explore advanced techniques for testing Lambda functions, API Gateway, and event sources locally without cloud deployment. You'll discover how Amazon Q Developer integration can accelerate development cycles and enable sophisticated local debugging. Bring your questions and challenges as we collectively explore ways to reduce development time and cloud costs while building more robust serverless applications.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: AWS Serverless developer experience workshop [REPEAT]
description: The AWS Serverless Developer Experience (SDE) workshop is a hands-on workshop that immerses developers in building serverless solutions using AWS SAM. It covers composing serverless applications, event-driven architecture principles, serverless observability, open-source tools, and deployment automation, and is available in Python, Typescript, Java, or .NET runtime. The workshop aims to accelerate your serverless maturity through a real-world use case, challenging you to understand the “why” behind the design decisions, and their implementation, as you complete the solution and apply Serverless best practices.

description: Discover how AWS Skill Builder is transforming AWS Cloud learning! Learn about the new features we are launching as part of Skill Builder Next.

description: The AWS Solutions Library provides proven architectural patterns for rapid innovation. This workshop demonstrates how to integrate multiple AWS Solutions to quickly implement an observability system for application performance and operational costs, and also take Agentic Actions on resources. Through hands-on exercises, learn to combine and customize pre-built solutions for enterprise-scale systems. Discover architectural strategies for leveraging the AWS Solutions Library to accelerate solution delivery. Gain practical experience implementing production-ready patterns from the AWS Solutions Library.

title: AWS storage beyond data boundaries: Building the data foundation
description: AWS storage services have evolved into the data foundation powering virtually any modern workload from massive data lakes to cutting-edge generative AI applications. This session unveils breakthrough innovations like S3 Tables for analytics optimization, S3 Vectors for AI/ML acceleration, and seamless SAN migration pathways that eliminate traditional infrastructure constraints. Discover how customers are building the world's largest data repositories while simultaneously running real-time analytics, training sophisticated AI models, and running mission-critical applications all on virtually unlimited scale, high performance, and elastic storage services. Learn how these storage services transform data from static storage into dynamic, intelligent data that adapts and scales with innovation.
tags: Storage; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: AWS Tools: Automate Simulation jobs Recovery & maximize Cost Savings
description:
Discover how to harness the power of AWS Spot instances for HPC workloads while achieving cost savings compared to On-Demand pricing. 
 This session demonstrates innovative automation techniques for managing long-running simulations through checkpoint-restore capabilities, ensuring your scientific research stays on track despite potential spot interruptions. 
 We'll showcase practical implementations using smart job navigator solution that allows stateful jobs to survive Spot interruptions, helping you accelerate research outcomes while optimizing budget efficiency.
tags: Cost Optimization; Compute; Sales / Marketing; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: AWS wherever you need it: From the cloud to the edge
description: While most workloads can be migrated to the cloud, some remain on-premises or at the edge due to low latency, local data processing, or digital sovereignty needs. In this session, learn how AWS services like AWS Outposts, AWS Local Zones, AWS Dedicated Local Zones, and AWS IoT support hybrid cloud and edge computing workloads such as multiplayer gaming, high-frequency trading, medical imaging, smart manufacturing, and generative AI applications with data residency requirements.
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Generative AI; VMware; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Balance cost, performance & reliability for AI at enterprise scale
description: Deploying generative AI at enterprise scale requires balancing performance, cost, and reliability across diverse business purposes and use cases. Amazon Bedrock offers a complete portfolio of inference options, with on-demand cross-region inference for elastic scaling, on-demand service tiers for balancing performance and cost, including optimization options like prompt caching for improving latency while significantly reducing cost, and batch inference for cost-effective bulk processing. This interactive session covers the tools and approaches needed to architect hybrid inference strategies that enable enterprises to maximize price-performance ratios as AI workloads scale.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Balancing Agility and Compliance feat. The Digital Agency of Japan
description: Regulated industries face the challenge of innovating with agility while addressing stringent security and compliance requirements in the cloud. In this session, learn how the Japanese government successfully implemented a centralized governance model for cloud adoption across 30 ministries and 1,700 local government, enabling over 5,000 accounts to be managed seamlessly. With AWS Cloud Governance services like AWS Control Tower, AWS Config, and AWS Security Hub, regulated and public sector industries can streamline operations, enhance governance, and meet evolving compliance requirements to strike a balance between central control and local autonomy.
speakers: Nivas Durairaj; Yukitaka Ohmura; Norihito Yamamoto
services: AWS Config; AWS Control Tower; AWS Security Hub
tags: Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Government; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Balancing AI Innovation and Security: Novo Nordisk Agentic AI Framework
description: In the highly regulated life sciences industry, Novo Nordisk's Product Supply division pioneered a breakthrough framework for secure enterprise AI deployment. In this session, you’ll learn how the company built and scaled a solution that combines Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AI agents, featuring robust sandboxing and automated security controls. Explore how this innovative approach not only ensures compliance with strict pharmaceutical requirements but also accelerates AI adoption across manufacturing operations.
speakers: Xiaoyu Xing; Jens Jepsen; Kasper Kristensen
tags: Responsible AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Interactive

title: BCC: Hybrid architecture for generative AI to meet regulatory needs
description: Bank CenterCredit (BCC), a leading bank in Kazakhstan developed the first secure, scalable hybrid architecture tailored to meet Kazakhstan’s financial data regulations in Central Asia. Leveraging AWS Outposts and AWS KMS, the bank enabled local data storage with encrypted processing in the cloud. This architecture created solid foundation for multiple Generative AI delivered with Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Use cases include custom speech recognition model in Russian, Kazakh, and mixed languages, investments news summarization, and an HR chatbot. These AI solutions enabled regulatory compliance, cost savings, and operational efficiency—positioning BCC for continued innovation and growth.
tags: Lecture-style

title: Behind the curtain: Generative AI observability in financial services [REPEAT]
description: Financial institutions deploying generative AI seek to effectively track model behavior, detect reasoning failures, and maintain regulatory compliance. In this chalk talk, we'll explore real-time observability techniques for generative AI workloads in regulated industries. You'll learn how to monitor prompt drift, hallucinations, grounding failures, and output volatility using Amazon Bedrock with Amazon CloudWatch and custom AWS Lambda logs. We'll walk through a solution that traces model behavior, visualizes anomalies, and enables prompt-level debugging—helping you meet audit, trust, and performance requirements for financial services deployments.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Cloud Security Specialist; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Interactive

description: Financial institutions deploying generative AI seek to effectively track model behavior, detect reasoning failures, and maintain regulatory compliance. title: Behind the curtain: How Amazon’s AI innovations are powered by AWS
description: Discover how Amazon leaders across Zoox, Prime Video, and Amazon Stores are leveraging AI to power their next-generation innovations with AWS and create better experiences for customers. Through three key stories discover how customer needs sparked transformative experiences: fan feedback revolutionizing sports broadcasting with AI-powered highlights, shopping patterns evolving Amazon’s mobile commerce platform, and robotics and automation delivering advances in supply chain optimization and fulfillment. Learn the best practices Amazon has applied using AWS that can help scale innovation in your organization.
tags: Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: Behind the scenes: How AWS drives operational excellence & reliability
description: How does AWS maintain operational excellence at a global scale? We'll dive deep into our operational best practices, culture, and learnings we've developed to operate large-scale services. We will also demonstrate some of the most-loved features in Amazon CloudWatch by AWS operators that you can readily deploy to improve operational efficiency and reduce Mean Time To Resolve (MTTR). You'll learn best practices for implementing scalable observability, drawn from our experience operating some of the largest distributed systems on Earth.
tags: Management & Governance; Monitoring & Observability; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Best practices for agentic data engineering with AWS Analytics MCP Servers
description: In this session, we will introduce AWS Analytics Model Context Protocol (MCP) Servers, including the Data Processing MCP Server and Amazon Redshift MCP Server, which enable agentic workflows across AWS Glue, Amazon EMR, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Redshift. You will learn how these open-source tools simplify complex analytics operations through natural language interactions with AI agents. We'll cover MCP server implementation strategies, real-world use cases, architectural patterns for deployment, and production best practices for building intelligent data engineering workflows that understand and orchestrate your analytics environment.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Best practices for building Apache Iceberg based lakehouse architectures on AWS
description: Discover advanced strategies for implementing Apache Iceberg on AWS, focusing on Amazon S3 Tables and integration of Iceberg Rest Catalog with the lakehouse in Amazon SageMaker. We'll cover performance optimization techniques for Amazon Athena and Amazon Redshift queries, real-time processing using Apache Spark, and integration with Amazon EMR, AWS Glue, and Trino. Explore practical implementations of zero-ETL, change data capture (CDC) patterns, and medallion architecture. Gain hands-on expertise in implementing enterprise-grade lakehouse solutions with Iceberg on AWS.
services: Amazon EMR; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Open Data; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Open Source; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Best Practices for CI/CD & Deployment Automation in Amazon QuickSight
description: Join us to learn Amazon QuickSight deployments in this session focused on CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies. Learn proven approaches for configuration management, infrastructure as code, and reliable release processes across all environments. We'll demonstrate version control strategies, validation checks, and monitoring solutions while covering dependency management and rollback mechanisms. Perfect for DevOps engineers and architects, you'll gain practical templates and insights for building scalable deployment workflows with popular CI/CD tools.
tags: Interactive

title: Best practices for cost optimization with AWS Backup [REPEAT]
description: AWS Backup enables you to protect application data at exabyte scale across more than 20 AWS services, including Amazon S3 and Amazon EBS. While implementing data protection is imperative in 2025, effectively balancing your total cost of ownership (TCO) with business and regulatory requirements requires a tailored approach. In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize AWS Backup costs while meeting business requirements for recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO). We'll walk through cost optimization examples and best practices learned from AWS customers, including how to use AWS Backup reporting and monitoring features for cost optimization.
tags: Data Protection; Resilience; Cost Optimization; Storage; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Best practices for deploying critical applications with Amazon EBS
description: Millions of customers run their performance-intensive enterprise applications and databases on AWS. In this workshop, explore the step-by-step process of deploying a high-performance application on Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS for optimized availability, resiliency, and cost performance. Discover how to select the ideal Amazon EC2 instance types and Amazon EBS volume types for various workloads. Learn about on-demand storage flexibility and performance using Elastic Volumes. Monitor and improve the operational performance and resource optimization of Amazon EBS using Amazon CloudWatch metrics. Build resilience and fault tolerance using AWS Fault Injection Simulator.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)
tags: Resilience; Well-Architected Framework; Business Applications; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Best practices for maximizing S3 File Gateway performance
description: Dive deep into advanced performance optimization techniques for S3 File Gateway in this expert-level discussion. Examine automated deployment patterns using Infrastructure as Code with Terraform, covering complex hybrid environment configurations. Share your challenges as we analyze critical performance factors including cache architecture, network design patterns, and sophisticated monitoring approaches. Explore architectural decisions that impact throughput, drawing from real customer implementations and latest best practices. This technical session covers advanced event-driven architectures, system limitations, and strategies for building highly optimized hybrid storage solutions. Bring your complex S3 File Gateway scenarios for collaborative problem-solving.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Monitoring & Observability; Automation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Best practices for migrating and operating Db2 databases on Amazon RDS
description: Whether you’re evaluating migration paths for your Db2 databases or are interested in efficiently operating your already migrated Db2 databases on Amazon RDS, we’ve got you covered. In this chalk talk, learn about migration paths, including those with minimal downtime, for Db2 databases running on various platforms including Linux, Unix, Windows, AIX, and z/OS. Explore real-world examples to learn best practices that help ensure high availability, optimize performance, and meet your compliance needs. Bring your questions and challenges—this interactive talk offers you the opportunity to hear directly from AWS experts and collaborate with your peers.
services: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for Db2
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Best practices for optimizing financial services application latency
description: Optimizing latency in complex financial services software systems requires in-depth analysis and a comprehensive understanding of both infrastructure and software stacks. In this chalk talk, learn how to efficiently run latency sensitive workloads in AWS, leveraging core banking as an example. Explore ways to optimize communication protocols and network performance using generative AI and practical mental models. Join us for step-by-step architecture decisions and live demos showcasing system performance enhancements with the right AWS services. Walk away with actionable insights and ready-to-use optimization checklists to enhance the user experience, drive customer satisfaction, and improve your return on investment.
services: Amazon CloudFront; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Edge Computing; Network & Infrastructure Security; Containers; Networking & Content Delivery; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Interactive

description: Learn how to build, test, and validate custom code transformation with agentic AI. Through practical examples, we'll cover defining effective transformation rules, testing strategies to refine your agents, and validation methods to ensure reliable code conversion. This session will help architects and developers create robust transformation agents for their application modernization projects. You'll leave with actionable best practices for handling complex code conversions and maintaining transformation quality at scale.

title: Best practices for serverless developers
description: Do you want to take advantage of the full power of serverless architectures for your production workloads? Are you wondering how events can help your applications scale? Have you been trying to tune your applications for higher performance and lower cost? This session provides architectural best practices, optimizations, and useful shortcuts that experts can use to build secure, high-scale, and high-performance serverless applications.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Better, faster, cheaper: How Valkey is revolutionizing caching
description: In this session, discover how the powerful combination of open source Valkey and Amazon ElastiCache is transforming the landscape of distributed caching. Explore recent innovations such as probabilistic data structures like bloom filters, a memory efficient dictionary that reduces memory usage by up to 40%, and a multi-threaded architecture that enables instantaneous scaling by up to 230%. We'll reveal the infrastructure that enables ElastiCache to seamlessly patch hundreds of thousands of customers while maintaining high availability, even for extreme workloads like Prime Day's trillion requests per minute.
tags: Open Data; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Beyond Batch: Modernize with Event-Driven Architecture & Serverless [REPEAT]
description: Legacy systems typically employ a batch processing model, where transactions are retrieved from logs or databases at scheduled times and processed. This builders session introduces event-driven patterns as a solution, enabling near real-time processing and removing the constraints of end-of-batch processing. Through practical analysis and real-world considerations, you'll gain the insights needed to eliminate batch processing and move towards event driven systems at scale. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Rajdeep Banerjee; Ray Chang; Ramesh Chidirala; Elie Elmalem; Ramesh Mathikumar
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Migration & Modernization; Advisor / Consultant; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Beyond EHR: Leveraging AWS for Maximum Clinical and Operational Impact
description: Successful EHR hosting on AWS has become standard practice, as evidenced by AWS' 2025 Best in KLAS rating for public cloud. This session features two innovative health systems demonstrating how they've moved beyond basic EHR implementation to create competitive advantages with AWS. Leaders will share strategies for moving past "lift-and-shift" to drive meaningful innovation by leveraging cloud-native solutions, extending EHR functionality, and developing unique patient and provider experiences. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn practical approaches to healthcare innovation, value creation frameworks, and implementation insights. Designed for technology leaders, digital strategists, and clinical innovation teams seeking to differentiate their organizations.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Well-Architected Framework; Migration & Modernization; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Beyond Fine-Tuning: Agentic AI for HFT Quantitative Analytics
description: Capital markets face a critical challenge: traditional LLMs generate skewed sentiment when analyzing combined dynamic market data and historical pricing for quantitative strategies. This session demonstrates a production agentic architecture that enables users to launch immediately without the time-consuming process of fine-tuning models. By eliminating the tedious work of creating labeled datasets, teams can quickly implement reliable investment analytics and start seeing positive results right away. Our solution leverages Claude 3.7 for task planning, MCP for historical data collection, and DeepSeek R1 reasoning in SageMaker. Using Bedrock multi-model capabilities and Q CLI, this Level 300 session includes demos and architectural patterns.
tags: Blockchain; Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Beyond microservices: Event-driven patterns for modern applications [REPEAT]
description: Modern applications demand resilient, scalable event-driven architectures. This chalk talk explores proven patterns for processing billions of events daily using Amazon EventBridge, AWS Lambda, and microservices. Learn practical strategies for decomposing monoliths using strangler and leave/layer patterns while maintaining system reliability. Examine approaches to schema evolution, event versioning, dead letter queue management, and observability. Discover how organizations achieve loose coupling, improved fault tolerance, and faster feature delivery through event-driven patterns that scale seamlessly from thousands to billions of events.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Modern enterprises need flexible file transfer strategies addressing one-time migrations, recurring workflows, and processing-intensive transfers. This session explores comprehensive solutions using AWS Transfer Family and DataSync across these three scenarios. Learn to segment requirements and select appropriate services through real customer stories. We'll cover migration patterns for moving data from on-premises and other clouds, establishing secure recurring workflows, and integrating processing capabilities. Walk away with practical guidance on service selection, reference architectures, and best practices for building unified data movement strategies that scale with your business needs.

This session will detail how you can take advantage of service events or custom metrics to build an operational dashboard using AWS Batch as an example.

title: Beyond Traditional Computing: How WorkSpaces Powers the Future AI Workplace
description: Discover how Amazon WorkSpaces is transforming the digital workplace through AI-powered desktop management and intelligent automation. Learn how new WorkSpaces capabilities support modern applications while enabling AI workloads and development environments. In this breakout, Deloitte will share their journey of eliminating physical infrastructure management, enhancing security through workload isolation, and optimizing costs. See how AI streamlines WorkSpaces through automated setup, predictive scaling, and intelligent monitoring, building the foundation for tomorrow's AI-enabled workplace.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; End-User Computing; Business Executive; IT Executive; Tech Explorer; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Beyond vibe testing: Productionalizing mission-driven genAI workloads [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations don’t have good criteria for moving their generative AI workloads from development to production, despite the fact that these capabilities can drive meaningful impact within social and environmental missions. They are effectively testing based on vibes, or their emotional reaction to a foundation model’s outputs, instead of real testing criteria. In this session, we’ll talk about how to create gold standard data, how to validate model outputs, and come up with quantitative criteria so you can confidently move workloads to production. You’ll leave with the tools and know-how so you can confidently break free from vibe testing.
tags: Generative AI; Tech for Impact; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Nonprofit; Interactive

title: Beyond vibe testing: Productionalizing mission-driven genAI workloads [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations don’t have good criteria for moving their generative AI workloads from development to production, despite the fact that these capabilities can drive meaningful impact within social and environmental missions. They are effectively testing based on vibes, or their emotional reaction to a foundation model’s outputs, instead of real testing criteria. In this session, we’ll talk about how to create gold standard data, how to validate model outputs, and come up with quantitative criteria so you can confidently move workloads to production. You’ll leave with the tools and know-how so you can confidently break free from vibe testing.

title: Binge-worthy: Netflix's journey to Amazon Aurora at scale
description: In this session, learn how Netflix successfully orchestrated the migration of terabytes of mission-critical data across 100+ clusters to Amazon Aurora while ensuring continuous service for millions of global subscribers. Through a detailed examination of their innovative approach combining AWS Database Migration Service and Netflix's proprietary Data Streaming Platform, explore how they achieved near-zero downtime and maintained data integrity throughout this complex transition. Technical leaders will gain actionable insights into architecting similar migrations, managing risks, and leveraging AWS tools effectively. Join us to learn how Netflix's experience can inform your own database modernization strategy.

Learn to create cloud-scale dev/test environments for Oracle, leveraging snapshots and cloning features to accelerate iterations and enhance collaboration. This chalk talk covers high availability and failover mechanisms for Single-AZ and Multi-AZ configurations, including automatic failover and data replication, to maintain seamless operations during events. title: Boost employee productivity with Amazon Q Business
description: In this session, learn how Amazon Q Business can help you quickly build a generative AI–powered assistant that can answer questions, provide summaries, generate content, and complete tasks based on data and information in your enterprise systems across a variety of use cases. With security and privacy as central considerations, Amazon Q can respect existing identities, roles, and permissions and allows you to restrict sensitive topics, block keywords, and filter out inappropriate questions and answers.
tags: Lecture-style

title: Boost performance and reduce costs in Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS
description: In this session, explore Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS cost components and learn important best practices that can help you improve the performance of your relational database workloads while reducing spend on cost components such as compute, storage, backup, and I/O. Learn about the latest performance monitoring features, which provide insights on how to efficiently track and optimize database performance at scale and help ensure that you’re maximizing efficiency while keeping costs under control.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Cost Optimization; DevOps; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

Learn how Amazon Q in QuickSight enables users to analyze databases, data lakes, documents, and business content through a single interface. See real-world examples of organizations breaking down data silos to gain comprehensive insights. Explore best practices for implementing unified analytics that drive better business decisions.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Break down monoliths, modernizing applications on Amazon ECS
description: Join this interactive chalk talk to solve a common challenge where monolithic applications take months to deploy new features and scaling becomes increasingly difficult. We'll start with a real scenario, an application running on servers with a shared database. Together, we'll design the modernization path using Amazon ECS and Well Architected Framework principles. You'll explore servers vs serverless trade-offs, CI/CD automation, blue/green deployment strategies, and how GenAI can accelerate your modernization journey. After this session, you'll walk away with a roadmap to modernize your application. Bring your curiosity and help us build the architecture live!
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Application Migration Service; AWS Fargate
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Containers; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; Advisor / Consultant; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

description: Generative AI deployments face challenges with high computing costs and complex scaling requirements. AWS Trainium2 and Inferentia2 chips deliver compelling price-performance for both training and inference workloads. In this session, discover innovations that enable efficient scaling of advanced AI workloads, from training and serving MoE models to deploying agentic systems with reasoning capabilities. Learn how customers are achieving exceptional performance while significantly reducing costs.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

Through collaborative whiteboarding with AWS industry experts, discover architectural patterns that combine IoT data with Amazon Bedrock to build next-generation maintenance support systems. Learn how to help your customers transform operations by creating intelligent assistants that integrate real-time telemetry, maintenance documentation, parts catalogs, and historical service records into unified solutions.

services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS IoT Core; AWS IoT Greengrass

See practical examples of chaos engineering for networking that reveal weak points before they become real problems.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

description: Struggling with fragmented data across multiple platforms? Join us for an interactive session where we'll explore strategies for breaking data silos and achieving interoperability between AWS and external data sources such as data in SAP, Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Oracle. We'll dive deep into best practices for creating a unified, open, and secure data lakehouse architecture, fully compatible with Apache Iceberg. Through live demos, you'll gain practical insights into overcoming common challenges in cross-platform data access and automating critical housekeeping tasks like data compaction, metadata management, and performance optimization. Whether you're dealing with databases, SaaS applications, or multi-cloud scenarios, you'll leave equipped with strategies to accelerate time to insights.

description: Media organizations struggle to monetize content archives due to fragmented workflows across search, rights verification, and distribution. This chalk talk demonstrates an agentic media lake platform enabling natural language asset discovery, automated rights verification, and distribution through coordinated agent workflows. Unlike rigid pipelines, our multi-agent architecture orchestrates dynamic workflows where specialized agents handle search, rights clearance, format optimization, and platform-specific distribution. We�ll explore agent-to-agent communication for adaptive decision-making as agents coordinate workflows and adjust strategies throughout the content lifecycle. This showcases how conversational AI transforms the journey from �finding content� to �generating revenue� into an intuitive interaction that accelerates monetization.
speakers: Vu San Ha Huynh; Robert Raver
tags: Generative AI; Migration & Modernization; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Interactive

title: Breaking the legacy barrier: How AI is revolutionizing modernization
description: Enterprises are trapped by legacy monoliths that drain billions in maintenance while stifling innovation. Traditional event storming relies on fragmented human memory and disappearing institutional knowledge. Learn how Large Language Models can now reverse-engineer entire codebases, automatically generating comprehensive event storming boards that capture hidden business rules and forgotten workflows in legacy applications. This AI-driven approach transforms months of code archaeology into days of systematic analysis. Organizations can modernize confidently, with early adopters reporting faster modernization with less timeline and fewer post-migration defects. Experience how AI precision is revolutionizing enterprise modernization.

tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

In session, we'll show how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore helps teams move from proof-of-concept to production using enterprise-grade services, including Runtime, Gateway, Identity, Memory, Observability, Code Interpreter, and Browser. Learn how these services simplify development, reduce operational burden, and improve time-to-value. You'll get best practices from the technical team at Ericsson, and we'll cover foundational capabilities like enterprise readiness, tool integration, and performance at scale, providing a blueprint for success no matter where you are in your journey.

In this chalk talk, learn how to architect an unified data platform using Amazon SageMaker that connects data providers with consumers securely. Through interactive white-boarding, explore architectural patterns for data marketplaces, governance controls, and compliance frameworks. Gain practical insights into implementing these solutions while maintaining security in highly regulated environments.

title: Build a stablecoin payment processor using AWS serverless services
description: In this session, build a stablecoin payment processing system using AWS serverless architecture. Through hands-on labs, implement digital asset workflows using AWS Lambda functions, secure critical transaction data with AWS Key Management Service, and design scalable Amazon DynamoDB data models for high-volume payment processing. You will implement robust and scalable mechanisms for handling blockchain events and create automated settlement processes. Also learn how to leverage built-in metrics from Lambda and DynamoDB to monitor invoice creation and payment confirmations. Prerequisites include experience with AWS serverless services and basic blockchain concepts. You must bring a laptop to participate.
tags: Blockchain; Serverless; Application Integration; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Executive; Tech Explorer; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Hands-on; Interactive

description: In this workshop, learn to build modern web applications at scale using purpose-built databases. Discover how to apply development patterns using Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon ElastiCache, Amazon Neptune, and Amazon OpenSearch Service to build a fully functional and scalable ecommerce bookstore application, and dive deep into best practices along the way. Basic familiarity with AWS concepts and services such as AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Amazon VPC, networking, and storage services are recommended. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Neptune
tags: SaaS; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build a well-architected foundation for scaling generative AI and agentic apps
description:
You've seen the potential of agentic AI through proof-of-concepts, and you're ready to build a foundation that can support all AI applications across your organization. Enter the complexities: model access and management, tool discovery, memory and state handling, observability, plus deployment and operations at scale!
In this session we'll demonstrate how to build a well-architected foundation that seamlessly integrates model access, orchestration workflows, agents, tools and domain-specific data pipelines while maintaining enterprise-grade observability and governance controls. We'll examine components of a production-ready generative AI and agentic system and dive deep into the architectural patterns that separates successful deployments from failed experiments.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Build Advanced AI-powered Search with OpenSearch MCP and Vectors
description: Learn how to improve search applications using Amazon OpenSearch Service. We'll explore implementing advanced architectural patterns using Model Context Protocol (MCP) and hybrid search features like Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF). Discover how to move from traditional RAG solutions to advanced implementations combining OpenSearch's vector engine, keyword search, and neural search capabilities. Developers and architects will learn to implement hybrid search capabilities, configure intelligent query routing, and optimize relevance ranking through automation. We'll demonstrate how to build search applications that deliver higher accuracy and improved user experiences by combining different search methodologies. Whether enhancing e-commerce search, building enterprise solutions, or implementing AI-powered applications, you'll learn to modernize search applications at scale with OpenSearch.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon OpenSearch Service; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Build Advanced Enterprise Search with Vector, Hybrid, and AI Techniques
description: Discover how global enterprises are revolutionizing search experiences using Amazon OpenSearch Service. Learn how vector search combined with hybrid optimization transforms business operations through examples of leading enterprises who have transformed their content discovery and retrieval processes, achieving significant improvements in search accuracy and performance. Learn how Canva processes 1.2 million daily requests while Adobe leverages vector search for improved retrieval accuracy. We'll dive deep into OpenSearch vector capabilities, reciprocal rank fusion (RRF), and AI-powered relevance optimization. You'll learn how to build scalable, high-performance search solutions that combine traditional search with advanced AI capabilities.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; Data Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

description: Monolithic applications present unique challenges when extending functionality and adopting to genAI capabilities. In this builder's session, you'll learn how to create autonomous agents that can reason, generate, and securely execute code in a sandbox environment and seamlessly integrate agentic AI-powered features into existing "black box" applications using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. We'll explore implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for enhanced AI model interactions to connect agents with enterprise systems and APIs. You'll gain practical experience building secure integration patterns that enable your legacy systems to interact with modern AI capabilities without compromising stability or security.

title: Build agentic AI–powered search with Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS
description: The integration of embeddings generated from LLMs with Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL offers a powerful and efficient solution for optimizing product catalog similarity search experience. By leveraging foundation models and vector embeddings, businesses can enhance speed and accuracy of responses using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), enable agentic AI capabilities such as reasoning and tool use, and apply Model Context Protocol (MCP) to manage context and prompt structure, which drives more personalized, intelligent user experiences. In this workshop, build your own agentic AI applications with Amazon Bedrock, using Aurora PostgreSQL as your vector database.

Follow step-by-step guidance to set up models, connect external knowledge bases with RAG for richer context, integrate multi-turn agentic workflows, and deploy a scalable voice chat app optimized for cost, latency, and accuracy. description: Discover how to architect and enhance AI development workflows on AWS with powerful third-party agents and tools from AWS Marketplace using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway and Runtime. This session walks through real-world use cases for third-party agents and how to efficiently source and deploy AI development tools the moment you need them. Through architecture diagrams and live demonstrations, we'll explore how to import tools via Gateway, establish connections with Claude Desktop and Amazon Q developer environments, and deploy tools in Runtime. Learn architectural best practices and see implementation patterns that showcase the power of integrating third-party products into your AWS workflows.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Build agentic workflows using third-party AI agents & tools
description: Discover how to fast track your AI initiatives using pre-built AI agents and agent development tools from software vendors in AWS Marketplace. This chalk talk will demonstrate how to utilize specialized AI agents for common use cases and access curated tools to build custom solutions on your preferred frameworks. Learn about the API-based deployment method with MCP and A2A support, enabling seamless agent integration and communication. We'll showcase deployment options through Genesis Runtime and containers, all while maintaining enterprise-grade security. Join us to explore how AWS Marketplace can accelerate your AI agent development while leveraging trusted AWS infrastructure.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Build agentic workflows with Aurora and MCP [REPEAT]
description: Explore how to build an agentic AI application using Amazon Aurora and Model Context Protocol (MCP). This session introduces design patterns for agents powered by Amazon Bedrock that retrieve live relational data from Amazon Aurora to drive autonomous workflows. Learn how to build solutions using MCP servers to enable contextual memory, handle multi-turn queries, and securely connect LLM agents to Aurora clusters. Discover architecture blueprints that combine structured data with LLMs and orchestrate multi-agent workflows with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, LangGraph and Strands Agents. Ideal for builders creating real-time, intelligent systems that operate directly on relational data.
tags: Open Data; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

Create autonomous agents that reason, plan, and execute complex tasks through advanced prompt engineering and state management. Get hands-on experience with tool calling and MCP integration patterns to manage context between different tools, enabling seamless multi-step workflows. Learn to use Bedrock AgentCore to deploy agents for real-time use cases with security, observability and scale. Integrating with LLMs deployed in SageMaker AI, Bedrock AgentCore, and open-source frameworks, learn to build production-ready AI agents that deliver measurable business value while maintaining security, scalability, and cost efficiency.

This session provides comprehensive guidance on optimizing your AI agents for Bedrock AgentCore, as well as exploring the interconnectivity possibilities between agents and third-party tools through AgentCore Gateway. You'll also gain valuable insights into the specific build requirements needed to successfully list your agents in AWS Marketplace, enabling you to expand your reach to potential customers.

Discover how to leverage enterprise-grade features for building secure and scalable AI solutions. Practice implementing agent development patterns that take advantage of AgentCore's comprehensive infrastructure capabilities. Experience hands-on development combining Strands' flexible framework with AgentCore's robust enterprise features. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build AI agents: A scalable framework using Strands and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: Join this interactive session to explore architectural patterns for building enterprise-ready AI agents using Strands and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Through collaborative whiteboarding, discover how to design a flexible, scalable framework for AI agents that can be applied across various industries, demonstrated through retail use cases like intelligent product recommendations and automated customer service. We’ll showcase how Strands multiagent architecture enables highly composable and extensible solutions, while AgentCore Gateway provides runtime, identity, and more. Learn implementation strategies for connecting language models through Amazon Bedrock with your tools and systems, emphasizing patterns that can be adapted to different business contexts.
tags: Generative AI; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Interactive

description: Discover how Amazon Bedrock delivers a frictionless developer experience for building generative AI applications. Learn how to get started quickly and build prototypes using Bedrock API keys, eliminating the need for complex infrastructure setup. See how Bedrock's Unified API gives you consistent, secure access to 200+ foundation models from leading providers, with rich SDKs and language support that integrate seamlessly into your stack. Whether you're building chatbots, copilots, or multimodal experiences, this session will show you how Bedrock lets you focus on innovation instead of infrastructure.

title: Build AI Assistants Using Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases
description: This lab explores building an AI shopping assistant using Amazon Bedrock Agents, Knowledge Bases, and Guardrails. Using a pre-built lawn maintenance products dataset, learn to integrate knowledge bases with agents, implement guardrails for safe interactions, and utilize agent functions for calculations and pricing. Practice developing applications with Jupyter notebooks and analyze agent behavior through trace analysis. Ideal for developers implementing secure, knowledge-driven AI assistants.
tags: Training & Certification; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Build AI Commerce Media Agents: Audience Discovery & Campaign Performance
description: As agentic AI emerges as a transformative technology, organizations face challenges integrating it effectively within existing retail and commerce media workflows traditionally powered by machine learning (ML). In this hands-on builder session, you’ll create a multi-agent solution for automating campaign audience definition and A/B testing to model customer 'what-if' scenarios for commerce media, advertising, and marketing use cases. Through practical exercises, you'll learn how to enhance traditional ML with agents to discover new segments and improve recommendations, potentially enhancing audience intelligence and improving return on ad spend (ROAS).
speakers: Mark Hoover; Alicja Kwasniewska; Ghandi Nader; Hari Radhakrishnan; Negin Rouhanizadeh
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Lambda
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Retail & Consumer Goods; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build AI your way with Amazon Nova customization
description: AI delivers the most value when it deeply understands your business. Whether you're enhancing the customer experience of your AI applications, or building agents that handle diverse tasks - Amazon Nova gives you tools to adapt the model to your specific needs. Learn how to combine the power of your organization's data for aligning model responses to your preferred tone and behavior, or training it on your unique workflows and business knowledge. Hear from Terra Security how they incorporated proprietary security data with built-in guardrails, dynamic refusal capabilities, and model retraining to ensure ongoing effectiveness in security operations.
speakers: Veda Raman; Dan Sinnreich; Gal Malachi
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Build AI-Powered Dashboards for Virtual Desktops
description: Elevate your desktop management with intelligent monitoring and automated insights. In this workshop, learn to enhance Amazon WorkSpaces observability using AI-powered analytics and CloudWatch metrics. Build comprehensive dashboards that automatically detect usage patterns, identify optimization opportunities, and streamline troubleshooting workflows. Through hands-on exercises, implement AI-assisted monitoring that provides predictive insights into workspace performance and user experience. Create automated response workflows that reduce resolution times and optimize resource utilization across your WorkSpaces environment.

description: AI coding agents are transforming how developers build and operate modern cloud-native applications. From tools such as Kiro, Q developer, and Cline, developers are embracing AI to move faster and scale smarter. This session explores how Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for AWS services like ECS, EKS and Lambda provide real-time, contextual code assistance to AI-powered coding agents. Learn how MCP servers help developers streamline code generation, deployment, and debugging by embedding infrastructure awareness directly into the AI assistant. Discover how teams are using MCP to boost productivity, reduce complexity, and build more reliable serverless and containerized applications at scale.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS Lambda

Learn to integrate generative AI features and custom branding into your solutions. Work through real scenarios including multi-tenant data isolation, programmatic dashboard generation, and AI-powered insights for your end users. Explore the QuickSight Embedding SDK and best practices for scaling embedded analytics.
tags: Analytics; Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build an adaptive compute grid with Amazon ECS and AWS Lambda
description: In this talk, we will delve into the intricacies of building a compute grid using Amazon ECS. We'll explore how to create a scalable, efficient, and flexible infrastructure capable of handling the demanding yet spiky workloads . The discussion will highlight ECS capacity providers and cluster auto scaling to optimize resource allocation, along with its integrations with AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and AWS Batch for orchestrating complex workflows. We’ll discuss common patterns to create a robust, cost-effective compute infrastructure.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Fargate; AWS Lambda
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Containers; Serverless; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Build an Agent Factory: An Agent that can Create any Agent On-Demand [REPEAT]
description: Watch us live-code an intelligent agent factory that creates specialized business agents on-demand through natural language. Using Amazon Bedrock, and open source frameworks like MCP and Strands, we'll build a system where users describe their needs ('I need an HR onboarding agent and a Business Analyst Agent') and get working agents deployed securely through AgentCore in minutes. You'll see real-time debugging, architecture decisions, and integration challenges as we demonstrate agent orchestration, tool binding, and multi-modal capabilities. Leave with production-ready patterns for building scalable agentic AI platforms.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Small & Medium Business; Interactive

title: Build an agentic SAP order management solution
description: Use AI to transform manual  SAP order management into adaptive, scalable agentic workflows. Using Amazon Bedrock, you'll first build an agent to monitor ServiceNow for part replenishment requests. Next, you'll develop another agent that converts these tickets into Purchase Requisitions (PR). A web controller agent will then be created to handle PR distribution across your supplier network. Finally, you will create an agent that generates Purchase Orders (PO) based on supplier quotations and predetermined guidelines. You'll walk away with practical experience creating multi-agent workflows that effectively orchestrate business functions across enterprise applications.
tags: SAP; Migration & Modernization; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build an AI Agent: Customer Service Excellence with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore [REPEAT]
description: Build your first AI-powered retail customer service agent using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. In this hands-on workshop, create a customer service agent that seamlessly orchestrates specialized tools handling tasks like Order tracking, Returns and product information. You will learn how to build agent using any framework and any model, add capabilities through specialized tools and deploy it to your AgentCore with built in security and scalability required for production applications. Experience the power of AI Agent with built in short term and long term memory in handling complex customer interactions while maintaining natural conversation flow.
speakers: Shaik Abdulla; Ahmed Alkhazraji; Meera Balasubramaniam; Adam Hensley; Santosh Mohanty
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon DynamoDB; AWS Lambda
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Build your first AI-powered retail customer service agent using Amazon Bedrock! In this hands-on workshop, create a primary customer service agent that seamlessly orchestrates specialized sub-agents handling tasks like Order tracking, Returns and Personalized product. Starting from scratch, you'll configure your main agent, add capabilities through sub-agents, and connect to a retail knowledge base. Experience the power of multi-agent collaboration in handling complex customer interactions while maintaining natural conversation flow. recommendation.

Learn to build sophisticated search solutions that leverage vector capabilities, semantic search, and foundation models without complex ML infrastructure management. You'll create end-to-end search pipelines that combine traditional keyword search with AI-powered features including multi-modal content processing, and contextual summarization. Experience building real-world applications like document retrieval systems and conversational agents using the Agentic RAG framework.
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build an AI-ready data foundation
description: An unparalleled level of interest in generative AI and agentic AI is driving organizations to rethink their data strategy. While there is a need for data foundation constructs such as data pipelines, data architectures, data stores and data governance to evolve, there are business elements that need to stay constant like cost-efficiency and  effectively collaborating across data estates. In this session we will cover how building your data foundation on AWS provides the tools and the building blocks to balance both needs, and empower organizations to grow their data strategy for building AI-ready applications.
services: Amazon OpenSearch Service; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Q Developer

title: Build an S3 time machine: Implementing advanced point-in-time recovery [REPEAT]
description: Build a robust point-in-time recovery (PITR) solution to protect your Amazon S3 data from ransomware and account takeover attacks. This hands-on workshop guides you through implementing your own S3 time machine using managed services including S3 Metadata, S3 Tables, cross-account replication, and S3 Batch Operations. Learn to restore objects to any historical point, leveraging near real-time recovery point objective (RPO) and cross-account recovery capabilities. This solution enables full data recovery even if the source account is completely compromised. Gain practical experience in building a resilient backup system that surpasses standard S3 versioning.
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Resilience; Architecture; Storage; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build and Deploy Highly Available Event Processing with Containers
description: Building reliable, scalable queue processing systems in containerized environments requires careful consideration of retry logic, scaling behaviors, and deployment strategies. This session demonstrates best practices for implementing safe retries, dead-letter queue handling, and auto-scaling techniques to efficiently match demand using Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS). Attendees learn how to prevent premature termination during scaling events using task protection, and implement blue-green deployments with hooks for safe, consistent updates. These patterns ensure reliable queue processing operations at scale.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Resilience; Containers; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Build and operate resilient and performant distributed applications [REPEAT]
description: This workshop explores how to design and implement applications for multi-geo operations while meeting data residency and performance requirements. You will learn how to design fault-tolerant, latency-sensitive applications across distributed locations with limited hardware resources. You will also explore distributed hybrid architectures, edge networking implementations, and traffic management solutions that balance regulatory requirements with high availability needs. Learn practical strategies for optimizing performance while maintaining data sovereignty across distributed locations.

You’ll learn how Amazon Bedrock can analyze architecture patterns and generate Infrastructure as Code (IaC) recommendations for optimal component distribution. Walk away with practical techniques for API integration, automated health checks, and dynamic resource allocation, plus working code samples and deployment templates for building adaptive, highly available edge solutions.

description: In this interactive workshop, learn to harness Amazon Q in QuickSight capabilities to accelerate your analytics workflow. Practice building dashboards using natural language, generate automated data stories, and create executive summaries that surface key insights. Learn to model complex business problems and perform what-if analysis through natural conversation with Scenario capability. Work with both structured and unstructured data sources to answer sophisticated business questions through the Q&A experience.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build data pipelines in minutes with the SageMaker Visual experience
description: Explore the new visual builders in Amazon SageMaker. Learn how to use the drag-and-drop interface to quickly assemble and orchestrate your end-to-end data integration workflows without writing complex code. See how visual builders can boost productivity by reducing time spent on maintenance and infrastructure setup. Discover how to seamlessly move between visual and code-based interfaces, and learn best practices for creating reusable workflow templates. Join this chalk talk to understand how visual workflows can accelerate your ETL and ML development lifecycle. Participate in live demos and ask questions of SageMaker experts.
services: Amazon SageMaker; AWS Glue; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Build data resilient application architectures using AWS Storage
description: Data powers your workloads, where downtime and data loss aren't just operational concerns anymore - they're existential business threats, where organizations are looking to build resilient data architectures to mitigate operational and cyber risks. Data resiliency is the ability for an organization to continue business operations when unexpected disruptions impact data availability. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect for data resiliency using Amazon S3, Amazon EBS, Amazon FSx, Amazon EFS, and AWS Backup. We'll explore design patterns that leverage high-availability, multi-region replication, immutable backups, and air-gapped data bunker capability, to achieve your desired data resiliency posture.
services: Amazon FSx; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Backup
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Build effective logging strategies for operational insights [REPEAT]
description: Effective log management requires proven patterns and practices to extract meaningful insights from vast amounts of data. In this session, explore best practices for correlating data across multiple sources, detecting anomalies, and generating metrics that drive decision-making processes. Join us for this essential exploration of modern log management and discover how to transform your organization's approach to data insights, security monitoring, and operational intelligence.
tags: Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

Learn how Amazon Bedrock Data Automation simplifies AI application development by unifying workflows for documents, audio, images, and video into a single service. Through Air's success story discover how Bedrock Data Automation helps streamline content processing, optimizes price-performance, and enables customized insights generation. See how teams can accelerate their journey from experimentation to production while maintaining flexibility to use existing AI services where needed.

This workshop guides you through building a complete application that orchestrates agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore using AWS Amplify Gen 2 and AWS AppSync's real-time features. You'll construct a travel planning system where specialized AI agents collaborate to deliver personalized recommendations based on user inputs and preferences. Learn to implement agent-to-agent communication, coordinate complex workflows, and integrate everything into a polished full-stack application. Leave with working code and architecture patterns that demonstrate how you can rapidly deploy advanced AI capabilities for your usecase.

Learn how Amazon S3 and Amazon FSx for Lustre offer scalability and compute acceleration, from rapid data access to multi-petabyte scales. Gain hands-on experience integrating storage services with Amazon SageMaker AI and monitoring performance using Amazon CloudWatch. Explore best practices for achieving optimal performance in your AI/ML workflows.

Get experience using CloudWatch to monitor application traces, metrics, and logs on unified dashboards, and to analyze Aurora database performance with SQL. Learn to set up automated instrumentation and custom dashboards that connect application and database telemetry.

New to AWS and want to build generative AI applications without rebuilding your data architecture? This chalk talk demonstrates how organizations beginning their AWS journey can quickly start using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio while leveraging data from anywhere - your data centers, other clouds, or SaaS platforms. Learn practical approaches to connect existing data sources to Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker, implement cross-environment governance, and maintain security controls. We'll explore best practices and architectural patterns for successful first steps in AI adoption while preserving investments.

description: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn how to enhance security operations using generative AI-powered runbooks with Amazon Bedrock. Create intelligent workflows that analyze AWS Security Hub findings and provide contextual remediation guidance. Through hands-on exercises, build AI agents that leverage AWS documentation and implement natural language interfaces for security investigations. Learn how to configure knowledge bases with organization-specific content and implement appropriate guardrails. You will leave having built a practical solution for streamlining security operations using generative AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build generative and agentic AI applications on-premises and at the edge
description: As customers scale generative AI and agentic AI implementations from pilots to production, they need to balance speed of innovation with data sovereignty requirements, low-latency edge processing needs, and space, power, and cost efficiency. This session explores how to build generative and agentic AI solutions using AWS Local Zones, AWS Outposts, and AWS Dedicated Local Zones. Discover architectural patterns and best practices for deploying foundation models across distributed locations. Learn how to implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with locally stored data. Gain insights into strategies for model selection and optimization.
speakers: Pranav Chachra; Fernando Galves; Chris McEvilly
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Local Zones; AWS Outposts
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Edge Computing; Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

description: Master the art of building high-performance Apache Iceberg data lakes for real-world use cases using Amazon S3 tables. Learn best practices for designing Iceberg schemas, optimizing partition strategies, automating maintenance including compaction and snapshot management and implementing tooling for monitoring and operations. Apply powerful Iceberg features like schema evolution and time travel queries to practical scenarios helping you build efficient, scalable data lakes that meet your organization's analytical needs.
speakers: Kunal Ghosh; Abhilash Nagilla; Dylan Qu; David Zhang
services: Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon SageMaker AI

title: Build high-performance inference APIs with Lambda SnapStart
description: Master production-grade LLM deployment using AWS Lambda SnapStart and FastAPI to achieve sub-2-second cold starts and handle 1000+ concurrent requests without pre-provisioning. Explore advanced techniques including memory-optimized model loading with memfd, parallel S3 downloads, custom Lambda layers with OpenBLAS acceleration, and streaming responses via Lambda Function URLs. Through live demonstrations and code walkthroughs, discover practical patterns for balancing performance, cost, and developer experience when deploying LLMs at scale. Walk away with immediately applicable strategies to quickly take your ML inference applications from development to production.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Build Humanoid Intelligence: Advancing Physical AI with AWS and NVIDIA
description: Simulation-based reinforcement learning advances Physical AI by enabling rapid policy learning for complex tasks. NVIDIA Isaac Lab offers a reinforcement learning environment to train and test policies in realistic virtual environments using physics-based simulation. In this session we’ll dive deeper into NVIDIA Isaac Lab, AWS Batch, and Amazon EC2 instances powered by NVIDIA GPUs and highlight the advantages of simulation on AWS. You’ll explore imitation learning and distributed training for Humanoid policies across multiple nodes with multiple NVIDIA GPUs and the simulation-to-real transition, sharing strategies for effectively translating simulation learning to the real world for large scale automation.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Batch; Amazon EC2 Spot
tags: Generative AI; Robotics; Industry Solutions; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Manufacturing & Industrial; Interactive

title: Build Hybrid Serverless Architectures with AWS and On-premises Systems
description: Organizations across finance, public sector, and manufacturing often have critical business logic locked in on-premises systems while seeking cloud adoption. This session explores practical patterns for implementing hybrid serverless architectures that bridge AWS services with on-premises systems. Through real-world examples, we'll demonstrate how to design hybrid solutions using AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway, implement unified API layers, and build resilient messaging patterns using Amazon EventBridge, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS with on-premises message brokers.
services: Amazon API Gateway; Amazon EventBridge; AWS Lambda
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Build Intelligent Media Workflows with Agentic AI
description: This workshop demonstrates how to enhance video processing workflows using agentic AI on AWS. Building upon last year's video understanding workshop, we'll show how to transform traditional orchestration steps into intelligent, agent-driven processes using Strands Agent SDK and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Participants will learn to implement agentic systems that improve metadata generation and content analysis for both video on-demand (VOD) and live scenarios, and how to apply intelligent workflows to archived content. Through hands-on exercises, attendees will gain experience in building agentic systems that improve content discovery, automate media operations, and enable new monetization opportunities.
tags: Generative AI; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build long running agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: In this chalk talk, we'll explore how to build AI agents that perform long-running and complex interactions like multi-day research projects. We’ll show you how to use Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Runtime & Memory to build agents that can pause and resume tasks, maintain state across hours or days, and handle complex workflows. You’ll learn how to structure agents that can effectively utilize different types of memory - semantic, episodic, and procedural - while maintaining state across long-running interactions. We’ll discuss how to apply these techniques to use cases like research agents and support ticket resolution.
speakers: Oscar Carrasquero; Qingwei Li; Osman Santos
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Build Media Workflows with Natural Language Using Strands Agents SDK
description: In this hands-on session you will develop a flexible media workflow creation tool using the Strands SDK and AWS Elemental Media Services. Attendees will learn how the creation, management, and troubleshooting of complex media workflows can be streamlined leveraging Strands Agents and Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. You will walk away with hands on experience developing a tool capable of generating optimized deployment configurations of production-ready solutions for use in streaming media. Perfect for media professionals and systems architects, this session will show you how you can leverage agentic AI to orchestrate and manage complex media workflows at scale.
speakers: Alastair Cousins; Maheshwaran G; Aravindharaj Rajendran; Shamik Shah
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Networking & Content Delivery; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build modern applications with Amazon Aurora DSQL
description: As organizations modernize applications for scalability and agility, database architecture becomes crucial. This session explores Amazon Aurora DSQL, a serverless, distributed SQL database for next-generation workloads. Learn to build modern serverless applications using Amazon Aurora DSQL with Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda. Examine performance characteristics, scaling behavior, and cost considerations, along with current limitations. Gain insights on choosing Amazon Aurora DSQL for modernization efforts, comparing it to alternatives like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon Aurora Serverless v2.
services: Amazon API Gateway; AWS Lambda; Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Application Security; Serverless; Databases; Serverless & Containers; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style
