title: Build more effective agents through model customization
description: ​Agentic applications interpret inputs and take actions within a customer’s enterprise environment, and model customization enables agents that understand the business and provides responses or actions that are appropriate for the use case. In this session, we will cover recent advancements like Nova customization on SageMaker AI and on-demand inferences on custom models, which lower the cost and effort needed for model customization. Explore customization techniques available through available recipes, walk through how you can enjoy the same low on-demand inference prices with your custom models, and learn how custom Nova models improve the price-performance for agentic use cases.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

description: Learn to implement collaborative AI systems using Amazon Bedrock's multi-agent architecture. Create specialized agents and a supervisor agent to orchestrate complex tasks. Ideal for developers building Agentic AI applications requiring coordinated agent interactions.

description: The open-source Strands Agents SDK enables building production-ready, multi-agent AI systems in a few lines of code. The session demonstrates creating custom tools for video content analysis and converting them into Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Live code examples show how to implement scalable chat memory with Amazon S3 Vectors, from local development to enterprise production. Developers will learn how agents maintain context across conversations and provide personalized responses through efficient memory storage and retrieval.

title: Build Once, Run Everywhere: Multi-Architecture in Your CI/CD Pipelines [REPEAT]
description: Building your containers to run on both x86 and AWS Graviton can help you optimize costs, improve performance, reduce your carbon footprint, and support local development on newer laptops. In this chalk talk, we'll take a web application built for x86, understand what it takes to run it on Graviton, then build a multi-architecture container image that allows you to run on the platform of your choice. We will demonstrate how to integrate that process in popular CI/CD systems like ArgoCD, GitLab, and GitHub.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon EC2 - Graviton; Amazon EC2 Spot
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Containers; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

Through guided exercises, configure encryption, access controls, and data security management for your EBS resources. Build practical strategies for balancing protection and cost optimization in your storage environment.

title: Build resilient AI at scale: Automated error detection on Amazon EKS
description: AI training failures at scale cost time and money. This session demonstrates how to build automated error detection and remediation into containerized AI environments using Amazon EKS for both Trainium and NVIDIA GPUs. Discover proven open-source monitoring solutions that proactively identify failures across GPU and AWS Neuron instances. Learn battle-tested strategies for resilient AI workflows—the same approaches deployed by AWS strategic partners. Leave with actionable best practices to minimize downtime and maximize AI productivity.

title: Build resilient distributed systems through comprehensive testing
description: Resilience testing in distributed systems is often perceived as too costly for early development stages. Drawing from AWS service experience, this technical session demonstrates how to establish and validate high resilience standards from day one. Developers will learn fault injection techniques, load testing strategies, and full-scale system testing methodologies. The presentation covers conducting resilience threat analysis, establishing system invariants, and defining performance contracts. Real-world examples of multi-region failures and experiments provide actionable insights for building highly resilient services that maintain durability, correctness, and availability.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; DevOps; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

description: Enterprise SaaS providers face increasing pressure to maintain high availability while preventing failures from spreading across tenant boundaries. Learn how leading ISVs use AWS Fault Injection Service to validate their multi-tenant architecture's resilience through controlled reslience testing experiments. We'll explore real-world examples from Security and HR tech providers who test cross-account failure scenarios while maintaining strict tenant isolation. Discover patterns for implementing resilience testing that strengthen your SaaS architecture without risking customer availability.
tags: Resilience; Threat Detection & Incident Response; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Build Resilient SaaS: Multi-Account Resilience Testing Patterns [REPEAT]
description: Enterprise SaaS providers face increasing pressure to maintain high availability while preventing failures from spreading across tenant boundaries. Learn how leading ISVs use AWS Fault Injection Service to validate their multi-tenant architecture's resilience through controlled reslience testing experiments. We'll explore real-world examples from Security and HR tech providers who test cross-account failure scenarios while maintaining strict tenant isolation. Discover patterns for implementing resilience testing that strengthen your SaaS architecture without risking customer availability.
tags: Resilience; Threat Detection & Incident Response; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Interactive

title: Build safe and resilient deployment pipelines for Amazon ECS
description: Learn how to build production ready CI/CD pipelines for Amazon ECS that prioritize safety and resilience through this interactive lightning talk. We'll showcase rolling deployment strategies that minimize service disruption and blue green deployments that enable zero downtime releases with instant rollback capabilities. You'll learn practical ways to build deployment safeguards, automate rollbacks, and monitor releases to ensures, your containerized applications deploy safely.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS CodePipeline; AWS Fargate
tags: Application Security; Resilience; Containers; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Build secure and scalable agentic AI workflows on Amazon ECS
description: Ever wondered how to take your AI agents from experimental notebooks to production? Join us to discover how Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate can transform autonomous AI workflows into resilient, production-grade applications. We'll dive into proven patterns for deploying frameworks like LangGraph and Strands, showing you how to leverage ECS's native capabilities for environment isolation, load balancing, and auto-scaling. You'll learn established patterns for integrating with Amazon Bedrock and understand key architecture decisions that matter. Whether you're a developer or architect, you'll walk away with practical insights for building scalable AI agent infrastructure.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
tags: Application Security; Agentic AI; Containers; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Build self-healing supply chains with agentic AI
description: Agentic AI enables new possibilities for automating business processes captured in unstructured data. Join this session to learn how you can turn SOP documents and other organizational learnings into automated workflows and see the time savings and productivity increases this can help you can achieve. We’ll show you the way to self-healing operations in your supply chain using agentic technology, so you can thrive in today’s chaotic business environment and overcome the challenges thrown at you every day.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Interactive

title: Build serverless chatbots using Amazon ElastiCache & Aurora PostgreSQL
description: In this session, learn how to build a serverless-first chatbot application by leveraging Amazon Aurora as a vector store and Amazon ElastiCache Serverless for Valkey to manage chat history. Discover how to harness these services to create contextually aware, scalable chatbots that retain conversational memory across interactions. Explore architectural patterns, implementation strategies, and real-world use cases. Along the way, gain insights into optimizing query latency, performance, and cost-effectiveness across the stack. Whether you’re a developer, architect, or decision-maker, this session equips you with the practical knowledge to build modern, serverless-powered chatbot applications using generative AI.
tags: Generative AI; Open Data; Serverless; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Build Streaming Analytics Dashboards in Minutes with Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: Transform video streaming observability using Amazon Q Developer to auto-generate sophisticated analytics dashboards. In this hands-on session, you'll use natural language prompts to create an Amazon Cloud Development Kit (CDK) application that processes Amazon CloudFront logs through Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Athena, visualizing the data in grafana. Deploy a complete solution that tracks ASN distribution, device types, and common media client data (CMCD) as well as quality of experience (QoE) metrics. You'll leave with practical experience in building automated streaming analytics and a working dashboard you can adapt for your own needs.
speakers: Umar Bhat; Maheshwaran G; Neha Kamat; Josue Mora; Brian O Riordan; Devendra Sharma
tags: Generative AI; Analytics; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build Streaming Analytics Dashboards in Minutes with Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: Transform video streaming observability using Amazon Q Developer to auto-generate sophisticated analytics dashboards. In this hands-on session, you'll use natural language prompts to create an Amazon Cloud Development Kit (CDK) application that processes Amazon CloudFront logs through Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Athena, visualizing the data in grafana. Deploy a complete solution that tracks ASN distribution, device types, and common media client data (CMCD) as well as quality of experience (QoE) metrics. You'll leave with practical experience in building automated streaming analytics and a working dashboard you can adapt for your own needs.
speakers: Umar Bhat; Maheshwaran G; Neha Kamat; Josue Mora; Brian O Riordan; Devendra Sharma
tags: Generative AI; Analytics; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build trust in AI with end-to-end data lineage in Amazon SageMaker Catalog
description: Before you can trust data for AI and analytics, you need to know where it came from, how it was transformed, and how it’s being used. In this session, learn how Amazon SageMaker Catalog provides automated data lineage that gives visibility into a dataset’s full journey across AWS services as well as non-AWS OpenLineage-compatible events. See how lineage helps data producers, analysts, and data scientists evaluate data quality, trace dependencies, and make informed decisions with confidence. We’ll walk through practical examples of how lineage accelerates collaboration, supports governance, and ensures teams are always working with the right data.
tags: Generative AI; Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Interactive

title: Build trust in your data with Amazon SageMaker Catalog [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, discover how to leverage Amazon SageMaker Catalog to establish robust data governance with quality data and lineage tracking for your organization. Gain practical experience in setting up data quality jobs, implementing automated validation processes, and exploring comprehensive data cataloging features. Work with datasets in Amazon Redshift and AWS Glue, integrating various data sources and data processing engines like dbt and Apache Airflow for a holistic view of your data ecosystem and its origins. Leave equipped to maintain high data quality standards and improved data understanding across your organization.
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build trust in your data with Amazon SageMaker Catalog [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, discover how to leverage Amazon SageMaker Catalog to establish robust data governance with quality data and lineage tracking for your organization. Gain practical experience in setting up data quality jobs, implementing automated validation processes, and exploring comprehensive data cataloging features. Work with datasets in Amazon Redshift and AWS Glue, integrating various data sources and data processing engines like dbt and Apache Airflow for a holistic view of your data ecosystem and its origins. Leave equipped to maintain high data quality standards and improved data understanding across your organization.
speakers: Jose Romero; Joel Farvault; Sidhanth Muralidhar; Rahul Sharma
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build ultra-low latency ad workloads with unmatched cost-performance
description: With the growth of digital media, including streaming video and retail media, customers that operate advertising platforms need to buy, sell, deliver, and measure millions of ad transactions per second while meeting stringent latency requirements. In this workshop, you will learn how to run ultra-low latency advertising workloads, transact with partners across a global community, and optimize against increasingly fragmented data signals and media channels. Push the boundaries of advertising platforms with AWS Graviton Processors, Amazon Elastic Container Service, and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances while optimizing cost-performance.
speakers: Gerry Louw; Sharik Pahwa; Mikhail Shapirov
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon EC2 Spot
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Software & Internet; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build useful, reliable agents with Amazon Nova
description: Some of the most important enterprise work still happens in the browser—reviewing data in partner portals, filling out internal forms, navigating supplier websites, or gathering insights from online dashboards. These tasks are often manual, repetitive, and hard to scale. In this session, you’ll learn how to use Nova for web browser automation to enable systems to interact with websites just like a human by completing complex tasks like multi-element form filling. You’ll hear about how early enterprise customers are turning time-consuming processes into streamlined, reliable agent workflows to accelerate service delivery.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Build Virtual Engineering Workbenches for SDV with AWS Marketplace
description: Experience how a curated collection of AWS Marketplace solutions can reduce automotive software development cycles by up to 80%. In this hands-on workshop, learn to leverage a new AWS solution guidance that combines validated development tools, virtual targets, and pre-configured environments from AWS Marketplace to accelerate software-defined vehicle (SDV) development. Using in-vehicle infotainment (IVI) as an example, you'll create a virtual engineering workbench that integrates GenAI-powered tools, automated build pipelines, and partner solutions available through AWS Marketplace. Learn best practices for selecting, deploying, and combining marketplace offerings to create a seamless development environment.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Application Integration; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build your own AI-Driven Industrial Automation System with Agentic AI
description: In this session, learn to build an Agentic AI system using MCP server and tools for industrial automation. You'll develop an AI solution that interprets Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), generates code for platforms like Siemens TIA and Beckhoff TwinCAT, and manages deployments across your automation infrastructure. Using AWS IoT SiteWise, your system will to automatically connect to PLCs for data management. The system will handle virtual commissioning and managing hybrid scenarios, and will automatically update P&ID diagrams, PLC code, and hardware configurations. Through hands-on exercises, you'll develop a functional Agentic workflow ready for immediate implementation in industrial environments.
speakers: Hubert Asamer; Raju Gottumukkala; Vikram Krishna; Jan Metzner; Gabriel Verreault
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon DynamoDB; AWS Lambda
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Solution / Systems Architect; Manufacturing & Industrial; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build your own GenAI app on Amazon EKS with Amazon FSx and accelerated compute
description: Dive into the world of GenAI in this workshop where you will build a GenAI chatbot that you can use for Q&A and documentation summarization. You will deploy an AWS GenAI stack using AWS Inferentia for accelerated compute, Amazon FSx for Lustre for model caching, and Amazon EKS for orchestration. This GenAI stack will power the vLLM inference engine and open source Large Language Model that you will deploy. This session will equip you with the knowledge to build self-hosted GenAI workflows optimized for performance, scalability and operational efficiency. Kubernetes experience is recommended, and participants need a laptop for this session.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon FSx for Lustre; AWS Inferentia
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Build your own high performance kernel on AWS Trainium with NKI
description: Dive deep into AWS Trainium's Neuron Kernel Interface (NKI) and unlock its potential for high-performance machine learning. This session explores hardware foundations, kernel basics, and advanced techniques for optimizing ML workloads. Learn to leverage profiling tools, benchmarking strategies, and distributed computing capabilities and gain insights from real-world applications. Whether you're a ML engineer, researcher, or performance enthusiast, discover how to harness Trainium's power for your next-gen AI projects.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Build, deploy, and operate agentic architectures on AWS Serverless
description: Discover how to architect scalable, production-ready agentic AI applications on AWS that deliver autonomous, multi-agent solutions for complex business challenges. Many organizations struggle with designing AI agents for real-world complexity, from managing context effectively to ensuring secure, scalable deployments. This session covers proven architectural patterns for single and multi-agent systems, applying monolith-to-microservices principles and domain-driven design to avoid common pitfalls. You'll explore practical implementations using API Gateway, Lambda, Fargate, and AgentCore Runtime with security best practices. Join us to transform your agentic AI understanding from experimental prototypes to production-ready systems.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Build, fine-tune & deploy AI models with SageMaker HyperPod CLI & SDK
description: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod helps build, train and deploy AI models at scale. You can spin-up preferred IDE on HyperPod to develop their models and run experiments, then scale to thousands of accelerators to run distributed training and finally deploy models for real-time or batch inference. With HyperPod task governance capabilities, you can optimize the utilization of the cluster resources. In this talk, we will show how interaction with HyperPod clusters is simplified via the SageMaker HyperPod CLI and SDK, which streamlined end-to-end model development, from training, fine-tuning to deployment. We'll show HyperPod CLI/SDK capabilities with live coding and troubleshooting.
services: AWS SDK for Python (Boto3); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Retail & Consumer Goods; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Build, govern, and share Amazon QuickSight dashboards with Amazon SageMaker
description: Learn how to go from finding data in Amazon SageMaker Catalog to building shareable dashboards in Amazon QuickSight in a single, secure workflow. This session shows how the integration between the next generation of Amazon SageMaker and Amazon QuickSight brings business intelligence dashboard governance into the same environment where you discover and prepare data. See how to manage access, ensure compliance, and share trusted insights across teams without moving data between systems.
speakers: Luis Campos; Utkarsh Mittal; Mirko Buholzer
tags: Generative AI; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; IT Administrator; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Build, Scale, and Optimize Agentic AI on CPUs with AWS Graviton [REPEAT]
description: Do you want to build production-grade scalable and cost efficient Agentic AI applications? You can leverage Graviton's performance, cost efficiency, and sustainability for deploying up to 80% of an AI/ML pipeline. In this workshop, you�ll use EKS and Karpenter to deploy an end-to-end Agentic AI application all on Graviton. Start by setting up LLM Inference services followed by building Strands SDK based multi-agent AI systems. Next, learn how to leverage Graviton's price performance for MCP Servers and VectorDB. Finally, you�ll build a simple chat application that interacts with the end-to-end system and highlights the advantages of Graviton.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon EC2 - Graviton
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building .NET AI Applications with Semantic Kernel and Amazon Bedrock
description: This code-first session demonstrates how to transform .NET applications into powerful AI solutions using Semantic Kernel and Amazon Bedrock. The presentation explores the Semantic Kernel framework and its integration with Amazon Bedrock's AI capabilities, including flexible foundation model selection and multi-turn conversational abilities. Learn how to leverage Amazon Bedrock for extensible tool usage in AI applications. Through practical examples, the session covers techniques for enhancing existing applications and building new AI-powered solutions in .NET, providing developers with actionable skills for AI integration.
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building A2A-enabled applications with Strands Agents
description: Learn about the future of multi-agent collaboration by building Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol-enabled applications using the Strands Agents SDK. This technical session demonstrates how to implement standardized agent communication patterns that enable Strands agents to discover, coordinate, and collaborate with agents built on any framework. Attendees will learn to build interoperable agent systems using Strands' A2A integration capabilities, implementing the AgentExecutor interface for seamless cross-framework communication. This session will teach you practical implementation of agent discovery mechanisms, task delegation patterns, and event-driven coordination using A2A's standardized protocol alongside Strands' model-driven agent architecture.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building a culture of API Excellence
description: Effective API discovery and reuse remain significant challenges in many organizations, often resulting in redundant development and underutilized APIs. This session examines how leading organizations have implemented API cataloging to transform their development culture. Discover practical approaches to API cataloging that drive both internal collaboration and external adoption. Through real-world examples, learn how to implement an API-first culture that maximizes the value of your API investments.
tags: DevOps; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building a GenAI-Powered Compliance Bot to Secure Networks on AWS [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, participants will be provided with a pre-built, intentionally insecure AWS environment featuring misconfigured VPCs, permissive IAM and NACL rules, public subnets, and improper AWS PrivateLink usage. Leveraging a GenAI-powered compliance bot, you’ll continuously monitor network configurations and traffic, validate AWS PrivateLink and service connectivity, enforce strict IAM and NACL policies, and in alignment to zero trust and AWS security best practices. Through real-time analysis and automated remediation, you’ll gain practical experience in maintaining a robust and compliant AWS network using continuous monitoring, alerting, and AI-driven insights.
speakers: Brett Eisen; Andrew Istfan; Ross Meyers; Jedediah Ryan; Jenifer Wang
tags: Advisor / Consultant; Cloud Security Specialist; Solution / Systems Architect; Education; Financial Services; Public Sector; Hands-on; Interactive

description: In this hands-on session, participants will be provided with a pre-built, intentionally insecure AWS environment featuring misconfigured VPCs, permissive IAM and NACL rules, public subnets, and improper AWS PrivateLink usage. Leveraging a GenAI-powered compliance bot, you’ll continuously monitor network configurations and traffic, validate AWS PrivateLink and service connectivity, enforce strict IAM and NACL policies, and in alignment to zero trust and AWS security best practices. title: Building a robust container security  pipeline [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, learn to implement comprehensive container pipeline security from code to production. Configure pre-commit hooks and IDE scanning, establish automated CI/CD security checks, and ensure artifact integrity using AWS Signer for container images. Through guided exercises, practice SBOM extraction, vulnerability scanning, and runtime policy implementation. You'll gain practical experience building a secure container pipeline that meets compliance requirements without sacrificing development speed. Ideal for DevOps engineers and security professionals focused on software supply chain security.
speakers: Rodrigo Bersa; Desiree Brunner; Vaishali Chaudhary; Danny Cortegaca; Rahul Gautam
tags: Application Security; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building a robust container security  pipeline [REPEAT]

title: Building a Secure Foundation for SAP RISE and Non-SAP Workload
description: Migration to AWS Discover how greenfield customer Lyondellbasell successfully migrated SAP RISE and non-SAP workloads to AWS. This session explores the critical foundational aspects of cloud migration, showcasing the implementation of a multi-account strategy that optimizes security and resource management. You'll learn how to build a secure landing zone, set up comprehensive backups, and establish a robust Security Operations Center (SOC) with integrated Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). We'll dive into crafting IAM policies that follow AWS best practices. Hear from Lyondellbasell team about their migration journey to AWS, highlighting how these key elements formed the backbone of their migration, supporting both SAP and non-SAP ecosystems. You'll gain insights into overcoming challenges and implementing strategies that can accelerate AWS cloud adoption.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS IAM Identity Center; AWS Organizations
tags: Management & Governance; SAP; Analytics; Business Applications; Cloud Security Specialist; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Manufacturing & Industrial; New to AWS; Lecture-style

title: Building adaptive AI agents: Enterprise patterns that scale
description: Early architectural decisions can significantly impact AI agent flexibility across industries. This hands-on workshop demonstrates building production-ready systems using AWS Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore with Model Context Protocol. Learn to create secure, enterprise-grade agent architectures that adapt across industries. Through practical exercises, master multi-agent orchestration, scalable configurations, and UI implementation patterns. Discover how to design flexible backends that power diverse industry solutions while maintaining security and performance at scale.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Cognito; Amazon DynamoDB
tags: Application Security; Agentic AI; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building agentic AI applications on Amazon Bedrock using C# and .NET
description: Discover the full potential of agentic AI in your .NET applications using automated multistep reasoning provided by Amazon Bedrock Agents. Learn how to securely create sophisticated AI agents in .NET that provide access to company systems, APIs, and data sources in real-time. We'll demonstrate practical patterns for building intelligent agents that leverage your existing .NET investments while harnessing Amazon's powerful AI capabilities. By the end of this session, you'll gain the necessary knowledge and confidence to build .NET Agentic AI applications that make intelligent decisions with your data, delivering immediate value to your organization.
speakers: Ashish Bhatia; Jagadeesh Chitikesi; Neeraj Handa; Mo Mohoboob; Vishwanath Uppala
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS IAM Identity Center; AWS Lambda
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Agentic AI architectures with AWS Serverless [REPEAT]
description: Discover how serverless architectures unlock the full potential of AI agents in production systems. In this hands-on session, you'll learn practical patterns for deploying AI agents that can scale automatically and optimize costs. We'll explore both event-driven and synchronous implementations, showing how serverless elegantly handles the complex challenges of agent orchestration and state management. Through guided exercises, you'll build production-ready architectures that demonstrate how to rapidly deploy AI agents, manage their interactions, and optimize their performance. Leave with battle-tested patterns for building scalable, cost-effective AI agent systems on AWS.
speakers: Bhuvan Annamreddi; Patrick Galvin; Michael Hume; Debasis Rath; Dan Ronald
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building agentic AI platform engineering solutions with open source
description: Join us for this session as we share our vision for driving innovation through open source agentic AI, and enhancing work-life quality for platform engineers worldwide. We'll explore real-world examples of how platform teams can apply autonomous agentic AI to their organizations, integrating AWS services alongside other open source projects such as Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Backstage and more.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; System Administrator; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Building Agentic AI: Amazon Nova Act and Strands Agents in Practice
description: Explore practical applications of Agentic AI through two real-world case studies. First, dive into a Hong Kong weather agent built with Amazon Nova Act, featuring conversation flow design and meteorological data integration. Watch a live demo showcasing natural language interaction for weather information retrieval and trend analysis. Next, discover a mathematics teaching AI agent developed using the Strands Agents framework, demonstrating personalized math video creation through automatic content generation. Both cases include comprehensive code demonstrations, providing developers with concrete references for AI agent application development on AWS.
tags: Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Building agentic memory layers on AWS managed databases
description: Scaling agentic AI and generative AI workloads requires multiple memory components to effectively support chat or multi-agent use cases. In this session, learn why different types of short-term and long-term memory components, such as semantic, episodic, or procedural memory layers are required. Discover how to build these memory layers with Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey and best practices to consider in your solution. Attendees implementing agentic AI or generative AI (with RAG) workloads on AWS will gain a better understanding of design considerations for AI memory components and how AWS services can simplify their solutions.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon ElastiCache; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building Agentic Smart home with Generative AI
description:
Participants will explore how to build intelligent, agent-driven smart home experiences using industry-standard Generative AI frameworks and managed integrations for AWS IoT Device Management. You'll learn step-by-step how to integrate IoT devices, real-time databases, and multimodal AI capabilities into seamless, responsive home automation systems.
Workshop Objectives: Understand Generative AI concepts and how they apply to smart home ecosystems, learn to deploy intelligent agents capable of reasoning and autonomous action, leverage AWS services, such as AWS loT Rekognition, and create an integrated architecture combining loT data, Generative AI and user intrations.
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS IoT Core for LoRaWAN; AWS IoT Device Management
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Internet of Things; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Telecommunications; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building agentic systems with Hugging Face and AWS AI chips
description: Unlock the next generation of AI capabilities with Hugging Face on AWS AI chips. In this chalk talk, explore implementing Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) models, reasoning systems, and multi-step AI workflows. Learn practical techniques for deploying sophisticated agent-based applications. We'll demonstrate how to leverage AWS Trainium and Inferentia to efficiently run and scale these advanced architectures while optimizing for both performance and cost.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Building agentic workflows for augmented observability [REPEAT]
description: Drowning in observability data but starving for insights? In this live, interactive coding session, we'll build an AI agent that transforms raw telemetry into actionable intelligence. We'll build a system that correlates metrics, logs, and traces from Amazon CloudWatch. Our agent will analyze patterns, create relevant monitoring artifacts, and provide natural language explanations of complex issues. We'll show how to productionize the agent to autonomously respond to operational events, creating a proactive observability workflow. Join us to explore the future of AI-augmented observability.

title: Building AI Agents with Serverless, Strands, and MCP
description: Join this session to master the art of building AI agents on AWS. Witness the evolution of generative AI (GenAI) that has enabled agentic systems to surpass traditional language models, and learn the fundamental principles that define an AI agent. Dive into the process of leveraging AWS serverless compute, the Strands Agents SDK, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to create these dynamic, adaptable agents. Observe the implementation of key capabilities like context awareness, authentication, security, and observability. Explore techniques to extend agent functionality with local tools, and unlock unprecedented integration by connecting to remote MCP servers. Walk away with the skills to elevate your intelligent applications with the transformative power of AWS-powered AI agents.
services: Amazon API Gateway; Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Lambda

title: Building AI Agents: A Fast-Track Guide to Scale
description: ISVs need to innovate quickly by building customizable AI agents for their customers. While open-source frameworks like LangGraph, CrewAI, and Strands Agents provide powerful capabilities, implementing enterprise-grade features like multi-tenant authentication, observability, and memory management remains challenging. This hands-on lab teaches ISV technical leaders and developers how to rapidly create a robust agent platform with minimal code, accelerating time-to-market for AI solutions.

title: Building AI-Powered operational insights and automated remediation
description: Operational monitoring often requires manual intervention, leading to delayed response times. Join this session to build an AI-powered solution that combines Amazon Q, Amazon OpenSearch Service, and AWS Systems Manager to deliver advanced operational insights and automated remediation. You'll work with Amazon Q via MCP Server to construct queries and implement AI integration with your operational data. Learn to configure OpenSearch for efficient data ingestion using zETL with Amazon S3, enabling near real-time anomaly detection. Conclude with setting up automated remediation actions and creating a comprehensive dashboard to visualize critical insights.

In this interactive session, we'll explore identity best practices and building an AI agent using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to help verify best practices, perform detective analysis, and take automated preventative actions to mitigate risks. We'll talk through how an AI agent can perform dynamic WAF rule adjustments, modify authentication flows, and perform security operations center (SOC) actions. title: Building an AI-powered waste classification using Amazon Nova & IoT
description: AWS Chile revolutionized waste management by developing an intelligent classification system using Amazon Nova, IoT, and serverless architecture. This revolutionary solution processes waste items in under 3 seconds with 95% accuracy, while keeping implementation costs below $300 USD and operational costs under $3 per 1,000 images. Explore the technical architecture integrating edge computing, computer vision, and AI to create a real-time classification system that improved recycling efficiency by 52%, preventing 644.7 kg of CO2 emissions in six months. Learn to implement this cost-effective solution in your organization using AWS, and understand key challenges and lessons learned from this sustainability initiative.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS IoT Greengrass; Amazon Nova

title: Building and tracing AI agents with Amazon SageMaker and Strands [REPEAT]
description: AI agents are moving from research prototypes to real-world applications powering copilots, automation flows, and customer-facing assistants. But building agents that are reliable, observable, and scalable is still challenging.  In this session, you’ll learn how to design and scale agentic workflows using Amazon SageMaker AI and the Strands SDK. We’ll show how managed MLflow enables step-level tracing, prompt and tool evaluation, and offline comparisons of agent strategies, while SageMaker Pipelines helps standardize testing and deployment. You will walk away with patterns and practices for building AI agents that are observable, trustworthy, and scalable in production.

description: Marketing teams require AI agents capable of orchestrating complex campaigns with enterprise controls. This session explores Epsilon's production-ready multi-agent system built with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore for intelligent marketing campaigns. Learn to implement secure agent collaboration using AgentCore Runtime for parallel execution, Gateway for controlled data access, and Identity for granular permissions. We'll cover architectural patterns for asynchronous workflows, demonstrate personalized content generation with brand consistency, and explore real-time campaign monitoring through AgentCore Observability. title: Building Cornell's AI Future: AWS Innovation at Enterprise Scale
description: Join us to explore how Cornell University is reshaping higher education through strategic AI adoption and data transformation. Learn how Cornell’s AI Innovation Lab, in partnership with AWS, evaluates and implements 20+ AI use cases each semester using a “minimum lovable product” approach. We’ll showcase SandboxAI, a secure campus-wide platform built on AWS serverless architecture and integrated with Amazon Bedrock. Also discover how migrating analytics to Amazon Redshift unlocked significant cost savings and performance gains, directly fueling Cornell’s AI initiatives and broader institutional goals. Cornell’s journey offers a blueprint for innovation, efficiency, and governance at scale.

In this chalk talk, we’ll share strategies for building cost-efficient and performant agent systems using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Learn to optimize concurrency, use asynchronous workflows, control execution time, and implement tool-caching and load-shedding patterns. We’ll cover pricing-aware architectural choices across Runtime, Gateway, and Memory—and how to reduce reprocessing, idle sessions, and over-fetching. You’ll leave with real-world tactics for minimizing cost without sacrificing experience or safety.

This session explores practical aspects of implementing EDA on Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate, focusing on patterns for consuming events in containerized environments using AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and Amazon EventBridge. title: Building fast with automated reasoning at Amazon S3 scale
description: S3 has a long history of using automated reasoning, but a core challenge has been applying these techniques to large systems while maintaining development velocity. Over time, we've learned to balance cutting-edge science with engineering velocity to accelerate development. We'll share diverse techniques for validating critical storage components, from black-box model-based validation using formal API specifications, to white-box verification with specialized concurrency checkers for ensuring transaction serializability and crash consistency. You'll learn how S3 engineers and scientists are advancing systems verification with new tools and ideas that you can apply to your own systems.

In this session, explore how AWS messaging services enhance system resilience through fault-tolerant design patterns. We'll examine four proven architectural approaches that strengthen your cloud infrastructure and maintain continuous service delivery. Through practical demonstrations, learn how to implement these patterns using AWS services to build loosely coupled, scalable systems that handle disruptions effectively. Discover techniques to create architectures that not only withstand challenges but excel under scale, ensuring consistent customer experiences.

title: Building for Efficiency & Reliability with Performance Testing on AWS
description: Learn how to run and leverage performance testing on AWS to drive cost optimization, validate system behavior, identify bottlenecks, and significantly improve reliability, while informing architectural decisions and optimal instance type selection for your workloads. You'll discover methods for pinpointing performance thresholds across different traffic patterns and understanding system reliability when stressed beyond normal parameters. Dive deep into techniques for measuring critical percentiles and determining breaking points as demand fluctuates, ultimately architecting for improved efficiency and building confidence in your system's resilience at scale.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Well-Architected Framework; Architecture; Compute; Lecture-style

title: Building for high availability using Amazon ElastiCache
description: Caching can dramatically improve the performance of your application, and the cache can often become a critical component of data architecture. In this chalk talk, learn how to build a highly available Amazon ElastiCache solution. Along the way discover advanced patterns and techniques to optimize for multi-AZ configurations, capacity planning, and client tuning. Also learn how you can deploy a multi-Region solution using Amazon ElastiCache Global Datastore.

description: This hands-on workshop teaches you how to build AI agents using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Lambda. You will learn to design and develop agents that make decisions and act independently. The session covers key concepts in Agentic AI, from setup to deployment, with practical exercises throughout. This workshop is ideal for developers, architects, engineers, and data scientists who want to develop Agentic AI solutions on AWS.

title: Building governed agents with Human-in-the-Loop
description: Discover how to deploy AI agents that act intelligently and responsibly in production environments. This session explores designing agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Strands that adhere to SOPs and business requirements while incorporating human oversight. Learn strategies for embedding policies, compliance rules, and operational safeguards into agents, alongside implementing human-in-the-loop workflows for critical decisions. We'll demonstrate intelligent escalation patterns blending automated efficiency with human judgment and share best practices for determining autonomous actions versus human expertise. Explore how to balance flexibility, control, and oversight, enabling agents to innovate within guardrails while maintaining trust and accountability for enterprise deployment.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building high-quality data products for AI Agents
description: AI agents are only as effective as the data they rely on. This chalk talk focuses on how to build and manage high-quality data products and contextual information for use by AI agents. You'll learn how to deliver accurate, up-to-date, and well-governed data for AI systems, including context engineering, RAG strategies, fine-tuning dataset curation, and automated quality checks. We'll cover how to manage AI context, handle data drift, and perform classical data management activities in the Agentic AI world.
tags: Generative AI; Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Interactive

title: Building intelligent agentic workflows with Amazon Nova [REPEAT]
description: Discover how Amazon Nova's reasoning capabilities support traditional chatbots through advanced tool support and performance optimization. In this hands-on session, you'll learn to architect three types of AI agents using Nova models: contextually-aware chat assistants, process-driven task agents, and sophisticated research agents that conduct iterative investigations. We'll explore how different Nova models align with different agent complexities, while leveraging built-in features like prompt caching and web search tools. You'll also learn to integrate open-source frameworks such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) to create extensible agent architectures. Leave equipped to build production-ready, cost-efficient AI agents that deliver reliable, intelligent automation.
speakers: Rui Cardoso; Julia Hu; Sharon Li; Arlind Nocaj; Dhaval Shah
tags: Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Intelligent Healthcare Systems: FHIR, AI, and AWS HealthLake
description: This hands-on technical workshop demonstrates building production-ready healthcare AI systems using AWS services. Participants will develop an end-to-end pipeline that converts medical documents into queryable insights while maintaining HIPAA compliance. The session covers Bedrock Data Automation for medical document processing, FHIR-compliant data transformation, and AWS HealthLake integration. Attendees will implement Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers enabling natural language queries of healthcare data. Participants receive complete implementation resources including templates, code, and architectural diagrams. The solution accelerates healthcare AI development from months to weeks, while ensuring compliance and security, bridging the gap between raw medical data and actionable healthcare analytics.
tags: Automation; Privacy; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Intelligent Workflows with Event Driven AI
description: Transform traditional enterprise workflows into intelligent, automated operations using modern event-driven architecture and AI capabilities. This session demonstrates how to evolve monolithic systems into scalable, cloud-native solutions that leverage AI agents for near real-time decision making and automated processing. Through practical examples of business process modernization, we'll show how combining AWS services creates resilient, intelligent systems that reduce operational overhead while improving response times.

Working alongside an AWS expert, you'll create a modern web app using AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon DynamoDB. Through guided exercises, implement real-time features like live updates and user authentication, while learning how serverless architecture enables automatic scaling and cost optimization. You'll leave with working code demonstrating practical patterns for user interfaces, API design, and data persistence - plus the confidence to build your own web applications.

title: Building LLMs with Amazon SageMaker HyperPod and AWS Trainium
description: AWS Trainium is purpose built to deliver better price performance for LLM training workloads, while Amazon SageMaker HyperPod makes it easy to scale model development tasks such as training, fine-tuning, or inference across a cluster of hundreds or thousands of AI accelerators. In this session we will demo the distributed training of the Qwen3 text model on Trainium-based instances using SageMaker HyperPod and Neuron SDK which has native support for PyTorch. You will learn the training process on Trainium chips, as well as tools to observe and monitor the cluster condition.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon SageMaker; AWS Trainium; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Multi-Account QuickSight - Architecture and Best Practices
description: Join this interactive session to explore architectural patterns for implementing QuickSight across multiple AWS accounts. Learn strategies for content promotion, security boundaries, and automated deployments using QuickSight APIs. Discuss real-world challenges and solutions for managing datasets, user access, and dashboard distribution at scale while maintaining operational excellence.
tags: Analytics; Interactive

title: Building multi-Region financial transaction systems with Aurora DSQL
description: Financial institutions require operational reliability and international connectivity to process millions of daily transactions across time zones. But maintaining global consistency, data integrity, and availability is complex. Learn how to deploy a robust multi-region financial transaction processing system with Amazon Aurora Distributed SQL. We’ll walk through how to set up active-active architectures that leverage Amazon Aurora's distributed features to ensure high availability, data consistency, and minimal latency globally. Attendees will gain hands-on experience setting up multi-region deployments, managing distributed transaction consistency, and optimizing global performance. You'll walk away with the knowledge to reliably manage global transactions at scale.
speakers: Michal Adamkiewicz; Julia Chorzelska; Pawel Moniewski; Pawel Zawadzki; rajesh kantamani
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; SaaS; Databases; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Multi-tenant Data Pipelines for Agentic SaaS experiences
description: Building secure, performant data pipelines while maintaining tenant isolation remains a critical challenge for SaaS providers developing Agentic AI experiences. Our solution, leveraging Amazon MSK, AWS Glue, and Apache Iceberg, implements data pipeline at scale to power SaaS Agentic platforms serving thousands of customer tenants. Join us to learn the architectural patterns, optimization techniques, and security controls that can help ISVs build scalable, multi-tenant data pipelines for their next-gen Agentic platforms.
services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK); AWS Glue
tags: SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Building Multi-tenant global ML SaaS platform
description: Get insight into how Qlik built a multi-tenant ML SaaS that processes 100,000 GPU-intensive training jobs monthly with 99.99% reliability. Learn about Qlik's proven patterns for scaling ML operations across global regions while optimizing costs through dynamic resource allocation. We'll share the architectural decisions that enabled supporting 2,500 organizations and 167,000 trained models. Essential knowledge for ISVs transforming ML capabilities into scalable SaaS solutions.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: SaaS; Kubernetes; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Lecture-style

title: Building multi-tenant RAG and MCP servers
description: Multi-tenancy brings a range of new wrinkles to the GenAI universe. This is especially true when we look at how data and resources are folded into our GenAI architecture. It’s here that we must consider how the presence of tenant context will influence how we reference the resources that refine/target the outputs of our GenAI interactions. In this chalk talk, we’ll look specifically at how RAG and MCP servers are represented and integrated into a multi-tenant experience. Will you have per-tenant RAG and MCP servers? How will you route to those servers? How will this impact onboarding and tenant isolation? These are amongst the considerations that will explore in this session.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Databases; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building multi-tenant SaaS agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: The introduction of Amazon Bedrock AgentCore equips builders with a range of new tools and technologies. These tools enable a range of new strategies and techniques that will directly impact how teams build multi-tenant AI solutions and agents. This session will dig into working examples how tenancy is leveraged and landed in an intelligence-as-a-service environment,  highlighting the multi-tenant nuances and possibilities that can built with the latest AI-powered AWS services. This includes a deep dive AgentCore multi-tenant pattern, spanning the identity, memory, gateway, observability, and run-time elements of the AgentCore experience. The goal here is to understand how SaaS providers can introduce tenant-context into their agents to support core SaaS mechanisms and constructs (onboarding, isolation, data partitioning, identity, etc.).
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Building multi-tenant SaaS applications with Amazon ECS
description: In this workshop you will learn how Amazon ECS simplifies critical SaaS operations and tenant management. Get hands on with essential SaaS components such as tenant onboarding, user management, and admin portals. Learn how to implement compute and tenant isolation with Amazon ECS, as well as how to efficiently route requests, and implement security measures at scale. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Karthik Annamalaisamy; Hoseong Seo; Dhammika Sriyananda
tags: SaaS; Containers; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building on AWS resilience: Innovations for critical success
description: Essential services that power global economies and critical infrastructure demand exceptional resilience. Through nearly two decades of focused innovation, AWS has developed core engineering practices and operational approaches that power critical workloads worldwide. Explore how AWS's architectural innovations and organizational practices help customers build robust services that maintain resilience during severe disruptions. Learn how AWS's continued investment in resilience provides the foundation for delivering essential services across governments, economies, and critical infrastructure.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Architecture; Business Executive; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building operational resilience in workloads using generative AI
description: Building operational resilience requires proactive identification and mitigation of risks. In this workshop, use AWS managed generative AI services in real-world scenarios to learn how to assess readiness, proactively improve your architecture, react quickly to events, troubleshoot issues, and implement effective observability practices. Also use AWS Countdown and the AWS Well-Architected Framework as the entry point reference frameworks to use generative AI services for operation. Through hands-on activities, learn strategies for debugging issues, detecting anomalies and incidents, and optimizing architectures to improve the resilience of your workloads. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Cloud Operations; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Pipelines for Analytics, ML and AI in Amazon Sagemaker Unified Studio
description: Learn how to create end-to-end pipelines to power data and AI applications in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. We will cover how to implement both batch and streaming pipelines to integrate various data sources, optimizing data movement with modern ETL techniques. This session will equip you with the knowledge to develop comprehensive data and AI solutions using the next generation of Amazon SageMaker, from initial data processing through to model deployment.
speakers: Aditya Challa; Daiyan Alamgir; Navnit Shukla
services: Amazon EMR; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Glue
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Analytics; Architecture; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Building pricing, tiering, and monetization solutions for GenAI and agents
description: Pricing and tiering can have profounds impacts on how you architect and build GenAI and agentic systems. This is especially true in multi-tenant agentic environments where pricing and tiering can be shaped heavily by the consumption of GenAI resources. In this chalk talk, we’ll look at the different considerations, patterns, and strategies when designing the architecture of a multi-tenant agentic experience. The goal here is to identify the areas where tenancy can impact the pricing/tiering model of your architecture before exploring different mechanisms that can be used to shape tenant experiences based on their GenAI consumption profile. We’ll also examine how tiering policies can be introduced to manage/limit consumption and noisy neighbor conditions.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Building privacy-aware generative AI applications in financial services
description: Financial institutions need to share sensitive documents across diverse roles while maintaining security and compliance. This includes junior analysts requesting summaries and compliance officers requiring complete audit trails. In this chalk talk, we'll architect a privacy-aware generative AI solution using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Cognito, and Amazon Verified Permissions. Explore how Cedar policies and identity context enable dynamic content tailoring, ranging from redacted summaries to full access, while maintaining single-source documents. Discover design patterns for secure, personalized document sharing that scales across asset management, research, and audit workflows.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Cognito; Amazon Verified Permissions
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Culture of Security; Security & Identity; Industry Solutions; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building Production Agent Swarms: Mastering Industrial AI
description: AI systems are evolving beyond multi-modal understanding into autonomous collaboration and problem-solving for industry-specific challenges. This technical session demonstrates how to build and orchestrate multi-agent systems that leverage industry expertise with LLMs. Topics include agent orchestration framework customization, advanced RAG patterns for domain knowledge, collaborative decision-making mechanisms, and production-scale observability. Drawing from real implementations, the session covers critical architecture decisions, common pitfalls, and proven solutions. Participants will gain practical patterns and code examples for building next-generation AI systems with memory, planning, and industry-specific collaboration capabilities.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Automation; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building production AI agents for cloud application resilience on AWS
description: Cloud-native applications demand intelligent, automated solutions for fault management and resilience. This session presents a production-proven multi-agent system built on AWS that diagnoses issues, predicts failures, and automates recovery in cloud environments. Learn how specialized AI agents collaborate to perform root cause analysis, classify faults, and orchestrate complex workflows. The presentation covers implementing distributed reasoning, maintaining context across processes, and enabling predictive maintenance. Explore real-world techniques for prompt engineering, function calling, and system integration. Gain actionable insights from building and operating AI-driven fault management at scale.
tags: Resilience; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Building Production-Grade Workflow Patterns with AWS Step Functions
description: Take your AWS Step Functions expertise to the next level with advanced architectural patterns and best practices. Join this session to dive deep into when and how to effectively use Map states, Parallel states, and nested workflows in production environments. Learn how to leverage features such as JSONata support, variables, and private API endpoint connections to build secure, high-performance workflows while optimizing costs. Through real-world production scenarios, discover proven patterns for building resilient serverless applications that scale.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Building production-ready Agentic AI architectures with AWS Serverless
description: Agentic AI is transforming enterprise applications, but taking it from prototype to production requires more than just prompting. Join this chalk talk to discuss pragmatic, scalable patterns for building agentic AI systems using AWS Serverless services like Lambda, ECS Fargate, and API Gateway. You'll learn how to architect and operate distributed agent-based systems, including patterns for running Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Together, we’ll walk through end-to-end architecture using the Strands Agents SDK, covering best practices for security, observability, and governance. Bring your questions — and leave with concrete patterns you can apply in your organization right away.

tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Resilience; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Join this chalk talk to learn proven patterns and best practices for moving AI applications from proof-of-concept to production using Amazon Bedrock. We'll dive deep into architecting secure, scalable AI solutions that meet enterprise requirements. Discover how to optimize performance, manage costs, and implement robust security controls to protect against AI-specific threats like prompt injection. Perfect for partners building AI consulting practices or software products, this interactive session will equip you with practical strategies for deploying production-grade AI applications. Bring your challenges and learn from real-world examples of successful enterprise AI implementations using AWS security services.

title: Building Production-Ready Data Systems for AI Applications
description: Join us to experience how the next generation of Amazon SageMaker powers data and analytics to enable intelligent business transformations with AI solutions. Using a real-world scenario, participants will step into the roles of different data professionals to solve real business challenges, from initial data preparation to deploying an AI-powered, targeted business campaign. Using SageMaker Unified Studio, you'll learn to build robust data foundations, implement governance, manage vector databases, and leverage integrated ML capabilities in a unified and secure environment. This hands-on session emphasizes practical application, demonstrating how to create measurable business value through data-driven, AI-enabled solutions.
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building Prudential’s microagent platform with MCP and A2A on AWS
description: Enterprises are exploring ways to scale their AI agent implementations beyond initial use cases. Learn how Prudential Financial is moving beyond single-purpose deployments with a scalable, microagent architecture powered by Amazon Bedrock and MCP agent-to-agent (A2A) communication. Prudential will share how their financial advisor assistant became the foundation for an enterprise multi-agent system, supporting diverse scenarios through modular design, independent scaling, and seamless deployment on AWS. Whether you’re exploring AI agents for specific business needs or building a foundation for enterprise-wide adoption, walk away with patterns and best practices for scaling AI agents.
speakers: Mun Kim; Subir Das; Rohit Kapa
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Containers; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Building Quantum-Safe Systems with Post-Quantum Cryptography on AWS
description: Learn how to prepare your systems for the quantum computing era using AWS's latest post-quantum cryptography capabilities. In this hands-on workshop, you'll implement quantum-safe key management using AWS KMS with ML-DSA and ML-KEM, deploy quantum-resistant certificates using AWS Private Certificate Authority, and analyze hybrid post-quantum TLS handshakes. Through practical exercises, you'll benchmark post-quantum algorithms against classical ones and implement secure file transfers using quantum-safe protocols. Leave with concrete experience in implementing post-quantum cryptography using AWS services and understanding performance implications for your applications.
services: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Data Protection; Cryptography and Post-Quantum; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building rate-limited solutions on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Does your scalable service overwhelm backends that can't keep up? Do you need to integrate with rate-limited third-party APIs? Attend this chalk talk to learn some of the best ways to build rate limiting into your systems for improved reliability. After a quick overview of AWS rate limiting tools, dive into the details of three different implementations. Leave with practical strategies to prevent downstream bottlenecks from impacting your application's performance.

description: Join this hands-on builders session where you'll implement real-time features using AWS AppSync Events. In this session, you'll build a real-time application incorporating in-app notifications and live updates. With guidance from AWS experts at your table, you'll configure WebSocket connections and implement data persistence strategies. Working in small groups, you'll get personalized assistance as you experiment with the provided code samples. By the end of this 60-minute session, you'll have hands-on experience building real-time features that you can apply to your own applications. Bring your laptop and come ready to code!

title: Building Real-Time Container Security with AWS Native Tools
description: Real-time threat detection is critical for container security. This technical session demonstrates how to build a comprehensive security monitoring solution using Amazon GuardDuty, AWS Security Hub, and Amazon Inspector. Through live coding demonstrations, participants will learn to implement automated detection pipelines that correlate findings across AWS security services to identify and respond to container threats, including supply chain compromises and runtime breakouts. Participants will implement defense-in-depth monitoring through AWS IAM Access Analyzer, AWS CloudTrail event monitoring, and vulnerability scanning integration, with working code samples and  templates for containerized infrastructure.
services: Amazon GuardDuty; Amazon Inspector; AWS Security Hub
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; DevSecOps; Containers; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building reliable operations, feat. Fannie Mae
description: Managing incidents effectively across complex infrastructure remains a challenge for many organizations. In this session, learn proven practices for building reliable operations and reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) through effective incident management. We'll showcase how Fannie Mae transformed their operations by building a cross-region observability platform on AWS, enabling them to automate incident response and improve reliability across their hybrid environment. Walk away with practical strategies for implementing automated incident management, establishing effective on-call processes, and leveraging AWS services to enhance operational reliability within your organization.
speakers: Bobby Hallahan; Steve Rice; Moiz Halani
services: Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Resilience Hub; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Management & Governance; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building resilience against ransomware using AWS Backup
description: To counter evolving cyber threats, organizations must fortify their backup infrastructure for recovery resilience, aligned with NIST CSF 2.0. This session explores three critical pillars: immutability with isolation, integrity validation, and predictable availability. AWS Backup enables these through Vault Lock for tamper-proof backups, restore testing for integrity assurance, and integration with partner solutions for enhanced forensic analysis. Learn how to strengthen accessibility by isolating authentication boundaries to protect recovery mechanisms from compromised credentials. Discover practical strategies to align these pillars with NIST CSF 2.0, ensuring robust recovery resilience and business continuity.
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Security & Identity; Storage; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building resilient architectures with observability [REPEAT]
description: When critical systems fail, every minute of downtime costs money and trust. Transform an application into a resilient, observable system in this hands-on workshop. Enhance resilience through chaos engineering, inject faults with AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate Availability Zones failures, network issues, and deployment problems. Learn to leverage Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon Application Recovery Controller to detect, diagnose, and automatically recover from failures. Leave with practical experience in building applications that remain observable and resilient under real-world conditions.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Fault Injection Service; Amazon Application Recovery Controller
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Resilience; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Hands-on; Interactive
