title: Building resilient block storage through chaos engineering and observability
description: Modern resilience engineering requires validating how storage systems behave under disruptions. In this session, learn how to use AWS Fault Injection Service (AWS FIS) to inject EBS-specific faults, such as volume latency, detachment, or I/O degradation, and observe system behavior under pressure. Dive into real-world strategies for designing observability into the storage layer using Amazon EBS and Amazon CloudWatch metrics. See how advanced teams are codifying recovery expectations, triggering automated failovers, and continuously testing system durability in production-like environments.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); AWS Fault Injection Service
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Building resilient clients: Architecture patterns from Amazon.com
description: Discover architectural patterns for building resilient frontend applications, drawn from Amazon.com's production experience at massive scale. Learn how Amazon.com architects frontend systems to maintain reliability during peak events through fault injection testing, caching strategies, and graceful degradation patterns. Explore implementations of circuit breakers, deployment safety, and comprehensive monitoring for operational excellence. This technical session provides practical patterns for architecting robust client applications that scale, aligned with AWS Well-Architected Framework principles.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Resilience; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Building resilient data protection with Amazon EBS Snapshots [REPEAT]
description: Design advanced data protection strategies using Amazon EBS Snapshots in this expert-level builders session. Architect automated, application-consistent snapshot workflows leveraging Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager with robust security controls and encryption. Configure Amazon EBS Provisioned Rate for Volume Initialization to enhance resilience, reducing recovery time and enabling concurrent initialization of hundreds of EBS volumes and EC2 instances. Build sophisticated safeguards against accidental deletions and ransomware attacks while strengthening your compliance posture. This session includes complex scenarios and hands-on development of best practices for enterprise-grade data resilience.
speakers: Dan Booth; Parker Bradshaw; James Corrigan; Denton He; Paul Janeway
services: Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager; Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Data Protection; Resilience; Automation; Architecture; Storage; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; System Administrator; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building resilient deployment pipelines with Amazon ECS
description: When running containerized applications on Amazon ECS, operations teams need to ensure that new software releases are rolled out safely, with the ability to try out new releases, and to quickly rollback to a previous known stable state. Join this workshop to gain hands on experience with Amazon ECS deployment strategies, diving deep into the different approaches, and learning how they can be automated as part of a CI/CD pipeline. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Mukul Khajanchi; Islam Mahgoub; Mike Rizzo
tags: Resilience; Containers; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Building resilient multi-Region applications with Capital One
description: Organizations face significant challenges achieving predictable recovery times and maintaining consistency in multi-Region applications at scale. Learn how to use Application Recovery Controller (ARC), Aurora DSQL, and DynamoDB Multi-Region Strong Consistency to create resilient architectures with bounded recovery targets. Through real-world implementation patterns, discover how ARC Region switch controls and AWS Fault Injection Service transform maintenance and testing approaches. This expert-level session provides practical strategies for architecting multi-Region applications that deliver predictable recovery and consistent operations.
speakers: Daniel Cil; Eduardo Patrocinio; Prem Kumar Dhayalan
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Application Recovery Controller; Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Architecture; Advisor / Consultant; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Building Resilient Multi-Tenant Messaging with Amazon SQS
description: Multi-tenant messaging systems face challenges like noisy neighbors and unexpected workloads that impact reliability. This chalk talk explores how Amazon SQS helps maintain fairness, isolation, and consistent performance across tenants. Discover practical strategies including dead-letter queues, retry handling, and monitoring demonstrated through SaaS and microservices scenarios. Join us to learn best practices for building resilient, scalable Amazon SQS architectures that deliver reliable message processing for all tenants.
tags: Application Security; Event-Driven Architecture; DevOps; Analytics; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Building resilient Serverless applications with chaos engineering
description: Chaos engineering helps build confidence in system resilience, but how do you apply it to serverless architectures? In this intermediate-level session, learn practical techniques for implementing chaos experiments on AWS Lambda functions to identify and address failure points before they impact your users. We'll demonstrate how to inject latency, errors, and resource constraints into your serverless environment using both custom approaches and AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS). You'll leave with actionable knowledge to create automated, repeatable chaos experiments for your production serverless applications. You'll also learn key metrics to measure the effectiveness of your resilience testing.
services: AWS Fault Injection Service; AWS Lambda
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Resilience; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Interactive

title: Building scalable applications with text and multimodal understanding
description: Discover how Amazon Nova models bring text and multimodal understanding to your applications. Learn how Nova interprets across modalities to deliver responses for diverse use cases, from automating content analysis to enhancing search and discovery—leading to deeper insights and delightful customer experiences.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Building Scalable, Secure Secrets Management on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Unlock the vault of industry-leading practices for protecting sensitive assets using AWS Secrets Manager. In this hands-on session, you'll architect an enterprise-grade secrets management solution that combines practical access management, automated secrets rotation, efficient caching with the Secrets Manager agent, and cross-region replication. Through real-world scenarios, learn to craft robust security controls using AWS KMS, AWS Lambda, IAM, and AWS Config. Discover how to implement compliance guardrails that scale with your applications while reducing operational complexity. By the end of this session, you'll have a clear strategy for strengthening your security posture with proven patterns that meet enterprise compliance requirements in modern cloud environments.
speakers: Simon Akkad; Alex Goff; Stephanie Mbappe; Tobias Nickl; Brendan Paul
services: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS); AWS Secrets Manager
tags: Data Protection; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Unlock the vault of industry-leading practices for protecting your crown jewels using AWS Secrets Manager's cutting-edge features. In this hands-on session, you'll architect an enterprise-grade secrets management solution combining automated rotation, intelligent caching, and cross-region replication. Through real-world scenarios, master the art of crafting robust security controls using AWS KMS, Lambda, IAM, and Config. title: Building Scalable, Self-Orchestrating AI Workflows with A2A and MCP
description: Learn how to build scalable, autonomous AI workflows using the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol and Model Context Protocol (MCP). This session demonstrates how to design specialized agents that dynamically discover each other's capabilities and collaborate on complex tasks across platforms and implementations. Using MCP for standardized context integration, you'll build horizontally scalable, serverless agents with AWS Lambda, Amazon Bedrock, and Momento Cache. You'll also learn how A2A enables secure agent collaboration with built-in observability. Through real-world examples and best practices, you'll leave equipped to design, deploy, and scale interoperable AI systems in production.
tags: Automation; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Building Secure agents with Q Index [AWS Partners only]
description: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn to enhance enterprise AI capabilities using Amazon Q Index to unify and contextualize distributed data sources securely. Through hands-on exercises, build intelligent agents that leverage Q Index to securely access organizational data. Dive deep into Strands Agent implementation for task orchestration and explore Model Context Protocol (MCP) for distributed AI workloads. Gain practical experience with Bedrock AgentCore for secure agent development and deployment. Discover strategies for intelligent data contextualization and automated reasoning to drive meaningful business outcomes while maintaining enterprise security. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Secure and Responsible Gen AI with GuardRails for Amazon Bedrock
description: This lab provides hands-on training in building a secure generative AI chatbot using Amazon Bedrock. Learn how to leverage Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to generate contextually relevant responses. They will implement guardrails to filter and control the chatbot's content generation. Additionally, you will explore essential security features like access control and logging to ensure the Bedrock configuration adheres to security best practices. After completing this lab, you will acquire skills to develop secure and compliant generative AI applications aligning with organizational requirements and ethical guidelines.
tags: Training & Certification; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Building secure and scalable lakehouses for the future
description: Join this interactive session to learn strategies for building secure and scalable data lakehouse architectures. You will get practical experience in implementing different lakehouse patterns using AWS Lake Formation as a single control plane for managing permissions across multiple data stores. Implement Attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) and Tag-based Access Control (TBAC) to efficiently scale permissions, create unified governance policies, and set up cross-platform access controls. Gain hands-on experience with real-world lakehouse scenarios that demonstrate how to scale data access management across your organization.

tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Identity & Access Management; Analytics; Architecture; Data Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Building serverless vector applications with Amazon S3 Vectors [REPEAT]
description: Vector embeddings are transforming how organizations build and scale AI, powering everything from semantic search to generative applications. In this session, dive deep into the unique architecture of Amazon S3 Vectors and learn how to build cost-effective vector search applications at scale. We'll whiteboard the technical differences between S3 Vectors and specialized vector databases, discuss the specialized indexing approach that delivers query performance at significantly lower costs, and explore integration patterns with popular AWS AI services including Amazon Bedrock and Amazon OpenSearch Service. Come with your architecture questions, and we'll work through real-world scenarios together.

description: Your AI coding assistant generates impressive code at lightning speed, but production deployments reveal the harsh reality - perfect authentication that ignores existing workflows, elegant APIs that break integration patterns. Join the Agentic AI ProServe Experience team to explore solutions to this "blindfolded coding agent" challenge. Through live coding with Amazon Q and Kiro, learn how to organize knowledge for maximum effectiveness: foundational principles, systematic workflows, automated quality gates, and real-time data access. title: Building Sovereign Cloud Environments
description: As organizations scale their operations globally, they need to meet evolving data residency, security, compliance, and business continuity requirements. This session explores how AWS Control Tower and Landing Zone Accelerator on AWS support key sovereignty requirements, including country-specific compliance frameworks, regional service selection, automated controls for data movement, and cross-border transfers. Through real-world examples, the session demonstrates how organizations can leverage AWS to implement country-specific security controls, maintain operational consistency across multi-region deployments, accelerate cloud compliance, and deploy automated security and compliance at scale.
services: AWS CloudFormation; AWS Config; AWS Control Tower
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

This chalk talk dives into best practices for training, fine-tuning, and deploying domain-specific models at scale. We'll explore how national AI initiatives are leveraging AWS services to build models tailored to local language and regulatory requirements, with a focus on language specialization, data sovereignty, and responsible AI. Reference use cases from public-sector LLM projects will be discussed to highlight practical strategies and lessons learned.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

We will share architectural patterns and startup-friendly resources, featuring live demos from a cutting-edge coding startup showcasing their complete journey—from rapid MVP development to handling production traffic at scale, including specific Bedrock capabilities, cost optimization strategies, and startup support programs that enabled their multi-model AI vision without enterprise-level infrastructure investments.

title: Cache me if you can, Valkey edition [REPEAT]
description:
This hands-on workshop explores practical caching with Valkey through three key use cases: database query optimization, session management, and real-time leaderboards. Participants will learn to cache expensive database operations, external API calls, and JSON configurations while building scalable session storage and dynamic leaderboards.
Beyond implementation, the workshop emphasizes critical caching challenges including cache invalidation, stampede prevention, memory management, and data consistency. Attendees will experience common pitfalls firsthand and learn proven strategies for cache warming, TTL optimization, and production monitoring.
Participants leave with working code examples, architectural patterns, and clear understanding of caching trade-offs they can immediately apply to their applications.
tags: Resilience; DevOps; Databases; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

tags: Resilience; DevOps; Databases; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Caesars personalizes guest service at scale with AI-powered Amazon Connect
description: Customers today expect personalized and relevant service at every touchpoint in their journey. Hear from Caesars Entertainment about how their Digital Concierge leverages Amazon Connect to gain a 360-degree customer view — utilizing advanced analytics and AI-driven capabilities to centralize digital outbound campaigns, empower agents with unified experiences, and proactively engage customers. Walk away with insights on how to turn casual customers into passionate advocates through personalized interactions and streamlined operations.
speakers: Ayesha Borker; Mary Ann Dennis; Greg Palk
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Travel & Hospitality; Lecture-style

title: Call the Amazon Q Business ChatSync API from a custom web application
description: Join this Builders session to learn more about the Amazon Q Business ChatSync API. Hear how to configure Amazon Cognito as a trusted token issuer, and then how your application can obtain an STS token to assume a role that calls the ChatSync API. Watch a demonstration of how a server-side Python script can call the ChatSync API when triggered by events in your front-end application, such as on page loads. And finish by understanding how a front-end application can upload a PDF to a server-side Python script that calls the ChatSync API to return a document summary.
speakers: Manasi Karale; Zuhayr Raghib; Suren Raju; Sumit Wasuja
tags: Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Can your model keep a secret? How to measure the privacy of your model
description: Understand the fundamentals of data privacy for generative and traditional AI systems in this expert-level chalk talk. Get acquainted with formal notions of differential privacy, its interpretations in terms of keeping your training data safe, and how this can be achieved practically. Learn a basic taxonomy of privacy breaches and what these mean in practice.  Explore how to audit the privacy of generative models efficiently and quickly. Leave with practical guidelines, code, and references on how to measure privacy risks on an ongoing basis.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Privacy; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Capability-first architecture: Bridging business intent to technology
description: With 200+ AWS services and a growing ecosystem of third-party solutions, making the right architectural choices can feel overwhelming. This session introduces a capability-first approach for moving from business goals to technology choices in a structured manner. Through practical examples, learn how this methodology narrows the solution space and keeps architectures adaptable to change. Discover how to make strategic, capability-aligned decisions that scale with your business, whether designing new solutions or refactoring legacy systems.
tags: Architecture; Advisor / Consultant; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Capital One: Building resilient systems by engineering for five nines
description: 99.999% availability—less than five minutes of downtime per year—is the gold standard for mission-critical applications. This session dives deep into architectural strategies to achieve such availability using AWS. We'll explore fault-tolerant patterns such as multi-Region deployments, active-active failover, circuit breakers, bulkheads, chaos testing, and event-driven designs. Learn how services like Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB Global Tables, and AWS Lambda can eliminate single points of failure. We’ll cover SLAs, SLOs, and engineering observability and automation to detect and respond to failures within milliseconds. Case studies and practical design guidance make this session ideal for architects and engineers building for extreme reliability.
speakers: Enrique Bastante; Arunkumar Ganesan; Sobhan Mupparaju
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Lambda
tags: Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Cell-based architectures: From connected vehicles to enterprise systems
description: Connected vehicle platforms demonstrate how cell-based architectures solve challenges of massive device access, data surges, and latency-sensitive workloads. Learn how this architectural pattern extends beyond automotive to transform smart cameras, monitoring systems, solar management, and SaaS platforms. Through practical examples using AWS IoT Core, Amazon MSK, Amazon EKS with Graviton, Amazon Aurora, and Amazon MemoryDB for Redis, discover how to implement fault isolation, scalable deployments, and localized edge services. This session provides architectural patterns for building resilient connected systems that maintain performance at scale across diverse industries.
tags: Resilience; Internet of Things; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Interactive

title: Centralize Multicloud Management using AWS
description: Operating in a multicloud environment can introduce operational complexity. In this session, learn to streamline operations with AWS Systems Manager, which allows for easier instance management across all environments. Gain insights into performance with Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon Managed Grafana, which delivers a unified dashboard of metrics and logs from any data source. With these services, you can simplify day-to-day tasks, maintain control, and optimize resources; whether your workloads span AWS, on-premises, or multiple clouds. Take the complexity out of multicloud and focus on what really matters—running your business.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Managed Grafana; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Management & Governance; Automation; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: CEO Keynote
description: Join AWS CEO Matt Garman to hear how AWS is innovating across every aspect of the world’s leading cloud. He explores how we are reinventing foundational building blocks as well as developing brand new experiences, all to empower customers and partners with what they need to build a better future.

title: Chaos & Continuity: Using Gen AI to improve humanitarian workload resilience
description: Almost everyone has experienced a bad IT day, where systems failed in unpredictable ways, but for organizations operating in humanitarian crisis contexts continuity is mission critical. Amazon’s CTO, Werner Vogels, has said: “Everything fails, all the time, so plan for failure and nothing fails”. Building resilient systems can be hard, and understanding the ways a system might fail can be challenging. However, generative AI can help in identifying gaps in your resilience posture. In this chalk talk, builders will see how they can leverage generative AI to better prepare for tomorrow’s disaster. You’ll leave with the tools, skills, and knowledge so your workloads are unaffected by future failures.
tags: Business Intelligence; Disaster Response & Recovery; Generative AI; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Chaos detective: Deploy generative AI-powered troubleshooting agents [REPEAT]
description: When chaos strikes your cloud infrastructure, rapid incident response becomes critical for financial institutions. In this chalk talk, learn how to create a generative AI-powered troubleshooting agent that investigates and diagnoses system failures in real-time. Together, we'll design patterns using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock to interpret observability metrics and logs during critical incidents. Explore architectural approaches for prompt engineering, agent design, and system resilience. Leave with proven patterns for building GenAI agents that transform infrastructure troubleshooting—from initial detection through automated resolution.
speakers: George Agiasoglou; Hisyam Jukifli; Robert Williams
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
tags: DevSecOps; Agentic AI; Containers; Cloud Operations; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Developer Community; Interactive

In this chalk talk, learn how to create a generative AI-powered troubleshooting agent that investigates and diagnoses system failures in real-time. Together, we'll design patterns using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock to interpret observability metrics and logs during critical incidents. Explore architectural approaches for prompt engineering, agent design, and system resilience. Leave with proven patterns for building GenAI agents that transform infrastructure troubleshooting—from initial detection through automated resolution.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
tags: DevSecOps; Agentic AI; Containers; Cloud Operations; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Interactive

title: Chaos engineering workshop [REPEAT]
description: This workshop introduces AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS) for running resilience experiments, also known as chaos engineering. You'll learn how to inject faults and apply test scenarios, such as power interruptions and cross-Region connectivity issues, to see how they affect the behavior of services like Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and Amazon RDS. You'll also learn how to produce experiment reports required for compliance in regulated industries. You'll also learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, and Amazon CloudWatch RUM to gain key insights from your experiments.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Fault Injection Service; AWS X-Ray
tags: Management & Governance; Resilience; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: This workshop introduces AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS) for running resilience experiments, also known as chaos engineering. You'll learn how to inject faults and apply test scenarios, such as power interruptions and cross-Region connectivity issues, to see how they affect the behavior of services like Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and Amazon RDS. You'll also learn how to produce experiment reports required for compliance in regulated industries. You'll also learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, and Amazon CloudWatch RUM to gain key insights from your experiments.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Fault Injection Service; AWS X-Ray
tags: Management & Governance; Resilience; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Choose your own modernization adventure: From legacy to cloud-native
description: Unsure where to start modernizing your infrastructure and applications? This hands-on workshop guides you through the complete modernization journey—from application discovery and dependency mapping to selecting the right modernization path. Learn about migrating to EC2, containerizing with Amazon ECS/EKS for both Windows and Linux environments, and refactoring .NET code for Linux deployment. Discover how agentic AI accelerates code refactoring and infrastructure migration while implementing cloud-native best practices and infrastructure-as-code principles. Explore real-world scenarios to make informed modernization decisions. Bring your laptop for an interactive experience that will equip you with practical skills for your modernization initiatives.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS); AWS Elastic Beanstalk
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Automation; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Choosing the right AWS network connectivity option for your use case
description: Learn when to choose AWS Transit Gateway vs Cloud WAN for network connectivity, AWS Direct Connect vs Site-to-Site VPN for hybrid connections, and traditional networking vs application networking services like Amazon VPC Lattice. Make your decisions based on scale, complexity, security, and cost considerations. Through real-world scenarios, learn to match connectivity patterns to the right AWS service—whether you're connecting VPCs in single or multiple Regions, on-premises networks, or microservices. Walk away with practical architectural patterns to optimize your network connectivity strategy.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Choosing the right AWS storage service
description: AWS offers a range of storage services designed for different use cases - from migrating applications and backing up data to integrating cloud storage with on-premises applications, building data lakes, and developing cloud-native applications. Join this chalk talk to evaluate storage options and avoid service mismatches that can create unnecessary complexity. Work with AWS experts to understand which storage service best aligns with your workloads and application requirements, providing the flexibility to scale as needed. Leave with clear guidance on selecting the right AWS storage service for various scenarios and situations.
services: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); Amazon FSx; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Data Protection; Cost Optimization; Learning from Amazon; Cloud Operations; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Climbing the AI Mountain With Your Security Team
description: Navigate the intersection of AI and security culture in this practical session. Learn how security teams can effectively embrace AI innovation through incremental steps and validation techniques. Using real-world examples, we'll demonstrate how security practitioners can adapt their skills to AI challenges regardless of their level of specialized expertise and share strategies for building security-aware AI practices. From understanding generative and agentic AI-specific security risks to creating engaging team exercises, discover how to transform security from a potential bottleneck into an enabler of responsible AI innovation. Attendees will leave with actionable insights for building a security-first approach to AI adoption.
tags: Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Cloud Foundations Accelerator [REPEAT]
description: This session explores critical capabilities every new AWS customer should start with. We'll cover key services and best practices for security, cost management, and operational efficiency that complement Control Tower. Perfect for a new AWS customers creating their first account or looking to expand their AWS footprint. You'll leave with a clear roadmap for building a robust, scalable, and secure AWS Cloud Foundation.
services: AWS Billing and Cost Management; AWS Config; AWS Control Tower
tags: Cost Optimization; DevOps; Identity & Access Management; Migration & Modernization; Networking & Content Delivery; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Cloud-native Java on Amazon EKS
description: Learn how to build cloud-native Java applications based on best practices, and discover ways you can optimize application performance for  fast startup and efficient resource usage in containerized environments. In this builders' session, gain hands-on experience you will learn how to reduce memory overhead, lower cold start latency, and achieve sub-second startup times when building Java applications on Amazon EKS. You will also learn how to use Amazon Bedrock to analyze profiling and thread dump data to uncover performance patterns and generate optimization insights.
speakers: Yuriy Bezsonov; Fernanda Machado; Abhishek Nanda; Andrei Shakirin; Yagr Xu
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Kubernetes; Business Applications; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: CMT: High-performance NLP & geospatial analysis with Redshift
description: This session explores how Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) uses Amazon Redshift for large-scale geospatial and text data analysis. We'll discuss why CMT chose AWS and Redshift based on scalability and integration needs, highlighting how Redshift's geospatial solution using H3 functions enable efficient processing of billions of location records. The presentation demonstrates CMT's use of Redshift's NLP capabilities, featuring QEv2 and Vega for advanced ad-hoc reporting. Finally, we examine how Redshift's architecture delivers the optimal price-performance balance for CMT's demanding data operations.
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Architecture; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: COBOL to cloud: Accelerated refactoring with AWS Transform agentic AI
description: Experience the power of AWS Transform in this hands-on workshop. See how agentic AI revolutionizes mainframe modernization, cutting transformation timelines from years to months while minimizing risk. Work with AI-powered features that analyze complex mainframe codebases, extract business rules, generate documentation and transform COBOL into modern, maintainable Java .Through guided exercises, you’ll explore AWS Transform’s tools including automated code analysis, business rule extraction, decomposition, and AI-assisted refactoring. Learn proven techniques for testing, validating, and deploying your modernized applications. Walk away with hands-on experience in creating cloud-native applications that maintain functional equivalence while unlocking the full potential of AWS services.
tags: Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Cochlear enhances contact center observability with Amazon Connect
description: Real-time visibility of contact center operations and customer interactions is critical to delivering excellent customer service. In this session, hear from Cochlear — the global leader in implantable hearing solutions — on how you can leverage Amazon Connect to observe and manage end-to-end customer experience operations, from forecasting contacts, to planning workforce schedules, to delivering human agent coaching, and beyond. Learn how Amazon Connect puts the power of AI in your hands to deliver end-to-end observability in your contact center.
tags: SaaS; Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Code completion to agents: The evolution of development
description: AI-powered coding agents are one of the most promising applications of generative AI. In this talk we will start from their humble beginnings as inline code completion tools and explain their evolution into sophisticated autonomous coding agents. Throughout the talk, we will ground our discussion in empirical evidence, presenting evaluations from public benchmarks that demonstrate the progressive improvements in each evolutionary stage. By walking through concrete examples and real-world applications, attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of the current state of AI-powered development tools and insights into future directions in this rapidly advancing field.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Coding an MCP server for Amazon Aurora [REPEAT]
description: Do you want to build an MCP server for your application running on Amazon Aurora where you control the access without handing full control to an LLM and the AI agents simply call it? In this code talk, learn about MCP servers, how they can help you, and key considerations to ensure you can safely and predictably enable LLMs to call it. See live coding firsthand and learn the code required to build a MCP that is designed to meet your requirements. Discover how you can integrate AI agents with MCP servers while ensuring secure database access.
tags: Open Data; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Coding an MCP server for Amazon Aurora [REPEAT]
description: Do you want to build an MCP server for your application running on Amazon Aurora where you control the access without handing full control to an LLM and the AI agents simply call it? In this code talk, learn about MCP servers, how they can help you, and key considerations to ensure you can safely and predictably enable LLMs to call it. See live coding firsthand and learn the code required to build a MCP that is designed to meet your requirements. Discover how you can integrate AI agents with MCP servers while ensuring secure database access.
tags: Open Data; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Coding cost-efficient multi-tenant knowledge bases with time-to-live (TTL)
description: This code-focused session demonstrates how to build cost-efficient, multi-tenant knowledge bases using time-to-live (TTL) operations to dramatically reduce infrastructure costs in SaaS environments. We'll live-code a serverless architecture that ingests documents only when needed and automatically expires unused documents, addressing the critical challenge of managing multiple tenants with varying usage patterns. The session will showcase practical implementation of Amazon Bedrock's custom data source with DynamoDB TTL triggers and intelligent document lifecycle management. Define a tiered based approach by implementing the knowledge base with a choice of vector databases, such as OpenSearch and S3 Vectors. We'll also explore broader applications of TTL-driven session management, cache optimization, and tenant resource provisioning.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Combat financial document fraud with a multi-agent system
description: Financial institutions face mounting pressure to combat increasingly sophisticated fraud attempts more efficiently. In this workshop, you will build a fraud detection system leveraging multiple AI agents using the Strands Agents SDK to detect fraud in financial documents. Dive deep into a multi-agent architecture where specialized AI agents work together to compare metadata across documents, detect AI-generated forgeries, validate regional formatting, match documents against legitimate document patterns, and cross-reference documents with public sources. Learn to deploy a multi-agent assistant supporting investigators through each step of the document verification process.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Commonwealth Bank of Australia reimagines modernization via agentic AI
description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) revolutionizes legacy modernization using AWS Bedrock's agentic AI architecture. Their groundbreaking solution slashes application assessment time from 6 weeks to under 1 hour and reduces overall modernization cycles from 16 weeks to just 1 week. Through specialized AI agents, CBA automatically analyzes legacy code, detects vulnerabilities, and orchestrates complex transformations while maintaining strict banking compliance. Multi-agent workflows handle security assessments, cloud readiness analysis, and automated network flow implementations, enabling transformation of monolithic systems into cloud-native applications with unprecedented speed and precision.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Q; Amazon Q Code Transformation
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Business Executive; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Professional Services; Software & Internet; Lecture-style

title: Compact yet powerful: Exploring model distillation with AWS Trainium
description: In this builder's session, dive into the practical implementation of model distillation techniques using AWS Trainium instances and the Neuron SDK. Learn how to compress large language models into smaller, efficient versions while maintaining performance and accuracy. Through hands-on exercises, you will set up and optimize your environment for AWS Trainium, implement knowledge distillation using Neuron SDK, learn best practices for teacher-student model architecture design, and measure and compare model performance before and after distillation. This session is ideal for ML practitioners and developers who want to deploy efficient AI models at scale. Participants should have basic experience with PyTorch.
speakers: Jim Burtoft; Steve Fu; Asheesh Goja; John Gray; Achintya Pinninti
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Compile blazing-fast MCP servers in Rust
description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are commonly written in Python and JavaScript, producing applications that need npm, uv, and Docker to run. But what if you could compile your MCP server into a standalone binary without worrying about dependencies? This session explores the Rust MCP SDK, demonstrating how to build blazing-fast MCP servers that run anywhere. Learn how to transform your MCP implementations into optimized Rust solutions.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Compute; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Compute innovation with the AWS Nitro System
description: Overview of AWS Nitro system and new compute innovations fueled by Nitro e.g. multi-host for smaller metal sizes, reduced blast radius, higher performance, how Nitro has helped us in accelerating the pace of innovation and deliver flex instances. Dive deep into Gen8 Intel/AMD instances.
tags: Cost Optimization; Compute; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Connect to VPC resources with PrivateLink and VPC Lattice
description:
Amazon VPC Lattice is designed to simplify service-to-service connectivity at scale across accounts and VPCs with built-in layer 7 routing and policy . Similarly, AWS PrivateLink is designed to make it easier to connect services and resources across different AWS accounts and VPCs to simplify your network architectures. Recently we added capabilities to PrivateLink and VPC Lattice to simplify access to non-HTTP services helps further by eliminating the need of deploying network load balancers in the target VPCs.
We will explore which use cases can be addressed with this feature and discuss how these can be implemented with either PrivateLink or VPC Lattice.
tags: Interactive

title: Connecting Infor CloudSuite to AWS Services
description: Infor CloudSuite customers can extend their ERP capabilities by integrating with AWS-native services. This chalk talk walks through real integration patterns using Infor ION and AWS building blocks such as API Gateway, EventBridge, Lambda, and Kinesis. Learn how to enable real-time event processing, self-service analytics with QuickSight, and API-based business process automation. Ideal for architects and developers modernizing Infor ERP systems, this session highlights best practices and success stories using AWS for scalable, compliant ERP integration.
services: Amazon API Gateway; Amazon Kinesis; AWS Lambda
tags: Automation; Serverless; Business Applications; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Control humanoid robots and drones with voice and Agentic AI
description: Voice control in robotics has traditionally required intricate coordination between speech recognition, natural language processing, and response generation. This session demonstrates a project developed together with the Hong Kong Institute of Information Technology (HKIIT), showing how Agentic AI and speech-to-speech streaming can simplify voice control for humanoid robots, robot dogs, and drones. The presentation explores practical AWS-based architectures designed for efficient command processing, intent recognition, and robot control systems. Through live demonstrations, learn how to minimize latency while maintaining precision across diverse environments. Discover patterns for handling continuous speech input and coordinating responsive robot behavior in real-world scenarios.
tags: Robotics; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Correlating compliance signals across AWS
description: Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) teams face the challenge of correlating compliance signals scattered across multiple locations both inside and outside of AWS. This interactive chalk talk explores how you can use the new zero-ETL in Amazon OpenSearch Service to eliminate data silos and enable comprehensive governance observability across your organization. You will learn about designing correlation workflows that directly query data from Amazon S3, including on-premises  and multi-cloud environments, without data movement or duplication. Walk away with actionable insights on real-world governance challenges including audit trail correlation, compliance violation detection, and security posture assessment
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon OpenSearch Service; Amazon Security Lake
tags: Cloud Operations; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Migration & Modernization; Interactive

title: Cost optimization for Amazon DynamoDB [REPEAT]
description: Developers love building on powerful, serverless Amazon DynamoDB, and as their production tables grow in size and traffic, they want to discover what mechanisms and optimizations can be applied to reduce costs. Cost optimization can be done both in the design phase and during operations. In this chalk talk, learn how to model and measure costs and discover cost optimization tools that can help you along the way.
tags: Cost Optimization; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Cost optimization for Amazon DynamoDB [REPEAT]
description: Developers love building on powerful, serverless Amazon DynamoDB, and as their production tables grow in size and traffic, they want to discover what mechanisms and optimizations can be applied to reduce costs. Cost optimization can be done both in the design phase and during operations. In this chalk talk, learn how to model and measure costs and discover cost optimization tools that can help you along the way.
tags: Cost Optimization; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Cost Optimize your .NET workloads on AWS
description: Are you looking for better performance and lower cost for your .NET workloads? Learn how to accelerate migration of your .NET workloads from VMware or Windows to Linux on AWS, including the AWS Graviton processor. We will also show you how Amazon Q developer can assist you in your .NET workload migration to Graviton. Finally, this session will equip you with the best practices for benchmarking workloads and analyzing price performance gains from using on AWS.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon EC2 - Graviton; AWS Transform
tags: Microsoft & .NET; VMware; Cost Optimization; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Cost-efficient AI model scaling with Amazon EKS on SageMaker HyperPod
description: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod accelerates AI model development by eliminating the undifferentiated heavy lifting involved in building and maintaining compute clusters powered by thousands of accelerators. Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) provides enhanced scalability and resiliency tooling to scale AI/ML workloads. Experience the hands-on setup of Kubernetes environments optimized for AI model development workloads in HyperPod. You'll use Amazon EKS alongside HyperPod task governance to implement robust resource allocation strategies that maximize NVIDIA GPU or AWS Trainium utilization, and leverage HyperPod observability capabilities to track EKS cluster and model development metrics in real-time, receive alerts when performance deteriorates, and automatically remediate issues using pre-defined policies.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Create a secure card management platform with AWS Payment Cryptography
description: Learn how to build a secure, PCI-DSS compliant card management platform using the AWS Payment Cryptography Service across multiple AWS Regions. Explore HSM-backed cryptographic operations for payment card data, reducing compliance scope and operational overhead. See demonstrations of key exchange between HSM vendors and AWS, implementation of P2PE, crypto material generation, and transaction authorization. Discover patterns for secure API design, localized deployment for data sovereignty, and disaster recovery. Ideal for financial institutions, payment processors, and enterprises, this session shows how to leverage AWS's global infrastructure to build secure, scalable card management solutions that meet stringent security requirements.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Payment Cryptography; Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL
tags: Application Security; Innovation & Transformation; Culture of Security; Security & Identity; Industry Solutions; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Create advanced self-service experiences with Amazon Connect [REPEAT]
description: Attend this hands-on workshop to learn how to effectively leverage Agentic AI in your self-service applications. This session will focus on building common self-service use cases with Amazon Q in Connect through the voice and chat channels including resolving personalized customer questions, fulfilling complex customer transactions, blend with structured AI where needed, and intelligently escalate to human agents. Through practical demonstrations and guided exercises, participants will gain hands-on experience implementing Amazon Q in Connect, learning best practices for prompt engineering, knowledge base integration, and creating seamless customer interactions.

title: Create an AWS DevOps AI Agent with the Strands Agents SDK

In this session, you will build a banking AI agent application, allowing end users to fetch account balances, pay bills, and transfer money using natural language prompts, and leverage MCP to interact with a banking data set stored in Aurora DSQL. title: Cyber Resilience on AWS, designing security and recovery strategies
description:
Cyber resilience is the ability of an organization to continuously deliver the intended outcome despite adverse cyber events. It has an overlap with disaster recovery where both cyber resilience and disaster recovery involve plans and actions to restore normal operations after an incident. Cyber resilience includes disaster recovery as part of its broader strategy.
There are multiple key themes when it comes to designing for cyber resilience:
- Protect: Proactive measures taken to safeguard systems, networks, and data.
- Prepare: Activities to ensure an organization can effectively respond to and recover from a cyber incident.
- Recover: Actions taken to restore systems, networks, and data to their normal state after a cyber incident.
services: AWS Backup; AWS Resilience Hub; AWS Security Hub
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Management & Governance; Network & Infrastructure Security; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Business Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Enterprise; Lecture-style

They then demand a ransom in order for organizations to regain access to the affected data. Without proper data protection techniques, an organization might fail to recover from a ransomware event. In this chalk talk, learn about data protection mechanisms you can use to protect your business-critical data on AWS against ransomware events. Also, discover first-response strategies you can use to rapidly restore your critical data during a ransomware event.

The discussion will cover advanced correlation techniques between database load dimensions, wait events, and SQL patterns. We will also demonstrate how to navigate from fleet-level anomalies to query-level root causes.

In this session, dive deep into new features – and Aurora’s most popular offerings including serverless, I/O-Optimized, zero-ETL integrations, MCP integration, and generative AI support for vector search and storage.
