title: Deep dive into Amazon DocumentDB and its innovations
description: Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) is a serverless, fully managed, MongoDB API-compatible document database service. In this session, take a deep dive into the most exciting new features Amazon DocumentDB offers including serverless, enhanced compression, performance upgrades, and the latest query APIs. Learn how the implementation of these features in your organization can improve resilience, performance, and the effectiveness of your applications.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Deep dive into Amazon ECS resilience and availability
description: Every application architecture relies on underlying infrastructure, and many choose Amazon ECS as the foundation to build upon. Do you know how Amazon ECS is built? What design considerations were taken while building the service? How Amazon ECS can help you minimize an outage? In this session, learn how Amazon ECS can help you address your requirements for running resilient and reliable applications in the cloud. Dive deep into how Amazon ECS service architecture, design, and operational practices provide a secure and resilient foundation for your applications.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Auto Scaling; AWS Fargate
tags: Resilience; Containers; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Deep dive into data processing in SageMaker Unified Studio
description: Join us for an interactive chalk talk demonstrating how to transform complex data processing workflows into manageable, secure, and scalable solutions in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. We'll explore building a robust data lake foundation, enabling self-service analytics through visual ETL tools, and implementing comprehensive data governance. Whether you're a data engineer scaling operations, a data analyst seeking self-service capabilities, or a business leader concerned with data security, you'll discover how SageMaker Unified Studio can streamline your journey from data to actionable insights.
services: Amazon EMR; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Glue
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; IT Administrator; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: Deep dive into databases zero-ETL integrations
description: In this session, learn how AWS zero-ETL integrations remove the need to manage complex data movement pipelines across multiple source database engines and targets so data engineers, architects, & DBAs can eliminate maintenance overhead while ensuring near real-time data availability for analytics & ML workloads. Examine the underlying architecture and how it works for the supported zero-ETL integrations between Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon RDS sources to Amazon Redshift, Amazon SageMaker, and Amazon OpenSearch Service targets - all without traditional ETL complexity. Dive into the data movement options, tunable settings, and how to monitor ongoing data movement.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Deep Dive into Deloitte's Amazon Neptune GenAI Security Intelligence Center
description: To adapt to an ever-changing threat landscape, effective cybersecurity must align policy interpretation, operational enforcement, and real-time metrics in a continuous feedback loop. Generative AI has a large role to play in retrieving relevant data and coordinating and adapting this complex task across a disparate set of tools and information sources. In this session you will learn about different options for developing GraphRAG capabilities using Amazon Neptune that supply highly relevant connected data to agentic workflows, and how Deloitte used the AWS GraphRAG Toolkit to build a Security Intelligence Center that produces predictive security guidance based on timely organizational context.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Deep dive into private DNS with Route 53: From basics to scale
description: Explore private DNS management using Amazon Route 53. In this chalk talk, attendees will discover two key areas: Route 53 Profiles for streamlined DNS management at scale, and best practices for implementing inbound resolver endpoints through forwarding and delegation patterns. Through interactive discussion and real-world examples, participants will learn common architectural patterns and receive practical guidance for building reliable private DNS solutions. Whether managing private DNS for a single VPC or implementing enterprise-wide DNS architectures, attendees will gain valuable insights into Route 53 capabilities for private DNS management.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Deep Dive into the AWS Nitro System
description: The AWS Nitro System is a rich collection of building block technologies including hardware offload and security components built by AWS that are powering the recent and future generations of Amazon EC2 instances with an ever-broadening selection of compute, storage, memory, and networking options. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Nitro System, review its design and architecture, explore new innovations in the Nitro platform, and see how it has made the seemingly impossible possible.
tags: Architecture; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Deep dive on Amazon S3
description: Amazon S3 operates at massive scale, serving hundreds of millions of transactions per second across more than 100 data centers and tens of millions of drives. In this session, we'll explore how S3 achieves 99.99% availability and strong read-after-write consistency while gracefully handling constant failures at every level—from bits to buildings. Join us to learn about the architectural principles and engineering decisions that enable one of the world's largest storage systems to maintain data integrity and availability at scale.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Well-Architected Framework; Architecture; Storage; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Deep dive on AWS hybrid and edge networking architectures
description: Whether you're using AWS Outposts or AWS Local Zones to extend an AWS Region, networking is central—spanning connectivity back to the Region, Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) design, and resiliency across environments. This chalk talk covers patterns such as private vs. public connectivity, service link and on-premises connectivity, and designing resilient Multi-Availability Zone architecture across Outposts and Local Zones. We highlight how second-generation AWS Outposts advances networking with a dedicated networking rack that delivers enhanced scalability, high throughput, and accelerated networking for ultra-low latency workloads, including resilient intra- and inter-VPC communication.
tags: Edge Computing; Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Networking & Content Delivery; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Defend against downtime using fault isolation boundaries
description: Building an application to recover from common failure modes aligned to AWS fault isolation boundaries can help you meet your availability goals. In this chalk talk, we'll share how to use Application Recovery Controller (ARC) to recover your applications from impairments within an AWS Availability Zone and an AWS Region. You'll leave with an understanding of how ARC works, as well as key take-ways to incorporate into your architecture.
tags: Management & Governance; Resilience; Architecture; Cloud Operations; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Delighting Slack users safely and quickly with Amazon Nova and Bedrock
description: Serving millions of users daily while adhering to strict compliance and reliability requirements makes delivery of high-scale AI services even more challenging. In this session, you'll discover how Slack integrated generative AI features to help users find and read information faster, exploring the architectural decisions they made to meet increasing demands while continuing to develop rich functions that help users save time daily. Learn how model flexibility on Amazon Bedrock and the accelerated performance of Amazon Nova at a low cost helped Slack grow exponentially in two years while maintaining security and reliability.
speakers: Gene Ting; Austin Bell; Shaurya Kethireddy
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Deliver GenAI Mobile Apps and Models at scale: A Testing Architecture
description: How do you deliver GenAI features that work reliably on millions of real devices and deploy the models behind them? In this chalk talk, discover the techniques for benchmarking AI mobile apps on real iOS and Android devices, differences with emulators/simulators, and use of Generative AI driven test platforms to accelerate testing with an example from the Amazon Retail team. Learn how Qualcomm AI Hub does on‑device AI, optimizing, compiling, and testing models across CPU/GPU/NPU targets with physical device validation at scale using AWS Device Farm.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Democratize Data: Bundesliga Real-time Insights Without Writing any SQL
description: Building production-grade Text2SQL systems reveals challenges that demos never show. This interactive chalk talk shares hard-won lessons from implementing GenAI-powered data analytics at scale, using German football as our proving ground. Journey from prototype to production through critical architectural decisions: real-time data ingestion, domain-specific prompt engineering, latency optimization, and cost management. Learn practical approaches to accuracy evaluation and security guardrails that keep GenAI applications reliable and focused. Relevant to any industry, these battle-tested patterns will accelerate your data democratization initiatives.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Nova
tags: Agentic AI; Serverless; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Media & Entertainment; Sports; Interactive

title: Democratizing Whirlpool's Virtual Product Development with AWS
description: Discover how Whirlpool leverages AWS to democratize Virtual Product Development and speed up design decisions. By running cloud-based cost and performance simulations, Whirlpool generates training data to build explainable machine learning models with Amazon SageMaker, deployed through a modular front-end on AWS Elastic Beanstalk. These tools empower enterprise-wide stakeholders to quickly explore trade-offs and perform multi-objective optimizations using Genetic Algorithms. This session highlights the journey from siloed tools to a unified cloud ecosystem, enabling faster, smarter product architecture choices and driving measurable improvements in cost, performance, and time-to-market.
tags: Industry Solutions; Automotive; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Demystify attestation: Cryptographically verify execution environment
description: Highly sensitive workloads often rely on cryptographic proof about the code, config and other aspects of the execution environment before unsealing code, data to be processed. In this code talk we will see examples of cryptographic attestation using AWS Nitro Enclaves, NitroTPM and Amazon EC2 Instance Identification document. We will also visit common scenarios where this is useful in multi party computation setups for data analytics, Generative AI.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Demystifying Aurora DSQL transactions and concurrency control
description: Join this session to learn about Amazon Aurora DSQL's optimistic concurrency control (OCC). Explore building an application to understand the impact of OCC on your relational workloads, how it differs from traditional databases, and how to achieve the desired semantics in DSQL's OCC model.
tags: Resilience; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Demystifying the shared security model on Amazon ECS
description: This session explores the AWS shared responsibility model in the context of containerized workloads on Amazon ECS, with a focus on what security means for different customer personas. Whether you're a developer, DevOps engineer, or part of a security team, you'll gain clarity on the specific responsibilities you hold in securing your ECS workloads. Through practical guidance and persona-specific checklists, this session helps you identify and address key security considerations at every layer—from code and container configuration to infrastructure and runtime. Walk away with the knowledge and tools needed to build and operate secure, resilient containerized applications on AWS.
tags: Application Security; Network & Infrastructure Security; Containers; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; IT Administrator; Interactive

title: Deploy Agentic AI Application with Strands and MCP on Amazon EKS
description: Build an enterprise-grade financial analysis platform by integrating Strands Agents and MCP on Amazon EKS. Learn to deploy and configure MCP servers, set up Strands Agents, and integrate financial data within a containerized environment. Experience hands-on implementation of scalable AI applications combining natural language processing with advanced tool invocation capabilities.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Training & Certification; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploy Amazon EKS workloads with ArgoCD and GitOps
description: GitOps has become a buzzword in the Kubernetes world, promising a simpler way to manage clusters through Git-based workflows. But what is it actually like to get started? In this lightning talk, I’ll walk through my first attempt at deploying applications on Amazon EKS using ArgoCD. I’ll highlight what worked smoothly, where I stumbled, and the key insights I gained along the way. This isn’t a production war story - it’s a builder’s perspective on learning a new approach. If you’re curious about GitOps on AWS, this session will help you see both the potential and the pitfalls.
tags: Serverless & Containers; Lecture-style

title: Deploy and manage blockchain nodes on AWS
description: In this session, learn how to deploy self-managed blockchain nodes on AWS using Amazon EC2 and AWS Blockchain Node Runners, an open source initiative. We will whiteboard a sample solution and dive deep into each component of the solution covering instance type selection, choosing storage options based on requirements, blockchain node provisioning, snapshot management, and patching. Leave this session equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to deploy, scale, optimize for data transfer and availability, and upgrade blockchain nodes on AWS.
tags: Blockchain; Global Infrastructure; Cost Optimization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Interactive

title: Deploy and use an open source Digital Asset Management platform
description: Visual Asset Management System (VAMS) is a purpose-built, AWS native solution for the management and distribution of 3D assets for Spatial technologies. VAMS offers a simplified solution for organizations to ingest, store, and manage visual assets in the cloud, which empowers any user with a web browser to create and consume visual applications. By the end of this workshop you will learn: 1\How to install VAMS to your AWS Account. 2\How to create VAMS assets, pipelines, and workflows. 3\How to use VAMS assets in your end applications.
speakers: Peter Daukintis; Kimate Richards; Ignacio Sanchez; Jerry Tejada
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Storage; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploy artificial intelligence architectures in regulated industries [REPEAT]
description: Generative AI empowers leaders to re:imagine how technology is used to elevate mission outcomes. This chalk talk explores the best practices to deploy Amazon NOVA, Anthropic, Meta, and custom FM’s in regulated environments with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SagemakerAI(v2) in FedRAMP High or DoD SRG IL4/5 sovereign environments. The talk will explain how to use Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to prevent undesirable outcomes, review architectural best-practice patterns for experimentation, testing, and deploying FMs using in production environments, and an update on the AWS GovCloud (US) AI strategy based on common GenAI use cases that improve mission success while promoting cost efficiency.
tags: Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; IT Executive; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Deploy artificial intelligence architectures in regulated industries [REPEAT]
description: Generative AI empowers leaders to re:imagine how technology is used to elevate mission outcomes. This chalk talk explores the best practices to deploy Amazon NOVA, Anthropic, Meta, and custom FM’s in regulated environments with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SagemakerAI(v2) in FedRAMP High or DoD SRG IL4/5 sovereign environments. The talk will explain how to use Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to prevent undesirable outcomes, review architectural best-practice patterns for experimentation, testing, and deploying FMs using in production environments, and an update on the AWS GovCloud (US) AI strategy based on common GenAI use cases that improve mission success while promoting cost efficiency.
tags: Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; IT Executive; Government; Interactive

title: Deploy infrastructure with speed and safety using AWS CloudFormation
description: In this hands-on workshop workshop, learn how to develop and deploy AWS CloudFormation templates using the latest validation and troubleshooting tools. Discover how to catch errors early with the new CloudFormation capabilities in the AWS IDE plugin, enforce best practices with CloudFormation Guard, and leverage new features in change sets for pre-deployment validation. Master troubleshooting techniques using the AWS Console's failure detection capabilities, timeline views, and root cause analysis. You'll also explore how AI assistance can accelerate template development, explain complex configurations, and guide you through common challenges. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: DevOps; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploy multi-agent AI on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Agentic AI is revolutionizing businesses by enabling autonomous reasoning and decision making to accomplish complex tasks. To deploy these agentic AI workloads, organizations need a foundation that is scalable, cost-efficient, and portable. In this builders session, discover how to deploy scalable multi-agent AI systems on Amazon EKS. You will learn how to configure multi-agent communication using the A2A (Agent2Agent) protocol. By the end, you’ll have practical experience running multi-agent AI applications on Amazon EKS.
speakers: Edgar Costa Filho; Saketh Gaddam; Zachary Jacobson; Carlos Santana; Ramesh Kumar Venkatraman
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploy multi-agent AI on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Agentic AI is revolutionizing businesses by enabling autonomous reasoning and decision making to accomplish complex tasks. To deploy these agentic AI workloads, organizations need a foundation that is scalable, cost-efficient, and portable. In this builders session, discover how to deploy scalable multi-agent AI systems on Amazon EKS. You will learn how to configure multi-agent communication using the A2A (Agent2Agent) protocol. By the end, you’ll have practical experience running multi-agent AI applications on Amazon EKS.
speakers: Edgar Costa Filho; Saketh Gaddam; Zachary Jacobson; Carlos Santana; Ramesh Kumar Venkatraman
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploying for resilience: HA/DR strategies for AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones
description: Critical workloads at the edge demand robust high-availability and disaster recovery strategies. In this chalk talk, learn how to plan and implement resilient deployments using AWS hybrid cloud and edge computing services. We'll examine how to architect edge infrastructure using AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts, covering key aspects of networking, compute, and storage redundancy. Through real customer examples and reference architectures, we'll explore deployment patterns and best practices for maintaining business continuity across failure modes. Join us to learn practical strategies for achieving your RPO/RTO objectives with edge deployments.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Edge Computing; Resilience; Architecture; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Deploying Intelligent Agent Systems with MCP [REPEAT]
description: This session guides participants through a hands-on workshop on how to build, deploy, and integrate AI Agents to effectively communicate with one another to solve business problems that partners encounter in their day-to-day lives. Participants will learn how to deploy intelligent agent systems using the Generative AI Application Builder on AWS, which leverages the Strands Agents SDK and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. The session will also address some of the challenges in running AI Agents in production along with exploring methodologies for improving interoperability using standardized protocols such as MCP.
speakers: Shashi Raina; Ken Spokas; Reet Takkar; Qiong (Jo) Zhang; Kamyar Ziabari
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Nova; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploying Intelligent Agent Systems with MCP [REPEAT]
description: This session guides  participants through a hands-on workshop on how to build, deploy, and  integrate AI Agents to effectively communicate with one another to solve  a number of business problems across a vast set of domains. Participants  will learn how to deploy intelligent agent systems using the Generative  AI Application Builder on AWS, which leverages the Strands Agents SDK and  Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. The session will also address some of the  challenges in running AI Agents in production along with exploring  methodologies for improving interoperability using standardized protocols  such as MCP and A2A.
speakers: Shashi Raina; Ken Spokas; Reet Takkar; Qiong (Jo) Zhang; Kamyar Ziabari
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Nova; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Deploying LLMs at scale with vLLM on AWS AI chips
description: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll collaboratively explore how to optimize LLM serving using vLLM on AWS Trainium and Inferentia chips. Through whiteboarding and hands-on discussion, we'll architect efficient deployment patterns, tackle common performance bottlenecks, and design scalable serving configurations. We'll work through real-world scenarios, examining code examples and configuration best practices. Bring your questions and challenges - we'll solve them together while building a deep understanding of vLLM's capabilities on AWS AI chips.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Derisk your mainframe exit through mainframe refactoring with agentic AI
description: Discover how industry leaders Fiserv and BMW modernized mission-critical mainframe applications using AWS Transform's agentic AI capabilities. Learn how Fiserv implemented a mainframe modernization factory that reduced modernization time while improving code quality and maintainability of refactored applications. Through BMW's transformation journey, explore how critical systems were migrated to a new technology stack within months, achieving unprecedented speed and efficiency. This session explores AWS Transform's AI-powered capabilities—from code analysis to intelligent refactoring—and their game-changing results. Get practical insights for large-scale refactoring from organizations that have successfully modernized millions of lines of mission-critical code across diverse industries.
speakers: Meena Vembusubramanian; Vimal Brahmbhatt; Frank Uslaub
tags: Automation; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Design a multi-expert system for fraud investigation with AI agents
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to design a multi-expert AI system for fraud investigations. Discover the essential building blocks of an AI agent network using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon ECS. Together, we'll explore how specialized AI agents handle different investigation aspects, from merchant risk analysis to public search. We'll sketch out the orchestration patterns between custom and open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, design agent communication flows, and address critical considerations like security, scalability, and cost optimization. You'll gain practical insights into implementing generative AI solutions that can transform your fraud investigation workflows.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Lambda
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Design and deploy custom guardrails for AI applications
description: Implementing guardrails for large language models (LLMs) requires balancing performance with responsible AI practices. This interactive chalk talk explores approaches for designing safety filters and use case-specific controls while optimizing for accuracy, latency, and cost. Through a real-world AI use case example, learn how to architect guardrails that align with your quality requirements and discover patterns for dynamic implementation in your generative AI platform. Walk away with practical strategies for integrating these controls into your existing AI workflows and evaluation methods for measuring their effectiveness.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Design and Implement Agentic AI Observability with OpenSearch [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build next-generation observability that goes beyond traditional search and analytics. In this session we will discuss how organizations can reduce operational costs by modernizing their observability stack using OpenTelemetry, OpenSearch, S3, and CloudWatch. By combining OpenSearch real-time analytics with AI-powered insights using Amazon Q, we will walk through an architecture and best practices to build such a solution for your enterprise.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon OpenSearch Service; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Design and Implement Agentic AI Observability with OpenSearch [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk covers how Amazon OpenSearch Service enables intelligent, autonomous observability. Developers and architects will learn to implement autonomous monitoring workflows that combine real-time analytics with Amazon Q and Amazon Bedrock to create self-learning systems. Explore building sophisticated observability patterns using OpenSearch for automated root cause analysis, intelligent alert correlation, and predictive insights. We'll demonstrate practical implementations including standardized data collection with OpenTelemetry, zero-ETL integration with Amazon S3, Amazon CloudWatch, and autonomous monitoring workflows. Learn to configure agentic AI frameworks for natural language exploration, automated insight generation, and intelligent alert routing across hybrid environments. You'll learn to transform traditional monitoring into automated, AI-powered observability.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon OpenSearch Service; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Design authentication, authorization, and logging logic in Agentic AI apps
description: This hands-on workshop addresses the critical challenge of managing identities and permissions for generative AI agents. Learn to implement user and machine authentication, along with fine-grained authorization mechanisms, tailored for AI agents, tools, and LLMs. Explore consent management and permission delegation in AI contexts. Participants will gain practical experience using AWS's latest services, including Strands SDK, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity, Amazon Cognito for identity management, and Amazon Verified Permissions for authorization decisions. By the end, you'll have the skills to enhance security and compliance in your AI operations using AWS's cutting-edge identity and access management solutions.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Cognito; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Design effective Amazon CloudWatch dashboards and alarms
description: Learn how to build actionable dashboards that simplify operational complexity. This session will use demos to explore capabilities in Amazon CloudWatch dashboards and alarms, to help you design appropriate visibility and actions for your workloads. This session will start with how we decide what to observe, from SLOs, to customer experience, to infrastructure perspective. We will look at using Amazon CloudWatch to reduce noise, cognitive load during incidents and helping teams quickly identify what matters for your workloads. This is an interactive session, so bring your questions about your own dashboards and alarms to share.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: Design multi-modal customer journeys with Amazon Connect
description: Learn how to build advanced customer experiences in Amazon Connect that seamlessly integrate voice, digital, and IoT interactions. Discover practical techniques for processing IoT signals as contact triggers, implementing device-aware routing, and designing context-rich agent interfaces. Through real-world examples, you'll learn patterns for extending Connect's capabilities into the IoT ecosystem to create next-generation customer service solutions.
tags: SaaS; Internet of Things; Business Applications; Interactive

title: Design multi-region resilience strategies on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Join this session to learn how to design highly available, resilient Amazon EKS deployments that span multiple AWS regions. This chalktalk explores architectural patterns for robust multi-region Amazon EKS workloads, including network connectivity models, cross-region replication strategies, and automated failover mechanisms. We'll demonstrate how to leverage GitOps, AWS Global Accelerator, Route 53, and EKS features to create seamless global application experiences while maintaining regional isolation for compliance and fault tolerance.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Route 53; AWS Global Accelerator
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Kubernetes; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Design multi-region resilience strategies on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Join this session to learn how to design highly available, resilient Amazon EKS deployments that span multiple AWS regions. This chalktalk explores architectural patterns for robust multi-region Amazon EKS workloads, including network connectivity models, cross-region replication strategies, and automated failover mechanisms. We'll demonstrate how to leverage GitOps, AWS Global Accelerator, Route 53, and EKS features to create seamless global application experiences while maintaining regional isolation for compliance and fault tolerance.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Route 53; AWS Global Accelerator
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Kubernetes; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Designing local Generative AI inference with AWS IoT Greengrass
description: While running inference in the cloud is a common and effective approach for Generative AI, some use cases demand local execution. This session explores how to design and operate local inference architectures using AWS IoT Greengrass. Through a live demo using a robotic arm, attendees compare cloud-based and local inference in practice, examining trade-offs in latency, connectivity, and model update frequency. The talk also presents a practical approach for delivering and updating models at the edge to support the reliable, ongoing use of Generative AI in real-world environments.
tags: Edge Computing; Generative AI; Internet of Things; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Designing mission critical applications with serverless services
description: In this session, learn how to design mission-critical systems that process millions of transactions daily, on serverless services. Beginning with a legacy system, we'll decompose a monolith and discuss key serverless patterns to help accelerate modernization efforts. This session highlights a transformational journey and the adoption of services like AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS), and Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS), enabling scalable and resilient processing.
speakers: Sara Gerion; Luca Mezzalira; Zeeshan Pervaiz
tags: Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; Lecture-style

title: Designing resilient Serverless Applications
description: Reliability is critical in serverless applications, and resilience requires thoughtful architecture. In this session, discover how to design for resilience at every layer of your application. We'll walk through practical strategies for improving reliability within a single region using synchronous, asynchronous, and polling patterns. Explore disaster recovery techniques to keep your applications running—even during major outages.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Designing web architectures on AWS at scale
description: What do you do when your monolith becomes unmaintainable? How do you handle authentication across dozens of micro-frontends? These aren't just theoretical questions but daily challenges web developers and architects face. Join us for an interactive session where we'll whiteboard real solutions to real problems. We'll break down complex architectures into understandable patterns, explore caching strategies that actually work, and share stories of both successes and failures from global AWS implementations.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Serverless; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Detect and mitigating hallucinations: A hands-on responsible AI workshop
description: Organizations deploying foundation model (FM)-powered applications face challenges in reducing hallucinations and reasoning errors. When FMs encounter ambiguous queries or multi-step instructions, they may guess, extrapolate, or conflate information, leading to unreliable outputs. This session presents a comprehensive hallucination and model reasoning toolbox to mitigate unreliable or inaccurate outputs. Learn how to build architectures that combine detection methods, use built-in safeguards from Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, develop custom guardrails, evaluate the effectiveness of the techniques, and integrate with broader AI systems including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and agentic AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Detecting falls in aged care with a minimum lovable product
description: Defining a Minimum Lovable Product (MLP) is challenging, especially when priorities are constantly being shifted during the product-market fit stage of a startup. Understanding end-user personas is critical to this process. This session explores the key decisions made while building an early-stage startup that provides fall detection and notifications for people primarily in the aged care sector. the session'll cover MVP vs MLP, the solution architecture, do you need batch or real time querying? Challenges around implementing real-time alerting, data partitioning approaches, and other tradeoffs involved in capturing and analyzing data from IoT sensors installed in the home or aged.

Learn how to apply these insights to your own team to go beyond lines of code and bring a more strategic level of thinking to your improvements to developer experience.

description: Join Amazon.com CTO Dr. Werner Vogels for the definitive developer keynote of 2025. Software developers and architects will discover how their tools, patterns, and practices are evolving in an AI-driven world that demands scalable, reliable, and price-performant solutions. Drawing from AWS's pioneering work, they'll share real-world insights and architectural principles that are shaping modern development. Learn how AI innovations are transforming software development and operations within AWS, and how you can embrace these advances to build better solutions.

description: In this chalk talk, learn how to approach tooling selection, taxonomy, and account structure to support your business's cost allocation goals. We'll cover chargebacks, showbacks, how to control cost visibility, and best practices that support automation. Join us to discuss how to approach tool selection for different use cases and discover resources you can use to streamline your cost allocation!

description: This session presents a comprehensive approach to deploying small language models (SLMs) to AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon EKS. We’ll demonstrate how to deliver domain-specific, fine-tuned SLMs from AWS Regions to edge locations for low-latency inference. You’ll learn how to build edge-optimized delivery pipelines, automate containerized model distribution, and manage model lifecycles across hybrid infrastructure using orchestration platforms. You will gain practical understanding of building robust AI deployment architectures that leverage both cloud scalability and edge proximity. You will walk away with insights into the architectural decisions needed for edge AI initiatives and implementation best practices for production-grade SLM deployments.

description: Experience the future of live sports broadcasting in this hands-on workshop. Learn to orchestrate multi-camera productions in the cloud using AWS Media Services and AI-assisted tools. Practice implementing DevOps principles in broadcast workflows while building a complete live production system. You'll work with real-world scenarios to create, automate, and optimize live content delivery, gaining practical skills applicable across broadcasting, sports, and digital media industries.

title: Digital sovereignty and data residency with AWS Hybrid and Edge services
description: Countries around the world are increasingly introducing or updating data residency and digital sovereignty laws that require at least one copy, or sometimes all data, to be stored or processed in a specific geographic or sovereign location that introduces new challenges for customers. This session explores how AWS services, including AWS Dedicated Local Zones, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts can help you with your digital sovereignty use cases. We’ll examine best practices for data residency, security controls, and operational consistency across deployments at the edge.
speakers: Mallory Gershenfeld; Ben Lavasani; Majd Aldeen Masriah
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Edge Computing; Global Infrastructure; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

This session showcases real-world success stories demonstrating the strategic use of the right accelerators—tools, services, solutions, training, investment or guidance—at precisely the right moments in their transformation journey to unlock business value and achieve operational excellence.
speakers: Jonathan Kong; Oscar Rodriguez; Ashish Shekhar
tags: Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Disagree in Commits: The Performance Improvements That Cut Costs by a Third
description: When paths diverge in open source, innovation often follows. Join Corey Quinn and Madelyn Olson as they dive into how Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey cut prices by up to 33% while simultaneously improving both performance and reliability through community-driven development. You'll discover how open governance enables optimization decisions that benefit all users, why performance improvements and stability aren't mutually exclusive, and what it really takes to create a seamless migration path at scale. Whether you're currently running Redis, evaluating alternatives, or simply interested in how open-source economics can benefit cloud customers, you'll leave with practical insights on reducing infrastructure costs without compromising on reliability.
tags: Open Source; Lecture-style

title: Disaster Recovery (DR) with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery Service
description: Scaling your disaster recovery (DR) strategy when you're working with environments that contain databases, directory services, and ERP solutions isn't easy.  In this session, we'll go over best practices for scaling your testing and application recovery capabilities, and show you how to get more out of your DR environments with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.
tags: Cloud Operations; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Distributed inference on AWS: Deep dive into inference optimizations
description: As Large Language Models (LLMs) become integral to applications, optimizing inference performance is paramount, especially at scale. This session delves into cutting-edge techniques, research and frameworks that enhance LLM serving efficiency, focusing on KV-cache management, PagedAttention mechanisms, and disaggregated serving architectures. We will cover best practices for self-managed inference on AWS: use cases with architecture diagrams, deep dive into how ML inference works on accelerated compute, and common patterns of optimizations in the field. Attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of the current landscape and future directions in inference optimization, with the knowledge to implement these advancements in distributed systems.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Distributed training at scale with Slurm on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod
description: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod offers advanced training tools to accelerate scalable, reliable, and secure AI model development. In this hands-on session, learn how to orchestrate distributed training using a Slurm-based cluster. Experience how Slurm integrates with parallel file systems (Amazon FSx for Lustre), NVIDIA GPUs/AWS Trainium, Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA), and diverse ML frameworks to train a LLM on representative datasets. Learn to leverage SageMaker HyperPod flexible training plans to reserve compute capacity in advance, providing cost efficiency and capacity assurance. Lastly, discover how to utilize the latest model training tools to troubleshoot convergence issues and optimize model performance.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: This session provides a deep dive into Amazon DynamoDB and shares insights into how DynamoDB is architected and how it’s able to deliver the scalability and response times that customers have come to expect. DynamoDB is used by over one million AWS customers, and powers hundreds of applications that exceed half a million requests per second. In this talk we explore the architecture of DynamoDB, and of several specific features. You will understand how we architected DynamoDB to deliver predictable low latency at any scale, and how best to develop your own applications to delight your customers.

title: Documents to decisions: AI-powered underwriting with Amazon Bedrock
description: In this session, participants will learn to build an agentic generative AI underwriting workflow on AWS that automates the evaluation of underwriting risk—turning life insurance submissions into explainable risk assessments and recommended actions using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, and the Strands Agents SDK. Explore how agents coordinate retrieval, apply underwriting guidelines, and explain their reasoning end-to-end—producing transparent risk scores and suggested next actions. By the end of this session, you’ll have a working prototype and repository that turns raw submissions into auditable risk assessments with patterns you can reuse for production.

services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Lambda; Amazon Nova
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Domain driven microservices design with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q
description: Defining the right service boundaries is a persistent challenge in microservice architecture. This session demonstrates how Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q can assist in domain-driven design by analyzing existing codebases to uncover natural domain boundaries. The chalk talk will include a live implementation showcasing how these tools detect domain relationships, propose service splits, and apply suitable design patterns to ensure business logic integrity. Attendees will gain a practical, AI-powered approach to architecting well-aligned microservices using Amazon Q and Bedrock to drive scalable, maintainable designs.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Downtime prevention with the Resilience Lifecycle Framework
description: With most system failures stemming from human error, code deployment issues, and misconfigured systems, it's important to have a framework in place to proactively mitigate risks, practice resilience plans, and prevent the repeat of operational incidents. In this chalk talk you'll learn how to apply the AWS Resilience Lifecycle Framework, a holistic approach based on years of working with customers and internal teams, that captures resilience best practices. You'll leave with practical strategies for setting objectives, designing for resilience, resilience testing, conducting operational readiness reviews, and incident analysis reporting to strengthen the resilience posture of your critical workloads.
tags: Resilience; Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: DraftKings: Scaling to 1M operations/min on Aurora during Super Bowl
description: Discover how DraftKings leverages Amazon Aurora to handle massive transaction volumes during major sporting events for high-stakes sports betting. Join DraftKings to explore the architectural decisions and technical innovations that enable processing of one million financial operations per minute with sub-millisecond latency during peak events like the Super Bowl. Learn how using Aurora, DraftKings can seamlessly scale its financial ledger system, ensure data consistency, and deliver uninterrupted service during moments when millions of users place simultaneous bets.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Databases; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Games; Lecture-style

title: DraftKings: Turning Compliance into Competitive Advantage with AWS Local Zones
description: Most companies view regulation as a roadblock to innovation, but DraftKings sees it as a catalyst for growth. In this session, we will share how the company built a scalable edge strategy using AWS Local Zones to meet Federal Wire Act requirements while accelerating expansion into 26 U.S. states. What previously took weeks now takes just days, saving millions in infrastructure costs while delivering industry-leading uptime, agility, and resilience. Learn how DraftKings transformed regulatory compliance into a competitive advantage, offering valuable lessons for Financial Services, Healthcare, and other regulated industries.
tags: Edge Computing; Global Infrastructure; Containers; Compute; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Games; Media & Entertainment; Sports; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

This session showcases how CloudWatch will help you understand your application and infrastructure as well as your business and customer experience.  Attendees will explore strategies for implementing observability in modern architectures and learn how to leverage new and existing AWS observability features to detect issues faster and reduce mean time to resolution while maintaining reliability at scale. Participants will also learn how to use these tools to accelerate deployments and break down silos between teams.

description: As supply chains grow increasingly complex, companies are using the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and internet of things (IoT) to gain better, faster insights and reduce costs. Hear how Sysco, the global leader in foodservice distribution, executed a strategic cloud migration to enhance scalability, improve warehouse efficiency, and develop a foundation to accelerate AI use cases. You will also learn how McDonald's, one of the world’s largest restaurant chains, built innovative AI-powered solutions to improve supply chain traceability and automate inventory tracking.

tags: Generative AI; Customer Enablement; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Travel & Hospitality; Enterprise; Lecture-style

description: Agentic AI is essential for autonomous decision-making in industrial operations. These systems require complete and reliable data from both internal operations and external supply chain processes to function effectively. In this Chalk Talk, learn about the fundamentals and applications of agentic systems in manufacturing operations and see how AWS helps with efficient data access along the value chain to improve the quality of autonomous processes. Learn how data spaces, EDI, and native AWS services such as Amazon SageMaker provide established means for governed, cross-company data sharing at scale.

description: In this session, learn how to implement comprehensive zero-trust security architectures for Amazon DynamoDB applications. Explore advanced IAM policy design, attribute-based access control, and integration with enterprise identity systems. Deep dive into fine-grained permissions, dynamic policy evaluation, and automated compliance monitoring. Also, discover real-world patterns for multi-tenant applications, data isolation strategies, and audit logging. This session is essential for enterprises implementing zero-trust security models requiring granular access control, continuous verification, and comprehensive security monitoring while maintaining application performance and developer productivity.

description: In this workshop, gain hands-on experience porting a .NET Framework application to cross-platform .NET. Use AWS Transform for .NET, a modernization service powered by agentic AI that significantly reduces the time to migrate applications from Windows Server to Linux. Learn how migrating to Linux helps you avoid additional licensing fees and gain performance and security benefits.

description: Dive deep into advanced EC2 Fleet configurations in this technical session. We'll examine complex architectural patterns using instance weighting for optimal compute capacity distribution, implementation of hybrid capacity models combining On-Demand and Spot instances, and sophisticated capacity reservation strategies. Through code-heavy demonstrations, we'll explore programmatic fleet management, custom weighting algorithms, capacity block integration for GPU workloads, and advanced monitoring solutions. You'll walk away knowing how to implement complex capacity management patterns and architect enterprise-scale solutions using EC2 Fleet's advanced APIs and configuration options.

title: Efficient AI model customization for agentic workflows
description: Join us to learn a practical and cost-effective way to customize AI models using spectrum-aware fine-tuning and fully managed training experience provided by Amazon SageMaker training jobs. We'll demonstrate how this method precisely updates only the most important parts of an AI model, making the process faster and more affordable than traditional approaches. Through real-world examples, we'll show how to train language models for high-accuracy task completion and decision-making in agentic workflows. This session will provide you with hands-on knowledge to make your AI training more efficient, helping you save both time and money while building more capable AI agents.

description: Join this interactive chalk talk and deep dive into Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) best practices focused on optimizing application performance. Explore strategic decisions for choosing between Application Load Balancer (ALB) and Network Load Balancer (NLB) implementations, while exploring cost optimization strategies and performance-tuning techniques. In this session, discover how to architect resilient load balancing solutions that scale effortlessly, optimize traffic distribution across Availability Zones (AZs), and leverage advanced routing features. Through real-world case studies of high-traffic systems and emerging microservices deployment patterns, participants will explore how recent ELB innovations are transforming cloud architectures. Bring your challenges – let's solve them together.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Elevate application and generative AI observability
description: This session demonstrates how to leverage Amazon CloudWatch's comprehensive observability capabilities for both traditional applications and generative AI workloads. Customers building generative AI-powered workloads face challenges in understanding end-user outcomes, AI performance, health, accuracy, and quality issues at scale. Whether you're dealing with high latency, excessive token consumption, or unexpected errors, Amazon CloudWatch's pre-built dashboards provide comprehensive monitoring capabilities and insights into end-user outcomes, AI performance, health, and accuracy. Learn how observability can help bring reliability across your entire application stack.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Elevate Multi-Tenant SaaS Operations: DevOps Strategy with Kubernetes [REPEAT]
description: Is your SaaS platform ready to scale from hundreds to thousands of customers while maintaining operational efficiency? Join this hands-on builders session to create a production-grade DevOps strategy using Kubernetes, addressing the challenges of managing multiple environments while onboarding tenants across different tiers. Working directly with an AWS expert, you'll implement automated tenant management and progressive release strategies using tools like Argo Workflows, Flux, and Helm. Using the next generation of Amazon SageMaker, their petabyte-scale solution enables users to discover and access data in a cloud-native marketplace then build  in a unified data and AI development environment. In this session, learn how Covered California uses AWS to power identity verification with AI/ML, automate call center operations with agentic technologies, and build data pipelines that pinpoint citizens and residents most at risk of losing healthcare coverage. Attendees will walk away with a blueprint for using Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, Databricks on AWS, Amazon Connect, and AI/ML services to turn complex, regulated datasets into actionable insights. The session highlights architectures, automation approaches, and lessons learned to help government leaders unlock data as the enabler of secure, citizen-focused innovation.

Watch a live demonstration of an end-to-end aerodynamic simulation workflow using AWS Research and Engineering Studio. See how Windows-based design tools connect seamlessly with Linux HPC resources through AWS Parallel Computing Service, all sharing data via FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Experience how this integrated environment accelerates automotive design cycles by eliminating platform barriers and infrastructure complexity. Learn how to implement similar workflows for your engineering teams.

description: Dive into the journey of a foundation model on AWS Trainium, from distributed training to fine-tuning and deployment. This talk showcases how to optimize each of these stages using Neuron SDK. We'll demonstrate the use of the Neuron Profiler to pinpoint bottlenecks and guide you through writing and integrating Neuron Kernel Interface (NKI) kernels to achieve peak performance. Explore real-world examples of how organizations are leveraging these techniques to accelerate their AI workloads and reduce costs.

EHO enables delivery of innovative seismic processing and state-of-the-art HPC algorithms while focusing on interoperability, scalability, and cost efficiency. The platform provides pre-optimized cloud native HPC templates and fosters a competitive environment that drives innovation. Through this ecosystem, partners can concentrate on developing their unique technologies while leveraging optimized infrastructure and workflows.

You will also get to engage with fellow builders on how they are approaching reliability issues in their agentic AI implementations.

title: Enterprise CI/CD: Advanced patterns for resilient deployments
description: Large-scale enterprise deployment scenarios face increasing complexity when operating across multiple regions and environments, challenging teams to maintain reliability while accelerating delivery. Advanced architectural patterns solve these challenges by combining progressive delivery strategies with sophisticated traffic management, enabling safe deployments through automated canary analysis and blue-green techniques. Self-healing mechanisms and event-driven orchestration ensure reliable operations, while intelligent build triggering and automated failure analysis help teams manage complex monorepo environments efficiently. These patterns establish a foundation for scalable, secure, and maintainable enterprise CI/CD pipelines.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Automation; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

description: This breakout session dives into licensing commercial software on AWS, with a focus on Microsoft workloads. Join our Microsoft Optimization and Licensing Assessment (OLA) specialists to explore the best practices for navigating licensing complexities in the cloud while maximizing cost-efficiency. Learn about fully-funded OLA offerings for on-premises workloads, cloud to AWS migrations, existing EC2 deployments, and the new self-serve AWS Transform Assessments. Discover how these assessments provide valuable insights and right-sizing recommendations across multiple services such as Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).

title: Enterprise-scale ETL optimization for Apache Spark
description: Apache Spark  on AWS Glue, Amazon EMR, and Amazon SageMaker  enhances the optimization of large-scale data processing workloads. These include faster read and write throughput, accelerated processing of common file formats, and expanded Amazon S3 support through the S3A protocol for greater flexibility in write operations. In this session, we'll explore recent enhancements in Spark for distributed computation and in-memory storage to enable efficient data aggregation and job optimization. We'll also demonstrate how these innovations, combined with Spark's native capabilities, strengthen governance and encryption to help you optimize performance while maintaining control and compliance. Join us to learn how to build unified, secure, and high-performance ETL pipelines on AWS using Spark.
services: Amazon EMR; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Glue

Second, witness Ericsson's solution to knowledge de-fragmentation in complex telecom development. Using AWS services, including custom SageMaker models and Amazon Q Developer, Ericsson created an AI-native environment that breaks down information silos and accelerates innovation. Learn how Ericsson harnesses Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, and Q Developer for future innovation in Agentic AI.

In this chalk talk, discover the essential things you need to know to ensure a smooth and successful migration from Oracle to Aurora PostgreSQL and the optimal architectures to enable such a migration. description: Roll up your sleeves for this interactive session where we'll whiteboard Amazon's frameworks for evaluating complex AI agents in production. Through collaborative discussion and real-world examples from our shopping, seller support, and advertising agents, we'll break down how to measure AI performance beyond traditional metrics. We'll sketch out approaches for assessing language model reasoning, tool usage, and memory management. Bring your questions as we dive deep into practical evaluation methods and share lessons learned from implementing human-in-the-loop processes. This technical session includes hands-on architecture discussions and group problem-solving.

title: Evaluating and testing multi-tenant agents [REPEAT]
description: Agents are meant to be autonomous and intelligent. Ensuring that this intelligence is operating as expected, requires all new approach to evaluating and testing our agentic systems. This gets even more complicated as we look at multi-tenant agents where the intelligence and capabilities of our agents may vary from tenant-to-tenant. In this chalk talk, we’ll dig into the nuances of evaluating and testing agents that have built-in tenant awareness, focusing on the specific strategies and approaches that will be used to exercise and profile the behavior of your agents. The goal here is to introduce the automation and mechanisms that will be used to assess the accuracy, outcomes, and impact being driven by agents that are running in a multi-tenant model.

title: Expedite model loading times in Kubernetes using kro & ACK
description: LLM models cause significant inference latency on EKS/GPUs due to slow loading. The Storage>Network>CPU>PCIe>GPU data path bottlenecks loading latency. In this session learn how different AWS storage solutions enable direct, optimized model loading to GPU memory. We compare Amazon S3 (object), Amazon EFS (shared), and Amazon FSx for Lustre (high-performance for local GPU disk caching) in expediting data delivery. Using Kubernetes Resource Orchestrator (kro) and AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK) simplifies resource provisioning and it streamlines managing these optimized storage solutions . Learn to diagnose bottlenecks, select optimal storage, and implement advanced strategies for rapid LLM inference on Amazon EKS.
tags: Generative AI; Kubernetes; Cloud Operations; Open Source; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

With PostgreSQL becoming a critical  database to modern enterprise data and AI workflows, learn to implement these features for real-world scenarios like banking, and analytics applications. title: Exploring hybrid quantum-classical computing with Amazon Braket
description: Hybrid algorithms, combining quantum and classical compute resources, are widely believed to be promising candidates for the first demonstrations of useful applications of quantum computers. Linear systems of equations, which play an important role in science and technology, are one such area where hybrid algorithms have been explored. In this workshop, learn how to use Amazon Braket Hybrid Jobs to implement the Variational Quantum Linear Solver algorithm to solve linear systems of equations on real quantum computers. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Dive into advanced techniques for cost allocation and observability across AWS containerized workloads. Learn how to leverage the power of AWS Split Cost Allocation Data feature for Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS. We'll guide you through best practices for tagging, labeling, and analyzing spend to enhance cost visibility and accountability across your container environments. You'll also get hands-on experience with Amazon Managed Grafana, creating dynamic dashboards to visualize and monitor your containerized workloads in real-time.

Discover practical strategies for implementing consistent security policies, cost management, and compliance controls. description: Large language models (LLMs) demonstrate exceptional performance across many general-purpose applications due to their extensive pretraining on a wide variety of datasets. While these models often offer strong baseline performance without additional specialized training, organizations frequently enhance model efficacy through fine-tuning on targeted task-specific or domain-specific datasets. This builders session provides comprehensive instruction on leveraging Amazon SageMaker's capabilities to fine-tune pretrained Hugging Face LLMs utilizing AWS Trainium and the Optimum Neuron library. Participants will gain practical expertise in both the fine-tuning process and subsequent deployment of optimized models for inference workloads.

This session explores fine-tuning, knowledge distillation, and preference alignment techniques to reduce latency and costs while maintaining performance. Cosine AI will dive into how they leverage multi-agent reasoning to power their AI coding agent and scales customized agents effectively. Learn how AWS-based multi-agent systems can continuously improve fine-tuned LLMs with minimal human intervention, enabling robust coordination between specialized agents for real-world applications.

Attendees of this session will learn how FIS built a cloud-native money-movement solution using services including Amazon EKS, Amazon Aurora, Amazon MSK, and Amazon CloudWatch to enable real-time interbank payments through a common unified API. title: From EC2 to EKS: Tipalti’s transformation to Windows containers on AWS
description: Is your Windows applications constrained by scaling limitations and complex operations? Discover how Tipalti transformed their traditional Windows application into a modern, containerized solution. Learn how to overcome process management challenges, implement auto-scaling, and achieve up to a 50% performance improvement. We'll walk through the implementation of Windows containers, logging solutions, and operational enhancements. Through Tipalti's transformation experience, key technical decisions, and lessons learned, you'll gain practical knowledge for modernizing your Windows applications.

title: From fragmented to unified platform: Rocket Companies data and AI journey
description: Enterprises seek to unify data access across the organization, safeguard sensitive client information, and scale MLOps efficiently. Learn how Rocket Companies addressed these challenges by building a unified data and AI platform on AWS. Discover how Rocket leveraged Amazon SageMaker for machine learning workflows, integrated with custom Amazon EKS applications and CI/CD pipelines, and implemented MLflow for model governance. See how Amazon DataZone can support secure enterprise-wide metadata management. Join this session to explore architectural patterns for data democratization, combined with MLOps excellence, showcasing practical solutions that streamline data and machine learning workflows while maintaining security controls.
speakers: Sajjan AVS; Ilia Fischer; Garima Sharma
services: Amazon DataZone; Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon SageMaker

This advanced session explores building modular pipelines that handle speech-to-text processing, content analysis, intelligent summarization, and audio synthesis. The discussion demonstrates how to combine Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Nova models, and Amazon Polly to build powerful AI tools that address real-world challenges in maintaining contextual integrity while preserving the essential meaning of the original content.
services: Amazon Polly; Amazon Transcribe; Amazon Nova
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Interactive

We review real world applications and best practices for agent integration, focusing on security, scalability, and implementation strategies. You'll gain insights into how you can find and leverage ready-to-use third-party tools and agents to accelerate and streamline your AI initiatives.
tags: Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: From ideas to impact: Architecting with cloud best practices
description: 2025 marks the 10-year anniversary of the AWS Well-Architected Framework, Cloud Adoption Framework, and AWS Cloud Operating Model. Learn how these foundational frameworks evolved through customer feedback and real-world learnings from thousands of organizations. What began as structured guidance has matured into dynamic insights for optimizing cloud environments. Discover how this continuous feedback drives innovation across architecture reviews, operations, and remediation. Learn practical strategies for applying these unified best practices to accelerate cloud transformation.

title: From KPIs to action: close the business objectives loop with AI agents
description: What if you could turn your KPIs from something you track in the rear-view mirror into targets your supply chain management systems automatically drive your business toward? Join this session to learn how AI agents make this possible. We’ll show you how to use agentic technology to automate the process of detecting deviations from plan and immediately figuring out why they are happening and what to do about it.
