title: From Lab to Market - AstraZeneca's Enterprise-Wide AI Success Story
description: AstraZeneca is on a mission to deliver 20 life-changing medicines by 2030, and is leveraging agentic AI technology to make it happen. The company has implemented AI solutions throughout their organization, revolutionizing their data management and analysis capabilities. Through their innovative approach of using modular, multi-agent AI systems, AstraZeneca has deployed multiple AI tools into production across multiple business units. During this presentation, we'll dive into how the company is implementing AI solutions in both their clinical development and commercial divisions to achieve tangible outcomes. Additionally, we'll explore how AstraZeneca is utilizing AWS technologies to create a scalable infrastructure that can readily incorporate future technological advancements.
tags: Business Intelligence; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: From manual to AI: Transforming Brazil's national exam at scale
description: Learn how Brazil's national exam system leveraged AWS AI services to revolutionize educational assessment at scale. This chalk talk explores the practical challenges and solutions in building an AI-powered evaluation system that handles millions of Portuguese language assessments. Discover architectural patterns for implementing bias-free scoring, managing multi-model orchestration, and ensuring real-time processing at national scale. We'll dive deep into the technical decisions that enabled 78% cost reduction and 5.2x productivity gains. You'll leave with actionable strategies for deploying large-scale AI systems, handling language complexity, and maintaining high availability during peak demands.
tags: Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Education; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: From monolith to microservices: Migrate and modernize with Amazon EKS
description: Organizations face the challenge of migrating legacy applications and modernizing them for cloud-native architectures. This session will cover how to leverage Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes to transform legacy workloads into cloud-native architectures. Learn to evaluate your current stack, identify transformation opportunities, and implement effective modernization strategies. We'll explore tools and best practices to containerize applications, embrace microservices, and harness Kubernetes power. Discover how Amazon EKS enables seamless migration paths and running containerized workloads across on-premises and cloud environments. This approach reduces operational burden, cuts costs, and accelerates innovation—no matter where you are in your migration and modernization journey.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Containers; Kubernetes; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: From Motion to Meaning: AI-Powered Human Movement Analysis on AWS
description: By leveraging machine learning and generative AI, the gaming, music, and healthcare industries can access unprecedented insights into human movement. In this session, we'll explore compelling use cases where move.ai and VueMotion are using AWS services to capture and generate human movement data, which is then used downstream to create character animations and athletics analysis. We will showcase how captured human movement data can be analyzed using AWS tools and services to provide insights for sport and healthcare experts. Join us as we uncover the transformative potential of this cutting-edge technology.
services: Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Machine Learning; Customer Enablement; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Media & Entertainment; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: From Pods to Gateway API: Container Networking Mysteries Solved!
description: Discover the fundamentals of EKS networking through interactive whiteboarding sessions. We'll explore architectural patterns for pod networking with Amazon VPC CNI, understand core concepts of service discovery, and learn essential security configurations. Through practical examples, you'll grasp how AWS Load Balancer Controller enables service communication and see how modern solutions like Gateway API and VPC Lattice fit into multi-cluster architectures. Perfect for those seeking to understand container networking patterns and best practices. Bring your questions for collaborative architectural discussions.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon VPC Lattice
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: From principles to practice: Scaling AI responsibly with Indeed
description: Building trusted AI applications requires balancing innovation speed with risk management across an increasingly complex set of responsible AI dimensions, including privacy, security, robustness, fairness, safety, transparency, and explainability. Join this session to learn about the AWS Responsible AI Best Practices Framework, and discover how Indeed has built an intelligent risk management platform that enables rapid product development while protecting millions of job seekers using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Walk away with actionable strategies for implementing responsible AI practices in your own applications.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: From Print to AI: The Economist's Digital Evolution with AWS Architecture
description: Discover how The Economist transformed its historic legacy into a cutting-edge AI powerhouse. This presentation reveals how the prestigious media group successfully integrated GenAI and ML technologies through strategic alignment of teams, workflows, and infrastructure. Learn their blueprint for secure data architecture and AI implementation using AWS SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Featuring live demonstrations, examine real-world applications, from sophisticated recommendation systems to advanced predictive analytics, demonstrating how traditional media can evolve in the AI era.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Lecture-style

title: From prompt to production: On-brand marketing images with Amazon Nova
description: Ad and marketing teams are racing to harness text-to-image models, but creating high-quality, on-brand visuals at production scale has remained unsolved. Until now. Generating marketing images isn’t just about automation; it’s about balancing speed, creative fidelity, and brand alignment—which has never before been explored in a scalable, production-ready workflow with agents. In this breakout session, discover the challenges of bringing text-to-image into real-world campaigns and the breakthrough that makes it possible. Join this session to learn how to create scalable, robust, and brand-aligned agentic workflows using Nova Canvas and Nova Pro, and see how AI can supercharge your creative pipeline.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Lecture-style

title: From punched cards to AI: The developer’s new mindset
description: Developer evolution is ongoing - from punched cards to cloud-native apps, each wave has reshaped how the team build. Today, AI introduces a new shift: vibe coding for rapid prototyping, and spec-first development for scalable, maintainable systems. This session takes a step back to explore the broader transformation journey and how developers can confidently navigate the current AI wave. the team’ll focus on the spec-first mindset and the growing importance of soft skills in human-AI collaboration. A short demo using Kiro learn how to illustrate practical strategies and workflows that help developers adapt, communicate, and thrive.
tags: Developer Tools; Lecture-style

title: From Reactive to Proactive: Infrastructure governance by design
description: Many organizations struggle to maintain consistent security controls across their cloud infrastructure as they scale, often discovering compliance violations only after resources are deployed. This reactive approach leads to security gaps, compliance issues, and costly remediation efforts. This code talk will discuss security best practices using AWS CloudFormation Hooks and AWS CloudFormation Guard, demonstrating how to prevent non-compliant infrastructure deployments before they occur. You will learn how to write CloudFormation Guard domain-specific language (DSL) rules for static template validation and integrate them with CloudFormation Hooks, including managed hooks, to enforce security standards proactively across your organization.
tags: Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: From reflection to action: Agentic AI for mission impact
description: Nonprofits operate under unique budgetary and resource constraints. Agentic AI can help nonprofit leaders and technologists transcend traditional resource limitations, enhance decision-making, and amplify social impact. This chalk talk explores agentic AI workflows for streamlining administrative tasks, enhancing fundraising, improving donor engagement, optimizing volunteer management, and personalizing member communication. Through real-world use cases, we'll analyze the immediate benefits and long-term strategic advantages of responsible AI implementation in nonprofit settings. Gain practical insights, and design patterns and architectural blueprints to scale your mission. Leave equipped with tools and best practices to leverage AI for maximizing your organization's efficiency, impact, and member trust.
tags: Generative AI; Tech for Impact; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Nonprofit; Interactive

title: From serverful to serverless Java
description: In this workshop, learn how to bring your traditional Java Spring application to AWS Lambda with minimal effort and iteratively apply optimizations to get the best out of your serverless Java experience. Find out how to improve the performance of your application with AWS Lambda SnapStart and GraalVM native images. Then, learn how to write new applications with Spring Cloud Function and use Amazon Q Developer to quickly generate the code. Leave this workshop knowing how to make well-informed decisions when modernizing enterprise Java applications with AWS Lambda. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: From Static to Dynamic: Modernizing AWS Access Management
description: Building a robust AWS identity foundation requires moving beyond static credentials. This session deep dives into proven patterns for implementing dynamic, temporary access across your AWS organization. We'll explore real-world challenges of access key dependencies and share practical approaches to transition towards ephemeral credentials using IAM roles and SAML federation. Through practical examples and lessons learned, discover how to implement secure authentication patterns that scale while reducing operational overhead. Walk away with actionable strategies to strengthen your identity perimeter and modernize your access management approach.
services: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM); AWS IAM Identity Center; AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: From threat to threat intel: 360 degrees of DDOS
description: Discover how AWS protects web applications at scale by analyzing billions of data points to detect attacks and automatically update defenses. Through real-world case studies, learn how CloudFront, ELB, Shield, and WAF use machine learning to distinguish legitimate traffic from malicious requests while maintaining performance. See how AWS’s global threat monitoring network delivers real-time DDoS protection, ensuring business continuity and resilient web delivery. Walk away with actionable insights to safeguard your applications against sophisticated threats.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Threat Intelligence; Networking & Content Delivery; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Professional Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: From Trigger to Execution: The Journey of Events in AWS Lambda
description: Dive deep into AWS Lambda's event processing ecosystem. We'll explore diverse event sources including queuing (SQS), streaming (Kinesis, DynamoDB Streams), and private sources (EventBridge Pipes, Kafka). Uncover Lambda's sophisticated message buffering and synchronous invocation mechanisms. Learn how Lambda ensures high availability through static stability and rapid AZ failover, and manages backpressure to prevent system overload. We'll examine Lambda destinations for advanced event routing and error handling. By mastering these concepts, you'll optimize your serverless architectures for reliability, performance, and scalability. Join us to unlock the full potential of event-driven computing with AWS Lambda, from trigger to execution and beyond.
services: Amazon EventBridge; Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS); AWS Lambda
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Resilience; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: From triggers to thinking: Building event-driven AI on AWS
description: AI systems are moving beyond static responses into adaptive, context-aware behaviors. In this session, learn how Model Context Protocol (MCP) extends event-driven design into AI workflows on AWS. Explore architecture patterns, integration strategies, and real-world examples to see how applications can move from simple triggers to intelligent, real-time responses. Leave with practical guidance for combining event-driven architecture and MCP to design resilient, AI-driven systems.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: From UX to AX: MCP Servers for AI Shopping Agents
description: The retail industry faces transformation as AI shopping agents emerge. Just as user experience (UX) optimization became essential for human shoppers, retailers must now prepare for Agent Experience (AX) optimization—designing for AI agents that autonomously navigate marketplaces. This talk examines leveraging Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers on AWS to position retailers advantageously in agent-driven commerce. MCP servers establish standardized communication frameworks enabling AI agents to seamlessly access product information, inventory, and pricing data. We present actionable approaches for deploying MCP server architecture, empowering retailers to lead in automated commerce while preserving exceptional customer experiences during this transition.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Generative AI; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

description: In this hands-on builders session, learn how to modernize legacy apps using Amazon Bedrock and Kiro. Step through techniques to tackle tightly coupled code, hidden dependencies, poor documentation, and data migration. Explore how AI can accelerate transformation while maintaining compliance and data integrity. Move from “vibe coding” to “vibe modernizing."

title: From VSAM to DynamoDB: Reimagining mainframe data for the cloud
description: Transform mainframe VSAM KSDS data structures into cloud-native architectures using Amazon developer tools and Amazon DynamoDB. This hands-on builder session explores two modernization paths: complete reimagination for tech-debt-free implementations and incremental augmentation for data analytics or new channels and functions. Learn to identify access patterns, strategically denormalize data for improved performance, and overcome common mainframe data format challenges. Experience the architectural benefits of DynamoDB including cost efficiency through on-demand pricing, elastic scalability, multi-AZ high availability, and built-in data integrity. Gain practical skills in schema design and optimization techniques that bridge legacy systems with modern cloud databases for enhanced business agility.
speakers: Luis Gustavo Dantas; Sunil Divvela; Arunkumar Selvam; Santosh Kumar Singh; Cheryl du Preez
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: From Windows to Linux: .NET application modernization
description: Porting and upgrades of .NET applications running on Windows servers to Linux can deliver cost savings and enhance security and compliance, but the modernization process can be long and laborious. This interactive chalk talk explores strategies for porting server-side components of a .NET application within days by refactoring using AWS Transform. The session includes codebase analysis, code decomposition into buildable units, transformation plan creation, and execution of key transformation tasks with approval from the developer.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; DevOps; Developer Tools; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: From Zero to Millions: Building Real-Time Applications at Scale
description: Discover how to scale real-time applications to millions of users with modern event-driven architectures. Learn essential strategies for managing high-volume connection requests, implementing effective filtering patterns, and handling event distribution at scale. We'll explore integration patterns for event processing, practical solutions for GenAI applications, and optimization techniques for operating at production scale. Join us to understand connection rate management, filtering strategies, and real-world architectural patterns for building highly scalable real-time applications.
services: Amazon EventBridge; AWS Lambda; AWS Step Functions

title: From Zero to SaaS: When Vibe Coding Meets Production [REPEAT]
description: Vibe coding is fun and fast, but can leave hidden gaps when building production SaaS. In this hands-on builder session, step into the role of an AWS developer tasked with readying a vibe coded SaaS application for go-live. Discover the holes in code that the LLMs often miss. Then learn rules, and smarter prompts to productionize the codebase to attain robust security and scalability. Learn powerful strategies and practical SaaS patterns as you wrangle tenant context and IAM policies. Leave with sharper SaaS instincts, improved AI assistant skills, and a clear view of where “vibe” falls short for production SaaS apps.
speakers: Farooq Ashraf; Chris Dorrington; Ben Dutton; Aman Lal; Anthony McClure

description: Vibe coding is fun and fast, but can leave hidden gaps when building production SaaS. In this hands-on builder session, step into the role of an AWS developer tasked with readying a vibe coded SaaS application for go-live. Discover the holes in code that the LLMs often miss. Then learn rules, and smarter prompts to productionize the codebase to attain robust security and scalability. Learn powerful strategies and practical SaaS patterns as you wrangle tenant context and IAM policies. title: Frontier Model Safety in Practice: Amazon Nova Risk Evaluation
description: Amazon’s Frontier Model Safety Framework establishes rigorous protocols for evaluating and mitigating critical, high-risk capabilities in frontier-scale AI models—those with exceptional scale or versatility—that might pose severe public safety hazards. This framework mandates assessments targeting three core domains: Chemical, Biological, Radiological & Nuclear weapons proliferation; Offensive Cyber Operations; and Automated AI R&D. Evaluations combine automated, reproducible benchmarks with expert red-teaming and uplift studies, supported by third-party audits, to determine if models exceed critical safety thresholds. In this context, we present the first comprehensive safety evaluation of Amazon’s Nova Premier, a frontier-scale foundation model capable of processing text, images, and video.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Full stack web apps on EC2: Using Elastic Beanstalk with Amazon Q
description: Onboarding web applications to AWS is easy with Elastic Beanstalk. Learn how AWS Elastic Beanstalk simplifies deployment and maintenance of full stack web applications on EC2 with automated infrastructure provisioning. See how Amazon Q accelerates development by providing contextual CLI commands, troubleshooting guidance, and best practices recommendations. We'll discuss configurable auto-scaling to handle traffic spikes while optimizing costs. Perfect for developers starting their cloud journey, this session shows how Elastic Beanstalk with Amazon Q's AI capabilities streamlines the path from traditional hosting to modern cloud architecture.
tags: Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Full-stack SQL Server modernization on AWS
description: Discover how to revolutionize database modernization by automating the migration of SQL Server workloads to open source databases. This session demonstrates real-world transformation scenarios, showcasing automated schema conversion, query optimization, and migration pathways to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL.Learn how to reduce licensing costs, improve performance, and eliminate vendor lock-in while maintaining business continuity. We'll explore best practices for assessment, planning, and execution, plus hands-on examples of complex workload migrations. Perfect for architects, DBAs, and developers looking to modernize legacy SQL Server environments and embrace cloud-native, cost-effective open source database solutions.
speakers: Ali Alzand; Ty Augustine; Pavankumar Kasani; Chandra sekhar Pathivada; Amir Sotoodeh
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Automation; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Function calling vs agents: Choose the right AI approach
description: As AI applications grow more complex, understanding when to use function calling versus agents in AWS becomes critical. This session breaks down the key differences, real-world use cases, and architectural considerations for each approach. Learn how to match the complexity of your AI solution with the right tools, whether you're building simple data integrations or orchestrating dynamic, multi-step workflows. the team'll also explore the emerging role of multi-agent systems and how they scale intelligent automation.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Fundamentals to scale Kubernetes across your organization [REPEAT]
description: Ready to get hands-on with Amazon EKS? This modular workshop begins with Kubernetes fundamentals and lets you choose topics that match your interests including generative AI, observability, networking, security, and more. You can learn how to optimize scaling with Karpenter, automate day-to-day operations with EKS Auto Mode, troubleshoot real-world issues, and extend clusters on-premises with EKS Hybrid Nodes. Get hands-on building resilient, production-grade clusters on Amazon EKS following industry best practices and explore the latest Amazon EKS features, choosing only the modules that matter most to you.

title: Gaining insights from your data lake with Amazon S3 Metadata [REPEAT]
description: Explore the comprehensive capabilities of Amazon S3 Metadata for both new and historical objects in your S3 buckets. Learn to configure and query journal and live inventory tables, stored as Apache Iceberg tables in your AWS-managed table bucket. Through practical exercises, write SQL queries using Amazon Athena to track near real-time changes and analyze your full bucket contents. Gain hands-on experience using S3 Metadata for comprehensive data discovery and management, regardless of object age or quantity.

title: Game Dev on AWS: Your Studio Architecture Questions Answered
description: Join AWS experts for an interactive deep-dive into game development architecture patterns using the Cloud Game Development Toolkit. We'll start with a brief overview of  common studio infrastructure challenges, then open the floor for your specific questions about Perforce migrations, build pipeline optimization, and multi-region  deployments. Bring your real-world scenarios - whether you're migrating from on-premises, scaling globally, or optimizing costs. This whiteboarding session will  tackle your unique challenges with proven AWS solutions and community-driven insights from the open-source toolkit.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)

title: Gen AI economics: Maximizing value while protecting the purse
description: In an era where generative AI revolutionizes public service delivery, agencies must strike a delicate balance between harnessing its transformative potential and upholding their fiscal responsibilities to taxpayers. This session provides a comprehensive blueprint for implementing cost-effective generative AI solutions in the public sector. We will demystify pricing models for AWS generative AI services, Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Q Developer & Amazon Q Business. Attendees will gain practical knowledge on strategic cost optimization techniques specific to foundation models, including effective prompt engineering, token usage management, and intelligent throughput planning that can dramatically reduce "dollars per inference" while maintaining service quality.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Gen AI in Security Assurance and Compliance: From Strategy to Daily Operations
description: Discover how GenAI is transforming security assurance and compliance operations in today's complex regulatory landscape. Learn practical strategies for integrating GenAI to convert manual-intensive compliance processes into streamlined, insights-driven workflows. We'll explore how GenAI can analyze compliance artifacts, map regulatory frameworks, and generate targeted response strategies while maintaining appropriate controls. Through the PACE framework (Purpose, Autonomy, Competency, Excellence), understand how to build a culture of responsible GenAI adoption. See real-world examples of achieving tangible improvements in both efficiency and quality while managing adoption risks through structured validation processes. Leave with actionable insights to enhance your organization's security and compliance operations.
tags: Generative AI; Culture of Security; Security & Identity; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: Gen AI Security Testing & Protection Strategies [AWS Partners only]
description: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Develop robust generative AI security strategies through hands-on testing. Practice red teaming with an LLM, implement data protection controls, and secure agent workflows. Learn to protect both individual models and multi-component AI systems effectively. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Training & Certification

title: GenAI game coach: Real-time gameplay feedback
description: What if your gameplay footage could talk back and tell you how to improve? In this Dev Chat, I’ll walk through how I built a lightweight GenAI-powered system that watches short clips of your gameplay and gives real-time coaching feedback in natural language. No SDKs, no engine mods, just video, voice, and AWS. Using a combination of Amazon Rekognition for visual cues, Amazon Transcribe for in-game voice analysis, and Amazon Bedrock for feedback generation, this system turns raw gameplay into structured insights. You’ll learn how to combine multimodal data (frames, audio, context) and prompt engineering to build an interactive review.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: GenAI Storyboarding: From Sketch to 3D Scene with GenAI on AWS
description: Artist controlled AI content creation for visual storytelling. Learn how to transform initial sketches into concept-ready storyboards using Amazon Bedrock's generative AI capabilities. Walk through a workflow that maintains artistic control while leveraging AI: sketch compositions, generate style-consistent 2D assets, convert images to 3D models, and compose dynamic scenes. See how this integrated pipeline enables rapid iteration for film pre-visualization, game level design, and UI prototyping. Discover techniques for maintaining visual coherence across generated assets, controlling camera movements, and sequencing shot — turning the unpredictability of AI into a reliable creative tool for professional workflows.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Lambda
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Games; Media & Entertainment; Software & Internet; Interactive

title: GenAI-Powered Contextual Security Analysis & Remediation
description: For ISVs, managing security and costs in multi-tenant environments is complex: threats can spread across boundaries, cost attribution becomes unclear, and understanding true impact radius is challenging. This technical session demonstrates how to overcome these challenges by mapping tenant infrastructure relationships using Amazon Neptune and OpenSearch. Watch how graph-based architecture with GenAI integration provides deep contextual understanding of cross-tenant dependencies. Learn patterns for security analysis and cost attribution that reduce operational risks in multi-tenant environments.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; SaaS; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Generative AI excellence: How AWS Partners help customers from strategy to scale
description: How AWS Partners and customers are working together to address generative AI adoption. We present generative AI industry research with insights into customer buying behavior and how partners are uniquely positioned to address.   Additionally, we cover insights on the AWS Partner Programs and resources designed to make both partners and customers successful in achieving their desired outcomes with generative AI.

Learn to identify valuable use cases across industries, understand implementation strategies, and manage organizational change. Focus on responsible AI adoption, covering essential concepts, risk management, and practical steps for getting started. Discover how to drive business value through AI while managing people, process, and technology transformations effectively. Ideal for leaders driving AI initiatives.

title: Generative AI strategy: accelerating path to production
description: Learn how to scale generative AI experiments into production-ready solutions. This session provides a strategic and technical framework for accelerating AI deployment while managing risks and maintaining governance. We'll cover practical approaches to align AI initiatives with business goals, establish evaluation criteria, and build effective teams. Through real-world examples, discover proven methods for fast-tracking implementation while ensuring security and quality. Gain actionable strategies for overcoming deployment challenges and creating repeatable processes that reduce time-to-value. Ideal for technology leaders focused on maximizing AI investments and driving enterprise adoption.

description: Follow along as we uncover the powerful forces shaping the future of AI coding. From the emergence of intelligent agents to Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, we'll explore the latest advancements and real-world use cases that are redefining what's possible for developer productivity and creativity. By the end, you'll feel empowered to embrace the magic of AI, no matter how daunting the technology may seem.

description: AI is creating new opportunities, and organizations need speed-to-market, scalability, performance, and cost efficiency to bring ideas to life. Amazon EKS provides the trusted and flexible foundation for your AI journey as you build new experiences using AI inference, agents, and model fine-tuning. In this session, we will cover recent innovations in Amazon EKS that empower you with the latest AI capabilities and we will share real-world architectures, best practices, and examples to leave you equipped with the information you need to accelerate your AI initiatives.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)

title: Geo-fencing & real-time geospatial alerts with ElastiCache Valkey
description: In this builders' session, you will create a high-performance, real-time, geospatial alerting pipeline using Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey. This architecture pattern is tailored for dynamic applications like ridesharing, logistics, and fleet management. While Valkey's geospatial features are well-documented, this session goes beyond basic usage by demonstrating how to integrate real-time geospatial queries with event-driven workflows, addressing the complexities of large-scale geofencing in modern applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Gururaj S Bayari; Damon LaCaille; Kevin McGehee; Veerendra Nayak; Allen Samuels
tags: Open Data; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Getting hands on with zero-ETL and data federation
description: Zero-ETL integration and query federation capabilities with Amazon SageMaker let you spend less time on undifferentiated heavy lifting and more time building data products. This hands-on workshop explores building Zero-ETL pipelines and federated queries using SageMaker Catalog, showcasing the power of the lakehouse architecture with Amazon SageMaker. This session will give you practical experience with streamlining data ingestion and querying external data sources, showing how these techniques accelerate your time to insights.
speakers: Sukhomoy Basak; Olivia Carline; Sandhya Khanderia; Nidhi Nayak; Shubham Purwar
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Getting started with Serverless using AI assistance
description: Serverless applications are built using many services, often with common architectural patterns. Wouldn't it be faster to get started with serverless if you had an AI assistant to apply patterns and best practices to build production-ready code? In this workshop, you will create a serverless application with authentication, create and run tests, set up observability, and have the option to configure a CI/CD pipeline. Along the way, your AI assistant will help review and explain code, look up configuration settings, and create tests. To complete this workshop, you must bring your laptop.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Global GenAI trends and learnings at re:Invent
description: [This session is conducted in Japanese] Generative AI technology is advancing at an astonishingly fast pace globally and many customers are exploring innovation with it. In that time, re:Invent is one of the best way to find out insights and chances to your next innovation. This session provides you preliminary knowledge to make your understanding more deeper to up-coming service launches, exciting customer stories and your chances to the future. We will share you global customer stories, common challenges and key points of recent service launches. Please join this session and be prepared for up-coming re:Invent!
tags: Lecture-style

title: Global Growth: A Framework for Expanding into New Regions
description: International growth is a top priority for ISVs, but meeting sovereignty requirements while expanding globally is challenging. In this session we focus on technical and operational considerations when expanding to new AWS Regions such as the upcoming AWS European Sovereign Cloud and Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. We will discuss navigating API parity differences, data residency requirements, generative AI options, SaaS delivery models, and more. This session will help you develop a structured approach to regional expansion while maintaining compliance and meeting customer requirements.
services: AWS Control Tower; AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS); AWS Security Hub
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Global Infrastructure; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Global Resilient Apps: Guide to Multi-AZ/Region Architecture with ELB
description: Learn advanced techniques for building globally distributed, highly available applications using Elastic Load Balancing (ELB). Through demonstrations and real-world use cases, you will learn essential patterns for multi-Availability Zone configurations, multi-Region deployments, and comprehensive disaster recovery solutions. The session covers optimizing global application performance using ELB and Amazon Route 53 to create resilient, globally accessible applications. Gain practical insights into implementing robust architectures and learn best practices for scaling, monitoring, and managing these complex systems, equipping yourself with the knowledge to build and maintain world-class, fault-tolerant solutions.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: Global tourism brand transforms customer service with Amazon Connect
description: Looking to modernize your customer journey? Join this session to learn how TUI Group, one of the world's leading tourism organizations, harnessed the power of AI through cloud migration - successfully onboarding 10,000 agents and retail staff to Amazon Connect across 12 European markets in 8 languages. Discover how they improved the customer and agent experience with conversational IVR, bots at the same time as reducing operating expenses by 10%. Hear about proven AI and modernization success stories along with best practices on cloud migration for customer service.
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Travel & Hospitality; Lecture-style

title: Go from idea to deployment faster with Amazon Q Developer
description: Building software at scale doesn't always require developers to work across multiple tools, technologies, processes and stakeholders in order to collaborate effectively as they plan, write, and ship code. In this session we explore Amazon Q Developer's third-party integrations with GitHub and Gitlab that help streamline the developer experience with a single unified solution. Learn how you can automate routine tasks, assign your backlog to Q Developer, and eliminate context switching.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Go-to-market in today's political climate: a policy and AWS Marketplace overview
description: New political scenarios have created waves in public sector IT. This session will feature a public policy update on the White House's AI Action Plan and other initiatives that create opportunities for public sector partners. We will deep dive into AWS Marketplace as a contracting mechanism with which to achieve efficiency and cost savings across the public sector.
tags: Generative AI; Business Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Sales / Marketing; Government; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: Governance and administrative controls with Amazon Q Business
description:
As organizations increasingly leverage conversational AI, the need for robust administrative controls and governance has become paramount.
This hands-on workshop will guide you through setting up Amazon Q Business for your organization and leveraging its administrative controls. You'll explore user roles, permissions, guardrails, policies, and topic controls to govern application behavior, content, security, and compliance at scale. By the end, you'll have practical skills to effectively manage and deploy Amazon Q Business within your enterprise.
tags: Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Governance that Enables Innovation at Scale feat. Eli Lilly and Company
description: As enterprises expand their cloud footprint, they want to set up flexible and secure cloud environments that can easily adapt to business processes. By modernizing cloud governance with AWS Control Tower, customers can experiment, innovate, and scale more quickly in a secure and resilient manner. Learn how Eli Lilly, an American medicine company, successfully modernized their governance structure by migrating to AWS Control Tower with zero downtime for critical workloads. Learn how they implemented controls to meet compliance requirements and integrated Account Factory for Terraform to automate provisioning, enhance agility, improve security posture, and innovate faster, so they can focus on improving lives and communities.
speakers: Tim Honychurch; Ellie Ray; Dustin Jefford
services: AWS CloudFormation; AWS Control Tower; AWS Organizations
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Migration & Modernization; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: GPU resource optimization on AWS: MIG, KAI, and Run:AI scheduling strategies
description: Discover advanced strategies for maximizing GPU utilization on AWS using NVIDIA MIG, KAI Scheduler, and Run:AI. Learn how to implement hard partitioning with MIG for guaranteed QoS, alongside intelligent scheduling with KAI and Run:AI for optimal resource allocation. This session demonstrates configuring these technologies on Amazon EKS, comparing performance characteristics, and implementing hybrid approaches. Walk away with architectural patterns for GPU sharing that balance isolation, utilization, and cost across multi-tenant ML workloads.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Graph Computations - Can we have best of two worlds: OLAP and OLTP?
description: Graph computations are a natural way of representing sparse relations and continue to gain attention, especially as knowledge graphs become central to generative AI applications. Can a single engine achieve analytical throughput and transactional consistency without fundamental performance penalties? Using Amazon Neptune Analytics architecture, explore tradeoffs of different graph representations and indexing strategies informed by high performance computing research, examining how performance varies under different workloads. We will discuss the space and time tradeoffs required for efficient cloud resource utilization, and present results that combine indexing efficiency, data locality, and parallel execution strategies.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Academic / Researcher; Interactive

title: Greenfield unlocked: Best practices for expanding new customer engagement
description: Experience the evolution of greenfield partner programs today. Discover what works and what doesn't through real partner feedback. Grow your new customer engagement practice by combining strategic funding with AI-powered tools and intelligent automation, like our Partner-First Scale model and more. Learn about the right sales motion for every customer need, allowing you to provide more personalized solutions as you streamline your customer's journey from initial engagement to successful implementation. Whether you're a consulting or technology partner, this session will teach you how to leverage AWS's funding, tools, and support to help you start growing your greenfield practice.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

description: This chalk talk will chart the evolution of data platforms, from the nascent stages of a small five-person business to the complexities of an enterprise with over 500 employees. We'll whiteboard how AWS AI services can be strategically integrated at each growth phase, enabling data optimization, process automation, and deeper insights. Come learn how to move from data challenges to data advantages, seeing how AI plays a pivotal role in extracting more value from your evolving data architecture for sustainable scaling.

title: HA and DR design patterns for Amazon RDS for SQL Server and Oracle
description: Explore high availability (HA) and disaster recovery  (DR) design patterns for SQL Server and Oracle databases on Amazon RDS. In  this session, learn about the features offered by Amazon RDS for business  continuity, including Multi-AZ deployments, read replicas, and  cross-region replication. Discover the customizations that Amazon RDS  Custom enables for HA and DR while also allowing you to bring your own  license (BYOL) for SQL Server. Also learn how globally resilient solutions  architected with RDS and RDS Custom minimize downtime and meet stringent  business continuity requirements for mission-critical workloads.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Oracle; Resilience; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Handle scaling with AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: Learn how serverless workloads can handle spikes in this interactive session on AWS Lambda scaling. Learn best practices to generate high throughput using load testing tools and analyze scaling behavior with CloudWatch metrics. Explore real-world use cases, covering potential pitfalls like cold starts, concurrency limits, and upstream/downstream bottlenecks. Leave with a tested approach to verify application scaling, even at high throughput levels. Gain confidence that your applications can truly scale on demand.
speakers: Diana Cheng; Rohan Mehta; Marco Plaul; Martin Sakowski; Archana Srikanta

title: Hands-on multi-tenant agents: Inside tenant-aware agentic systems [REPEAT]
description: Multi-tenancy can have a profound impact on the design, implementation, and behavior of GenAI agents. The presence of tenant context can influence the memory, tools, actions, and workflows that are employed by agents. In this workshop, we’ll build tenant aware agents that uses a combination of mechanisms, applying multi-tenant strategies to integrations with RAG, MCP servers, and other agent constructs. It will also examine a range of additional multi-tenant agent considerations, including tenant isolation, multi-agent systems, and the implementation of non-deterministic agentic experiences. Finally, the workshop will demonstrate how instrument and aggregate multi-tenant GenAI usage and cost per tenant metrics.
tags: Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Independent Software Vendor; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Harnessing analytics for humans and AI
description: Emerging trends, ranging from Open Table Formats (OTF) to agentic infrastructure, are rapidly changing how humans and applications interact with analytics to drive mission-critical business decisions. Join Mai-Lan Tomsen Bukovec, VP of AWS Technology, to explore emerging trends, the evolution of analytics engines and applications, and how to future-proof your data foundation for the rapidly changing landscape of analytics at scale. Learn how AWS is transforming data and analytics services to lead in optimized data storage, querying, streaming, processing, and governance - for both human users and agentic infrastructure.

title: High-performance storage for AI/ML, analytics, and HPC workloads
description: AWS storage services can act as a powerful, cost-effective foundation for the most demanding high-performance workload, from genomics analysis to media rendering and real-time analytics. In this session, explore storage options that are suitable for numerous architectures, data types, and organizational requirements and that can accelerate your most performance-critical applications to speed up time to insights and time to market. From data ingestion to processing and storage, learn advanced techniques and best practices for achieving peak performance at scale for your most demanding workloads.
speakers: Aditi Garg; Mark Roper; Manish Talreja
tags: Cost Optimization; Automation; Machine Learning; Compute; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: How Adobe & Salesforce Enable Sustainability initiatives with AWS CCFT
description: Join technical leaders from Adobe and Salesforce as they reveal how AWS's Customer Carbon Footprint Tool supports their environmental initiatives. This session explores innovative approaches to cloud optimization and sustainability reporting, showcasing real-world architectures that prioritize sustainability. Learn how these organizations leverage AWS's Customer Carbon Footprint Tool to achieve ambitious environmental goals while maintaining operational excellence. Discover actionable strategies for implementing comprehensive carbon reporting and advancing your organization's sustainability journey through cloud innovation.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Global Infrastructure; Generative AI; Sustainability; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Business Executive; IT Executive; Press / Media Analyst; Energy & Utilities; Software & Internet; Telecommunications; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: How AI is impacting the software development lifecycle
description: The AI-Driven Software Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC) is a revolutionary approach that empowers developers to harness the transformative power of AI in software development. Unlike traditional methods, AI-DLC places AI at the forefront, driving workflows, decomposing tasks, and generating recommendations. This AI-led paradigm enables faster decision-making, seamless task execution, and continuous adaptability, while maintaining human oversight and control. In this chalk talk, we'll explore the key principles and core framework of AI-DLC, demonstrating how it can help organizations deliver complex, high-quality software faster than ever before. Attendees will gain insights into the future of software development and how to successfully navigate the AI-driven era.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: How Allianz designed AIOps at enterprise scale
description: Deploying applications that utilize large language models (LLMs) at enterprise scale presents unique challenges beyond traditional MLOps. In this session, aimed at developers and data scientists, learn how Allianz built a comprehensive AIOps framework for bringing AI-powered solutions to production. Discover how they leveraged Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and open-source solutions to create an ecosystem serving a wide range of user groups. Explore architectural patterns for ensuring consistency, security, and governance across AI implementations while enabling rapid deployment of new use cases. Gain insights into managing end-to-end LLM applications within complex organizational structures, balancing innovation with compliance in highly regulated environments.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Fargate
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: How Amazon Ads uses AWS to democratize ad creation
description: Media advertisers see up to 25% higher engagement when delivering custom creative to relevant audiences, yet producing quality video ads traditionally requires weeks of expensive and specialized expertise.** **Discover how Amazon Ads is transforming the creative process by automating and enhancing the generation of multi-format ads to businesses regardless of their size or creative expertise. Explore how Amazon Bedrock, custom-built ML models, GPUs, and model evaluations are used to orchestrate and generate compelling ad creatives into full video productions with professional voiceovers from conversational natural language, while reducing creative development time.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Retail & Consumer Goods; Lecture-style

title: How Amazon EC2 improves the customer experience with Live Migration
description: Live Migration (LM) is foundational technology of Amazon EC2. It is used to rescue customer instance off degraded hosts, optimize the placement of instances to reduce the risk of correlated failures at the host/rack/DC level, optimize costs by improving the utilization of the hosts, optimizing the performance of the instance with heat management for example Aurora Serverles v2. This talk provides an overview how LM is used and implemented in AWS and how EC2 innovates in software and hardware to continously improve the customer's experience.
tags: Cost Optimization; Cloud Operations; Compute; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: How Amazon Game Studios builds a data foundation for AI/ML on AWS
description: Join us as we present Amazon Game Studios' transformative approach to game data infrastructure through their proprietary Data Forge platform. We'll show how this comprehensive solution integrates sophisticated data pipelines with MLOps capabilities, processing 5+ PB of game data across titles like Lost Ark. You'll see how the hub-and-spoke Redshift architecture enables efficient analytics while the unified ML environment has reduced model production time by 80%. We'll illustrate the complete data flow—from Kinesis ingestion through S3 storage to Redshift clusters—alongside the SageMaker-powered ML lifecycle that dramatically improves collaboration between data scientists and game developers throughout development and live service phases
services: Amazon Kinesis; Amazon RedShift; Amazon SageMaker
tags: Business Intelligence; Generative AI; Industry Solutions; Games; Interactive

title: How Amazon is migrating 1000’s of applications to new AWS regions
description: In this session we'll share learnings and best practices from Amazon’s largest cross region migration to date with 1000’s of services migrating across AWS regions. We’ll share our strategy and tools for migrations at scale and cover details on how we have automated common migration tasks for compute and storage replication. The session will cover how awe have simplified developer effort for migrations with CI/CD pipeline analysis and the tools we’ve implemented using Amazon Q Developer and the AWS CDK to remove region dependencies and deploy infrastructure as code where resources have been manually configured.
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Professional Services
tags: Learning from Amazon; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Retail & Consumer Goods; Interactive

description: Learn how Amazon developers achieve real productivity gains using Amazon Q Developer, an AI-powered coding assistant. This code talk demonstrates proven techniques for accelerating development workflows using Prompt-Driven Development and Agent Scripts. Through live examples, learn how development teams cut feature development time from weeks to days while maintaining code quality. Discover practical strategies for leveraging these patterns in both familiar and new codebases.

title: How Amazon uses AI and Automated Reasoning to detect hallucinations
description: With the launch of Automated Reasoning checks (ARc) in Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, AWS is the first major cloud provider to integrate automated reasoning in their generative AI offerings thus spearheading the push into neurosymbolic AI. In this 500-level session focused on ARc, join AWS experts for a deep dive into how automated reasoning techniques help verify AI model outputs. We will use practical examples to explain the underlying mathematical and scientific foundations, and to discuss strategies for setting up effective guardrails.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Agentic AI; Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: How Cathay Transformed DevSecOps with AI: A 75% Faster Security Story
description: Learn how Cathay Pacific Airways  partnered with AWS ProServe to revolutionize their DevSecOps approach, moving  beyond basic security scanning to create a comprehensive shift-left  security-first culture. By implementing AI-powered security champions, defensive  coding patterns & anti-patterns, AppSec-as-Code libraries as knowledge  base, customized AppSec scanning rules and RAG-based Agentic AI assistant,  they achieved remarkable results: 50% cost reduction, 75% faster  vulnerability remediation, and 70% improvement in developer security  capabilities. Discover how this Fortune 500 airline transformed 1,000+  developers into security-conscious practitioners while managing 4,000+ annual  deployments.

tags: Application Security; Culture of Security; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

By abstracting technical complexities, the platform allows teams to focus on content creation rather than infrastructure. Through AWS's scalable architecture, MediaCopilot empowers SMBs in diverse sectors to enhance customer engagement, training, and communications with professional-quality video content, addressing key challenges of resource limitations and quick deployment without specialized staff or substantial investment.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Advisor / Consultant; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Small & Medium Business; Lecture-style

title: How CloudFront Handles Black Friday-Scale Retail at the Edge
description: When millions of shoppers flood the internet during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, Amazon CloudFront is at the edge making sure every request gets through - fast, secure, and at scale. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll discuss how CloudFront handles internet-scale traffic: from request routing to caching strategies and edge compute. We’ll break down real-world architectures, share battle-tested patterns, and answer your toughest questions about building for massive global events.

title: How customers build AI at scale with AWS AI infrastructure
description: Join industry leaders as they share their experiences scaling AI initiatives using AWS AI infrastructures. AWS customers will present their journeys demonstrating how they optimized their AI workloads across training and inference for maximum performance and cost efficiency. Discover real-world architectures, implementation strategies, and lessons learned from organizations deploying large language models, reasoning systems, and multimodal applications at scale. Learn practical approaches to selecting and leveraging the right AI infrastructure for your AI workloads while managing costs effectively.

title: How Event Driven Architectures Go Wrong  and How to Fix them [REPEAT]
description: Event-driven architectures enable speed and agility for distributed cloud applications; however, this also means there's the risk of shipping bad ideas fast without governance. Fortunately, the same agility allows for quick fixes. Attend this chalk talk to learn common event-driven pitfalls, including YOLO events, god events, observability soup, event loops, exposing monoliths, state corruption, and surprise bills. Explore strategies and techniques teams can implement to avoid these pitfalls and reap the full benefits of event-driven architectures.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: How Event Driven Architectures Go Wrong  and How to Fix them [REPEAT]
description: Event-driven architectures enable speed and agility for distributed cloud applications; however, this also means there's the risk of shipping bad ideas fast without governance. Fortunately, the same agility allows for quick fixes. Attend this chalk talk to learn common event-driven pitfalls, including YOLO events, god events, observability soup, event loops, exposing monoliths, state corruption, and surprise bills.
