tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: How Netflix Connects Product Experiments to its AWS Bill
description: How do you measure the cost of innovation? At Netflix, a "winning" A/B test can create hidden cloud infrastructure costs that offset its business value. This session details our strategy for connecting product experiments to their infrastructure costs. We'll share our framework for identifying an experiment's impact on our cloud systems and show how we translate that impact into a projected AWS cost. Learn how this enables our teams to make smarter, more cost-aware product decisions at scale.
speakers: Manju Prasad; Tushar Arora; Chris Sanden
tags: Cost Optimization; Cloud Operations; Compute; Media & Entertainment; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: How Netflix Shapes our Fleet for Efficiency and Reliability
description: Netflix's strategy for optimizing its cloud architecture for efficiency and reliability. Placement of workloads on price-optimal hardware by automatically modeling capacity requirements and understanding AWS hardware performance and pricing. The talk will also cover a continuous optimization loop that monitors and reshapes the fleet to maintain business outcomes as load patterns change. Finally, it will touch upon managing traffic demand and compute supply to ensure availability during unexpected load shifts.
tags: Cost Optimization; Automation; Architecture; Compute; Media & Entertainment; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: How Nissan Accelerated Software-Defined Vehicle Development with AWS
description: Discover how Nissan built a comprehensive SDV ecosystem and reduced software testing time by 75%, combining advanced software development environments, robust data platforms, and scalable EE architecture all powered by AWS. We'll explore how the implementation of AWS Generative AI capabilities, test automation, and custom engineering workbenches has enabled Nissan to decouple service development from vehicle development cycles, allowing for more frequent and agile service releases.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Lecture-style

title: How Prime Video balanced innovation and reliability for live sports
description: Discover how Prime Video transformed its change control strategy to support 24/7 global live sports broadcasts while maintaining operational reliability. Learn to implement dynamic, risk-aware controls that replace rigid deployment freezes. Explore techniques for identifying resilient services, building programmable safety nets with AWS services, and encouraging test automation. Gain practical insights into balancing deployment velocity with operational safety, applicable to any organization managing mission-critical workloads in a rapidly changing environment.
tags: Resilience; Innovation & Transformation; Networking & Content Delivery; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Interactive

title: How Priority Pass migrated their global-scale website
description: Discover how Priority Pass, the world's largest independent airport lounge access program, successfully migrated their high-traffic website to AWS Amplify. This session explores the journey of modernizing a legacy platform serving millions of global travelers into a scalable, serverless architecture. Learn how the team leveraged AWS Amplify's full-stack capabilities to implement CI/CD pipelines, robust authentication, and dynamic content delivery while maintaining seamless performance across multiple regions. This session will explore the technical challenges faced, architectural decisions made, and benefits realized from this large-scale migration. Attendees will gain practical insights for planning their own enterprise-level AWS Amplify implementation.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Generative AI; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: How Samsung optimized 1.2 PB on Amazon DynamoDB with zero downtime
description: Join Samsung Cloud to learn how they successfully implemented a massive-scale table optimization, handling 1.2 PB on Amazon DynamoDB with zero downtime. Follow the innovative journey behind Samsung Internet's tab sync feature, showcasing how the team developed an in-house solution to handle complex data transfer achieving substantial cost savings without third-party dependencies. *Learn how this implementation resulted in the creation of a new standard framework that now serves as Samsung's blueprint for future data management initiatives.* Gain practical insights into building scalable solutions through deep service domain understanding and discover actionable strategies to tackle similar challenges in your organization.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Databases; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Lecture-style

title: How Security Maturity Enables Your Cryptographic Agility Playbook
description: Learn how organizational culture and robust security practices create a foundation for successful cryptographic transitions. This session demonstrates how enterprises can leverage existing TLS 1.3 migration experiences as a blueprint for post-quantum readiness. Discover practical mechanisms for establishing crypto-governance, building cross-functional partnerships, and creating repeatable migration patterns using AWS services like Private CA and KMS. Through real-world examples, explore how security culture mechanisms enable seamless cryptographic updates, setting your organization up for future quantum-safe transformations.
services: Amazon Security Lake; AWS Certificate Manager (ACM); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Culture of Security; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Interactive

title: How Stripe built a foundation model for fraud detection on AWS
description: Financial institutions face growing challenges detecting sophisticated fraud patterns within real-time transactions. Learn how Stripe tackled this challenge by developing a transformer-based foundation model on AWS. We’ll explore how they leveraged Amazon EKS with GPU instances and Amazon SageMaker to train models on billions of transactions, improving card testing attack detection from 59% to 97%. Discover their approach to treating transactions as language, creating semantic embeddings that capture relationships between transactions in a vector space. See how this sequence-based analysis enables detection of fraud patterns in real-time, even within high-volume merchant transactions.
speakers: Hasan Tariq; Kumar Chellapilla; Manish Kurse
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon SageMaker
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: How TE Connectivity Transforms Product Engineering with Agentic AI
description: Join to learn how TE Connectivity's agentic AI platform accelerates product development while optimizing costs. The platform unifies 500,000+ documents and 2 million engineering data points through a conversational interface, powered by Amazon Bedrock with RAG architecture. Agentic workflows enable engineers to synthesize documents, interpret code and design specifications, translate content, compare technical specifications, and generate compliance drafts autonomously. In three months, TE Connectivity processed 2.5 million documents and onboarded 40,000 engineers. Through optimized agentic architecture and precise model tuning, TE Connectivity delivers gen AI capabilities while maintaining low operational costs and securely scaling expertise across global teams.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); Amazon OpenSearch Serverless
tags: Business Intelligence; Cost Optimization; Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Advisor / Consultant; Business Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: How to optimize AWS storage for generative AI and ML workloads
description: Scaling deep learning programs into production often comes with its challenges, and you can’t have high-quality data modeling if your storage isn’t optimized for performance scalability. Getting this wrong can lead to unexpected cost and performance issues. In this interactive chalk talk, get answers to your questions related to selecting and optimizing storage for AI and ML workloads so you can build better, innovate faster, and deploy at scale.
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: How Toyota Built an AI Platform that Revolutionizes the Dealer Experience
description: In this session, Toyota Connected North America and Toyota Enterprise AI showcase how they transformed dealer operations using Amazon Bedrock and Claude to create an intelligent assistant that answers complex vehicle questions in seconds. The system now serves 2,300+ dealerships with instant, accurate vehicle expertise and handles 7,000+ monthly dealer interactions across multiple Toyota models and years, leveraging Amazon Bedrock, OpenSearch Serverless, and Amazon EKS for enterprise-scale performance.
speakers: Bryan Landes; Stephen Ellis; Stephen Short
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Automotive; Lecture-style

title: How well do you know EC2?
description: Many organizations deploy Amazon EC2 instances without fully leveraging available optimization opportunities. EC2 offers over 850 instance types across six categories: general purpose, compute optimized, memory optimized, storage optimized, accelerated computing, and high-performance computing. Most instances run on the AWS Nitro System, which delivers enhanced performance through dedicated hardware for compute, storage, and networking functions. This session explores EC2's breadth, from processor architectures including Intel, AMD, and AWS Graviton processors that deliver up to 40% better price performance, to purchase options like Spot Instances offering up to 90% savings and Savings Plans for predictable workloads. Discover practical strategies for matching workloads to optimal instance configurations and purchasing models.
tags: Lecture-style

title: How Yahoo! Finance built research multi-agent systems with Gen AI
description: Learn how Yahoo! Finance architected multi-agent systems to transform financial research and analysis using generative AI. Discover their implementation of Model Context Protocol (MCP) for efficient agent collaboration, integration of structured/unstructured data processing, and video analysis through tool/API calling. Get practical guidance from their production deployment and insights for scaling agent architectures. For data scientists and architects building enterprise AI solutions.
speakers: Rahul Ghosh; Vidya Sagar Ravipati; Dipen Rughwani
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Professional Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: How Zydus implemented regulated DR on AWS
description: This session explores Zydus Lifesciences' cloud-driven disaster recovery strategy for safeguarding Terabytes of regulated data across 10+ critical pharma applications. The session details how Zydus achieved a less than 5-15 minutes of RPO and less than 2-3 hours of RTO across main Data Center and multiple Plant locations and reduced DR costs by 55% and increased the resiliency of critical Pharma Applications while meeting strict regulatory requirements. We will cover in-depth technical & Network architecture covering AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (DRS), Elastic Block Storage, Direct Connect & Transit Gateway AWS services
services: AWS Direct Connect; AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery; AWS Transit Gateway
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Network & Infrastructure Security; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Networking & Content Delivery; IT Administrator; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; New to AWS; Lecture-style

title: HPC at Scale: From Robot Learning to Scientific Insights on AWS
description: High-performance computing on AWS is driving advances from AI-driven robotics to large-scale industrial simulations. This session explores how AWS Batch with SageMaker Training scales generative AI models that teach robots complex skills, and how AWS Parallel Computing Service powers HPC workloads like energy modeling and scientific research. You will also hear directly from customers who showcase real-world use cases with AWS HPC services, providing an in-depth view of how innovation is being enabled across robotics, energy, and beyond.
services: Amazon SageMaker; AWS Batch; AWS Parallel Computing Service; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Robotics; Customer Enablement; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Business Executive; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: HPC infrastructure for Financial Services using AWS Batch and AWS CDK
description: Take your HPC infrastructure as code skills to the next level with AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK). In this Builders Session you'll use CDK to implement an HPC architecture using AWS Batch and run a sample Financial Services "Risk Analysis Grid" workload. This session is for experienced HPC practitioners beginning their AWS infrastructure as code journey, and AWS builders who are new to HPC and AWS Batch.
speakers: Timothy Brown; Todd Churchward; Jeremy Dahan; Matt Koop; Ramin Torabi; Matt Vaughn
services: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Batch
tags: Workforce Development; Compute; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Hands-on; Interactive

title: HPC Made Easy: AWS PCS for AI & Scientific Computing
description: Discover how AWS Parallel Computing Service eliminates the undifferentiated heavy lifting of cluster management for both HPC and AI workloads. This workshop walks through creating, configuring, and using fully-managed compute environments with minimal setup time. Learn practical job submission techniques, resource optimization strategies, and gain hands-on experience with PCS's intuitive interfaces. We'll showcase select new capabilities that further streamline workflows. Ideal for researchers and engineers seeking to accelerate computation without infrastructure complexity.
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Hands-on; Interactive

title: HPC Sustainability by Design: Optimizing for Planet and Performance
description: Master the art of building sustainable HPC clusters on AWS that optimize both performance and environmental impact. This session demonstrates how to architect energy-efficient HPC workloads using Graviton-based instances and AWS Well-Architected Framework's Sustainability Pillar principles. Through practical examples from science and engineering domains, learn proven strategies to reduce carbon footprint while maintaining computational power. Walk away with actionable insights to implement green computing practices in your HPC infrastructure, and drive meaningful environmental improvements across your organization's high-performance workloads.
services: Amazon FSx for Lustre; Amazon EC2 - Graviton; AWS Parallel Computing Service
tags: Sustainability; Well-Architected Framework; Compute; Academic / Researcher; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Energy & Utilities; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Human Meets Microservice: Zero Trust with AWS Networking Services [REPEAT]
description: In today's evolving security landscape, organizations need secure access without complex VPN overhead. Zero Trust provides the new baseline. This hands-on session teaches you to enable identity-aware, least-privilege access for both human users and microservices using AWS Verified Access and Amazon VPC Lattice. You'll configure secure access from remote users to internal applications with Verified Access. Then build service-to-service communication across VPCs using VPC Lattice. Discover how to connect users and services—securely, efficiently, and without compromise. Whether you're responsible for secure remote access or service mesh connectivity, this session provides the practical knowledge to implement these solutions in your own environment. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Identity & Access Management; Networking & Content Delivery; Security & Identity; Hands-on; Interactive

description: In today's evolving security landscape, organizations need secure access without complex VPN overhead. Zero Trust provides the new baseline. title: Hybrid connectivity at scale: A deep dive into AWS Direct Connect
description: Unlock the full potential of AWS Direct Connect in this advanced technical deep dive. In this session, explore both dedicated and hosted connections, Virtual Interfaces (VIFs), and BGP routing optimization for predictable bandwidth and reduced data transfer costs. Learn from experts about complex architectures including Direct Connect Gateway for multi-Region connectivity, LAG configurations for redundancy, and capabilities such as AWS Direct Connect SiteLink. After diving into advanced features like MACsec encryption and cross-connect processes, attendees will gain insights into troubleshooting methodologies, performance optimization, and integration patterns with AWS Transit Gateway and AWS Cloud WAN.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: Hybrid Science: AI + Physics Simulations for Climate & Automotive Engineering
description: This chalk talk explores architectures that couple AI with physics-based simulations across climate science, weather forecasting, and automotive engineering. We'll examine how AWS technologies such as AWS Batch enable efficient workflows where numerical simulation outputs train AI models, which then feed downstream simulation tools. Through interactive discussion, we'll demonstrate real-world patterns for  computational efficiency and workflow orchestration. Learn practical approaches for implementing these hybrid pipelines – from using simulation-generated weather data to train AI models for rapid forecasting to computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations for AI-assisted intelligent aerodynamic surface design.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); AWS Batch; AWS Step Functions
tags: Compute; Interactive

title: I didn't know AWS SAM could do that [REPEAT]
description: Discover the hidden potential of AWS SAM for local serverless development. This technical deep-dive showcases how SAM transcends deployment to become your indispensable local development companion. You'll explore advanced techniques for testing AWS Lambda functions, Amazon API Gateway, and event sources on your laptop without cloud deployment. Experience how Amazon Q enhances the SAM experience, accelerating development cycles and enabling sophisticated local debugging. Learn how these powerful capabilities can dramatically reduce development time and cloud costs while improving the robustness of your serverless applications.
speakers: Daniel ABIB; Luis Miguel Flores dos Santos; Nicolas Tarzia; Ricardo Tasso; Charleston Telles
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; DevOps; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

Experience how Amazon Q enhances the SAM experience, accelerating development cycles and enabling sophisticated local debugging. Learn how these powerful capabilities can dramatically reduce development time and cloud costs while improving the robustness of your serverless applications.

title: I didn't know AWS WAF did this [REPEAT]
description: Think AWS WAF is just for blocking SQL injection and XSS? Think again. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into creative, real-world use cases - from deploying honeypots and shedding traffic, to stopping account fraud and mitigating DDoS at scale. We'll explore advanced configurations, walk through customer-tested patterns, and whiteboard strategies that make WAF a powerful tool in your security arsenal. Bring your questions and experiences - we're here to break the "WAF does that?" moments together.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: I didn't know AWS WAF did this [REPEAT]
description: Think AWS WAF is just for blocking SQL injection and XSS? Think again. tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: IAM Access Analyzer Deep Dive: From Configuration to Remediation
description: Dive deep into IAM Access Analyzer in this interactive code talk focused on enhancing your AWS security posture. Watch and code along as we explore the automated reasoning powers of the three key analyzers: Unused Access, External Access, and Internal Access. Through live coding demonstrations, you'll learn how to configure each analyzer and interpret their findings. We'll guide you through actionable recommendations and specific remediation steps for common issues identified by these tools, showing the actual code implementation. By the end of this code talk, you'll be equipped with the knowledge to effectively implement IAM Access Analyzer in your own environment, enabling you to proactively identify and address potential security risks, optimize access management, and maintain a robust security stance in your AWS infrastructure.
services: AWS CloudTrail; AWS IAM Identity Center; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
tags: DevSecOps; Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: IAM Access Analyzer from Research Paper to Reality
description: Discover how IAM Access Analyzer evolved from theoretical research into a practical service through a deep examination of its foundational paper on stratified predicate abstraction. Through live analysis of the paper that powers Access Analyzer's external access findings, you'll learn techniques for understanding complex technical publications, from quick assessment to deep comprehension. Whether you're curious about Access Analyzer's inner workings or looking to dive into research publications, you'll leave equipped to bridge the gap between academic theory and practical applications.
services: VPC Reachability Analyzer; AWS IAM Access Analyzer
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Academic / Researcher; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: IAM Analytics: Automate & Visualize [REPEAT]
description: In this Workshop, learn to create an automated pipeline that optimizes AWS IAM roles using CloudTrail, Athena, Lambda, DynamoDB, and IAM. We'll address the common challenge of overly permissive roles in AWS environments, especially after migrations or when establishing cloud foundations after a POC. You'll build a workflow that analyzes CloudTrail logs using Athena queries, processes results with Lambda, stores data in DynamoDB, and automatically adjusts IAM permissions. You'll also create a QuickSight dashboard to visualize permissions usage patterns with GenBI. This hands-on experience will equip you with skills to enhance security and efficiency in your AWS account management.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon QuickSight; AWS CloudTrail
tags: Architecture; Cloud Operations; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Hands-on; Interactive

title: IAM Analytics: Automate & Visualize [REPEAT]
description: In this Workshop, learn to create an automated pipeline that optimizes AWS IAM roles using CloudTrail, Athena, Lambda, DynamoDB, and IAM. We'll address the common challenge of overly permissive roles in AWS environments, especially after migrations or when establishing cloud foundations after a POC. You'll build a workflow that analyzes CloudTrail logs using Athena queries, processes results with Lambda, stores data in DynamoDB, and automatically adjusts IAM permissions. services: Amazon Athena; Amazon QuickSight; AWS CloudTrail

title: Illumina DRAGEN pipelines on F2 instances with Nextflow & AWS Batch
description: Navigate the critical transition from F1 to F2 instances for Illumina DRAGEN genomics pipelines as F1's end-of-life approaches in December 2025. This session demonstrates optimal configuration of DRAGEN pipelines using Nextflow and AWS Batch, focusing on performance optimization and monitoring strategies. Learn practical solutions for common debugging challenges and gain insights from a real-world biopharma migration case study. Whether you're new to DRAGEN or planning an F1 to F2 migration, discover best practices for implementing these complex genomics workflows. Ideal for bioinformaticians, life sciences developers, and IT infrastructure owners.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Architecture; Compute; Lecture-style

title: Implement Agentic AI at the edge for industrial automation
description: Manufacturing and industrial operations demand real-time, intelligent decision-making in low-connectivity environments. This code talk demonstrates how to deploy SmolVLMs (small vision language models) and AI agents to automate site operations using AWS Outposts and Strands Agents. The solution enables on-premises, multilingual interaction with safety protocols, documentation, and equipment data to enhance the productivity and safety of frontline workers. You’ll learn how to combine edge infrastructure, publicly available models, and agent frameworks to deliver context-aware, resilient AI for industrial automation.
tags: Edge Computing; Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Energy & Utilities; Manufacturing & Industrial; Interactive

title: Implement hybrid search with Aurora PostgreSQL for MCP retrieval [REPEAT]
description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) shifts the focus from relevance-based retrieval (RAG) to structured, queryable, and context-rich inputs for foundation models. In this session, learn how to build a hybrid search solution using pgvector, PostgreSQL full-text search, and query filters in Aurora PostgreSQL - all geared toward enabling MCP-style interactions. We'll walk through implementing weighted hybrid search combining vectors, SQL filters, and reranking, enabling LLMs to retrieve specific context slices based on time, persona, or operational context. Gain practical experience and ready-to-use templates for implementing hybrid search in your MCP-compatible generative AI applications, enabling more accurate and contextually aware AI interactions.
speakers: Chirag Dave; Radwan Deeb; Sergey Melnik; Shayon Sanyal; Baji Shaik
tags: Open Data; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) shifts the focus from relevance-based retrieval (RAG) to structured, queryable, and context-rich inputs for foundation models. title: Implement Low-code Agentic Finance Analytics for SAP
description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn to automate SAP financial data processing and create dynamic dashboards using low-code, agent-based AI solutions through Amazon Q Business. You will begin by integrating MCP servers  with SAP S/4HANA using a standard plugin within Amazon Q Business. Then, you will setup real-time cash flow analysis, daily cash reporting, and account settlement automation, and test the analytics by comparing real-time data against daily batch reconciliation reports. You will gain knowledge on using fully managed, low-code tools to enhance SAP business processes.
tags: SAP; Migration & Modernization; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Implement Modern Data and Lakehouse Architectures with Amazon SageMaker
description: Discover Amazon SageMaker's unified approach to data management across S3 data lakes, Redshift warehouses, and third-party sources. Master both federated and managed catalogs while working with diverse enterprise datasets. Practice hands-on integration of multiple storage types (S3, RMS), implement cross-engine querying, and explore unified data access patterns. Perfect for data architects building modern, scalable analytics environments.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Training & Certification; Developer Tools; Storage; Developer / Engineer; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Implement RAG while meeting data residency requirements
description: As governments develop data protection and privacy regulations, organizations increasingly need to leverage generative AI with regulated data that needs to remain on-premises to meet data sovereignty requirements. This session explores how to implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with on-premises and edge data. Learn how to extend Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones for a hybrid RAG architecture, or build a local RAG architecture for more stringent data residency requirements. Discover the latest techniques like reranker models to improve precision without increasing model size, reduce inference cost, and enforce more governance and control over prompt outcomes.
tags: Data Protection; Digital Sovereignty; Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Implement Secure & Scalable Admin Controls in Amazon QuickSight
description: Join us to explore Amazon QuickSight's enterprise governance capabilities. Learn to implement robust controls while scaling BI across your organization. We'll cover identity management, resource monitoring, and compliance features, focusing on role-based access, quota management, and audit trails. Discover how to structure organizational hierarchies, manage costs, and automate security controls. Through practical examples, see how to balance security with operational efficiency. Perfect for platform owners and administrators seeking to establish comprehensive governance frameworks.
tags: Interactive

title: Implement secure automated workflows with AWS Systems Manager
description: IT operations teams face challenges in manually managing security incidents and access controls across their AWS infrastructure, leading to slow response times and potential compliance risks. This session shows how AWS Systems Manager enables you to build automated responses to security and operational incidents. You'll learn to create secure workflows that integrate with your existing tools while maintaining detailed audit trails. We'll demonstrate how to implement controlled emergency access procedures and show how Systems Manager's permission model ensures security compliance. Through practical examples, you'll see how to develop automated runbooks that reduce remediation time and maintain governance. Whether you're managing a small AWS deployment or a complex enterprise environment, you'll learn how to build a framework that balances operational efficiency with security controls.
tags: Management & Governance; Automation; DevSecOps; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Implementing Advanced Data Protection Controls
description: Protect sensitive data throughout its lifecycle in this hands-on workshop focused on securing data in transit and at rest. Build a real-time TLS monitoring system using CloudTrail and CloudWatch to detect outdated protocols with automated alerts—preparing for future protocol deprecations beyond TLS 1.2. Implement automated discovery of sensitive information with Macie, configure S3 encryption, and establish key rotation with KMS and Secrets Manager. Through practical exercises simulating real-world scenarios, you'll develop immediately applicable skills to detect, classify, and secure sensitive information across your AWS environment while satisfying both security best practices and compliance requirements.
services: AWS CloudTrail; AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS); AWS Secrets Manager
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Implementing advanced Serverless resilience: A practitioner's guide [REPEAT]
description: While serverless platforms provide built-in reliability features, achieving true resilience requires intentional architectural choices. At scale, we must go beyond service features and implement proven architectural patterns for distributed systems. We'll explore cell-based architectures that contain failure impact, domain-driven design for clear bounded contexts, and recovery mechanisms including event replay and automated remediation. Multi-region deployment strategies enable geographic redundancy and seamless failover. Join us to learn practical techniques for implementing serverless systems that maintain operations across regional failures and recover automatically from unexpected conditions.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Resilience; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Implementing agentic AI solutions on-premises and at the edge
description: As governments and standards bodies develop data protection and privacy regulations, organizations increasingly need to combine the use of generative AI tooling in the cloud with regulated data that needs to remain on-premises to meet data residency requirements. In this workshop, learn how to extend Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to hybrid and edge services like AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones to build distributed agentic applications using Model Context Protocol (MCP) and agent-to-agent (A2A) communication with on-premises data for improved model outcomes. Get hands-on with hybrid agentic AI using Amazon Bedrock and Strands Agents while exploring AWS hybrid and edge services.
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Local Zones; AWS Outposts
tags: Digital Sovereignty; Edge Computing; Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Implementing Automated Security Controls for Zero-Day Defense
description: Manual security responses to vulnerabilities across cloud environments create operational bottlenecks and increase risk exposure in today's evolving threat landscape. Learn how to strengthen your security posture by combining vulnerability management with automated risk controls using Amazon Inspector, AWS Systems Manager, and AWS Security Hub. We'll demonstrate effective response strategies for zero-day vulnerabilities across Amazon EC2 instances and AWS Regions, implementing automated compliance monitoring and continuous control validation through infrastructure and policy as code.
services: Amazon Inspector; AWS Security Hub; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Management & Governance; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Automation; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Implementing generative and agentic AI in multicloud environments
description: Organizations implementing AI across multiple cloud providers face challenges such as secure deployment, management of AI agents, and enabling their builders to quickly innovate by leveraging models of their choice. In this chalk talk, we'll explore practical approaches to building secure, enterprise-grade generative AI solutions in multicloud environments. We will dive deep into orchestration of generative AI workflows and demonstrate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) patterns that securely access data spread across different cloud providers. We'll walk through establishing Model Context Protocol (MCP) agent security models, optimizing data accessibility, and maintaining governance across cloud providers.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Interactive

title: Implementing Human-in-the-Loop Controls for Multi-Agent AI Systems
description: While AI agents offer powerful automation capabilities, many critical business workflows require human oversight and approval. This 20-minute lightning talk demonstrates practical patterns for integrating human-in-the-loop (HITL) controls within multi-agent AI systems. Learn how to design asynchronous agent workflows that incorporate human decision points using serverless architectures. We'll explore real-world examples showing when and how to implement HITL effectively while maintaining system reliability and scalability. Walk away with actionable patterns for building AI agent systems that balance automation with appropriate human oversight.
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS); AWS Lambda
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Lambda-Based Applications; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; Lecture-style

title: Implementing observability at scale: A blueprint for success
description: Achieving comprehensive observability to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and user experience is crucial for businesses. In this session, we will explore best practices for collecting and analyzing metrics, traces, and logs across your AWS environments. Discover techniques for streamlining agent management, optimizing alerting, and enabling cross-account observability. Learn how to reduce operational overhead while gaining deeper visibility into your applications' performance and health in a cost-optimized manner.
tags: Management & Governance; Monitoring & Observability; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Lecture-style

title: Implementing security best practices for serverless applications
description: Discover how to maximize security in serverless architectures while maintaining developer velocity. This session explores enterprise-proven security best practices across the serverless application lifecycle, from development to production. Learn how to leverage AWS's built-in security features, implement effective security controls, and establish proper guardrails without hampering innovation. Drawing from real customer experiences, we'll demonstrate practical approaches to strengthen your security posture while enabling developers to build and deploy with confidence
services: Amazon API Gateway; AWS Lambda; AWS Step Functions
tags: Application Security; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Improve Manufacturing Production Planning with Amazon SageMaker
description: For manufacturers, delivery of product components or ingredients is critical to meet production schedules. Learn how to mitigate supply chain disruptions with AI-driven analysis to process data from disparate sources dynamically, enabling real-time adjustments to the production plan with agentic workflows. This workshop will demonstrate how leveraging Amazon SageMaker can accelerate the development of AI-powered supply chain management to transform potential catastrophic supply chain disruptions into a manageable operational challenges, minimizing financial impact and maintaining business continuity.
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Business Executive; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Improve self-managed database performance and agility with Amazon FSx
description: Learn how Amazon FSx can modernize Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle DB, SAP HANA and others by supercharging performance and improving data protection and resilience. Learn how to choose the right FSx service (FSx for NetApp ONTAP, FSx for OpenZFS, and FSx for Windows File Server) to optimize the TCO of your database environments. We will review practical migration strategies and best practices for resilience including how to protect with replication with the ability to recover in minutes. This session is ideal for anyone who is migrating from on premises and wants to learn the latest in database performance tuning and high availability.
services: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP; Amazon FSx for OpenZFS; Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
tags: Data Protection; Resilience; Cost Optimization; Databases; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Improving Availability with EC2 Best Practices for Application Monitoring
description: Organizations running critical applications on Amazon EC2 need to detect application-level issues before they impact users. This session demonstrates EC2 best practices for monitoring of application health, faster detection of failures, and automation of recovery actions. Attendees will learn how to advance beyond basic infrastructure monitoring to detect complex issues that can impact application performance and availability. Through demonstrations and architectural discussions, the session will cover configuring advanced monitoring checks, integrating them with auto-scaling solutions, and implementing automated recovery mechanisms.
tags: Compute; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Improving citizens customer experience
description: Explore how state and local governments can revolutionize citizen interactions through AI-driven modernization. This interactive chalk talk demonstrates how organizations can leverage data platforms, machine learning, and generative AI to create personalized, responsive citizen experiences. Learn proven architectures and implementation strategies for common government scenarios, from permit processing to public service delivery. Discover flexible frameworks that adapt to evolving data requirements and citizen needs. Walk away with actionable insights to transform your agency's citizen engagement through cutting-edge technology while maintaining security and compliance.
tags: Advisor / Consultant; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Improving multimedia analytics with customized Amazon Nova models
description: Transform your multimedia analysis performance and capabilities by customizing Amazon Nova foundation models. This hands-on builder session, designed for experienced practitioners, explores advanced Nova customization techniques for enterprise-scale multimedia workloads. You'll learn practical strategies for model optimization, cost management, and implementing efficient workflows to handle complex multimedia analysis tasks. Our AWS experts will guide you through real-world examples of Nova customization that have helped organizations achieve significant improvement in processing efficiency.
speakers: Vijay Karthick Baskar; Raja GT; Rajesh Gomatam; Ajit Kumar KP; Shiva Mahalingam; Arabinda Pani
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Advertising & Marketing; Government; Media & Entertainment; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Incorporating generative AI in the CI/CD pipeline
description: In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon Q Developer’s agentic capabilities in Gitlab Duo and GitHub is transforming the developer experience by speeding up a range of tasks that support you as you research how to get started, evaluate system design, build secure and scalable applications, upgrade existing applications, and optimize application performance. Gain insights into how Amazon Q Developer capabilities for building, testing, reviewing, and transforming applications faster and more easily frees you up to focus on experimentation and innovation
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Increase your database agility with Amazon FSx
description: Get hands-on experience optimizing self-managed Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MySQL databases on Amazon EC2 using Amazon FSx. Learn how FSx's advanced features transform database operations through snapshots, cloning, backup, and replication. Discover techniques to reduce RPO/RTO from hours to seconds and implement robust business continuity strategies. Practice using zero-space cloning to create instant, isolated database environments for streamlined development cycles without additional storage overhead. This workshop is ideal for architects, administrators, and engineers seeking to enhance their cloud database management capabilities.
services: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP; Amazon FSx for OpenZFS; Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
tags: Management & Governance; Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Databases; Storage; Data Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Indeed's migration to Amazon S3 Tables
description: Discover how Indeed is actively modernizing their data infrastructure with Amazon S3 Tables through an ambitious 80PB data lake transformation. Follow their ongoing journey as they migrate 12,000+ tables from Hive to S3 Tables and learn how they're tackling complex migration challenges while already realizing significant cost benefits. You'll get answers to common concerns about large-scale data modernization, supported by early results. You'll gain practical insights for making strategic decisions about your data infrastructure, whether you're planning a similar transformation or evaluating your data management options. Learn from Indeed's experiences as they progress through this major modernization initiative.
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Industrial-scale agentic web automation with vLLM and Amazon SageMaker AI
description: Learn to build industrial-scale infrastructure for fine-tuning and deploying the GLM-4.5V vision model to power real-world web automation. In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to leverage AWS vLLM Deep Learning Containers (DLCs) and Amazon SageMaker AI to create a secure, scalable, and cost-optimized solution for enterprise workloads. You’ll see a practical walkthrough of implementing GLM-4.5V on SageMaker AI for agentic automation—from fine-tuning to deployment—culminating in a live example of automating complex web interactions at scale. You’ll leave with actionable insights and reference architectures for building enterprise-ready, vision-powered automation with SageMaker AI.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Inference on AWS Trainium and Amazon EKS using vLLM
description: Join us for a immersive, hands-on workshop to learn to deploy and optimize large language models (LLMs) for scalable inference at enterprise scale. Participants will learn to orchestrate distributed LLM serving with vLLM on Amazon EKS, enabling robust, flexible, and highly available deployments. This session demonstrates how to utilize AWS Trainium hardware within EKS to maximize throughput and cost efficiency, leveraging Kubernetes-native features for automated scaling, resource management, and seamless integration with AWS services. You'll gain hands-on experience using observability tools like CloudWatch Container Insights or the open telemetry stack, along with AWS Neuron tools to effectively monitor inference workloads.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS Trainium
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Infrastructure and Service Innovation Keynote
description: Join AWS SVP Peter DeSantis and Dave Brown, Vice President of Compute and Machine Learning Services as they dive deep into the engineering that powers AWS services. Get a closer look at how our unique approach and culture of innovation help create leading-edge solutions, from silicon to services.

title: Infrastructure Automation with Amazon Q CLI and EC2 Image Builder
description: Speed up EC2 Image Builder pipeline development with Amazon Q CLI's AI capabilities. Through hands-on exercises, create sophisticated infrastructure code using intelligent automation. Starting with Amazon Q CLI's enhanced agentic experience that can read and write files locally, query AWS resources, and automatically debug issues, you'll build sophisticated image pipelines that leverage the latest EC2 Image Builder innovations. The session showcases how Q CLI integrates with Systems Manager Parameter Store for dynamic configuration management, while utilizing EC2 Image Builder's customizable image workflows to modify build and test phases for industry-specific requirements
speakers: Ali Alzand; Malini Chatterjee; Prashanth Ganapathy; Smriti Ohri; Ariana Rahgozar
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Q; EC2 Image Builder
tags: Compute; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Infrastructure protection at scale with AWS Security, ft. Block, Inc.
description: Learn best practices from AWS and Block's Network Security team on how to architect a robust network security strategy using AWS Network Firewall, AWS WAF and other security services to protect large-scale infrastructure. This session explores real implementation patterns to protect egress and ingress, covers architectural decisions, and lessons learned while building advanced security controls.
speakers: Dustin Ellis; Amish Shah; Ramesh Ramani
services: AWS Network Firewall; AWS Shield; AWS WAF
tags: Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Innovating with AWS Confidential Computing: An Integrated Approach
description: Confidential computing enables customers to protect code and data from unauthorized access during processing.  This session explores AWS's innovation on confidential computing capabilities including the AWS Nitro System, AWS Nitro Enclaves, and the Nitro Trusted Platform Module.  Learn how Nitro System capabilities can be used to meet evolving data protection challenges, such as confidential inferencing. The session will cover concepts that range from isolation from cloud operators to leveraging cryptographic capabilities on CPU, GPU, and AI accelerator-based instances for applications handling highly sensitive data such as personally identifiable information, financial assets, medical information, intellectual property, and AI data.
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Compute; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Innovation in Identity Security: how we protect the cloud and help you do it too
description: At AWS, identity is foundational to cloud security, both in how we protect the platform itself and in how we enable customers to secure what they build. In this session, we'll share the approaches and mechanisms AWS uses to strengthen identity across the stack: from secure-by-design development and automated policy controls to tools that detect auth issues and support data perimeter adoption. You'll also learn about our latest innovations in access management, data perimeters, machine identity, agentic identity, and how these capabilities are shaping the future of identity security. Discover how we're raising the bar for identity security, and how you can apply these same strategies and new capabilities in your environment.
tags: Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Innovation Sandbox on AWS: Automating Temporary Cloud Environments
description: Cloud administrators face challenges in efficiently managing temporary sandbox environments while maintaining security and cost control. Innovation Sandbox on AWS addresses this by automating the deployment and management of short-lived sandbox environments. It implements service control policies, spend controls, and account recycling mechanisms, saving weeks of administration time. This solution enhances operational efficiency, establishes cost governance, and empowers teams to experiment and innovate on AWS within controlled, standardized environments. Whether you're running GenAI experiments, managing student labs, or developer environments, learn how this solution can streamline your sandbox operations.
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Identity & Access Management; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Innovations  in Infrastructure Protection to strengthen your network
description: In this session, learn about new capabilities in infrastructure protection services like AWS Network Firewall, Amazon Route 53 DNS Firewall, AWS WAF, and AWS Shield, to simplify your application protection, streamline robust egress protections and gain insight into your network. Dive deep into how new visibility investments can give insight  into misconfigurations, possible threats, and proactive identification of network configuration issues.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Security & Identity; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Innovations in SQL Analytics: What's new in Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena
description: Learn how AWS is enhancing its SQL analytics offerings with new capabilities in Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena. Discover how Redshift's AI-powered data warehousing capabilities are enabling customers to modernize their analytics workloads with enhanced performance and cost optimization. Explore Athena's latest features for interactively querying data directly in their Amazon S3 data lakes. This session showcases new features and real-world examples of how organizations are using these services to accelerate business insights while optimizing costs.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon RedShift; Amazon Redshift Serverless
tags: Business Intelligence; Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Migration & Modernization; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: Inside a multi-tenant architecture built with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore [REPEAT]
description: The introduction of Amazon Bedrock AgentCore provides builders with a range of new tools and constructs that can be used to design, secure, scale, and implement a multi-tenant agent. This session will look at how different multi-tenant patterns and strategies are realized through different AgentCore components, configurations, and deployment models. This includes enabling tenant-aware outcomes with tenant-specific workflows, memory, and MCP servers using the AgentCore gateway. We’ll also look at how multi-tenant agents are operated and secured with AgentCore’s observability and identity constructs. The goal is to examine each of the multi-tenant agentic models, through the lens of each of these AgentCore mechanisms.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

description: The introduction of Amazon Bedrock AgentCore provides builders with a range of new tools and constructs that can be used to design, secure, scale, and implement a multi-tenant agent. This session will look at how different multi-tenant patterns and strategies are realized through different AgentCore components, configurations, and deployment models. This includes enabling tenant-aware outcomes with tenant-specific workflows, memory, and MCP servers using the AgentCore gateway. We’ll also look at how multi-tenant agents are operated and secured with AgentCore’s observability and identity constructs. The goal is to examine each of the multi-tenant agentic models, through the lens of each of these AgentCore mechanisms.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Inside an agentic SaaS control plane
description: Most SaaS environments include some notion of a control plane. This plane support all the cross-cutting needs of a SaaS environment (onboarding, billing, metering, tenant management, etc.). The question is: what does a control plane look like in a agentic universe? In this chalk talk, we’ll look at how agents can be introduced into your SaaS control plane, decomposing your experience into a series of collaborating agents that own responsibility for orchestrating your control plane capabilities. It’s here that we’ll dive into how we can achieve new efficiencies and adaptability into our control plane, leveraging the strengths of agents to enrich the capabilities of SaaS control planes.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Inside multi-tenant cell-based SaaS architectures
description: Building a multi-tenant SaaS architecture is a balancing act. Finding the right blend of cost efficiency, scale, resilience, and operational agility can be challenging. It’s here that a cell-based architecture can often represents a natural fit. The cell-based model gives you new ways to approach tenant isolation, deployment, scaling, regional distribution, and tiering, bringing a range of new possibilities to your SaaS architecture and operational footprint. In this session, we’ll go under the hood of a cell-based multi-tenant architecture, highlighting the strategies, patterns, and considerations that come with employing this model.
tags: SaaS; DevOps; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Inside S3: Lessons from exabyte-scale data lake modernization
description: Amazon S3 internally processes hundreds of petabytes daily across microservices, generating millions of logs. This session chronicles S3's journey from basic log analysis to a modern Apache Iceberg-based data lake. We’ll explore key architectural transitions: replacing legacy processing with SQL capabilities, migrating from unstructured text to Iceberg tables, and implementing enhanced ingestion engines. Discover our decision-making process for format selection, backward compatibility, and maintaining operations during complex migrations. Gain practical insights for your own data modernization projects, from technology selection to managing legacy constraints while ensuring business continuity throughout transformational changes.
tags: Management & Governance; Well-Architected Framework; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Storage; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Inside the Attack Chain: Emerging Threat Actor Tactics and Techniques
description: Get up to speed on emerging threat actor tactics and techniques across the attack chain. In this session, we'll expound upon methods of Initial Access, Persistence, Defense Evasion, Lateral Movement, and Impact. You'll gain practical knowledge of specific configurations to detect and mitigate these threats, and learn common misconfigurations to avoid.
services: Amazon GuardDuty; AWS Security Incident Response
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; Security & Identity; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Instrument Your Serverless Apps for Full Visibility [AWS Partners only]
description: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Gain comprehensive visibility across your entire serverless architecture. Learn to monitor AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and supporting services through hands-on exercises. Practice implementing end-to-end observability using CloudWatch and X-Ray for complete application awareness. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Training & Certification

title: Integrate and orchestrate data workflows with AWS Glue & managed Apache Airflow [REPEAT]
description: Elevate your data integration and workflow orchestration capabilities in this hands-on session with AWS Glue and Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA). Learn to easily build ETL pipelines across data lakes, warehouses and databases with Glue, and orchestrate end-to-end data processing workflows across distributed systems with automated DAGs for data ingestion, transformation, and consumption.
speakers: Akhilesh Dube; Raks Khare; Ananth Kommuri; Lydia Ray
services: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (Amazon MWAA); AWS Glue
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

Learn to easily build ETL pipelines across data lakes, warehouses and databases with Glue, and orchestrate end-to-end data processing workflows across distributed systems with automated DAGs for data ingestion, transformation, and consumption.

services: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (Amazon MWAA); AWS Glue

title: Integrate any agent framework with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: Bring existing agents to AWS with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Whether you've built custom agents or use frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, or LlamaIndex, this session shows how to run them on secure, scalable AWS infrastructure without rewriting your logic. Discover how AgentCore's API-based orchestration integrates external agent frameworks and services, centralizing tooling, observability, memory, and security. Learn how Cohere Health successfully integrated their healthcare workflow agents with AgentCore to enable secure, scalable processing of healthcare prior authorization decisions, leveraging AgentCore's services like Runtime and Memory to meet strict healthcare compliance requirements while maintaining the flexibility to use their chosen frameworks.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Integrate serverless applications with AWS storage services
description: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You can integrate it with Amazon EFS and Amazon S3 for data persistence, enabling increased application availability and regional resiliency. In this workshop, discover how to build your serverless AI applications with persistent data in Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS. Additionally, explore how the application can process data as its being retrieved from Amazon S3, transcribe content, and use Amazon Bedrock for summarization. Learn how to network your Lambda functions with regional storage services for external data access and how to share data between serverless functions. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS); Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS Lambda
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Kubernetes; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Integrated AI Agents & Code Assistants with MCP & AWS [REPEAT]
description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is the foundation for building AI Agents and Code Assistants that are connected to your data, infrastructure, and services. Whether you are building AI for enterprise use cases or writing code that will run on AWS, MCP is the way to bring together intelligence and integration. This session will teach you what MCP is and the ways you can build MCP servers & clients with AWS. We will cover how to use AWS-related MCP servers in your code assistants as well as how to integrate MCP-powered AI Agents with your AWS data & servers.

title: Integrating virtual try-on into your ecommerce platforms
description: Create immersive shopping experiences by visualizing products in context with virtual try-on capabilities in Amazon Nova Canvas.  Whether it's clothing naturally draped on a shopper or furniture intelligently placed in a room, Amazon Nova Canvas creates realistic visualizations while preserving important details. This session will cover techniques and implementation recommendations to build the most engaging experience for your customers.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Retail & Consumer Goods; Interactive

title: Integration patterns for distributed systems
description: Today's applications are interconnected: they expose APIs, publish events, call third-party services, and externalize states. They must therefore address the fundamental challenges of distributed systems, such as out-of-order delivery, retries, idempotence, and partial failures. To address these challenges, architects must carefully evaluate integration options while considering how to manage complex system interactions. In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for distributed systems and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by examples.
services: Amazon EventBridge; Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS); Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Integration patterns for multi-tenant systems
description: Today's SaaS applications are interconnected: they expose APIs, publish events, call third-party services, and externalize states. Adding multi-tenancy to these integrations introduces new challenges. How do builders ensure tenant performance and data isolation whilst sharing resources? In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for multi-tenant integrations and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by examples.
services: Amazon EventBridge; Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS); Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; SaaS; Serverless; Application Integration; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Integration to impact: Accelerate AWS Partner revenue measurement
description: Discover how AWS Partners implement revenue measurement capabilities that allow partners to track and measure aggregated service consumption and automate revenue attribution by solutions and service engagements. In this session, partners will gain integration blueprints for solution deployments and customer engagements, with examples of how this data enhances the collaboration between AWS and partners. Technical and business leaders are invited to join us to learn how successful partners are leveraging measurement insights to create data-driven strategies, maximize partnership value, and drive joint customer success.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Training & Certification; Customer Enablement; Analytics; Business Executive; IT Executive; Independent Software Vendor; Lecture-style

title: Intelligent automation for managing cloud governance and compliance [REPEAT]
description: Manually processing and correlating compliance data can lead to delayed response times and missed security insights. Learn how to create smart workflows that analyze data from AWS compliance tools, including AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and AWS Audit Manager, to provide context-aware insights for efficient policy enforcement and risk management. Through hands-on exercises, build an automated solution that processes compliance queries and implements interfaces for complex governance investigations. Leave with a practical solution for automating compliance monitoring and enabling proactive risk management on AWS.
speakers: Guilherme Greco; Kisshore Gunasekaran; Avi Harari; Justin Plock; Luis Rodriguez Montilla
services: AWS Audit Manager; AWS Config; AWS Security Hub

title: Intelligent Document Processing at Scale Using Bedrock
description: Learn how Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) can embed intelligent document processing (IDP) into multi-tenant SaaS applications using AWS Step Functions, Lambda, and Amazon Bedrock Data Automation. This session shows how to build scalable, event driven document workflows that support up to 10,000 parallel executions while ensuring tenant isolation. Explore architectural patterns that use serverless services to extract structured data from PDFs, automate data entry, and build customizable extraction frameworks with consumption based pricing and efficient scaling. Walk away with reusable templates and patterns to quickly embed IDP capabilities that reduce manual work and help differentiate SaaS offerings.
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Lambda; AWS Step Functions
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Serverless; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Intelligent Document Processing with Amazon Bedrock
description: This lab teaches building an end-to-end Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) solution for invoice analysis. Learn to extract data using Amazon Textract, store information in Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB, and generate insights using Amazon Bedrock's Large Language Models (LLMs). Practice implementing automated document processing workflows combining structured data extraction with AI-powered analysis. Ideal for developers building automated document processing systems using Generative AI.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Textract

title: Intelligent Observability and Modernization with OpenSearch Service

title: Introducing AI driven development lifecycle (AI-DLC)
description: The AI-Driven Development Life Cycle (AI-DLC) represents a transformative approach to software engineering that positions AI as a central collaborator throughout the development process. Unlike traditional AI-assisted development methods, AI-DLC reimagines the entire software lifecycle through two key dimensions: AI-powered execution with human oversight and dynamic team collaboration. The methodology operates in three phases - Inception, Construction, and Operations - where AI initiates workflows while maintaining persistent context across all stages. This innovative approach delivers significant benefits including increased velocity, enhanced quality, improved market responsiveness, and better developer experience, all while ensuring critical human oversight and collaboration.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: It's About Time! Improving Distributed Systems with Amazon Time Sync
description: Keeping track of the order of events in distributed systems is one of the most fundamental and important problems in computer science. In 2023, we improved the Amazon Time Sync Service to microsecond-level clock accuracy so we, and our customers, can use wall-clock time in applications including databases, AI/ML, financial services, broadcast/media, telecommunications, and more to improve both the performance and resiliency of our systems and applications. We will be sharing how with real-world examples of AWS services now leveraging this capability, as well as direct customer references who are using precision time to build their next generation applications.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Global Infrastructure; Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

description: This session shares the journey of implementing a hybrid Data Mesh architecture within a multi-company holding, balancing centralization and decentralization needs. We will cover how our hybrid approach leverages Amazon EMR on EKS for data lake ingestion and Amazon SageMaker to enable self-service data discovery, data product subscription, and consumption, allowing companies within the group to autonomously explore, access, and utilize data products while maintaining centralized governance. Through ITTI - Grupo Vázquez's real-world experience, attendees will learn how this hybrid data mesh architecture successfully addresses diverse data domains, varying governance requirements, and rapid value delivery needs.
services: Amazon EMR; Amazon SageMaker; AWS Lake Formation
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Architecture; Data Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

Learn how Amazon Q Developer streamlines Java application modernization through automated code analysis and guided migration paths, helping developers confidently upgrade from Java 8 to Java 21. The workshop includes deploying test environments using CloudFormation, comparing performance across different instances, and leveraging Amazon Q’s contextual code recommendations. You’ll walk away with knowledge on how to optimize your Java workloads. Requires laptop to participate.

tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: JPMC and Amazon Advanced Solutions Lab drive quantum R&D on Braket
description: The study introduces qReduMIS, a quantum-informed reduction algorithm for solving maximum independent set problems. This hybrid quantum-classical framework combines traditional kernelization techniques with quantum computing insights. The quantum computer serves as a co-processor, identifying vertices likely to be in large independent sets, which helps optimize the reduction process. Testing on Rydberg quantum hardware through Amazon Braket, using up to 231 qubits, demonstrated that qReduMIS can address performance limitations in both classical and quantum solvers. The framework can be implemented on various quantum platforms, including superconducting qubits and trapped ions, with potential for future enhancements.
speakers: Michael Brett; Martin Schuetz; Romina Yalovetzky
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Lecture-style

We'll demonstrate how to make REST APIs instantly accessible to AI agents using Kiro's vibe coding approach to naturally understand your intent alongside AgentCore Gateway's integration framework and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Watch practical examples of transforming a real legacy application into an AI-enabled system, showing how Kiro and AgentCore work together to modernize your infrastructure with zero modifications to original codebases.

title: Known Unknowns: Bayesian Multi-Path Framework for Uncertainty in LLMs
description: This session presents a novel Bayesian framework for quantifying uncertainty in enterprise large language models through multi-perspective reasoning. We demonstrate how combining Bradley-Terry probability models with PageRank algorithms enables systematic decomposition of epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty patterns. Our approach automatically triggers appropriate enhancement strategies—retrieval augmentation, tool calling, or foundation model responses—based on uncertainty thresholds. Our approach transforms uncertainty from a limitation into actionable intelligence, enabling data-driven decisions about model customization and knowledge integration. Discover how enterprises can use uncertainty patterns to optimize retrieval strategies, reduce computational costs, and improve model reliability in mission-critical applications. Attendees receive practical implementation guidance for production deployments.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Cost Optimization; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Light qubits in the AWS network
description: For many customers, the word qubit suggests impossibly sophisticated computing circuits operating at near zero temperatures in a steampunk-looking contraption. However, photonic qubits are made out of laser light, work at room temperature, and travel through the same fibers as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) or Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data. In this session, discover how these flying qubits can work together with existing AWS infrastructure. You will learn how to deliver enhanced security, distributed clock signals, and provide the foundation for a quantum-enabled cloud.

title: LLMs Reflecting on Reasoning: A Probabilistic VC-Theory Approach
description: As LLMs tackle increasingly complex reasoning tasks, can they accurately evaluate their own reasoning quality? We introduce a novel theoretical framework extending classical VC-dimension to probabilistic models through two measures—Probabilistic VC (PVC) and Calibration-aware PVC (C-PVC)—that quantify a model's ability to generalize and assign meaningful confidence. Our benchmark demonstrates important patterns: models trained with reinforcement learning often display high pattern recognition but poor calibration. These findings provide practitioners with practical metrics to assess model reliability and insights into how different training approaches affect self-reflection capabilities—critical knowledge for deploying trustworthy AI systems that can monitor their own reasoning processes.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Student; Interactive
