title: Maximize ROI: How Octus migrated CreditAI from Azure to Amazon Bedrock
description: This session reveals how Octus migrated CreditAI to Amazon Bedrock. We will detail Octus' journey from managing multiple cloud providers and costly GPU instances to implementing a streamlined architecture using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Fargate, and Amazon OpenSearch. Learn how Octus achieved zero downtime while reducing costs, improving scalability to handle millions of documents, and enhancing response quality. Discover practical strategies for consolidating AI operations and leveraging AWS to deliver powerful, conversational intelligence at enterprise scale.
speakers: Lavanya Bandari; Vaibhav Sabharwal; Vishal Saxena
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon OpenSearch Service; AWS Fargate
tags: Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Small & Medium Business; Lecture-style

title: Maximize the value of cold data with Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes
description: The data world has massive amounts of cold data, but with advanced analytics and increased demand for machine learning, it could be put to work at any time. In this session, learn how to use Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes to modernize your data archive and cost-effectively store long-term data without worrying about expensive tape drives or off-premises archival data. Discover the options for ingesting and restoring your data at petabyte scale while taking into consideration cost and retrieval performance.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Cost Optimization; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Maximizing block storage performance for high-intensity workloads
description: Amazon EBS handles over 140 trillion I/O operations daily. Performance matters, a lot, but it’s not just about average performance—it’s about stable ultra-low latency that minimizes outliers or tail latency. io2 Block Express volumes are designed for that purpose with consistent sub-millisecond latency and 99.999% durability for critical applications such as SAP HANA, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, and more. Learn about how its performance characteristics optimize compute utilization, leading to cost efficiency and the success of many performance-demanding use cases. Explore how the expanded support for Multi-Attach NVMe Reservations, Amazon EC2 Nitro instances, and Amazon RDS drives new innovations and architecture enhancements.
services: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Innovation & Transformation; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Maximizing customer outcomes: AWS Partner Led Customer Success
description: As customer needs become more sophisticated, especially with the increased adoption of AI, and the range of AWS services continues to expand, partners play an increasingly critical role in ensuring successful outcomes and value realization for our customers. Through our new Partner Led Customer Success initiatives, we're equipping you with the mechanisms needed to systematically drive value realization. Whether you're supporting customers in their early AI experiments or guiding large-scale deployments, this session will preview the actionable frameworks and best practices we will share to enhance your customer success capabilities and deliver lasting value in partnership with AWS.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: Maximizing EC2 Local NVMe Storage: Enhanced NVMe Metrics and K8s Integration
description: Discover how to leverage the full potential of the latest high performance Nitro SSDs in EC2 storage-optimized instances for data-intensive workloads. This technical session also explores new capabilities for monitoring and managing NVMe instance storage on EC2. Learn how to leverage enhanced performance metrics including latency, IOPS, and throughput statistics to optimize and troubleshoot data-intensive workloads on Nitro-based instances. We'll also demonstrate the new AWS Local Instance Storage (LIS) CSI driver that enables simplified management of NVMe volumes in Amazon EKS environments. You'll learn best practices for monitoring storage performance and integrating the LIS CSI driver in containerized applications.
tags: Compute; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Maximizing EC2 Performance: A Hands-on Guide to Instance Optimization [REPEAT]
description: In this Code Talk, we'll explore advanced techniques for extracting optimal performance from Amazon EC2 instances through hands-on demonstrations and real-world examples. Watch as we implement systematic workload analysis using native AWS tools including CloudWatch and APerf, showing you how to measure and interpret key performance indicators across instance types. Through live coding, we'll demonstrate how to optimize application code for different programming languages to fully leverage EC2 capabilities. You'll leave with a better understanding of how to match instances to specific workload patterns, equipped with concrete methods to fine-tune your EC2 instances and applications for maximum performance and cost-effectiveness.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon EC2 - Graviton
tags: Cost Optimization; Compute; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: In this Code Talk, we'll explore advanced techniques for extracting optimal performance from Amazon EC2 instances through hands-on demonstrations and real-world examples. Watch as we implement systematic workload analysis using native AWS tools including CloudWatch and APerf, showing you how to measure and interpret key performance indicators across instance types. title: MCP Server for Amazon S3 Tables: AI-powered data operations
description: Explore how the Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server transforms S3 Tables management through AI-assisted operations. This chalk talk demonstrates building intelligent agents that leverage MCP Server's contextual understanding to automate table creation, schema management, and data operations using natural language interactions. Learn advanced patterns for integrating AI assistants with S3 Tables, implementing secure permission frameworks, and orchestrating complex data workflows through the MCP protocol.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Measure what matters: Web & API optimization with Amazon CloudFront
description: How fast is your content really reaching your users? In this session, we explore how to measure the real-world performance of web applications & APIs delivered via Amazon CloudFront. Learn how to combine server-side metrics (from CloudFront) with client-side telemetry (e.g. Core Web Vitals, CMCD, Server-Timing) for a complete view of performance. We will discuss benchmarking, troubleshooting, and alerting strategies — and leave with actionable patterns you can apply.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Global Infrastructure; Monitoring & Observability; Networking & Content Delivery; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Advertising & Marketing; Retail & Consumer Goods; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Measuring AI Impact with Amazon Q Developer and Jellyfish
description: Development leaders are struggling to show the impact of AI in software development. No single tool, such as Amazon Q Developer, can give the full picture. In this session hear from Genesys about their journey to measure the impact of AI and how the integration of Amazon Q Developer metrics into the Jellyfish platform gave them the visibility they needed. Attendees will learn about ways that AI Impacts software development, how the ingestion of Q Developer metrics into Jellyfish can shed light on those impacts over time and how a customer took that information and was able to tell the story of the impact of AI on their Development process.
tags: Management & Governance; Responsible AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Meet ultra-low latency and high throughput needs with AWS Outposts
description: This session dives deep into the new category of accelerated networking Amazon EC2 instances on AWS Outposts, purpose-built for modernizing ultra-low latency and high-throughput mission-critical workloads such as core trading systems of financial exchanges, real-time market data distribution, telecom 5G infrastructure, and media distribution. Discover how bare metal networking works and how precision time protocol, L2 multicast, and other innovative features deliver the performance required by some of the most demanding on-premises workloads. Learn how to design and architect for continued operations under various disconnection scenarios to uphold the highest level of resiliency.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Outposts
tags: Edge Computing; Resilience; Well-Architected Framework; Compute; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Financial Services; Government; Telecommunications; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Metadata Intelligence: The Key to Trusted and Smart Agentic AI Systems
description:
Discover how metadata intelligence forms the foundation of trustworthy, enterprise-grade agentic AI systems. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into a comprehensive metadata-driven architecture encompassing context enrichment, data lineage tracking, schema management, query usage patterns, and domain-specific knowledge graphs.

Through live technical demonstrations, you'll see how strategic metadata strengthens AI system quality and reliability. We'll walk through practical implementations using Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, OpenSearch, and Redshift, showing how these services work together to address critical AI challenges at scale. Come prepared with your most complex metadata problems—we'll tackle them together on the whiteboard.
services: Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); AWS Glue
tags: Generative AI; Management & Governance; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); IT Professional / Technical Manager; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Microseconds matter: Architect ultra-low latency trading platforms
description: Digital asset trading platforms demand high performance, ultra-low latency, and high availability infrastructure to address the 24/7 operational model of cryptocurrency exchanges and market makers. In this interactive session, we will live architect strategies to build solutions for high-frequency trading applications. Dive deep into best practices such as distributed state machines, and multi-AZ designs that improve scalability and high availability. Learn how to leverage differentiated capabilities such as Amazon EC2 Cluster Placement Groups and Amazon Time Sync Service’s PTP Hardware Clocks to fulfill your low latency requirements on AWS.
tags: Blockchain; Global Infrastructure; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Compute; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Interactive

title: Migrate and Modernize Legacy Workflows to Intelligent Agents
description: Modernize your enterprise clients' legacy workflows into intelligent, AI-powered solutions with AWS's innovative Move to AI pathway methodology. This technical session explores how to leverage Model Context Protocol (MCP) and generative AI  including AWS Transform to overcome the limitations of rigid, rule-based systems. Learn to build specialized offerings that modernize on-premises workflows into context-aware agents, creating new revenue streams through industry-specific accelerators. Discover how to help clients reduce operational costs, accelerate time-to-market, and gain competitive advantage by bridging traditional systems with cloud-native AI capabilities. Position yourself as a digital transformation leader in the AI-driven enterprise landscape.

tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Automation; Business Applications; Migration & Modernization; Advisor / Consultant; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Migrate and modernize VMware and Java workloads with on-premises dependencies
description: During cloud migration, certain workloads must stay on-premises or at the edge due to latency-sensitive application interdependencies, data residency requirements, or local data processing needs. This workshop guides you through migrating VMware and Java applications to AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones while modernizing them through containerization. You will initialize AWS Application Migration Service, set up post-launch actions, containerize applications using AWS Systems Manager Automation documents, pull container images from Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR), and deploy containerized applications to AWS Outposts. Leave this workshop with practical skills in migrating legacy applications.
services: AWS Local Zones; AWS Outposts; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Digital Sovereignty; VMware; Containers; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Migration & Modernization; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Migrate from VMware to AWS: Cloud Operations Best Practices
description: Planning to migrate your VMware workloads to AWS? This interactive session will equip you with strategies to streamline operations and maximize the benefits of Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) using AWS Cloud Operation services. Learn how to leverage tools like AWS Organizations, CloudTrail, Config, CloudWatch, and Systems Manager to automate routine tasks, enhance visibility, implement robust governance, and accelerate your migration timeline. Walk away with actionable insights to not only ease your migration journey but also to operate your workloads more effectively, securely, and cost-efficiently in the AWS cloud. Whether you're planning a migration or looking to optimize existing EVS deployments, this session will provide valuable strategies to elevate your cloud operations.

tags: Management & Governance; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Migrate generative AI workloads to Amazon Bedrock
description: Learn from a customer's real-world experience migrating production GenAI workloads to Amazon Bedrock. Discover how to build evaluation frameworks, resilient model routing, and a scalable GenAI development platform that accelerates product delivery while maintaining enterprise security standards. We'll share practical insights on achieving model interoperability, optimizing cost-performance trade-offs, and establishing best practices that enable teams to innovate quickly without compromising reliability, compliance, or responsible AI requirements.

tags: Migration & Modernization; Data Scientist; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

Gain hands-on experience implementing improvements across all Well-Architected pillars. Practice using various AWS services to enhance your migration projects and optimize outcomes. You must bring your laptop to participate.

description: Legacy systems shouldn't hold back your AI ambitions. Join Dr. Asa Kalavade to see how AWS is making migration and modernization simpler and faster with agentic AI, building on nearly two decades of enterprise experience. Learn how we're using AI to build domain-specific agents that continuously learn, streamlining and accelerating transformations like never before. Recognizing the collaborative nature of transformation projects, see how we're building a new composable experience integrating first and third-party agents. Through customer success stories and interactive fireside chats with customers and partners, you'll learn proven approaches to accelerate your enterprise AI transformation.

description: Join this session to understand how customers are successfully migrating from existing API platforms to Amazon API Gateway while achieving cost savings, improving security posture and performance. In this session, we will explore proven real-world migration strategies and how to overcome challenges like licensing, authentication, rate limiting and more. We will discuss how tools like AWS Lambda, AWS WAF and OpenAPI specifications are key to a successful migration. Whether you’re planning to migrate from a legacy API provider, or optimize existing APIs, you will understand patterns to accelerate your API Gateway adoption.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; DevOps; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Migrating your VMware workloads with on-premises dependencies
description: While most VMware workloads can be easily migrated to the cloud, some need to stay on-premises due to application interdependencies, data residency requirements, or timeline constraints. Join this session to learn how AWS hybrid and edge services like AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones allow you to migrate in place and modernize at your own pace. Dive deep on various migration pathways with Outposts and Local Zones and the migration tools and programs that you can use to simplify and accelerate transition to the cloud.

title: Mission-critical security: How U.S. Army secures comms with AWS Wickr
description: Seamless and secure collaboration is central to operational success. Join this session to discover how the U.S. Army uses AWS Wickr to protect critical communications between various units, mission partners, and citizens. You’ll learn how your organization can deploy the end-to-end encrypted communication capabilities, data residency controls, and administrative features AWS Wickr provides to protect messages and files, manage users and policies, and retain conversations in a data store of your choice to meet regulatory needs.

title: Mission-Ready HPC: From NOAA Today to AI Tomorrow
description: High-performance computing (HPC) powers critical missions in federal science—from advanced modeling to large-scale Earth observation. Agencies like NOAA use HPC to scale research, forecasting, and data-intensive workloads that safeguard communities and inform decisions across supply chains, logistics, and operations. In this session, we’ll explore how AWS helps agencies deploy secure, scalable HPC environments tailored to mission needs. NOAA will share how it applies HPC today to accelerate science and improve prediction, while AWS looks ahead to the future—where HPC and artificial intelligence (AI) converge to unlock new opportunities for research, modeling, and collaboration across the public sector.
speakers: Mickey Iqbal; Rayette Toles-Abdullah; David Michaud
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Model governance at scale with SageMaker AI
description: Join us to learn how organizations across industries - from finance to healthcare - are building powerful, specialized AI applications using these techniques. Whether you're looking to create domain-specific chatbots, improve content analysis, or develop custom AI solutions, you'll leave with practical skills to implement these approaches in your own projects. This session is ideal for data scientists, ML engineers, and technical practitioners who want to move beyond prompt engineering to build more powerful and efficient AI solutions.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: This expert-level workshop demonstrates how to use S3 Tables to build sophisticated batch processing pipelines for transactional datalakes built on Apache Iceberg. Learn advanced techniques for processing and storing data in Amazon S3 Tables while leveraging AWS analytics services. Learn to orchestrate complex data workflows using AWS Glue, security with AWS Lake Formation, ad-hoc SQL query with AWS Athena and Amazon Redshift, powerful visualizations using Amazon QuickSight and conversational interaction with Amazon Q with MCP server for S3 Tables. Knowledge of Apache Iceberg and AWS analytics services is highly recommended. Participants must bring a laptop for this session.
services: Amazon Q; Amazon QuickSight; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Automation; Machine Learning; Analytics; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Modern Secrets: A Journey from Legacy Systems to AI-Ready Security
description: Learn from Acquia's journey from complex legacy systems to cutting-edge secrets management with AWS Secrets Manager. Discover how Acquia revolutionized its security infrastructure, mastering multi-tenant isolation and achieving zero-downtime migration across hundreds of services. This is a potential blueprint for your modern security architecture. Perfect for forward-thinking architects and security leaders, you'll get exclusive insights into Acquia's transformation and how Acquia leveraged its relationship with AWS to drive its roadmap for Agentic AI integration and improved security via automated secrets rotation. This is valuable glimpse into large-scale and seamless secrets management.
speakers: Ritesh Desai; Zach Miller; Jake Farrell
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Culture of Security; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

Perfect for organizations looking to modernize their managed file transfer systems while maintaining security and compliance. Walk away with practical templates and patterns for implementing enterprise-grade file transfer solutions.
tags: Application Security; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Automation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Discover the comprehensive landscape of workload identity management on AWS and learn how to choose the right strategy for your specific needs. From IAM roles for AWS services to service mesh authentication, certificate-based solutions, and modern approaches like SPIFFE/SPIRE integration, this session explores proven patterns for securing service-to-service communications. Learn how to implement these strategies across containers, serverless functions, and hybrid environments while maintaining security at scale. We'll examine real customer examples of how organizations successfully navigate workload identity challenges using AWS native services, focusing on automated credential management, fine-grained access controls, and operational efficiency.

tags: Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Modernize your data warehouse by moving to Amazon Redshift
description: Are you spending too much time on data warehouse management tasks like hardware provisioning, software patching, and performance tuning and not enough time building your applications and innovating with data? We'll explore new capabilities like Managed Instances, enabling you to move your on-prem workloads to the cloud while maintaining current workflows and existing VDI management software. description: Join this session to learn how Bancolombia modernized banking applications tightly integrated with mainframe systems using a hybrid cloud architecture. The bank successfully migrated from Red Hat OpenShift on VMware vSphere to Amazon EKS on AWS Outposts. This migration and modernization effort has helped Bancolombia meet sub-millisecond latency requirements and improve system resiliency with an active-active disaster recovery (DR) implementation. The bank now uses a unified cloud governance model across on-premises systems and AWS Regions. Their single cloud operating model streamlines operations, reduces operational costs, and enhances scalability. Discover how to apply these implementation insights to your complex IT environment.

description: Discover how Idemia, a provider of identity solutions serving 48 Department of Motor Vehicles (DMVs) across the United States, successfully modernized their legacy .NET Framework applications using AWS Transform. This session explores how the company addressed 25 years of technical debt through composable transformations, seamlessly integrating partner tools while leveraging existing knowledge bases for a customized modernization approach. We'll showcase how AWS Transform's composable architecture enabled Idemia to modernize their mission-critical applications while maintaining business continuity and reducing transformation risks.
speakers: Rahul Chugh; Nits Jeganathan; Srinivas Singaraju
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Lecture-style

title: Modernizing Document Processing [REPEAT]
description: Oldcastle, a major building materials company, revolutionized document processing by replacing manual methods with an automated system using AWS Bedrock and Amazon Textract. This scalable solution handles hundreds of thousands of monthly documents across multiple facilities. The architecture combines Amazon SES, S3 events, Textract, and Bedrock to process shipping receipts and invoices with minimal human input. The system manages complex document variations without custom coding, extracts data intelligently, and integrates with enterprise systems, delivering significant cost savings and operational efficiency.
services: Amazon API Gateway; Amazon Bedrock; AWS Lambda
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Modernizing Global Payment Processing: Moving from Mainframe to AWS
description: Learn how Global Payments is transforming its 40-year-old mainframe system into a modern AWS cloud platform. This major financial services company, which processes credit cards for over 600 million cardholders worldwide, is using enhanced support and monitoring tools to ensure a reliable transition to cloud-based processing.
tags: Resilience; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Migration & Modernization; Lecture-style

title: Modernizing Java applications with generative AI
description: In this session, use Amazon Q Developer's transformation capabilities to modernize a Java application. Learn how Amazon Q Developer can leverage generative AI to automate common language upgrade tasks like updating your code, conducting unit tests, and verifying deployment readiness. Save days' or even months' worth of the undifferentiated work involved in moving from older language versions.
speakers: Venugopalan Vasudevan; Ben Coburn; Rafa Reyes; Vijay Golla
tags: Innovation & Transformation; DevOps; Developer Tools; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Modernizing Legacy Systems: Boeing's PLM Cloud Transformation
description: Learn how Boeing transformed a complex, bureaucratic product lifecycle management (PLM) system into an agile, cost-effective powerhouse. In this talk, we'll explore how leveraging cloud technologies and embracing DevOps practices led to breakthrough improvements, including 95% faster deployments, 40% cost reduction, and enhanced global collaboration. We'll dive into the challenges of migrating critical systems, the innovative solutions implemented, and the outcomes realized. This journey demonstrates how large, established companies are revolutionizing their operations, boosting efficiency, and driving innovation by embracing AWS and modern development practices.
speakers: Justin Iravani; James Gallagher; Daniel Meyering
tags: Industry Solutions; Business Executive; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; Aerospace & Satellite; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Modernizing monoliths: The path to architectural freedom [REPEAT]
description: Witness the transformation of a rigid monolith into a clean architecture that seamlessly runs across Lambda functions, ECS clusters, and EKS pods. Through live demonstrations, you'll explore the evolution from architectural simplicity to sophisticated flexibility, showing how each stage addresses specific challenges while enabling new deployment patterns. Learn how thoughtful architectural decisions create truly adaptable applications that leverage AWS's full capabilities while maintaining deployment freedom.
speakers: Daniel ABIB; Michael Costa; Swarna Kunnath; Bianca Mota; Philipp Page
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Witness the transformation of a rigid monolith into a clean architecture that seamlessly runs across Lambda functions, ECS clusters, and EKS pods. Through live demonstrations, you'll explore the evolution from architectural simplicity to sophisticated flexibility, showing how each stage addresses specific challenges while enabling new deployment patterns. speakers: Daniel ABIB; Michael Costa; Swarna Kunnath; Bianca Mota; Philipp Page

title: Modernizing Operational Technology for AI-power Manufacturing
description: In this session, discover best practices for modernizing manufacturing applications - such as SCADA, Historian, and MES - and integrating Operational Technology data into an Industrial Data Fabric. Through reference architectures and a live demonstration, we will show examples of how to accelerate data ingestion and contextualization in order to deploy a breadth of analytics and agentic capabilities to deliver outcomes such as improved process quality, cost productivity, and machine reliability.
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Internet of Things; Machine Learning; Industry Solutions; Manufacturing & Industrial; Lecture-style

title: Modernizing Serverless Applications with Event-Driven Architectures
description: REST APIs and synchronous workflows have long been a popular choice for building applications, due to their familiarity and straightforward implementation. However, as applications evolve to handle increasing complexity, modern architectural patterns offer new opportunities to enhance performance, resilience, and scalability. In this interactive chalk talk, join an open conversation on embracing asynchronous workflows and event-driven architectures as a natural evolution for modern applications. We'll walk through reimagining a traditional synchronous API-driven e-commerce solution as a decoupled, asynchronous, event-driven system. You’ll also experience a live demo of a retail application built with this architecture.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Monetizing agentic AI solutions: A Partner's guide for AI agents & tools
description: Learn how AWS Partners can unlock new revenue streams by bringing their agentic AI solutions to market through the AWS AI Agents & Tools Marketplace, where customers discover, evaluate, and deploy AI solutions with confidence. This session covers packaging AI agents, specialized tools, and professional services for enterprise buyers, best practices for marketplace positioning and go-to-market strategies, and includes a demonstration of deploying AI solutions on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Attendees will discover how to position their solutions for seamless deployment into customers' AWS environments and leave with actionable insights to accelerate their AI solution monetization and effectively reach enterprise customers through AWS's trusted marketplace ecosystem.
tags: Agentic AI; Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: Monitor the quality and accuracy of your generative AI workloads
description: Join this live coding session to learn how Amazon CloudWatch enables AI observability and troubleshooting. We'll build agentic applications using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Amazon EKS with Strands Agent SDK, automatically instrumented through AWS Distro for OpenTelemetry (ADOT). Learn how to visualize agent and model telemetry in CloudWatch's generative AI dashboard, and troubleshoot common challenges like latency, errors, throttling, and token usage. Leave with practical skills to build and maintain reliable AI applications.
tags: Generative AI; Monitoring & Observability; Agentic AI; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Monolith to microservices: modernization pathways and genAI
description: In this workshop, learn how to use AWS modernization pathways to transform a monolithic workload into a loosely coupled, distributed microservices architecture. Follow a real-world migration scenario, starting with migrating your application, and apply AWS modernization pathways such as Move to Containers, Move to Managed Database, Move to Open Source, Move to Cloud-Native, and Move to AI. Discover how AWS services like Amazon RDS, AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway and Amazon Q enable each pathway. By the end of the session, you will gain practical experience and understand how to modernize your workloads using AWS services and modernization pathways.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS Lambda; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Containers; Architecture; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Moody’s: Architecting a multi-agent system on AWS
description: Financial institutions need to orchestrate specialized analysis across diverse domains while maintaining regulatory compliance and performance at scale. Learn how Moody's built their Research Assistant using domain agents for ratings, climate, and economics; task agents for KYC screening and company credit assessment; and workflow agents for sales and marketing and portfolio monitoring with early warning signals on Amazon Bedrock. Explore architectural patterns for multi-agent coordination using Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, AWS Lambda, and Amazon ECS that accelerated insights by 60% and reduced task completion by 30%. Discover approaches to agent specialization and knowledge retrieval that ensure compliance while processing complex financial datasets.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon OpenSearch Service
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Motability Operations' unified backup strategy: From fragmented to fortified
description: Discover how Motability Operations, the UK's largest accessible vehicle leasing organization, transformed their fragmented backup environment into a unified, ransomware-resilient architecture using AWS Backup. Learn about their implementation of a distributed, multi-account strategy aligned with the 3-2-1-0 resilience framework, incorporating automated daily restore testing and ransomware scanning. This session explores how they achieved continuous validation of critical data, ensuring clean recovery points are always available to meet strict RTO and RPO targets. Gain insights into evolving from basic backup processes to assured recovery capabilities that protect against modern ransomware threats.
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Moving AWS Accounts seamlessly at scale
description: Mergers and acquisitions,divestitures, and other business transitions often require organizations to migrate AWS accounts securely and precisely to prevent operational disruptions and address security gaps. Multi-account best practices can help you migrate AWS accounts like a maestro during business changes and transitions. You can simplify scaling of your workloads and promote agility while saving time and mitigating risks. Learn how you can assess dependencies and perform additional checks to execute a quick, secure, and efficient migration.
tags: Management & Governance; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Cloud Operations; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Moving data to Amazon S3 to enable Amazon Bedrock gen AI workflows
description: Set up efficient data pipelines from on-premises systems, other clouds, and third-party sources to Amazon S3 using AWS Storage Gateway, DataSync, and Transfer Family. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to integrate migrated data with Amazon Bedrock for generative AI processing and analysis. Practice configuring data movement services, establishing secure transfer patterns, and implementing gen AI workflows. Learn to build scalable data lakes that support advanced AI applications, focusing on real-world migration scenarios and data processing requirements.
services: AWS DataSync; AWS Storage Gateway; AWS Transfer Family
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Moving to Valkey without downtime
description: Join us for an in-depth exploration of Valkey, an open source in-memory datastore project under the Linux Foundation, and discover how this high-performance key-value database is revolutionizing the way we approach data storage and management. From the core engine to the modules and client libraries, we'll delve into the architecture and features that make Valkey an attractive alternative to traditional in-memory implementations and provide migration strategies from Redis to Valkey. We'll provide a step-by-step guide on how to seamlessly transition your existing workloads to Valkey, leveraging the compatibility and benefits that this new database offers.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Migration & Modernization; Open Source; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: Multi-agent collaboration for optimized advertising performance
description: Companies struggle to scale their operations and drive better performance across increasingly complex, multi-channel advertising campaigns while maintaining control and governance over AI-powered automation. This chalk talk demonstrates how organizations can use agent-driven processes using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to automate and augment complex workflows beyond content generation. Learn to automate workflows, complement planning, optimize budget allocation, and drive better campaign outcomes. We’ll explore how Amazon Bedrock can improve return on ad spend using multi-agent collaboration to orchestrate and optimize campaigns, proactively monitor and detect underperformance, and provide solutions such as bid adjustments, creative refreshes, or audience pivots.
tags: Generative AI; Migration & Modernization; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Retail & Consumer Goods; Interactive

title: Multi-Agent Data Pipelines: Shaping the Future of Analytics
description: In this session, attendees will learn to build a domain-aware data preprocessing pipeline using Amazon Bedrock’s multi-agent framework. Specialized agents for tasks like classification and metadata extraction automate processing of diverse data, accelerating analytics and generative AI pipelines for marketing, reporting, and other SMB use cases. This approach matters in 2025 as SMBs face growing data variety and urgency for insight; it shapes the future by enabling lean teams to deliver rapid, accurate business intelligence. By automating end-to-end data workflows, SMBs can boost decision making and generative AI success
speakers: Pulkit Bahl; Manish Dhawaria; Vaishnavi Ganesan; Pablo Redondo Sanchez; Muhammad Shahzad; Deepti Venuturumilli
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Small & Medium Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-agent financial fraud detection with Amazon Nova Models
description: Master advanced AI system architecture by building a comprehensive financial fraud investigation platform using Amazon Nova's multi-agent orchestration capabilities. This workshop teaches participants to design sophisticated workflows where Nova Premier coordinates specialized agents: Nova Pro analyzes documents and transaction patterns, Nova Lite monitors real-time activities, and Nova Sonic conducts voice-based customer verification. Using synthetic financial data, participants create working systems for transaction analysis, identity verification, risk scoring, and automated case management. The session covers agent coordination strategies, model distillation for creating specialized fraud detection models, and performance optimization methods delivering immediate ROI for financial compliance operations.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Financial Services; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-Agent Systems: Build, Evaluate, Observe with Strands Agents [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on builder session, create a multi-agent AI system using AWS Strands Agents with minimal code. Master the critical observe-evaluate-improve-iterate cycle using OpenTelemetry to gain visibility into agent behavior, evaluate performance, and continuously refine your AI systems. This iterative approach enables businesses to deploy AI confidently without specialized expertise. Leave with practical skills to build, assess, and enhance production-grade AI agents that solve real business problems while maintaining complete visibility into their operations. Perfect for organizations seeking to implement effective AI solutions with sustainable improvement processes.
speakers: Vaishnavi Ganesan; Navleen Kaur; Justin Leto; Saurabh Rawat; Emad Tawfik
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Small & Medium Business; Hands-on; Interactive

description: In this hands-on builder session, create a multi-agent AI system using AWS Strands Agents with minimal code. Master the critical observe-evaluate-improve-iterate cycle using OpenTelemetry to gain visibility into agent behavior, evaluate performance, and continuously refine your AI systems. This iterative approach enables businesses to deploy AI confidently without specialized expertise. title: Multi-Cloud Container Migrations: Amazon CodeCatalyst for Balanced Workloads.
description: Utilize AWS CodeCatalyst to create a seamless deployment of Container Compute resources in AWS, enabling a multi-cloud deployment that meets your DR and cost needs. Utilizing AWS CodeCatalyst, ECR, S3, and ECS/Fargate, you can deploy containers across multiple clouds, migrating to take advantage of AWS' multiple Regions and container offerings.
services: Amazon CodeCatalyst; Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); AWS Fargate
tags: Automation; Containers; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Multi-protocol data access in FSx for NetApp ONTAP scale-out file systems
description: This technical workshop provides deep-dive implementation of multi-protocol access using Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP scale-out file systems. Through hands-on configuration exercises, set up an FSx for ONTAP file system to enable simultaneous file access from Linux and Windows environments. Apply advanced techniques for performance optimization, granular permission management, and complex multi-protocol scenario troubleshooting. Practice architectural patterns that address cross-platform authentication, file locking, and security mapping challenges. This expert-level session targets storage administrators and architects working with heterogeneous environments. Prior ONTAP experience recommended.
tags: Application Security; Innovation & Transformation; Business Applications; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-Region disaster recovery & resilience testing (feat. Fidelity)
description: Explore how AWS innovations are revolutionizing disaster recovery (DR) strategies for enterprise-scale organizations. Managing thousands of applications across AWS Regions demands sophisticated DR capabilities that have historically required complex and resource-intensive custom development. Learn how Fidelity transformed DR for 8,500 mission-critical applications by using the multi-Region recovery orchestration, live dashboards, and reporting capabilities of Amazon Application Recovery Controller's Region switch feature. Combined with AWS Fault Injection Service, Fidelity also validates their recovery procedures under realistic conditions to bolster confidence in their DR plan. Discover how AWS enables enterprises to modernize their infrastructure operations, improve compliance, and enhance business continuity for mission-critical applications.
speakers: Joe Cho; John Formento; Keith Blizard
services: AWS Fault Injection Service; Amazon Application Recovery Controller
tags: Resilience; Cloud Operations; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Lecture-style

title: Multi-Region strong consistency with Amazon DynamoDB global tables
description: Join this session to learn how multi-Region strong consistency mode for Amazon DynamoDB global tables helps you build highly resilient applications across Regions. Explore the advantages of this innovative functionality, learn how to identify which use cases will benefit most, and discover how to choose the optimal global tables mode for your workloads. Deep dive on how AWS built DynamoDB global tables with multi-Region strong consistency and see a practical demo of the feature. Leave this session ready to leverage multi-Region strong consistency with your applications.
tags: Resilience; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Multi-Tenant AI Cost Control
description: SaaS providers struggle with unpredictable AI costs and inability to attribute shared foundation model usage per customer. This workshop demonstrates how ISVs can build cost-controlled AI features using Amazon Bedrock Application Inference Profiles, AWS Budgets, and Cost Explorer. Learn to implement per-tenant usage boundaries, accurate billing attribution, and consumption alerts when multiple customers share models. Attendees will build a multi-tenant architecture with granular cost tracking, automated threshold alerts, and detailed usage analytics—enabling transparent customer billing and predictable AI operational costs for SaaS platforms.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Cost Optimization; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-Tenant ETL: Consolidate SaaS Data
description: Unlock the power of your clients' data through efficient multi-tenant consolidation. Learn to build a robust ETL pipeline using AWS Lambda, Step Functions, and EventBridge, transforming distributed SQL databases into a unified data foundation. This workshop guides you through creating a secure, scalable solution that enables advanced analytics and Generative AI applications. Ideal for data professionals seeking to drive innovation through consolidated SaaS data, you'll master techniques for data extraction, parallel processing, and automated scheduling. Join us to elevate your data strategy and unlock new business insights.
tags: Databases; Migration & Modernization; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multi-tenant GenAI vector databases: Design, cost, and architecture strategies
description: Vector databases are often an essential component of the GenAI experience. There are a wide range of vector database tools, mechanisms, and strategies that are used to refine the footprint of a GenAI experience. This gets more interesting when we inject tenancy into the equation. In this chalk talk, we’ll look at different architectures and approaches that are used to connect vector databases, GenAI, and tenancy. We’ll look at how vector data is partitioned, how it’s provisioned, how its isolated, and how it can be used to deliver targeted tenant experiences.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Agentic AI; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Multi-tenant multicloud SaaS using Kubernetes, feat. Adobe
description: Organizations often adopt a multicloud container strategy to meet latency, regulatory, and customer requirements. Adobe operates 500+ clusters across multicloud and on-premises environments, powering 4,000+ production services. In this session, we dive deep into Adobe's journey with fleet management of their multicloud Kubernetes clusters. Learn how Adobe solved challenges such as standardization of cluster lifecycle management, inter-cluster networking, security policies, and multi-tenancy across cloud providers. Adobe will share their approach, design patterns, and practices based on a declarative, GitOps-based solution with Cluster API and Argo, tenant isolation with Open Policy Agent (OPA), and fleet-wide optimization techniques.
speakers: Gaurav Dhamija; Shankar Ramachandran; John Weber
tags: SaaS; Containers; Kubernetes; Compute; Lecture-style

title: Multicloud & hybrid node operation at scale is easier than you think
description: Modern enterprises face significant challenges in managing compute resources across multiple cloud environments and on-premises infrastructure, often resulting in operational complexity and inconsistent controls. Join this interactive chalk talk to discover practical solutions for streamlining your operations at scale. We'll explore how AWS Systems Manager, Amazon CloudWatch, and other services can efficiently handle fleet-wide operations including patching, application deployment, incident resolution, and access control management. These services help thousands of customers operate millions of resources across their distributed compute landscape, reducing operational overhead while maintaining security and compliance.
tags: Management & Governance; Cloud Operations; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Multicloud architectures: Solutions and design patterns
description: Organizations operating in multicloud environments face challenges such as fragmented tooling, distributed configuration and resource management. This interactive chalk talk explores architectural patterns for teams managing multicloud environments. We will dive deep into how patterns such as centralized operations management and service mesh that can help you manage resources across cloud providers. You will learn practical approaches to maintain consistent control, automate routine tasks and simplify management across cloud providers.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Security Lake; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Management & Governance; Monitoring & Observability; Network & Infrastructure Security; Architecture; Advisor / Consultant; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Multicloud data movement best practices with AWS DataSync
description: Learn how to perform multicloud data transfers using AWS DataSync. This chalk talk provides the expertise to leverage AWS DataSync as a powerful data transfer solution, allowing you to efficiently migrate and synchronize data between Amazon S3 compatible storage on other clouds and AWS storage services. AWS experts guide you through the DataSync Enhanced mode tasks without agents, when to use Basic mode transfers with agents, best practices, endpoint connectivity, and cloud-specific nuances. Harness the ability to move your object data at scale, securely transferring it to cost-efficient AWS storage classes.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS DataSync
tags: Global Infrastructure; Cost Optimization; Automation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Multicloud networking best practices
description: Organizations with multicloud environments face networking challenges such as the overhead of maintaining different networking constructs per cloud and fragmented security policies creating blind spots. In this chalk talk, we will explore multicloud networking approaches across public, private, and managed connectivity options. We will dive deep into design patterns such as distributed network overlay model, multi-region transit hub architecture, and network policy orchestration. You'll gain practical blueprints for unified IP space management, automated policy propagation, and resilient connectivity patterns between clouds.
speakers: Rohit Aswani; Joe Flanagan; Donald Quindardo
tags: Management & Governance; Network & Infrastructure Security; DevOps; Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Multicloud security best practices
description: Organizations operating in multicloud environments face challenges with distributed data security, identity management, and continuous monitoring. In this session, we will explore approaches to address multicloud security, aligned with NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), an industry standard, focused on protect, detect, and respond functions. We will dive deep into security visibility via centralized logging, encryption and privacy enforcement, and centralized federation. You will learn specific architectural patterns that will help address multicloud security and identity challenges.
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; Culture of Security; Identity & Access Management; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Multilingual Contact Center with Amazon Connect
description: Get hands-on experience building a real-time voice translation solution using Amazon Connect and AWS AI services. In this workshop, you'll configure speech recognition, implement machine translation, and set up voice synthesis to enable multilingual customer conversations allowing agents to communicate with customers in their preferred languages without the need for language proficiency or additional staffing. Through guided exercises, you'll create a complete contact center solution that allows agents to communicate with customers across language barriers. Bring your laptop to follow along. Ideal for developers and solutions architects.
services: Amazon Connect; Amazon Lex; Amazon Polly
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Multimodal Video Understanding AI at Scale with Amazon Bedrock
description: Bring next-level video intelligence to your workflows using multimodal video understanding models in Amazon Bedrock to index and search through your video content by understanding video holistically like humans. Start by using the multimodal embedding model Marengo on Bedrock to embed entire video libraries. Then, store these embeddings on S3 Vectors for faster and efficient vector search and retrieval. Lastly, use video language model Pegasus to perform video analysis at scale for better video understanding.
speakers: Nolan Chen; Patrick Palmer; Eric Kim
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Manufacturing & Industrial; Media & Entertainment; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Navigate the cloud compute landscape with Amazon ECS
description: Amazon ECS offers multiple compute options that enable architects to optimize for performance, cost, and operational requirements. This session provides a comprehensive guide to the Amazon EC2 and serverless based compute offerings for Amazon ECS. We'll dive into the technical architecture, operational models, and cost implications of each compute type through real world scenarios. You'll learn the inflection points when matching compute options to specific application patterns including batch processing, web services, and data intensive workloads.
speakers: Mats Lannér; Alexandr Moroz; Ruben Di Battista
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); AWS Fargate
tags: Global Infrastructure; Cost Optimization; Containers; Compute; Serverless & Containers; Advisor / Consultant; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Navigating API modernization on AWS
description: Navigate AWS API architecture choices with confidence in this interactive session. Through collaborative discussion and whiteboarding, we'll explore key options for modernizing APIs on AWS, including API Gateway REST vs HTTP APIs, AppSync with GraphQL, Lambda integration patterns, and Step Functions. Together, we'll analyze real-world scenarios to understand which solutions best fit different use cases and requirements. Learn practical evaluation criteria for selecting optimal API architectures and gain insights into various integration patterns. Whether you're starting a new project or modernizing existing APIs, you'll leave with clear decision-making frameworks to guide your architectural choices.
services: Amazon API Gateway; AWS AppSync; AWS Step Functions
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Innovation & Transformation; Serverless; Architecture; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Navigating multi-Region AWS database choices for financial services
description: Financial institutions operate mission-critical systems across multiple regions to meet strict resilience and regulatory requirements. In this chalk talk, we'll examine AWS's expanded multi-region database portfolio through the lens of financial services workloads. Together, we'll compare Amazon DynamoDB Global Tables (both consistency modes), Amazon Aurora Global Database, and Amazon Aurora DSQL. Using real-world scenarios, you’ll learn how each solution approaches data consistency in- and cross-Region, and the associated failover mechanics. Gain practical insights for matching these solutions to your specific application needs and resilience requirements.
speakers: Gerrard Cowburn; Harsha Sharma; John Gorry
services: Amazon DynamoDB; Amazon Aurora for PostgreSQL; Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Global Infrastructure; Databases; Industry Solutions; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Navigating the future: Solutions architecture in the age of AI
description: AI is dramatically accelerating technological evolution, with new architectural primitives emerging monthly. This unprecedented pace transforms the Solutions Architect (SA) role from system designer to change navigator. Learn how SAs deliver value by enabling and de-risking rapid transformation while maintaining architectural stability. Discover strategies for developing new capabilities while preserving foundational expertise. This session explores how to guide organizations through an accelerating technology landscape where managing change has become the primary architectural challenge.
tags: Workforce Development; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Business Executive; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Navigating the multicloud journey: essential foundations for success
description: Is your organization operating in a multicloud environment? Drawing from thousands of executive and builder engagements, we will cut through the noise with practical guidance to help you succeed with your multicloud strategy. In this session, we will describe the AWS multicloud approach that aims to help you build multicloud capabilities across People, Process and Technology pillars. You will learn how to build a business case-driven multicloud strategy, establishing centralized management and oversight of your multicloud environment and architectural best practices for multicloud.
tags: Management & Governance; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Lecture-style

title: Network observability in AWS: Picking the right tool for the job
description: AWS offers a rich network observability toolbox, including Amazon CloudWatch Network Synthetic Monitor, Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor, Amazon VPC Reachability Analyzer, Amazon VPC Flow Logs and the latest Amazon CloudWatch Network Flow Monitor. Yet, many teams struggle to know which tool to grab when latency spikes, packets vanish, or hybrid links fluctuate. In this interactive chalk talk, AWS networking specialists map the most common real-world scenarios to the most effective observability service, explaining when, where, why, and how to use each tool for the right job.
services: Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor; VPC Reachability Analyzer
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Network Operations with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore [REPEAT]
description: Explore agent-driven network operations using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore in this hands-on workshop. Learn to build intelligent agents that automate network tasks using AWS services like VPC Reachability Analyzer, Traffic Mirroring, and CloudWatch, integrated through AgentCore Gateway. Discover agent personalization with Memory features and multi-agent coordination via Agent to Agent (A2A) protocol  You will walk away with an understanding of how agent-based NetOps can reduce resolution times and enhance operational reliability in common network operational tasks.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC)
tags: Generative AI; Monitoring & Observability; Network & Infrastructure Security; Artificial Intelligence; Networking & Content Delivery; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Network Operations with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore [REPEAT]
description: Explore agent-driven network operations using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore in this hands-on workshop. Learn to build intelligent agents that automate network tasks using AWS services like VPC Reachability Analyzer, Traffic Mirroring, and CloudWatch, integrated through AgentCore Gateway. Discover agent personalization with Memory features and multi-agent coordination via Agent to Agent (A2A) protocol  You will walk away with an understanding of how agent-based NetOps can reduce resolution times and enhance operational reliability in common network operational tasks.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC)
tags: Generative AI; Monitoring & Observability; Network & Infrastructure Security; Artificial Intelligence; Networking & Content Delivery; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Network security architecture: Deployment patterns for firewalls in AWS
description: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore firewall deployment patterns for AWS environments. In this session, discover east/west and north/south scenarios using AWS Network Firewall and Gateway Load Balancer. Through collaborative discussion and Q&A, participants will dive into optimal approaches for centralized and distributed inspection models across multi-VPC architectures. Share your challenges, learn from others, and explore real-world examples in this peer-driven problem-solving discussion of effective network security patterns.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Networking and observability strategies for Kubernetes
description: Join this session to explore advanced networking and observability capabilities in Amazon EKS, from securing multi-tenant environments to gaining deep visibility into cluster traffic patterns. We'll share comprehensive strategies for implementing layered network security controls at both infrastructure and application layers which enable granular traffic observability and optimize network performance across distributed workloads. Learn best practices for fine-grained access control, efficient traffic monitoring, and automated policy enforcement. Finally, discover how to leverage Amazon EKS' integration with AWS services to build robust, observable, and secure Kubernetes environments while maintaining operational efficiency.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Network & Infrastructure Security; Kubernetes; Networking & Content Delivery; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: Networks at scale and how to automate operations [REPEAT]
description: Join us in this Code Talk to explore how to leverage AWS Serverless services to automate AWS networking operations across multiple AWS accounts. In this session, we will showcase AWS Cloud WAN to walk through building a global network using policy-as-code. Learn how to automate the connection and validation of VPCs and hybrid environments, while ensuring architecture security and standards are met without any manual intervention. By the end of the session, attendees will build a solution that can help reduce manual operations, enforce standardization, and efficiently manage networking infrastructure at scale.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Networks at scale and how to automate operations [REPEAT]
description: Join us in this Code Talk to explore how to leverage AWS Serverless services to automate AWS networking operations across multiple AWS accounts. In this session, we will showcase AWS Cloud WAN to walk through building a global network using policy-as-code. Learn how to automate the connection and validation of VPCs and hybrid environments, while ensuring architecture security and standards are met without any manual intervention. title: Neurosymbolic AI integration in LLMs to enhance reasoning
description: This session explores the integration of Neurosymbolic AI with Large Language Models (LLMs), demonstrating how formal verification techniques can enhance model reasoning capabilities beyond traditional training approaches. Drawing from recent implementations, we'll examine how incorporating formal mathematical proofs and verification during model training can improve performance not only in mathematical reasoning but also in adjacent domains like coding and agentic tasks. The presentation will cover practical approaches to neural-symbolic integration across different training stages - pre-training, supervised fine-tuning, and reinforcement learning. Technical challenges and solutions in scaling AR verification for LLM training will be addressed.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: Neurosymbolic AI: Logic-Enhanced Neural Networks at Amazon Scale
description: Neurosymbolic AI combines neural networks' pattern recognition with symbolic systems' logical reasoning capabilities. This hybrid approach creates more robust, transparent, and explainable AI systems while reducing costs. In this talk, we'll explore key symbolic tools including SMT solvers and Lean theorem provers, demonstrating how they integrate with neural architectures. Drawing from Amazon's production experience, we'll examine real-world implementations in Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Guardrails Automated Reasoning Checks. Attendees will learn practical techniques for building neurosymbolic systems, understand when to apply these approaches, and discover how symbolic reasoning enhances AI reliability in enterprise applications.
tags: Generative AI; Network & Infrastructure Security; Responsible AI; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

title: New York Times: Best practices for migration to Amazon FSx for ONTAP
description: Learn and benefit from the New York Times successful FSx for ONTAP migration while understanding how to optimize the cost and performance of FSx for ONTAP for your workload. A New York Times storage architect will discuss best practices and field proven techniques for migrating your data to Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Discover time saving tips on how to increase scale, performance, and resilience by migrating to Amazon FSx for ONTAP. You’ll learn how to configure and optimize your FSx for NetApp deployment with high availability, ransomware protection, snapshots, auto-tiering and more.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
tags: Resilience; Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Storage; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Next generation etcd for Amazon EKS
description: Amazon EKS has reimagined its etcd architecture to enable Kubernetes clusters with high availability, durability and performance, even at 100K nodes. In this session, we examine how offloading etcd's traditional Raft consensus algorithm to a robust log replication service improved our resiliency and scalability story. We'll dive into challenges faced by a traditional quorum-based database, exploring theoretical/practical constraints of performing consensus, and explain how offloading consensus eliminates trade-offs. We also cover how we achieved a fully in-memory store and key-space partitioning to enable high-throughput Kubernetes. Attendees will gain practical insights into distributed consensus and challenges of operating databases at hyperscale.
tags: Containers; Kubernetes; Machine Learning; Serverless & Containers; Academic / Researcher; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Next-gen agentic SaaS: Transforming to an agent-powered experience [REPEAT]
description: The move to Agentic AI is having a profound impact on SaaS providers. For many, this will have a transformative effect on their business and architecture. This workshop will take an end-to-end pass through an agentic modernization, extracting functionality from an application and moving it into intelligent agents. We’ll look at how these new agents integrate into with the other moving parts of your system, using tenant-aware MCP severs, intelligent workflows, and so on. The goal here is to illustrate the fundamental strategies and approaches that can be used to transform existing SaaS solutions into multi-tenant, agent-enabled environments.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Independent Software Vendor; Hands-on; Interactive

description: The move to Agentic AI is having a profound impact on SaaS providers. For many, this will have a transformative effect on their business and architecture. This workshop will take an end-to-end pass through an agentic modernization, extracting functionality from an application and moving it into intelligent agents.
