title: Next-Gen Logistics with GenAI
description: Join this session to see how generative AI and open protocols revolutionize logistics operations. Through demonstrations, learn to implement Amazon Bedrock with MCP for enhanced supply chain visibility and automation. Discover architectural patterns that blend AI capabilities with open standards while maintaining security and operational efficiency.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Next-gen MSPs: From service providers to strategic partners.
description: In today's rapidly evolving technology landscape, successful service providers must evolve beyond professional services or traditional break-fix and management services. This session provides a roadmap for modernizing your Managed Services Provider (MSP) practice to meet changing customer expectations. Together, we'll explore how to build predictable, recurring revenue streams; what MSPs require to support next-gen services delivery; tools that help you optimize but maintain margins; portfolios that combine highly sought-after services; and strategic relationships to expand capabilities without increasing overhead. We'll also share practical tools for identifying growth, balancing standardization with customization, and measuring key business metrics.
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; Sales / Marketing; Partner Enablement; Lecture-style

title: Next-gen SAP security analytics powered by AWS
description: Learn how to transform SAP ERP security with an Agentic AI solution that processes daily logs into OCSF-compliant security data with 99.9% accuracy at terabyte scale. Implement a multi-agent system using AWS Strands SDK and experience how Swarm Intelligence algorithms with Amazon Security Lake enable real-time threat detection. Deploy a multi-account architecture integrating SAP LogServ, staging, and Security Lake, while using Amazon Q for natural language security analytics. Set up automated cross-account governance with AWS Control Tower. Take home enterprise-ready CDK implementation code and deployment automation scripts. Ideal for security architects, cloud engineers, and SAP administrators.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Q
tags: Migration & Modernization; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Next-Gen SOC: Agentic SOC analyst with Amazon Bedrock
description: SOC teams are often overwhelmed by the volume and complexity of security alerts, leading to slow response times and analyst fatigue. This workshop demonstrates how to automate repetitive SOC tasks—such as reviewing findings, analyzing incident details, and assigning ownership to respective teams—using Amazon Bedrock agents, Knowledge Base, GuardDuty and Security Hub. Attendees will build a GenAI-driven solution that streamlines SOC I actions, enabling our SOC analysts to focus on higher level analysis, leading to faster triage and escalation. Learn how to deploy scalable automation that empowers security teams to focus on critical threats and accelerate incident resolution.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Agentic AI; Government; Public Sector; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Nextworld Revolutionizes ERP: Supply Chain powered by Sagemaker AutoML
description: Machine learning has long helped businesses make smarter decisions, but it’s traditionally required data scientists, long development cycles, and heavy investment to deploy and maintain. In this session, see how business users can now build powerful AI models to solve problems like supply chain optimization or cash flow forecasting in hours instead of weeks. By combining Nextworld's enterprise-grade, AI-native application platform with Amazon SageMaker AutoML, organizations cut development time by up to 95%, democratize access to AI for non-technical roles, and solve critical business challenges faster.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Small & Medium Business; Lecture-style

title: NLP to SQL: Data Access with Amazon Nova
description: Discover how Amazon Nova transforms database interactions through Natural Language Processing to SQL translation, enabling non-technical users to access critical business data without SQL expertise. This session explores practical implementations, showcasing how organizations can democratize data access while maintaining precision and security. Learn how to empower users with natural language queries, reduce technical bottlenecks, and foster a data-driven culture. We'll cover implementation strategies, real-world applications, and best practices for leveraging Amazon Nova to streamline database interactions across your organization
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS); Amazon Nova
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Novartis's next-gen clinical platform enables AI drug development
description: Dive deep into how Novartis architected their regulated NextGen clinical trial data platform using AWS services including Amazon S3, Databricks on AWS, Amazon Sagemaker, and AWS RDS. Explore their AWS-based clinical landscape, implementation of data lake patterns, and legacy system modernization approach. Learn how they built secure, traceable data backbone powering AI/GenAI innovations in protocol design, trial performance management, and clinical document generation, while maintaining regulatory compliance. Learn how this architecture enables clean data flow and rapid decision-making across drug development workflows.
speakers: Apoorva Joshi; Kaustubh Patil; Anna Klebus
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Culture of Security; Analytics; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Observability for AI Agents and Traditional Workloads
description: Modern applications combine AI agents with traditional software components, creating hybrid systems requiring unified monitoring. This session demonstrates using Amazon CloudWatch to observe your complete application stack—from AI agent decision-making and behavior patterns to traditional infrastructure metrics like CPU and memory usage. Learn practical techniques for tracking AI agent performance alongside existing application monitoring, correlating issues between AI components and traditional services, and using Amazon CloudWatch's search capabilities to identify problems quickly. We'll show how customers use Amazon CloudWatch Application Signals to maintain reliability when AI agents interact with conventional workloads, streamlining troubleshooting across hybrid environments.
speakers: Siva Guruvareddiar; Igor Sedukhin; Muthukumaran (Muthu) Ardhanary
tags: Generative AI; Monitoring & Observability; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Lecture-style

title: Observability for Reliable Agentic AI with Strands SDK & OpenTelemetry
description: Reliable agentic AI requires robust observability. In this hands-on session, learn how to instrument and monitor AI systems using OpenTelemetry with AWS native tools and open-source solutions. Explore real-world implementations using Strands SDK, diagnostic methodologies for typical use cases, and strategies for continuous improvement. Join us for a gamified experience troubleshooting an agentic application, and leave with practical skills to implement observability at scale.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Retail & Consumer Goods; New to AWS; Interactive

title: Observability: The open source way
description: Many AWS customers adopt open source observability tools, but managing and scaling them can be difficult due to rapid changes and operational overhead. In this hands-on workshop, discover how AWS fully managed services for Prometheus, OpenSearch, and Grafana simplify observability while maintaining the flexibility of open source. You will deploy a sample application and use OpenTelemetry for instrumentation to collect, store, analyze, and visualize observability data. Gain practical experience building cost-effective, scalable observability solutions using familiar tools�without the burden of infrastructure management. Leave with the skills to streamline observability and improve visibility into your applications using AWS managed services.
services: Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus; Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK); Amazon OpenSearch Service
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Cloud Operations; Open Source; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Onboarding and optimizing AI/ML workloads with Amazon S3 & Amazon EKS
description: Join this workshop to learn about a solution to onboard and optimize distributed ML training workloads that use Amazon S3. Learn how to use the power of Amazon S3 as scalable storage for different types of ML training workloads, and harness the orchestration capabilities of Amazon EKS. Discover how these services, coupled with the Mountpoint for Amazon S3 CSI driver, enable Kubernetes applications to access S3 objects through a file system interface. Also, for PyTorch workloads, explore the efficient data loading and model checkpointing capabilities of the S3 Connector for PyTorch.
speakers: David Castro Sanchez; David DeLuca; Ran Pergamin
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Generative AI; Containers; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Operating Apache Kafka and Apache Flink at scale
description: Enterprises use Apache Kafka and Apache Flink for an increasing number of mission-critical use-cases, real-time analytics, application messaging, and machine learning. As this usage grows in size and scale, so does the criticality, scale, and cost of managing the Kafka and Flink clusters. Learn how customers can achieve the same or higher availability and durability of their growing clusters, both at lower unit costs and with operational simplicity with Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka), and Amazon MSF (Managed Streaming for Apache Flink).
services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Operating AWS Lambda functions at scale
description: Unlock the full potential of AWS Lambda as you scale across multiple accounts! In this chalk talk, discover effective strategies for runtime management and learn how generative AI accelerates operational excellence. We'll showcase comprehensive observability implementation using AWS Powertools for Lambda and share proven patterns for optimizing application performance. Through interactive discussions, we'll explore how cold starts, concurrency limits, and service dependencies influence scaling behavior. You'll gain confidence in architecting serverless workloads that scale reliably and efficiently.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Monitoring & Observability; Cloud Operations; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Operating large-scale enterprise workloads with Amazon EBS and EBS Snapshots
description: Many enterprises are running their business-critical production workloads in multiple AWS Regions using Amazon EBS for block storage and EBS snapshots for data protection. With block storage, operating at scale can mean different things, including delivering high IOPS or I/O bandwidth to applications, managing and monitoring millions of volumes, or protecting petabytes of data with stringent RPO and RTO requirements. In this talk, learn best practices for scaling and managing your Amazon EBS environment with cloud-native tools and techniques to help keep costs down while meeting your business needs.
services: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Innovation & Transformation; Business Applications; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

description: This chalk talk explores the critical relationship between operational practices and system resilience. Examine how fundamental elements like logging, health checks, and deployment strategies impact application reliability on AWS. Through real-world scenarios, discover common operational pitfalls that compromise system availability and learn practical solutions aligned with Well-Architected principles. Learn proven approaches to strengthen architecture resilience and elevate operational excellence. This interactive session provides architects and operators with actionable patterns for building and maintaining robust cloud systems.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Health Dashboard; AWS Resilience Hub

title: Operationalizing MCP for Agentic AI in Utilities with Bedrock AgentCore
description: With MCP adoption accelerating in energy and utilities, the next step is operationalizing it for agentic AI. This chalk talk outlines an MCP-based reference architecture on AWS's serverless stack, demonstrating how to structure data domains (AMI, SCADA, assets, and tariffs) with partitioning, schema versioning, and robust governance. We'll explore Amazon Bedrock AgentCore role: its Gateway converts APIs into MCP tools, its Runtime hosts long-running agents with isolation, and its Identity service enforces scoped delegation across systems. This framework offers utilities a practical, production-grade blueprint for exposing critical data and tools as MCP tools while safely integrating emerging agent ecosystems.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Energy & Utilities; Interactive

title: Optimize .NET Price-Performance with Graviton using AWS Transform
description: Master the migration of .NET Framework applications to AWS Graviton to achieve up to 40% better price performance for your .NET workloads. In this hands-on workshop, learn to leverage AWS Transform for efficient porting of Windows-based .NET applications to Linux on Graviton. Experience the migration steps, including code analysis, automated transformations, and CI/CD pipeline adaptations. This workshop is recommended for .NET developers and solutions architects modernizing their Windows-based .NET workloads to gain Graviton's price-performance benefits. Walk away from this workshop equipped with production-ready skills to accelerate your .NET modernization journey. Requires laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon EC2 - Graviton; AWS Transform
tags: Microsoft & .NET; VMware; Cost Optimization; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Optimize agentic AI apps with semantic caching
description: Multi-agent AI systems now orchestrate complex workflows requiring frequent foundation model calls. In this session, learn how you can reduce latencies to single-digit milliseconds from single-digit seconds in agentic AI applications using semantic caching, while also reducing the cost incurred from your foundation models for production workloads. By implementing semantic caching in agentic architectures like RAG-powered assistants and autonomous agents, customers can create performant and cost-effective production-scale agentic AI systems.
tags: Generative AI; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Optimize AI infrastructure performance with SageMaker HyperPod
description: Join us in this interactive session where we'll explore how to efficiently manage your AI infrastructure to maximize compute performance while optimizing costs. We will discuss how to leverage SageMaker AI high-performance compute to accelerate model training and inference and SageMaker HyperPod's task governance tools to streamline workflow management and resource allocation. You'll learn observability best practices to gain visibility into cluster performance and identify optimization opportunities, and strategies to gain the visibility and control needed to fine-tune your cluster performance for large-scale AI model development.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Optimize analytics workloads on Amazon EKS for performance and cost
description: The analytics landscape is undergoing a shift as global data volumes grow at unprecedented rates. This rapid growth, combined with rising demand for real-time analytics, is driving organizations to modernize and optimize their data processing and analytics workloads. Amazon EKS delivers cost-performance and scalability making it the best place to run these workloads. In this workshop, you gain hands-on experience on how to optimize Amazon EKS for Spark workloads using different Karpenter configurations, Spot and Graviton Instances, and NVMe volumes. You will also explore observability best practices and granular cost visualization per job.
speakers: Alan Halcyon; Ramesh Mathikumar; Sundar Shanmugam
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Open Data; Kubernetes; Machine Learning; Analytics; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Learn to enhance your AWS Backup implementation using the AWS Backup Evaluator Solution, an AI agent that synthesizes data from multiple sources, including AWS Backup Audit Manager. Through hands-on exercises, use Amazon Q to assess your backup environment against the Well-Architected AWS Backup lens, generating actionable recommendations. Create a unified view of your backup landscape to identify optimization opportunities, strengthen compliance, and improve your backup strategy. Build practical solutions for AI-driven backup evaluation that align with AWS best practices while enhancing efficiency and resilience.

description: As cloud applications grow in complexity, optimizing costs becomes crucial for developers. This session explores AWS-native tools and coding practices that reduce expenses without compromising performance or scalability. Learn to identify resource inefficiencies using AI-powered recommendations and cost analysis tools. Discover how to implement cost-aware architectures across compute, serverless, and observability services. The presentation covers practical techniques for identifying and automating optimization practise using Amazon Q Developer. Developers will gain actionable insights to build cost-efficient applications and optimize cloud spending.

description: Learn how to build intelligent workflows that bridge customer interactions with back-office operations using generative AI capabilities in Amazon Connect. Discover practical techniques for automating case management, streamlining tasks, and generating AI-powered responses and resolution guides. You will explore automatic field population, case summarization, and next-best-action recommendations, helping you modernize operations and reduce resolution times across your organization.

description: Join this session to learn how to elevate operational efficiency in your contact center using Amazon Connect. We'll focus on industry-leading practices for change management and automated CI/CD workflows to master change control, asset versioning, and automated deployment of Amazon Connect resources. We'll cover strategies to streamline release cycles, minimize risk, and drive rapid innovation in both B2B and B2C environments. You'll also learn how to maintain a secure, resilient, and scalable architecture and walk away with the knowledge to optimize operational overhead and achieve seamless efficiency in your Amazon Connect implementation.

title: Optimize contact center staffing using AI-powered assistants
description: Discover how to automate contact center agent staffing exceptions and call-outs within Amazon Connect workforce planning using an intelligent MCP scheduling server. This hands-on session will show you how to create a system that processes natural language notifications, calculates staffing impacts through Athena SQL queries, and execute real-time schedule adjustments across skill groups. You'll implement advanced algorithms that assess staffing gaps, trigger proactive coverage changes, and alert managers with data-driven recommendations when automation limits are reached. Learn practical techniques that improve forecast accuracy, reduce understaffing, and enhance SLA compliance through automated workforce optimization.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Optimize cost & performance in Amazon RDS for SQL Server
description: Cost and performance are top of mind for customers, and these topics go hand in hand. In this chalk talk, learn how to deploy a performant and cost-effective Amazon RDS for SQL Server solution that fits your needs. Explore RDS monitoring tools and native SQL Server features that can be leveraged to pinpoint query inefficiencies, optimize workloads, and right-size your database instances for both cost and peak performance.
tags: Microsoft & .NET; Cost Optimization; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Optimize Cost and Performance in Amazon OpenSearch Service
description: Join us to learn Amazon OpenSearch Service cost optimization and performance improvement strategies. Discover how organizations reduce costs using tiered storage strategies and automated lifecycle management. Learn how Cluster Insights and Query Insights enable automated health monitoring and query optimization, while Workload Management delivers efficient multi-tenant resource allocation. Developers and architects will learn practical approaches for implementing zero-ETL integration, optimizing queries, and right-sizing deployments. We'll demonstrate automated configuration testing and dynamic parameter adjustment for optimal performance. You'll learn to implement cost-effective data retention, efficient index management, and automated optimization workflows for large-scale analytics or managing multi-tenant deployments.
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Business Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Optimize Costs with Multi-Session Application Streaming
description: Managing high-performance application workloads presents ongoing challenges: unpredictable demand, underutilized expensive resources, and escalating costs. In this session, you'll discover how Amazon AppStream 2.0's multi-session feature transforms application delivery by enabling multiple users to share GPU and CPU-intensive instances securely and cost-effectively. In this hands-on builder session, you'll build and test graphics workloads on multi-session AppStream 2.0 while learning scaling optimization techniques. We'll guide you through configuring shared GPU instances, monitoring resource utilization, and implementing cost-effective scaling strategies. You'll gain practical experience and leave with actionable strategies to modernize your infrastructure and achieve significant cost savings.
speakers: Asriel Agronin; Anthony Harvey; Andrew Morgan; Jeremy Schiefer; Brian Stucker
tags: Management & Governance; Well-Architected Framework; Cost Optimization; End-User Computing; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Financial Services; Professional Services; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Optimize customer conversations in your IVR with Amazon Connect
description: Discover how to set up effective interactive voice response (IVR) experiences in Amazon Connect by combining structured and unstructured conversation designs. Through hands-on exercises, learn when to use structured pathways for specific outcomes versus unstructured approaches for handling ambiguous inquiries. You'll gain practical knowledge to implement the right IVR strategy based on your business requirements and customer needs.
tags: SaaS; Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Optimize data processing with built-in AWS Step Functions features [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize your serverless data processing workflows at scale. Dive into utilizing AWS Step Functions and its features, including service integration patterns and Distributed Map state. Review common applications and examples of these features to understand when to use them, and learn how they can help you save processing time, resources, and money. title: Pioneering Agentic AI Transformation: CSL VMware & SAP modernization
description: Explore CSL's comprehensive transformation strategy focused on migrating complex VMware workloads and consolidating fragmented SAP systems to build a more agile and resilient foundation. Learn how CSL leveraged agentic AI with AWS Transform to reduce technical debt and licensing costs across 4000+ VMware servers, revolutionizing traditional migration approaches and accelerating discovery and planning processes by 10x. You'll also discover how CSL unified their fragmented ERP landscape and established enterprise-wide data standards through RISE with SAP on AWS. Gain technical guidance, get inspired with lessons learned, and walk away with actionable insights that you can use in your organization.
speakers: Victor Feinman; Hariharan Govindharajan; Erik Hong
services: AWS Application Migration Service; AWS Transform
tags: SAP; VMware; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Pipeline architectures: Balancing centralization and team autonomy
description: Centralized pipelines enhance standardization and compliance oversight, while decentralized approaches enable team autonomy - but how do you achieve both? Explore architectural patterns for implementing effective security controls and governance across hybrid models that balance organizational control with developer agility. Through real-world examples, learn strategies for security gates, compliance monitoring, and risk management that scale across pipeline architectures. Discover how different architectural decisions impact DORA metrics to improve deployment frequency, lead time, reliability, and incident recovery.
services: AWS CloudFormation; AWS CodePipeline; AWS Config
tags: Management & Governance; DevOps; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Plan and execute PostgreSQL version upgrades for Aurora & Amazon RDS
description: Navigating PostgreSQL major version upgrades in Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL environments requires careful planning and understanding of available options. This session provides a comprehensive guide to upgrade paths, covering both in-place and replication-based strategies. We'll explore critical considerations for minimizing downtime, handling compatibility issues, and leveraging AWS tools for smooth upgrades. Learn more about long-term support and RDS Extended Support offerings, helping you make informed decisions for your database upgrade strategy. Whether you are managing a single instance or a fleet of databases, discover best practices for successful major version upgrades.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Open Data; Innovation & Transformation; DevOps; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Platform engineering: From developer success to business value
description: Dive into platform engineering in this interactive session. We'll explore real-world challenges and practical solutions for building effective internal platforms that support developers and meet organizational goals. Through collaborative discussion and sketching, we'll examine ways to enhance developer experience, reduce complexity, and create measurable business impact. Key topics include organizing platform teams, standardizing workflows, and tracking success metrics. Whether you're new to platform engineering or refining existing systems, you'll gain valuable insights from peers and contribute your own experiences. Join us to collaboratively tackle common hurdles and design strategies that foster innovation and operational excellence in your organization's platform journey.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; DevSecOps; DevOps; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Platform engineering: How to build a developer platform on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Development teams struggle with inconsistent and fragmented tooling as well as complex provisioning processes. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to build an internal developer platform (IDP) centralizing capabilities while enabling developer self-service. You’ll create a unified developer portal with Backstage for service discovery and golden paths; deploy infrastructure-as-code templates using Crossplane for standardized AWS resource provisioning; enforce security-by-default with Kyverno policies for namespace isolation and network controls; and establish data-driven KPIs to measure platform adoption and delivery metrics. We'll use AWS services including Amazon EKS and demonstrate practical patterns for namespace-as-a-service, policy-as-code, and GitOps workflows.
tags: DevSecOps; Containers; Kubernetes; Developer Tools; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Platform engineering: How to build a developer platform on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Development teams struggle with inconsistent and fragmented tooling as well as complex provisioning processes. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to build an internal developer platform (IDP) centralizing capabilities while enabling developer self-service. You’ll create a unified developer portal with Backstage for service discovery and golden paths; deploy infrastructure-as-code templates using Crossplane for standardized AWS resource provisioning; enforce security-by-default with Kyverno policies for namespace isolation and network controls; and establish data-driven KPIs to measure platform adoption and delivery metrics. We'll use AWS services including Amazon EKS and demonstrate practical patterns for namespace-as-a-service, policy-as-code, and GitOps workflows.
tags: DevSecOps; Containers; Kubernetes; Developer Tools; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: PostgreSQL performance: Real-world workload tuning [REPEAT]
description: PostgreSQL performance isn’t magic—it’s engineering. In this code talk, we dive deep into practical tuning techniques to avoid common pitfalls that silently degrade performance by improving an underperforming PostgreSQL database workload. Learn how excessive indexes hurt write throughput, why HOT updates fail, and how vacuum behavior can stall your system. We’ll demonstrate how to use Query Plan Management (QPM) and pg_hint_plan for plan stability and decode wait events to uncover hidden bottlenecks. With real SQL examples and system insights, this session equips you to tune PostgreSQL for predictable, high-performance workloads.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Open Data; DevOps; Databases; Open Source; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: PostgreSQL performance: Real-world workload tuning [REPEAT]
description: PostgreSQL performance isn’t magic—it’s engineering. In this code talk, we dive deep into practical tuning techniques to avoid common pitfalls that silently degrade performance by improving an underperforming PostgreSQL database workload. Learn how excessive indexes hurt write throughput, why HOT updates fail, and how vacuum behavior can stall your system. We’ll demonstrate how to use Query Plan Management (QPM) and pg_hint_plan for plan stability and decode wait events to uncover hidden bottlenecks. With real SQL examples and system insights, this session equips you to tune PostgreSQL for predictable, high-performance workloads.
services: Amazon Aurora; Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
tags: Open Data; DevOps; Databases; Open Source; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Power streaming analytics on AWS with AI-driven insights
description: Learn how to build a modern, streaming analytics solution for real-time data processing and power it with agentic AI capabilities to analyze events and extract patterns for actionable responses. This session will provide a hands-on experience on building a streaming solution using Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka for real-time data ingestion, using Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink for complex event processing, and Strands Agents on Amazon Bedrock Agent Core to take immediate action. Further evolve this solution to demonstrate the integration with Amazon S3 Tables for deeper analysis.
services: Amazon Kinesis; Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)
tags: Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Powering AI and agentic platforms with Amazon Bedrock
description: Organizations are rapidly building AI applications and workflows to automate manual processes and boost productivity. The reality: many of these initiatives never reach production. This session explores the critical challenges of building, deploying, and scaling end-to-end enterprise AI systems and shares proven technical architectures and best practices to go from POC to production with Amazon Bedrock. You'll hear directly from Vercel, a leading provider of AI dev tools, as they share how they built and scaled their production AI platform with Amazon Bedrock and how their AI SDK accelerates building AI applications with Amazon Bedrock integrations.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Powering Enterprise AI: Architecting and Governing Agents at Iberdrola on AWS
description: Iberdrola leverages AWS to deploy Claude 4 AI agents that enhance operational efficiency through compressed decision cycles. The implementation focuses on three use cases demonstrating the design of domain-specific agents with comprehensive telemetry and safe scalability. Their approach transforms experimental prompts into reliable services through robust governance that balances innovation with risk management. Performance metrics directly connect agent activities to business outcomes. Iberdrola's vision includes developing an enterprise Agent Hub - a marketplace for teams to share and reuse certified AI agents. This platform will serve as a strategic asset, enabling Iberdrola to maximize AI benefits across its operations.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Serverless; Artificial Intelligence; Energy & Utilities; Lecture-style

title: Powering the Future of Battle Royale — EA’s Apex Legends & Amazon GameLift
description: Technical leaders from Electronic Arts share the story behind one of the most significant backend transformations in modern online gaming: the migration of EA’s Apex Legends to Amazon GameLift. EA’s move to Amazon GameLift represents a major shift in how large-scale multiplayer games are built, deployed, and operated. This session will dive deep into the motivations, challenges, and solutions that drove the transition. Attendees will gain insights into real-world cloud migration at scale, learn best practices for live service architecture, and explore how EA and AWS are shaping the next generation of infrastructure to deliver reliable experiences for players worldwide.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Games; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Powering your Agentic AI experience with AWS Streaming and Messaging
description: Organizations are accelerating innovation with generative AI and agentic AI use cases. This session explores how AWS streaming and messaging services such as Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka, Kinesis Data Streams, Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink, and Amazon SQS build intelligent, responsive applications. Discover how streaming supports real-time data ingestion and processing, while messaging ensures reliable coordination between AI agents, orchestrates workflows, and delivers critical information at scale. Learn architectural patterns that highlight how a unified approach acts on data as fast as needed, providing the reliability and scale to grow for your next generation of AI.
speakers: Mindy Ferguson; Francisco Morillo; Christopher Jackson
services: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams; Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK); Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Analytics; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Powering your success through AWS Infrastructure innovations
description: Discover how AWS Networking delivers on five critical outcomes: availability, performance, scalability, agility, and cost. Come and learn about continual infrastructure advancements in datacenter technologies, and how we integrate lessons from our GenAI scaling journey. As one of the world's top network device makers, we've applied these innovations to make all workloads - including AI/ML - faster and more reliable. In this session, you will learn how the AWS backbone is more reliable from transformative cloud infrastructure innovations, giving your workloads competitive advantages in today's evolving technological landscape.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Network & Infrastructure Security; Quantum Technologies; Architecture; Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: Practical Applications of Edge Compute in Amazon CloudFront [REPEAT]
description: Edge compute is a practical way to build faster, smarter applications. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into how Amazon CloudFront empowers developers to run custom logic at the edge using CloudFront Functions, Lambda@Edge, and the Key Value Store. We'll explore real-world use cases, architectural patterns, and recent feature launches that unlock powerful personalization, performance optimization, and cost efficiency. Come ready to whiteboard, ask questions, and discover how to push intelligence closer to your users.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Practical Applications of Edge Compute in Amazon CloudFront [REPEAT]
description: Edge compute is a practical way to build faster, smarter applications. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into how Amazon CloudFront empowers developers to run custom logic at the edge using CloudFront Functions, Lambda@Edge, and the Key Value Store. We'll explore real-world use cases, architectural patterns, and recent feature launches that unlock powerful personalization, performance optimization, and cost efficiency. Come ready to whiteboard, ask questions, and discover how to push intelligence closer to your users.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: Prepare for your Next AWS Certification Exam [Exam Prep]
description: Learn how to prepare for your next AWS Certification exam with the Exam Prep team. In this 45-minute session, the team will walk you through the 4-step plan to prepare for AWS Certification exams and introduce you to the official materials available in AWS Skill Builder. Search the re:Invent catalog for Exam Prep sessions for foundational, associate, and professional-level exams.
tags: Training & Certification

title: Privacy-enhanced ML and GenAI for AdTechs with AWS Clean Rooms
description: Delivering relevant ads to consumers and understanding return on advertising spend historically involved sharing data in ways that posed privacy concerns. Explore how organizations can generate insights with their partners without sharing underlying data with AWS Clean Rooms. Learn how to use AWS Clean Rooms ML to train models and run inference for use cases including lookalike modeling and fine tuning foundation models without sharing raw data or model weights. Discover how to apply privacy-enhancing controls to enable AI data collaboration for brand standard adherence, personalized GenAI recommendations, RTB optimization, and more while mitigating privacy concerns in multiparty ML workflows.
tags: Generative AI; Responsible AI; Analytics; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Advertising & Marketing; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Media & Entertainment; Interactive

title: Privacy-enhanced multi-party analytics with AWS Clean Rooms: Setup to insights
description: Companies across multiple industries increasingly look to complement their data with external partners’ data to build a complete view of their business while protecting sensitive consumer information. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how AWS Clean Rooms enables secure data collaboration between multiple parties without sharing raw data. You will learn how to set up a Clean Rooms collaboration, configure privacy-enhancing controls, and perform multi-party analytics using collective datasets. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn enterprise-grade patterns for secure data partnerships that drive business value and generate unique insights about advertising campaigns, investment decisions, research and development, and more.
tags: Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Financial Services; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Privacy-preserving AI primitives: Building blocks for regulated industries
description: Regulated industries face unique challenges in adopting AI while maintaining compliance. Explore four fundamental privacy-preserving primitives that unlock AWS AI capabilities: encryption with AWS KMS, confidential computing with AWS Nitro System, federated learning, and cryptographic computing. Through industry case studies, examine real-world implementations, architectural considerations, and performance trade-offs. Learn to evaluate these essential primitives against specific regulatory requirements and design solutions that maintain data sovereignty while leveraging cloud scalability. Gain actionable strategies for implementing privacy-preserving AI in regulated environments.
tags: Data Protection; Cryptography and Post-Quantum; Architecture; Advisor / Consultant; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Processing payments with real-time serverless architectures
description: Traditional batch processes often introduce significant processing delays and lack the resilience demanded by modern business operations. In this session, we will demonstrate how adopting an event-driven paradigm can fundamentally remove the constraints and limitations inherent in traditional batch processing, enabling near real-time data processing and enhanced operational efficiency. Learn practical strategies and architectural patterns to transform your legacy batch workflows into agile, event-driven systems.
services: Amazon EventBridge; AWS Lambda; AWS Step Functions
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Advisor / Consultant; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Production Trino: Robust Interactive Workloads at Scale
description: Trino has emerged as a powerful distributed SQL engine for big data analytics, enabling fast, interactive querying across diverse data sources. This session explores how to build and optimize Trino clusters for production workloads at scale. We'll dive deep into key features like fault-tolerant execution and efficient caching strategies, addressing implementation challenges and real-world configurations. Beyond these core topics, we'll discuss broader considerations for running Trino in production environments. You'll gain practical insights for operating mission-critical Trino workloads on AWS, with a focus on achieving reliability and performance at scale.
tags: Disaster Response & Recovery; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Databases; Open Source; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Production-ready AI: Architecting resilient apps with Amazon  Bedrock
description: You've proven AI works—now make it production-ready. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll explore the architectural patterns that take Amazon Bedrock applications from POC to production scale. Learn how to architect for resilience across model changes, optimize for performance and cost, implement effective monitoring, and handle capacity planning. Learn how successful Bedrock customers choose the right models for your use cases, build multi-region strategies, manage model upgrades, and establish operational excellence. Walk away with battle-tested patterns and a production readiness framework you can apply immediately.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Production-ready Serverless: mastering Powertools for AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: Discover how Powertools for AWS Lambda transforms Lambda development by implementing critical best practices at scale. This chalk talk demonstrates practical techniques beyond observability, including event schema validation, dynamic routing mechanisms, and feature flag implementations. We'll explore parameter resolution, idempotency controls, and batch processing patterns for building reliable functions. Learn how to enforce strong typing with event source data models while implementing resilient error handling flows. Build Lambda functions that reduce boilerplate while aligning with Well-Architected principles. Bring your questions as we collaboratively design serverless solutions that are observable, maintainable, and optimized for enterprise requirements using this open source toolkit.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Well-Architected Framework; Serverless; Open Source; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; System Administrator; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Production-ready Serverless: mastering Powertools for AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: Discover how Powertools for AWS Lambda transforms Lambda development by implementing critical best practices at scale. title: Prompting the future: How the public sector turns barriers into breakthroughs
description: Public sector organizations face unique challenges in digital transformation, from strict security requirements to complex regulatory compliance. But cloud technology is paving new paths for government agencies and public institutions. Discover practical approaches to secure migration and modernization, and the management of classified and regulated workloads. Through real-world examples, explore how organizations are leveraging high-performance computing and implementing AI solutions to advance their missions. In this session, you'll learn technical insights for advancing your organization's cloud journey, regardless of where you're starting.
tags: Industry Solutions; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: Protect privacy in GenAI applications using AWS Confidential computing
description: Data privacy in generative AI applications includes protecting highly sensitive data in prompts, augmented data sources and model weights among other things. In this workshop you will build three generative AI sample application stacks after identifying the attack surfaces for common scenarios like inferencing, knowledge augmentation. You will mitigate the associated threats as part of the design using AWS Confidential Computing features of Amazon EC2 that align with secure approach to generative AI with AWS . You will use open source language models as well as Amazon Bedrock as part of this workshop.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Generative AI; Privacy; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Protect your data with AWS Backup: overview, use cases and what's new
description: AWS Backup helps over 140,000 customers protect more than 2.9 exabytes of application data across AWS services. It offers policy-based data protection, streamlining backup management, enhancing security controls, and simplifying compliance reporting. In this session, you'll learn how to use AWS Backup, hear what's new, and discover practical implementation strategies. Plus, hear directly from customers about their real-world experiences using AWS Backup to protect mission-critical workloads and maintain business continuity. Whether you're new to AWS Backup or a seasoned user, this session will provide valuable insights into protecting your AWS environment.
speakers: Palak Desai; Bisman Sethi; Chuck Uwanna
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Security & Identity; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Protecting  Your Infrastructure with Amazon Threat Intelligence
description: Come see how AWS Security processes 5 billion events per second to transparently protect all AWS customers. Learn how AWS builds and  leverages threat intelligence so customers can protect their infrastructure  through three key components: MadPot threat disruption system, Amazon Threat  Intelligence, and active threat defense architecture. We'll deep dive into  our data architectures used to analyze against incoming security data, our  threat intelligence capabilities and how they are integrated into AWS  security services. Discover how to maximize these intelligence-driven  services within your own security operations and improve your cloud security  posture.
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Protecting block storage at scale with native encryption and EBS Snapshots
description: With more than 500 million Amazon EBS volumes created daily, protecting them against threat events requires native encryption for data at rest and in transit. This session explores how EBS integrates with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) for key policies, automatic rotation, and cross-account controls. Learn how to launch hundreds of EC2 instances and EBS volumes with speed and predictability from EBS Snapshots and automate backup, replication, and disaster recovery using Data Lifecycle Manager. We’ll also cover snapshot consistency, incremental storage efficiency, and restore performance to help secure sensitive workloads, ensure compliance, and accelerate EC2 instance startup times.
services: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Data Protection; Disaster Response & Recovery; Resilience; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Protecting FSx for NetApp ONTAP data from ransomware
description: Organizations need advanced data protection strategies as ransomware events become more frequent and sophisticated. Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP delivers advanced capabilities to strengthen data resilience through NetApp's Autonomous Ransomware Protection (ARP). This intelligent monitoring system detects unusual file system activity and automatically creates protective snapshots when anomalous behavior occurs. Combined with NetApp ONTAP SnapLock WORM technology and volume replication, ARP provides comprehensive protection for SMB and NFS file shares. This session covers how to protect your file data to plan for rapid responses to ransomware events, helping you maintain business continuity and minimize operational disruption.
tags: Data Protection; Network & Infrastructure Security; Resilience; Security & Identity; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Put your data to work for Agentic AI with AWS storage
description: Agentic AI systems require storage that delivers persistent memory, real-time decisions, and seamless multi-agent collaboration. AWS offers the most comprehensive storage portfolio to support these needs, including high-speed services like S3 Express One Zone, storage for compute intensive agent workflows using FSx for Lustre, and scalable vector storage and query with S3 Vectors. With the new MCP Server for S3, agents can query context-rich data using natural language without complex code. This session explores how to architect agentic AI with purpose-built AWS storage and integrations with Amazon Bedrock and OpenSearch Service, enabling intelligent agents to operate continuously while simplifying infrastructure and accelerating production deployment.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon FSx; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Quantum Computing with Amazon Braket: From Exploration to Enterprise
description: Join us to explore the emerging field of quantum computing through Amazon Braket. This session outlines AWS's quantum strategy and latest service capabilities, demonstrating how organizations can begin experimenting with quantum algorithms alongside classical computing workloads. Senior technical and business leaders will gain a clear understanding of current quantum capabilities, experimental approaches, and how future quantum computers will integrate with HPC systems.
tags: Quantum Technologies; Customer Enablement; Compute; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; Tech Explorer; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Quantum Computing: Accelerating Pharma Innovation
description: Discover how quantum computing is transforming pharmaceutical development and healthcare today. This session demonstrates practical quantum optimization using QAOA through MATLAB and Amazon Braket integration. Explore real-world breakthroughs in pharmaceutical production optimization and cancer diagnostic acceleration. You'll learn how cloud-based quantum computing solves previously intractable computational challenges, see live demonstrations, and gain actionable insights for implementing quantum solutions in your organization. Whether you're in pharma research, healthcare tech, or industrial optimization, leave with practical steps to leverage these cutting-edge capabilities in your existing workflows. See how accessible quantum computing delivers measurable impact now—not years from now.
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Quantum Solutions Driving Enterprise Value: From Security to Finance
description: Join us to learn how industry leaders are researching and developing quantum applications with Q-CTRL and Amazon Braket. We will show you how Accenture Federal Services improved the performance of quantum algorithms for network anomaly detection by 3x using QCTRL’s Fire Opal optimizer. Discover how hybrid approaches that combine quantum and classical computing on AWS can be applied to use cases in cybersecurity, finance, or materials science. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how your organization can get ready for quantum computing with Q-CTRL and Amazon Braket.
services: Amazon Braket; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Quantum Technologies; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Quick catch up to GenAI on AWS
description: [This session is conducted in Japanese] As always AWS does, we are focusing on evolving rapidly our Generative AI related services based on customer's feedbacks. But sometimes, customer gave us feedbacks like "It's tough to catch up since new services and capabilities are come up one after another". In this session, we'll show you an up-to-dated overview of Generative AI related services offered by AWS. Through this session you can get quick summary to wide variety set of services that are useful to build Generative AI enabled applications. It's also helpful for better understanding to newly launched services and functionalities.
tags: Lecture-style

title: RAG vs MCP: Making the right choice for enterprises
description: As generative AI adoption accelerates, architects face a critical question: should they rely on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to ground LLM responses or embrace the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for richer tool integration and orchestration? This session provides a practical decision framework for selecting the right approach, or combining both for your enterprise workloads. We will dive deep into RAG architectures on AWS, and explore MCP concepts for enabling secure, structured interactions between models and external tools. Through real-world patterns and live demos, you’ll learn when RAG alone is sufficient, when MCP offers a better fit, and how to design hybrid.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Rapid prototyping: Leveraging Kiro and Amazon Q Developer CLI [REPEAT]
description: Gain hands-on experience building functional prototypes using proven AWS techniques. Learn to leverage Kiro and Amazon Q Developer CLI to rapidly transform ideas into working solutions while validating technical approaches. Master effective prompt engineering and spec-driven development practices. Explore how to combine generative AI capabilities with AWS services for accelerated iteration and refinement. This workshop equips architects and developers with practical skills for rapid, AI-assisted prototyping on AWS.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Q Developer; Amazon Nova
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Gain hands-on experience building functional prototypes using proven AWS techniques. Learn to leverage Kiro and Amazon Q Developer CLI to rapidly transform ideas into working solutions while validating technical approaches.
