services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Q Developer; Amazon Nova
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Rapidly accelerate product development and launches with AI
description: Consumer expectations are rapidly evolving, requiring brands and retailers to develop and launch innovative, new products quickly. In this session, you’ll learn how to use artificial intelligence (AI) to accelerate prototype development, create compelling content, and rapidly scale product launches, significantly reducing time-to-market and costs. VF Corporation will share how they are reinventing go-to-market with generative AI, embedding it across brands to accelerate product launches, streamline global content creation, and drive unprecedented speed, efficiency, and creativity. Fanatics Collectibles will showcase how they are using specialized AI agents to create engaging, high quality trading cards in minutes instead of days.
speakers: Shiva Hariharaiyer; Davide Azzalini; Celia Chen
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Industry Solutions; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Re-defining customer experiences with SAP and Pan-Amazon Services
description: The SAP landscape is changing— with customers not just asking “How can you help us migrate and run our SAP applications in the cloud?”, but instead: “How can you help us transform our business and better serve our customers?”. Join this session to learn how industry leaders are combining SAP modernization with Amazon's extensive portfolio to revolutionize customer experiences. You'll hear how customers are redefining purchasing through Amazon.com and Alexa integration. Discover how Pan-Amazon services like Amazon Business, Prime, and Multi-Channel Fulfillment can help deliver exceptional customer experiences alongside SAP.
speakers: Adam Hill; Rik Blog; Dongho Lee
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Q; AWS SDK for SAP ABAP
tags: SAP; Innovation & Transformation; Learning from Amazon; Application Integration; Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Real-Time Data and Analytics Showdown
description: Your task for the Architecture challenge: Design and implement a data engineering pipeline that ingests petabytes of batch and real-time data from both structured and unstructured data sources. Develop a data lakehouse architecture which could act as a source for machine learning and reporting systems for making data-driven business decisions. Minimize data duplication and at the same time provide governance around data quality and security. Teams will be formed onsite, then guided by AWS subject matter experts compete in a gamified challenge where trade-offs decide success. Compete, showcase strategies, and leave with prizes and proven patterns for real-time analytics at scale.
speakers: Amit Borulkar; Avichal Chum; Sudeesh Sasidharan
tags: Analytics; Application Integration; Architecture; Interactive

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Resilience Challenge
description: Ready for a high-availability challenge? Your solution must minimize global latency, enable seamless automatic failover, and meet surge capacity needs while leveraging AWS global infrastructure services. Learn how to apply multi-region design strategies, optimize for resilience, and balance trade-offs in performance and cost. Teams will be formed onsite, where AWS subject matter experts guide you in a gamified live challenge where architectural decisions are put to the test. Compete to present and defend your solutions, explore diverse approaches, and walk away with proven patterns and some exclusive Rodeo swag.
speakers: Amit Borulkar; Avichal Chum; Brian Maguire
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; DevOps; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Serverless Showdown
description: Strap in for the Serverless Rodeo: a high-energy migration challenge where teams must transform a legacy application into a modern, global, service-oriented platform built on open-source databases with serverless technologies on the AWS Cloud. Your team will design incremental microservice decompositions, execute zero-impact data migrations from a commercial database to PostgreSQL or MySQL, and ensure the frontend is globally accessible via edge and multi-region patterns. AWS experts will coach teams as you make real-world tradeoffs around availability (99.99%), hybrid connectivity, and cost. Walk away with battle-tested modernization patterns, a playbook for global delivery, and bragging rights for whoever modernizes the monolith best.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Innovation & Transformation; Serverless; Architecture; Migration & Modernization; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Real-time AI inference patterns: Lessons from production game workloads
description: Discover practical patterns for real-time AI inference through a production case study. When Jam & Tea Studios shipped one of the first AI-native games on Steam, they faced unique challenges: reducing inference costs 1000x during development, achieving low latency response times for multiplayer sessions, and building testing frameworks for non-deterministic AI behavior. Learn their architectural approaches for fusing traditional application logic with ML systems, techniques for managing hallucinations as features not bugs, and in-production tools for debugging AI behavior. This technical deep dive covers lessons applicable to any interactive AI system where response speed and cost efficiency determine user experience.
tags: Generative AI; Industry Solutions; Games; Interactive

title: Real-time insights for smart manufacturing with AWS Serverless
description: Manufacturing facilities need instant access to operational data for smarter decision-making. This serverless solution leverages AWS Lambda, Amazon Timestream, and Amazon S3 to deliver real-time, multilingual safety protocols and technical insights to the factory floor. This architecture eliminates infrastructure overhead while enabling immediate analysis of production data, helping manufacturers optimize operations and maintain safety compliance through data-driven insights.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon Timestream; AWS Lambda
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Real-time Patient and Revenue Cycle Insights with Gen AI
description: Discover how Huron is using generative AI to transform patient satisfaction and revenue cycle analytics. Harnessing the power of AWS Bedrock, Amazon Nova LLM, and Amazon Redshift in diverse areas of healthcare analytics, Huron is achieving 90% accuracy in real-time sentiment analysis and proactively diagnosing opportunities for revenue cycle improvement. Learn how their solution drives hospital revenue through improved funding and staff coaching, successfully scaling to over 100 healthcare providers. Discover practical insights for integrating AWS AI services to transform patient experience measurement and achieve immediate business impact in healthcare operations.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon RedShift; Amazon Nova
tags: Business Intelligence; Generative AI; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Reclaiming Clinical Time: How Veradigm Uses AI to Transform Workflows
description: Discover how Veradigm's Practice Fusion EHR leverages AWS' purpose-built Healthcare AI services—AWS HealthLake, AWS HealthScribe, and Amazon Bedrock—to reduce administrative burden and reclaim valuable clinical time. This session highlights a real-world implementation where ambient clinical documentation powered by AWS HealthScribe seamlessly integrates with AWS HealthLake FHIR datastore and Amazon Bedrock's generative AI capabilities to streamline workflows at the point of care. Learn how these integrated healthcare AI solutions enable health tech organizations to accelerate patient care innovation by eliminating the complexity of building and maintaining foundational data and AI infrastructure.
speakers: MIRZA BAIG; Himanshu Joshi; Ken Sheppard
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS HealthLake; AWS HealthScribe
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Red Team vs Blue Team: Securing AI Agents
description: AI agents represent the next evolution of APIs, bringing new security challenges and attack vectors. This session examines real-world adversarial threats including prompt injection, tool abuse, and agent-to-agent escalation. Learn defensive strategies using rate limiting, encrypted endpoints, and Amazon Bedrock Guardrails. The session demonstrates how to build secure-by-default agents using Infrastructure as Code, enforcing deterministic behavior and Zero Trust principles. Essential knowledge for teams deploying autonomous agents in production environments.
tags: Application Security; Zero Trust; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Red teaming LLMs: Defence techniques for generative AI applications
description: In this session, we’ll explore adversarial and “red team” testing for LLM-powered applications—covering prompt injection attacks, toxic output generation, training data poisoning, model exfiltration, and other emerging threats. Attendees will deep dive into real attack demonstrations, such as jailbreaking an AI assistant, and hands-on threat modeling exercises. We’ll also highlight how AWS services and features (Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, content moderation APIs, and logging/monitoring tools) help defend against these vulnerabilities. Participants will leave with a clear strategy for hardening generative AI apps against abuse and insights into conducting security assessments on AI systems.
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Security Specialist; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Red teaming your generative AI and MCP applications at scale
description: Step into the shoes of an AI-powered red team adversary in the GenAI Red Team Challenge. In this intensive workshop, you'll deploy a AI security agent to orchestrate sophisticated threat chains against Model Context Protocol (MCP) applications, systematically discovering vulnerabilities. Master countermeasures from prompt templating and guardrails to OAuth-enhanced MCP security configurations that prevent unauthorized access. This hands-on, gamified experience helps you think like a threat actor and equips you with practical skills in automated vulnerability testing and risk mitigation against common MITRE and OWASP vulnerabilities for LLM-based applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Cognito; AWS WAF
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Redefining Operations: Caterpillar's Geospatial Intelligence Solution
description: Discover how Caterpillar's innovative GIS solution is revolutionizing construction and mining operations through advanced geospatial intelligence. By integrating real-time data from 20,000+ connected assets, this cloud-native platform delivers terrain modeling with 2-centimeter precision. The system combines sensor data, from ground elevation to equipment activity, with drone-generated surface scans, enabling data-driven decisions that optimize operations and enhance safety. This scalable solution minimizes infrastructure overhead while ensuring robust security and compliance. Learn how this intelligent ecosystem helps customers reduce rework, improve resource utilization, and gain competitive advantage in the heavy equipment industry.
speakers: Steve Blackwell; Alan Doty; Ash Shah; Sriram Somasuntharam
tags: Industry Solutions; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Redefining service excellence: Canada Life’s AI-powered contact center
description: Join this session to discover how Canada Life transformed its contact center by moving from a fragmented, manual system to a cloud-based, AI-powered solution using Amazon Connect. This shift enabled seamless multi-channel engagement enabling customer interaction through their preferred channel, simplified authentication, and empowered agents with real-time tools and unified interfaces—resulting in streamlined operations, reduced complexity, faster resolutions and thus reduced operational costs and significantly improved customer satisfaction.
speakers: Sheila Smith; Arpita Bhattacharya; Jenny Daboud
tags: SaaS; Innovation & Transformation; Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Travel & Hospitality; Lecture-style

title: Reducing downtime: Build resilient architectures with Amazon ECS
description: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into proven strategies for building resilient applications using Amazon ECS. We will walk through real-world scenarios across the entire technology stack - from infrastructure and networking to operations and application layers. Through these practical examples, you will learn patterns to improve the resilience of your containerized workloads. By the end of the session, you will have actionable insights to enhance fault tolerance, reduce system downtime, and maintain business continuity in your Amazon ECS deployments.
tags: Resilience; Containers; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Refactoring Java applications to serverless
description: In this chalk talk, you will learn how to modernize enterprise Java architectures using serverless technologies. You will explore the transformation of three common enterprise patterns: scheduled job processing using Amazon EventBridge Scheduler with AWS Lambda, synchronous API handling through Amazon API Gateway with Lambda, and asynchronous task processing via Amazon SQS with Lambda. Along the way you will learn how to structure your Serverless Java project, including strategies for seperating business logic across Lambda functions and how to leverage Spring, Quarkus and Micronaut framework support.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Refactoring post-migration: API-first and event-driven architectures
description: Explore architectural strategies for refactoring legacy systems post-migration using API-first and event-driven design principles. Learn how to leverage Amazon API Gateway, EventBridge, and Q Developer to create loosely coupled services. Examine patterns for using generative AI to accelerate interface extraction, OpenAPI contract generation, and event flow design. Through financial and logistics case studies, discover how these architectural approaches enhance release velocity and system flexibility. Gain practical patterns for implementing scalable, asynchronous processing in your post-migration modernization efforts.
services: Amazon API Gateway; Amazon EventBridge; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Refine customer journeys with predictive routing in Amazon Connect
description: Learn how to enhance customer experiences using AI-powered attribute routing in Amazon Connect. This session covers how to combine customer attributes with predictive modeling to intelligently match customers with the best-suited agents before conversations begin. Through practical examples, discover how machine learning techniques can reduce handle times, improve first-contact resolution, and create predictive customer journeys that boost satisfaction and loyalty.
tags: SaaS; Machine Learning; Business Applications; Interactive

title: Reimagine enterprise productivity with Amazon Q Business
description: Generative AI is reshaping how we interact with information and tackle complex tasks. Discover how Amazon Q Business enables you to rapidly deploy an AI-powered assistant that answers questions, generates summaries, creates content, and automates tasks—all using your enterprise data and systems. In this session, we'll explore the key features of Q Business and showcase real-world examples of how it's revolutionizing productivity and decision-making for Amazonians across various roles and departments. Learn about the benefits, best practices, and potential use cases that can be applied to your own organization.
tags: Business Applications; Lecture-style

title: Reimagine your mainframe applications using AWS Transform's AI agent
description: Transform mainframe applications into powerful cloud-native services in this workshop. Go beyond simple migration, harnessing AWS Transform's AI capabilities alongside developer tools to reimagine critical systems. Work with a specialized AI agent to tackle COBOL codebases and decode embedded business logic. Through practical exercises, you'll use agentic AI to break down monolithic applications into microservices, preserving relevant business rules. Experience the generation of well-structured, maintainable Java code optimized for the cloud. Practice proven techniques for successful modernization: validating transformed applications and maintaining required business logic integrity. Leave this session ready to deliver a winning transformation, armed with experience and practical knowledge.
tags: Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Reimagining AWS operations with autonomous AI agents
description: AI agents can take on routine operational tasks and reduce manual effort. This session explores how autonomous agents monitor, analyze, and respond to AWS workloads in real time. Learn design patterns, integration strategies, and guardrails to ensure reliability while accelerating operations with AI.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Reimagining Healthcare Access with Amazon One's Biometric Innovation
description: Discover how healthcare leaders are leveraging Amazon One's biometric technology to revolutionize patient check-in and staff authentication. This innovation creates friction-free experiences that improve operational efficiency throughout healthcare organizations. Industry executives will share how the technology enhances security and accuracy while allowing staff to focus on high-value patient care. Join us to learn from these leaders about their implementation journey and how Amazon One can transform your organization's daily operations.
tags: Automation; Culture of Security; Customer Enablement; Business Applications; Security & Identity; Business Executive; IT Executive; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Reimagining incident response with MCP on AWS
description: Enhance incident response with MCP-powered agents that understand your AWS platform context. In this session, you’ll learn how to build agents correlating symptoms across services, suggesting likely root causes, and automating initial remediation steps using Amazon EventBridge, AWS Lambda, and Amazon Bedrock. Discover how these agents deliver precise, real-time context to responders, enabling faster, more informed decision-making. Leave with proven patterns and a clear blueprint to dramatically reduce mean time to resolution (MTTR) in your AWS environments.
tags: Developer Tools; Lecture-style

title: Reimagining Public Sector with AWS Partner generative AI solutions
description: Generative AI is reshaping how public sector organizations deliver on their missions. In this session, discover practical approaches to adopting GenAI securely and effectively, guided by solutions from AWS Partners. We’ll explore four key pathways: weaving AI securely into your organization, preventing data loss with trusted controls, accelerating adoption through embedded AI, and solving complex business problems with partner-built solutions. Whether you’re just getting started or looking to scale, you’ll gain a roadmap for harnessing generative AI to drive impact across your agency or institution.
tags: Generative AI; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Education; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Reinforce large policy based authorization systems with Cedar Analysis
description: Cedar is a powerful open source solution for creating large-scale policy-based authorization systems. As policy systems expand, opportunities arise to enhance traditional testing approaches, addressing nuanced scenarios like Shadowed Permits, Impossible Conditions, Forbid Overrides, and Complete Denials. Customers seek robust assurance that access to their data remains secure and well-managed my policy changes are needed.
tags: Application Security; DevSecOps; Identity & Access Management; Developer Tools; Open Source; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Reinvent your career: From developer to cloud leader

This session explores how developers can grow into cloud leadership roles, sharing practical strategies for building influence, technical expertise, and resilience along the way. Attendees gain insight into how to navigate career growth while staying grounded in engineering best practices.

description: In this session, explore how Kiro's intelligent automation streamlines incident response, accelerates troubleshooting, and simplifies system maintenance. Discover practical strategies for implementing AI-assisted DevOps practices that scale with your organization's needs.

title: Reinventing software development with AI agent
description: The rise of AI coding and autonomous agents is transforming how developers work - enhancing productivity, improving flow state, and making development more intuitive. While simple code completion tools have existed for years, today's agentic capabilities act as collaborative partners throughout the entire development lifecycle. Through real-world examples, we'll show how these AI tools and autonomous agents bring structure and engineering maturity to development, turning prototypes into production-ready applications while keeping developers in control. You'll learn how leading teams are using these capabilities to accelerate development cycles, reduce cognitive overhead, and focus on solving meaningful problems - fundamentally changing how we build software.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: Remote Access Patterns: AWS Verified Access and Client VPN
description: While traditional VPNs struggle to meet modern security demands, organizations need evolving remote access solutions. This interactive session demonstrates how AWS Verified Access and Client VPN address diverse enterprise application access patterns. Explore application-level versus network-level access approaches, covering AWS Verified Access's policy-based controls and new Connectivity Client for non-HTTP applications, alongside Client VPN's network connectivity and concurrent connection features. Learn about designing robust remote access solutions for your entire environment - from legacy systems to modern web applications. Gain knowledge about practical strategies for implementing seamless, secure access to your AWS resources.
services: AWS Client VPN; AWS Verified Access
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Resilience; Identity & Access Management; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Networking & Content Delivery; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Resilience of AWS Cloud: Design patterns for availability
description: Explore how AWS Regions are designed and operated to achieve resilience beyond traditional data centers. Learn key architectural patterns that AWS services use to maintain operations through disruptions. Discover how service teams ensure continuous availability through sophisticated design principles and operational practices. Gain insights into the foundational patterns that enable mission-critical workloads to maintain availability at scale.
speakers: Rob Charlton; Stephen James Martin; Stephen Quigg
tags: Architecture; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: Resilience testing and AWS Lambda actions under the hood [REPEAT]
description: As use of serverless technology grows, the resilience testing (also known as chaos engineering) for serverless becomes even more crucial for ensuring reliable and available applications. Join us as we demo new capabilities for testing the resilience of AWS Lambda-based workloads, and unpack how these faults were built and run under the hood. You'll also leave with valuable lessons gleaned from our customers' experiences with modern serverless applications.
services: AWS Fault Injection Service; AWS Lambda

title: Resilient and resourceful: Balance compute resiliency and costs
description: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling helps you maintain application availability and automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances using scaling policies that you define. In this chalk talk, dive deep into Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling innovations and best practices designed to increase the resiliency of your applications while meeting your cost-efficiency objectives. Learn how your deployment patterns and tools such as Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling instance maintenance policy and instance refresh rollback can help you achieve the exact balance of healthy compute capacity needed.
services: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Resilience; Cost Optimization; Compute; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Rethinking DevSecOps with Platform Engineering That Actually Works [REPEAT]
description: Many DevSecOps initiatives create bottlenecks despite promising faster, more secure delivery. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll collaboratively design a scalable DevSecOps blueprint that moves beyond checkbox compliance to enhance both security and velocity. Using real-world examples, we'll explore the DevOps-to-DevSecOps evolution, examine AWS's internal approach to security requirements, and uncover effective platform engineering patterns. You'll leave with a practical roadmap for making security a "paved road" and clear steps to launch your security platform initiatives—without getting bogged down in unnecessary complexity.
tags: Application Security; Culture of Security; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Interactive

description: Many DevSecOps initiatives create bottlenecks despite promising faster, more secure delivery. tags: Application Security; Culture of Security; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Interactive

title: Revealing the northern lights: Amazon Aurora security deep dive
description: Researchers at the DEF CON 33 security conference shared that Amazon RDS successfully defended against their novel attack, despite the underlying open source database engine not releasing patches at the time. This is the result of years of consistent investment in security and isolation, enabling customers to focus on their applications instead of managing databases. We dive deep into the engineering and layered security architecture for Amazon Aurora, examining how multiple complementary layers including encryption, network controls, granular permissions, AWS IAM, active defense, and Amazon GuardDuty work together to protect customers' data from the infrastructure through the application interface.
tags: Application Security; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Culture of Security; Databases; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Revolutionize customer care with data-driven generative AI
description: Imagine a world where every customer call is answered instantly, issues are resolved swiftly without any human intervention, and the entire experience feels personal and seamless. In this builders’ session, develop a fully automated generative AI assistant using Amazon ElastiCache, to provide an unparalleled customer experience at high speed. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Gururaj S Bayari; Damon LaCaille; Veerendra Nayak; Allen Samuels; Dan Touitou
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Revolutionize media production: Field-ready cloud solutions
description: In this fast-paced session, discover how Amazon MGM Studios revolutionizes remote media production through an innovative collaboration with AWS and Rivian. We'll demonstrate our "Media to Cloud from Anywhere" solution, which combines Rivian's electric vehicles with AWS cloud services to transform daily footage uploads. In just 15 minutes, learn how this sustainable approach achieves 3x faster transfer speeds while significantly reducing carbon emissions. See real-world examples of how Digital Imaging Technicians use this system to streamline production workflows, and walk away with insights into the future of eco-friendly content creation.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Data Transfer Terminal
tags: Sustainability; Learning from Amazon; Architecture; Business Executive; Data Engineer; IT Executive; Media & Entertainment; Lecture-style

title: Revolutionize public sector data governance with unified analytics
description: In this interactive chalk talk, discover how to strengthen data governance in regulated environments using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. Learn practical strategies for building a unified data foundation that helps government organizations make data-driven decisions while maintaining compliance. We will set up domain structures, create centralized repositories, track lineage, and implement secure data sharing protocols that help reduce organizational silos. This session shows you how Amazon SageMaker can help streamline collaboration, optimize storage efficiency, and speed up model deployment in public sector environments. You'll gain actionable insights into establishing robust data governance frameworks that support both innovation and compliance requirements.
tags: Data Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Education; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Revolutionize shopping: Inside Amazon's AI-powered 'Buy for Me' experience
description: Join this interactive session where we'll dive deep into the architecture of "Buy for Me," Amazon's autonomous shopping AI agent. Using whiteboard diagrams and real-world examples, we'll explore how we built and deployed this customer-facing solution using Amazon Bedrock, Titan, and Claude models. Through collaborative discussion, we'll break down our system design, integration patterns, and reliability strategies. Bring your questions as we sketch out autonomous purchasing workflows and quality assurance frameworks. This technical session includes hands-on architecture discussions and practical insights from our production implementation.
tags: Generative AI; Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Retail & Consumer Goods; Interactive

title: Revolutionizing Audi's Welding Inspection System through AI
description: Learn how Audi implemented an AI-powered quality control system, transforming a traditional welding inspection processes. The system analyzes 1.5 million weld points across 300 vehicles per shift, expanding upon previous manual ultrasound inspections that covered only 5,000 points per vehicle. This AI integration enables production staff to focus on addressing potential anomalies, significantly enhancing quality monitoring efficiency. Following its success, Volkswagen Group is expanding this technology across multiple sites, including Audi Brussels, VW Emden, and Audi Ingolstadt. The implementation process includes site-specific AI model retraining to accommodate varying welding parameters, demonstrating a scalable approach to manufacturing quality control optimization.
speakers: Verena Koutsovagelis; Fabrizio Manfredi; Mathias Mayer
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Industry Solutions; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Automotive; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Revolutionizing multimodal data search with Amazon Q Business
description: Today’s enterprises deal with data in various formats, including audio, image, video, and text, scattered across different documents. Searching through this diverse content to find useful information is a significant challenge. This workshop explores how Amazon Q Business transforms the way enterprises search and discover data across multiple formats. By utilizing cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, Amazon Q Business helps enterprises navigate their content seamlessly. Find out how this powerful tool accelerates real-world use cases by making it easier to extract actionable insights from multimodal datasets. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Ripple: Building an intelligent, multi-agent system for 24/7 operations
description: Financial institutions face challenges analyzing massive log volumes, requiring hours or days of manual review for critical incidents. Learn how Ripple is building an automated, multi-agent system using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and the Strands Agents framework to process 30-50GB of daily logs in minutes. Explore architectural patterns for integrating Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon OpenSearch to correlate log entries with codebase sections. Discover approaches for designing specialized agents that create conversational user interfaces for guided investigations. See how this system transforms blockchain operations and walk away with strategies for implementing a scalable foundation for building multi-agent applications.

title: Road to re:Invent
description: Watch the Road to re:Invent livestream as teams compete in a hackathon, then join us at Midday Madness on Sunday at 3:00 PM to witness the thrilling finale where these talented developers showcase their innovative solutions and one team will be crowned champion – be part of the excitement as we celebrate the creativity and technical excellence of the AWS community.

title: Robo-Reviewer: Building AI Video Evaluators with Bedrock
description: Video evaluation has traditionally been time-consuming, resource-intensive, and subjective. In this hands-on workshop, master the creation of an automated evaluation system using Amazon Bedrock. You'll build a complete pipeline that generates scenario-specific video prompts, crafts detailed assessment criteria through automated Q&A pairs, and implements objective quality evaluations using foundation models as intelligent judges. Learn to replace subjective human assessment with consistent, scalable automated metrics. Leave with a functional prototype capable of producing comprehensive evaluations of video content across diverse scenarios, powered by Bedrock's suite of foundation models.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Business Intelligence; Generative AI; Automation; Artificial Intelligence; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Robust network security with perimeter protection and zero trust
description: Learn about comprehensive network security on AWS, focusing on integrating Amazon CloudFront, AWS WAF, Network Firewall, and Verified Access (AVA) for zero-trust architecture. Discover how AVA implements access controls for both HTTPS and non-HTTPS applications, providing secure workforce access. Through real-world examples and design patterns, learn AWS-recommended practices for application security and service integration. Gain practical insights for implementing zero-trust frameworks and enhancing organizational network security on AWS.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Lecture-style

title: Run real-time advertising workloads with unmatched cost-performance on AWS
description: Advertising technology (AdTech) companies need to buy, serve, and measure hundreds of billions of ads per day at single-digit millisecond latency. In this session, explore best practices and learnings for AdTech using purpose-built services. Discover how AWS can reduce cost and improve performance for scaled real-time advertising workloads. Learn how AWS helps customers move faster and spend less with the broadest set of solutions to migrate real-time advertising workloads, expand into new markets, and improve development velocity with cloud-native best practices and architectures. Hear AWS AdTech experts share customer stories and pitfalls to avoid when running ad platforms at scale.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon EC2 - Graviton; Amazon EC2 Spot
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Advertising & Marketing; Media & Entertainment; Software & Internet; Lecture-style

title: Running compute efficient workloads on Amazon EKS Auto Mode
description: Amazon EKS Auto Mode, powered by open source Karpenter, simplifies infrastructure management while optimizing compute resources. Karpenter provisions Amazon EC2 Instances based on the requirements of your workload. In this hands-on workshop, you’ll gain practical experience in advanced workload scheduling, continually compute optimization with Karpenter consolidation, explore AWS Graviton and AWS spare capacity through Amazon EC2 Spot Instances. Whether you’re new to EKS Auto Mode, or an experienced operator you’ll learn best practices for running efficient workloads on Amazon EKS while simplifying Kubernetes cluster management.
speakers: Faisal Masood; Olawale Olaleye; Pongsan Sayampol
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)

description: Traditional SaaS models give providers complete infrastructure control, but many tenants now require AI solutions deployed within their own environments for enhanced data security and compliance. This hands-on workshop teaches participants how to implement "SaaS Anywhere" architectures for GenAI applications across diverse deployment scenarios—from fully provider-hosted to entirely tenant-controlled environments. Participants will learn practical deployment patterns and address key challenges including tenant lifecycle management, maintaining observability across distributed deployments, and ensuring system reliability. The workshop provides actionable strategies for SaaS providers who need to accommodate tenants requiring greater control over their data and compute resources.

Join us as we will discuss real-world examples of you can use Bedrock Guardrails to achieve your goals with code samples and Q&A.

title: Seamlessly Connect On-Premises to AWS [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to bridge your on-premises infrastructure with AWS using VPN, Transit Gateway, and Direct Connect in this hands-on workshop. We guide you through the essentials of hybrid cloud networking, from secure VPN setup to scalable connectivity with Transit Gateway and high-performance links with Direct Connect. Discover best practices and architecture patterns to ensure seamless, secure, and reliable connections between your data center and AWS. Perfect for new AWS customers, this session will empower you to design and implement hybrid network solutions tailored to your organizational needs.
speakers: Saransh Burman; Tracy Honeycutt; Arth Purohit; Anoop Talluri
services: AWS Direct Connect; AWS Site-to-Site VPN; AWS Transit Gateway
tags: Global Infrastructure; Network & Infrastructure Security; Architecture; Cloud Operations; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Advertising & Marketing; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Secure AI Agents Delivering Efficiency in Regulated Industries
description: Regulated industries demand more than AI deployment—they require secure, efficient, and measurable outcomes. Holland Casino modernized cloud operations with a multi-agent system using AWS Strands Agents SDK, orchestrating agents for security, cost optimization, and operations support with fine-grained permissions. Sicoob, Brazil’s largest credit union, transformed operations with AI agents and digital employees: achieving 80%+ case resolution, cutting document processing time by 25%, deploying 80 digital employees to save 440,000 hours and R$23M, and automating 85% of credit operations. In this session, you’ll learn how organizations securely scale AI to cut costs, streamline compliance, and modernize operations.
speakers: Amanda Quinto; Adriaan de Jonge; Andries Krijtenburg; Edson Lisboa
tags: Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Government; Public Sector; Lecture-style

title: Secure Amazon ECS observability with CDK and Grafana
description: Observability is critical for running secure workloads. This session shows how to combine the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK), Grafana, and OpenTelemetry to build an observability solution for Amazon ECS. Learn practical methods to detect anomalies, strengthen security posture, and improve developer productivity.
tags: Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Secure and build apps in minutes with Amazon Verified Permissions
description: Learn how to implement robust  API authorization in applications within minutes using the new Amazon  Verified Permissions Express Toolkit. Move beyond complex, embedded  authorization logic that becomes unmanageable over time. In this hands-on  session, you'll build a secure API layer using policy-based authorization,  separating security concerns from business logic. By the end of this session,  you'll understand how to define fine-grained permissions using Cedar  policies, integrate with identity providers, and enforce consistent  authorization across your express.js application —all while writing minimal  code. Bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Manuel Heinkel; Rickard Loefstroem; Victor Moreno; Abhishek Panday; Kevin Shanley
tags: Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Secure Generative AI using trusted execution environments
description: There are numerous implications to data privacy and intellectual property security in generative AI applications, here we will focus on solving for some of those using trusted executions environments (TREs). In this builders session you will create a TRE using an Amazon EC2 instance with NitroTPM enabled and run an LLM in it. Further you will configure a LLM Chat web application to cryptographically attest to the TRE. You will further learn about sealing, unsealing sensitive artifacts to the TRE.
speakers: David-Paul Dornseifer; Anton Gridin; Garry Knox; Sudhir Reddy Maddulapally
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Secure in milliseconds: Visa's AI-powered fraud defense on AWS
description: Discover how Visa revolutionized real-time payment security by leveraging AWS services, including AWS Nitro Enclaves, Amazon EKS, and Amazon MemoryDB, for their Visa Protect solution. This session explores Visa's journey to a rapidly scalable, cloud-based fraud detection solution. Learn how Visa processes massive volumes of sensitive financial data with ultra-low latency while maintaining stringent security standards. We'll dive into the multi-region architecture, real-time AI/ML fraud detection on Amazon EKS, and compute-level isolation that allowed Visa to achieve sub-250 millisecond fraud detection latency and 99.99% availability. Join us to uncover the blueprint for secure, AI-driven payment risk scoring.
speakers: Suraj Sajo; Aravinda Nagalla; Hema Zutshi
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon MemoryDB
tags: Application Security; Containers; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Secure user code execution with AWS Lambda for SaaS platforms
description: Modern SaaS platforms increasingly allow customers to upload custom code snippets for platform customization, but executing untrusted code presents significant security challenges. Join this interactive session to explore architectural patterns for secure code execution using AWS Lambda. We'll examine how Lambda's isolation mechanisms and ephemeral runtime environment create robust security boundaries for untrusted code. Through collaborative whiteboarding, we'll design solutions covering invocation patterns, multi-tenant isolation models, security controls, and operational best practices. Bring your architecture challenges as we dive deep into compute isolation, IAM configurations, and sandbox implementation techniques for building secure, scalable code execution environments.
services: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Lambda
tags: SaaS; Serverless; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Secure your cloud networks with Amazon VPC Block Public Access [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, explore how the security feature Amazon VPC Block Public Access (BPA) controls internet access to VPC resources across AWS accounts. Through five hands-on labs, participants will learn how to implement and manage BPA's bidirectional and ingress-only modes, create strategic exceptions, and analyze network traffic. The course progresses from basic connectivity to advanced BPA configurations, teaching security analysts and network engineers how to effectively balance network accessibility with robust security measures. By the end, you will perfect skills in VPC BPA implementation for enhanced cloud network protection.
speakers: Salman Ahmed; Alan Halachmi; Ikenna Izugbokwe; Jiyeon Lee; Kunj Thacker
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Networking & Content Delivery; Security & Identity; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Secure your cloud networks with Amazon VPC Block Public Access [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, explore how the security feature Amazon VPC Block Public Access (BPA) controls internet access to VPC resources across AWS accounts. Through five hands-on labs, participants will learn how to implement and manage BPA's bidirectional and ingress-only modes, create strategic exceptions, and analyze network traffic. The course progresses from basic connectivity to advanced BPA configurations, teaching security analysts and network engineers how to effectively balance network accessibility with robust security measures. By the end, you will perfect skills in VPC BPA implementation for enhanced cloud network protection.
speakers: Salman Ahmed; Alan Halachmi; Ikenna Izugbokwe; Jiyeon Lee; Kunj Thacker
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Networking & Content Delivery; Security & Identity; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Secure Your Data in a BYOD World with Amazon WorkSpaces
description: In today's hybrid workplace, protecting proprietary AI models and LLM training data from browser-based exfiltration is critical. We'll examine how financial services, healthcare, and technology organizations use WorkSpaces Secure Browser and AppStream 2.0 to secure sensitive data. Through interactive discussion and whiteboarding, we'll dive deep into implementation patterns and security configurations using real customer examples. You'll learn practical approaches to maintain control over intellectual property while enabling productive remote work.
tags: Application Security; Data Protection; Network & Infrastructure Security; End-User Computing; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Financial Services; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Securely extend Amazon Q Business applications using APIs.
description: In this chalk talk we will explore the infrastructure necessary for building a customized, end-to-end application that uses Amazon Q Business. Learn how to authenticate a user via an identity provider, exchange identity tokens with AWS IAM Identity Center to obtain identity-aware credentials, and interact securely with the Amazon Q Business APIs.
tags: Interactive

title: Securely monetize your data with Amazon Redshift
description: Transform your payment data from cost center to revenue driver through advanced AWS analytics with Amazon Redshift and AI services. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how payment processors can build sophisticated data monetization platforms to generate new revenue streams while maintaining PCI DSS compliance
speakers: Asif Abbasi; Sudipta Bagchi; Shoukat Ghouse; Lucas Rehem de Azevedo; Sekar Srinivasan; Salim Tutuncu
tags: Analytics; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Securing Agentic AI: OWASP, MAESTRO, and Real-World Defense Strategies [REPEAT]
description: Explore the latest in Agentic AI security with OWASP's updated Threats and Mitigations Guide and Agentic Security Initiative. We will also explore MAESTRO, a specialized threat modeling approach for AI systems, offering a layered methodology to identify and mitigate risks throughout the AI lifecycle. Through a real-world case study, we'll demonstrate security best practices for agentic AI, including robust governance, continuous monitoring, and least-privilege access. Learn how to confidently deploy autonomous AI agents while minimizing risks. Gain practical insights for building secure, trustworthy, and resilient agentic AI applications that can transform industries safely.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Verified Permissions; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Explore the latest in Agentic AI security with OWASP's updated Threats and Mitigations Guide and Agentic Security Initiative. We will also explore MAESTRO, a specialized threat modeling approach for AI systems, offering a layered methodology to identify and mitigate risks throughout the AI lifecycle. Through a real-world case study, we'll demonstrate security best practices for agentic AI, including robust governance, continuous monitoring, and least-privilege access. Learn how to confidently deploy autonomous AI agents while minimizing risks. Gain practical insights for building secure, trustworthy, and resilient agentic AI applications that can transform industries safely.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Verified Permissions; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
tags: Application Security; Generative AI; Security & Identity; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Securing AI agents: Identity patterns in Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: As generative AI agents take on more complex tasks, the need for secure, contextual identity becomes critical. In this chalk talk, dive into Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity, the foundational building block that enables secure, auditable, and role-aware execution for AI agents. We'll sketch out real-world scenarios and work together to solve common identity challenges in AI agent applications. We'll explore modeling agent personas, architecting secure authentication flows, and integrating with existing identity systems. Attendees will leave with a reference architecture and best practices for embedding identity into their agent-based applications.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Securing AI Agents: SailPoint's Journey with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
description: As enterprises rapidly adopt AI agents, managing agent identities across environments becomes a critical challenge. SailPoint, a leading identity security ISV serving 85% of Fortune 500 companies, is leveraging Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to transform their product into a comprehenhensive AI agent governance solution. This session demonstrates how SailPoint built a scalable security control plane for AI agent management, addressing enterprise-grade discovery, permissions, and audit requirements. ISVs will learn implementation patterns, API integration strategies, and architectural best practices for enhancing their products with robust AI agent governance capabilities using AgentCore, enabling secure AI adoption at scale.
tags: SaaS; Culture of Security; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Independent Software Vendor; Interactive

title: Securing Amazon ECS workloads with application-aware networking
description: In this workshop, learn how to build, secure and monitor networking traffic for containerized microservices. Dive deep into service-to-service communication patterns with both Amazon ECS Service Connect and Amazon VPC Lattice. You will also learn how to encrypt data using end to end TLS as well as how to restrict user access. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Masatoshi Hayashi; Pedro Henrique Oliveira; Henrique Santana
services: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon VPC Lattice
tags: Application Security; Network & Infrastructure Security; Containers; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Securing Amazon Q Business applications with APIs
description: Learn how to securely extend Amazon Q Business applications using APIs. In this workshop, build a single-page web application along with the infrastructure necessary for user authentication via an identity provider. The application will exchange identity tokens with AWS IAM Identity Center to obtain identity-aware AWS Signature V4 credentials. These credentials will then be used to securely interact with the Amazon Q Business APIs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
tags: Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Securing and observing Amazon EKS clusters [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, explore how to automate the identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in Amazon EKS clusters. Learn how to implement robust security controls—including role-based access control (RBAC), EKS Pod Identity, and service accounts—to apply least-privilege access and secure workload isolation. Discover how to use AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch to gain deep visibility into EKS cluster activities, enabling real-time monitoring and automated risk detection. You will learn the skills to automate risk management processes, helping your Kubernetes workloads remain resilient against evolving threats.
speakers: Bharath Gajendran; Joao Melo; Rafael Pereyra; Megan Velez Rivera; Shawn Zhang
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS CloudTrail; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
tags: Monitoring & Observability; Network & Infrastructure Security; Kubernetes; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Securing and observing Amazon EKS clusters [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, explore how to automate the identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in Amazon EKS clusters. Learn how to implement robust security controls—including role-based access control (RBAC), EKS Pod Identity, and service accounts—to apply least-privilege access and secure workload isolation. Discover how to use AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch to gain deep visibility into EKS cluster activities, enabling real-time monitoring and automated risk detection. You will learn the skills to automate risk management processes, helping your Kubernetes workloads remain resilient against evolving threats.
speakers: Bharath Gajendran; Joao Melo; Rafael Pereyra; Megan Velez Rivera; Shawn Zhang
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS CloudTrail; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

title: Securing and optimizing your software supply chain with Amazon ECR
description: Raise the bar on your software supply chain security with AWS. In this chalk talk, we will discuss DevOps security best-practices, threat detection and incident response for containers, and how to leverage AWS security services including Amazon ECR, Amazon GuardDuty, and Amazon Inspector to protect your Amazon EKS workloads. Discover how you can ensure CVE patching while optimizing storage to accelerate image delivery through seamless integration with open-source tools for publishing and deploying containerized workloads at scale. Learn how to efficiently streamline your software supply chain while mitigating risks.
services: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
tags: Network & Infrastructure Security; Threat Detection & Incident Response; Kubernetes; Security & Identity; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: Securing Data Lakes: From Ingestion to AI Analysis
description: Data lakes require comprehensive security controls throughout their lifecycle, particularly for AI/ML workloads. This session provides hands-on experience implementing end-to-end security for AWS data lake architectures. Learn to configure secure data ingestion patterns, implement automated classification, and establish dynamic, fine-grained access controls. Through practical exercises, discover how to implement data lake security controls that enable innovation while maintaining appropriate governance.
speakers: Archana Ambavane; Dimple Dhar; Mohit Gadkari; Songzhi Liu; Oren Waldman
services: Amazon Bedrock; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
tags: Data Protection; Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Developer / Engineer; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Securing event-driven architectures: from sync to async security
description: The shift from synchronous to asynchronous communication fundamentally transforms security requirements. Learn how to protect event buses from common attacks such as poison pill messages, denial of wallet attacks or message replay exploits. Through live coding, we'll demonstrate how to secure decoupled producers and consumers while maintaining confidentiality, integrity and availability of our event driven systems. You will leave with a comprehensive framework for building secure and resilient event-driven architectures using AWS services.
services: Amazon EventBridge; AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Lambda
tags: Application Security; Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Securing Generative AI agents using AWS Well-Architected Framework
description: This advanced lab teaches developers to build secure generative AI agent solutions using Amazon Bedrock Agents, following AWS Well-Architected Framework's Generative AI Lens. Learn to implement endpoint security, monitor agent interactions with CloudWatch, and control agent permissions. Implement security controls, monitoring, and safeguard agents against unauthorized actions. Ideal for developers wanting to build secure AI agent implementations.
tags: Training & Certification; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Securing IoT Workloads with AWS IoT Lens and AWS Security Reference Architecture
description: Today’s industrial environments are enabling new levels of connectivity, automation, efficiency, and real-time data insights. However, this increased connectivity also introduces significant security challenges. Unaddressed security concerns can expose vulnerabilities and slow down companies looking to accelerate digital transformation leveraging IoT and Cloud. This chalk talk explores relevant techniques, architecture patterns, best practices and AWS security services for securing complex OT/IT environments, IoT devices, edge and cloud using the AWS Well Architected IoT Lens and AWS Security Reference Architecture (SRA).
services: Amazon GuardDuty; Amazon Security Lake; AWS Security Hub
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; Culture of Security; Security & Identity; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Interactive

title: Securing your network perimeter through observability
description: Enhance your AWS security posture by monitoring  Amazon VPC activity using AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch. In this hands-on workshop, build a comprehensive security monitoring solution for your VPC perimeter. Learn to capture and analyze VPC activity, then create powerful dashboards, metrics, and alerts for deep visibility into activity patterns. Gain practical knowledge in setting up automated security controls, creating custom metrics for activity analysis, and implementing alert mechanisms to detect potential risks using AWS native services. Walk away with the skills to strengthen your cloud security through improved observability and proactive monitoring.
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC); AWS CloudTrail
tags: Data Protection; Monitoring & Observability; Identity & Access Management; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Security Compliance & Hardening with EC2 Image Builder
description: Discover how to leverage EC2 Image Builder to create secure, compliant, and hardened AMIs. Learn to automate security baseline implementation, including CIS benchmarks. We'll demonstrate building compliance checks into Image Builder pipelines, integrating vulnerability scanning, and implementing automated testing for regulatory standards.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); EC2 Image Builder
tags: Compute; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Security posture and exposure management using AWS security services
description: Join this hands-on deep dive to learn how AWS Security Hub and Amazon Inspector can work together to help you strengthen your security posture and streamline security operations across your entire AWS environment. We'll show you how AWS Security Hub performs security best practice checks, aggregates alerts, supports automated remediation, and provides a comprehensive view of your security state in AWS. Explore how Amazon Inspector continually scans Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2), AWS Lambda functions, and container workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Select and launch the right instance for your workload and budget
description: This session covers the latest compute innovations such as the new generation of Amazon EC2 instances powered by Intel Xeon processors, AMD EPYC processors, and AWS Graviton. Learn how to determine which instance is best for your specific use case and budget.
tags: Cost Optimization; Compute; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Serverless cost optimization: More from every invoke
description:
"In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into practical strategies for optimizing AWS Lambda and AWS Step Function costs while maintaining performance. We'll explore how processor architecture selection, memory configuration, and execution patterns can significantly reduce costs.

Join us to learn how to leverage event filtering, implement effective batching strategies, optimize the Init phase, and architect cost-effective workflows using Step Functions. Bring your questions as we'll dedicate ample time to addressing your specific serverless cost optimization challenges."
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Cost Optimization; Serverless; Cloud Operations; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Serverless data processing with AWS Lambda and Apache Kafka
description: Learn how to easily process data on an Apache Kafka stream using AWS Lambda in this hands-on Builders Session. You will use Lambda's built-in support for Kafka as an event source to process streaming analytics data and publish it to a live dashboard. Learn practical skills for tuning data processing workloads across Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) and self-managed Kafka clusters. Understand how to effectively handle errors and automatically retry failed jobs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Franklin Aguinaldo; Diego Casas; Brian Krygsman; Kensuke Shimokawa; Nikita Tibrewal
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Analytics; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Serverless Observability: Best Practices for AWS Distributed Systems
description: Want better visibility into your distributed serverless systems? In this chalk talk we'll demonstrate practical solutions for common observability challenges in distributed serverless applications. We'll tackle common pain points like request tracking across services, performance optimization, and error correlation. Through a retail application example, you'll learn how to implement comprehensive tracking across AWS serverless services, enabling you to maintain reliable and performant applications.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Monitoring & Observability; Serverless; Cloud Operations; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Serverless Optimization: Balancing Cost, Throughput & Latency
description: While serverless architectures can be optimized for cost, throughput, latency, and reliability, it is not possible to optimize for all factors simultaneously. Organizations must prioritize based on workload requirements. This session provides guidance on key decisions, such as selecting the right compute options and choosing between message and stream processing. Learn about cell-based architectures and how to identify critical, latency-sensitive components. Discover practical approaches for building serverless systems that balance competing demands while maintaining operational excellence
tags: Cost Optimization; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Serverless patterns for large-scale applications with AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: In this code talk, learn how to manage large-scale serverless architectures. As Lambda functions multiply, organizations struggle with project organization, code reusability, dependency management, and maintaining consistent deployments across environments. See a live coding session on how to organize multi-function codebases, implement cross-function reuse, and establish standardized deployment pipelines. Leave this talk with battle-tested techniques to immediately improve your team’s serverless development practices and confidently scale your Lambda applications.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: In this code talk, learn how to manage large-scale serverless architectures. title: Serverlesspresso: Build an event-driven application from the ground up [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, build a fully event-driven, serverless coffee-ordering web application using AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, AWS Step Functions, and more. Learn to design scalable architectures through orchestration and choreography as you simulate customers placing orders and baristas managing them in real time. Discover best practices for integrating serverless services and handling real-world workflow challenges. This session is ideal to deepen your understanding of event-driven serverless design on AWS. You must bring your laptop to participate.

description: In this workshop, build a fully event-driven, serverless coffee-ordering web application using AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, AWS Step Functions, and more. Learn to design scalable architectures through orchestration and choreography as you simulate customers placing orders and baristas managing them in real time. title: Service-oriented builders guide to agentic AI: Insights from WEX
description: Large language models and agentic tools have reached enterprise viability, with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) principles providing the foundation for robust agentic systems. This session examines which SOA design principles translate directly to generative AI implementations and which require rethinking for agent orchestration and nondeterministic behaviors. Learn architectural patterns for secure AI service integration, tools for enterprise-scale agent deployment, and techniques for building agents that work seamlessly with existing ecosystems. WEX demonstrates how extending SOA into the agentic domain enables generative AI solutions to deliver enterprise-grade operational support at scale. Gain practical insights into combining SOA best practices with modern AI architecture requirements.
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Shared responsibility: leadership lessons from active defense of the cloud
description: Navigating uncharted waters in AWS security demands more than technical expertise—it requires masterful leadership in high-stakes environments. Join us to explore critical lessons learned while building a threat detection and response organization at scale. Learn concrete strategies for fostering psychological safety while maintaining high standards, balancing experimentation with risk management, and evolving from technical expert to transformational leader. Discover practical approaches to metrics design, delegation in technical domains, and creating a culture of ownership. Whether you're scaling a security program or leading technical teams, these battle-tested insights will help you navigate the complex intersection of people, technology, and security leadership.
services: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC); AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM); AWS Shield
tags: Culture of Security; Security & Identity; Business Executive; Interactive

title: Shell's HPC Evolution: Accelerating Seismic Processing with AWS GPU Innovation
description: Explore Shell's transformative journey in hybrid HPC computing, combining on-premises systems with AWS GPU capabilities for seismic processing and AI applications. The evolution from CPU-based processing to advanced GPU implementations represents a critical advancement in energy sector computing. Learn how this hybrid approach achieved 3-5x project acceleration while maintaining cost efficiency, including migration of Shell's processing code to AWS, implementation of GPU-based Full-Waveform Inversion workflows, and significant cost reductions in non-EC2 services. Gain insights into the latest developments in capacity block services, transitions to H200 GPUs, and the future of energy sector HPC through Amazon Parallel Computing Service and Energy HPC Orchestrator platforms.
tags: Generative AI; Compute; Energy & Utilities; Lecture-style

title: Shuffle, Scale, Succeed: Optimizing Spark Performance on Amazon EKS
description: Running Apache Spark on Amazon EKS delivers scalability, but poor defaults can drive up costs and slow pipelines. This ChalkTalk highlights the top Spark performance challenges and production-proven fixes. Learn how Apache Iceberg reduces query times with metadata pruning, how DataFusion Comet accelerates Spark SQL by ~2.4x, and how Gluten with Velox delivers up to 3x gains. We will compare Comet and Gluten, demonstrate Apache Celeborn for remote shuffle scaling, and share EKS optimizations including custom batch schedulers, dynamic scaling with Karpenter, and Spark DRA. Data teams will receive a practical playbook on implementing faster and more cost-effective Spark workloads.
tags: Open Data; Kubernetes; Machine Learning; Analytics; Serverless & Containers; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Simplified Data Lake Access with AWS Identity Center
description: AWS Trusted Identity Propagation simplifies data access  management in large organizations by seamlessly integrating with enterprise  identity providers like Okta and Azure AD. It eliminates complex AWS role  configurations while providing granular control down to table and column  levels across major AWS data tools including Athena, EMR, and Redshift. This  centralized solution maintains detailed access logs for compliance and audit  purposes, reducing time spent on access management and enhancing data protection.  Organizations can maintain clear visibility of data usage patterns—all  managed from a single location. The result is a streamlined approach that  maintains strong security controls while simplifying administration across  AWS services.
tags: Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Simplify backup for stateful Amazon EKS workloads
description: Protecting persistent data in Amazon EKS environments presents unique challenges. This lightning talk demonstrates practical approaches for backing up stateful workloads using AWS services. Learn how to configure backup policies for persistent storage used by containerized applications, automate protection schedules, and establish efficient restoration workflows. Discover strategies to enhance data protection and simplify management while maintaining a fully AWS-native infrastructure. This demonstration is ideal for teams looking to optimize their Amazon EKS backup strategies using AWS services.
tags: Data Protection; Resilience; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Simplify development workflows with agentic capabilities
description: Amazon Q Developer's agentic coding experience transforms how developers build software. By using natural language understanding, Q Developer can intelligently perform multi-step tasks that go beyond code generation with minimal human intervention by automatically reading project files to build context, generating code diffs, and running shell commands. Join this session to discover how the new agentic coding experience helps developers go from planning to getting new features in front of customers even faster.
speakers: Al Destefano; Svetlana Kolomeyskaya; John Almasan
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Simplify discovery and deployment of software with AWS Marketplace
description: Discover how AWS Marketplace simplifies access to third-party software and tools across your entire infrastructure. In this session, explore the diverse delivery methods AWS Marketplace offers, including SaaS solutions, Amazon Machine Images (AMIs), containerized applications, and API-based agents. Learn how to efficiently discover products available globally, select flexible pricing models that fit your needs, and streamline spend management across your organization. See firsthand how AWS Marketplace accelerates your modernization and migration initiatives by providing enterprise-ready solutions exactly where and when you need them.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; DevSecOps; DevOps; Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Simplify fraud investigation with Strands Agents and Amazon Nova Sonic

This session demonstrates how financial institutions can leverage AI agents to autonomously analyze complex fraud patterns while streamlining user interactions through voice interfaces. Explore how Strands Agents simplifies building voice-based detection solutions to identify fraudulent activities and fraud rings through pattern recognition and relationship mapping using Amazon Neptune and Amazon Nova Sonic. Attendees will learn how AI agents can break down complex workflows, access fraud detection tools, and adapt their actions based on context and memory.
tags: Business Intelligence; Agentic AI; Threat Intelligence; Artificial Intelligence; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Financial Services; Digital Native Business; Interactive

title: Simplify secure file sharing with Transfer Family no-code web apps
description: Traditional file transfer solutions often require complex client software, custom scripts, or technical expertise, creating barriers for business users who need to share data. Learn how AWS Transfer Family's web apps enable secure, browser-based file transfers that automatically trigger your data processing workflows. In this session, we'll show you how to build automated pipelines that process files as soon as they're uploaded, while maintaining enterprise-grade security through flexible authentication options for internal and external users. You'll discover how to use Transfer Family web apps to streamline file ingestion, kick off data validations, and orchestrate downstream processing... starting with a simple drag-and-drop interface for your end users.

description: In this builders' session, discover how Amazon Q Developer streamlines testing for serverless workflows.
