Explore validation of input and output payloads, error handling, and state transitions, all guided by Amazon Q Developer. You'll leave with a tested workflow and a repeatable approach for scaling best practices across serverless applications.

tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Simplify Tenant Authorization with Cedar and Amazon Verified Permissions
description: Enterprise customers demand customizable authorization controls in multi-tenant SaaS applications, making tenant isolation and security policies a critical challenge for ISVs. Learn how ISVs implement fine-grained authorization while maintaining a unified codebase using Cedar policies and Amazon Verified Permissions. Working directly with an AWS expert, you'll build tenant-aware authorization supporting complex enterprise requirements - like custom roles, delegated administration, and tenant-specific security policies - all while keeping authorization logic separate from application code.

tags: Application Security; SaaS; Identity & Access Management; Open Source; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Software & Internet; Digital Native Business; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Simplifying data interoperability with the lakehouse architecture on AWS
description: Apache Iceberg is designed for interoperability across compute engines without the need for data duplication or format conversions. Amazon SageMaker's lakehouse architecture simplifies data interoperability through its shared metadata capabilities and support for the REST API specification. The lakehouse architecture delivers the flexibility to access and query your data, stored across Amazon S3 data lakes and Amazon Redshift. In this session, we will explore how Amazon S3 Tables and  Apache Iceberg come together to build an open lakehouse architecture that seamlessly works with multiple compute engines on AWS.

Learn to automate tenant provisioning, enforce security controls, and monitor performance and usage metrics in real time. By the end of the session, you'll have practical experience streamlining your SaaS delivery workflows and accelerating application rollout. Bring your laptop and get ready to build!

This internal solution combines enterprise security and developer flexibility, enabling teams to use their preferred IDEs while maintaining organizational standards. Additionally, it reduces environment setup from days to minutes and ensures consistent deployments across multicloud environments.

title: Solving private IPv4 exhaustion using AWS Cloud WAN and Amazon VPC Lattice [REPEAT]
description: Enterprises face private IPv4 exhaustion due to limited address planning, architectural shifts, mergers, and IP-hungry technologies like containers. The result - restrictions to cloud scalability and new project deployment. In this session, learn how AWS solutions solve these challenges with a scalable and cost effective approach combining AWS Cloud WAN with service insertion, and Amazon VPC Lattice to centralize private NAT Gateways and AWS PrivateLink. With this setup, discover how to maximize IP space utilization, reduce costs, and simplify network management—offering a durable solution to support evolving infrastructure needs across distributed environments
services: Amazon VPC Lattice; AWS Cloud WAN

You will gain practical migration and modernization experience with live applications while learning how to transform their database systems to Aurora PostgreSQL Serverless v2. description:
As the internet evolves with new clients, protocols, and threats, leveraging global edge infrastructure has become critical for delivering exceptional user experiences. In this session, we'll examine the broader trajectory of the web, from the proliferation of mobile-first experiences to the rise of AI workloads  and emerging security threats. 
 Discover how Amazon CloudFront, AWS Global Accelerator, AWS WAF, and AWS Shield have integrated to address today's most pressing web performance and security challenges. Learn how to incorporate AWS Edge networking services as foundational components within modern web architectures and  how AWS is positioning its infrastructure to meet tomorrow's challenges.

description: This session explores modern  vulnerability management strategies for cloud and development environments.  We'll demonstrate how to integrate automated scanning and continuous  monitoring for both AWS compute resources and Git code repositories. Learn  how to identify misconfigurations, unpatched software, and insecure code  dependencies before they become threats. Attendees will gain practical  insights into prioritizing and remediating vulnerabilities across  infrastructure and code, unifying security efforts from development to  deployment. Join us to discover actionable techniques for reducing risk and  strengthening your organization's security posture in today's dynamic,  cloud-native landscape.

title: Storage optimization by Apache Iceberg V3's Deletion Vectors
description: In modern data architectures, Apache Iceberg has become a popular table format for data lakes. Iceberg evolves at a rapid pace, and one of the recent key enhancements is Apache Iceberg V3 format. Apache Iceberg V3 format introduces Deletion Vectors, allowing you to reduce storage usage while optimizing workloads. This session dives deep into Deletion Vectors: why Deletion Vectors are introduced, how Deletion Vectors are designed, and their contribution in real-world scenarios. You'll learn how to optimize Iceberg table storage with Deletion Vectors in detail. You'll also learn migration strategies from Apache Iceberg V2 format.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Migration & Modernization; Open Source; Storage; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: StradVision's Vision AI journey with AWS
description: StradVision is a Vision AI startup offering ADAS/AV models for automotive companies such as BMW. So far, 3M+ vehicles from 13+ OEM have equipped with StradVision's Vision AI perception software. StradVision migrated 1PB+ data from on-prem to S3 through AWS Snowball, run data processing/labeling jobs on EKS/ECS, and training AI model by leveraging GPU instances on AWS. This reduced data processing time, improved latency for data labeling workloads, and accelerated AI model development pace.

description: Learn how to streamline Amazon Connect management through natural language AI commands. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to implement a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts simple spoken or written instructions into Amazon Connect API actions. You'll build a practical prototype that enables your team to adjust queue settings and operating hours through natural language, significantly reducing administrative complexity and training time.
tags: Generative AI; SaaS; Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Streamline Amazon EKS operations with Agentic AI
description: In this code talk, learn how to build agentic AI systems that automate Amazon EKS cluster management, from real-time issue diagnosis to guided remediation. Discover how to create agents that connect with AWS services through Model Context Protocol (MCP) to simplify operational tasks like incident response and debugging. The live coding demo showcases how agentic systems can leverage tribal knowledge within a company to provide contextual troubleshooting assistance and even auto remediation. Join us to discover best practices and tips for enhancing EKS operations with AI agents.
speakers: Lucas Soriano Alves Duarte; Sai Vennam
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Q Developer
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Organizations face challenges in maintaining healthy infrastructure visibility and responding to incidents as their AWS environments grow more complex. In this chalk talk, learn to build comprehensive health monitoring and automated incident response using AWS Health, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS CloudTrail. Get hands-on experience implementing Systems Manager Automation for remediation, creating effective monitoring patterns, and transforming metrics into actions. Leave with practical approaches for cross-account health dashboards, intelligent alerting, and automated response runbooks.

tags: Management & Governance; Resilience; Automation; Architecture; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; System Administrator; Interactive

description: Learn how to build secure verification systems in Amazon Connect that work seamlessly across voice, chat, and digital channels. This session demonstrates how to implement authentication methods that enhance security while maintaining a smooth customer experience. You'll gain practical strategies for creating robust, cross-channel verification solutions that combine traditional and innovative authentication approaches to elevate both security and customer satisfaction.

tags: SaaS; Identity & Access Management; Business Applications; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Accelerate your transition from on-premises VDI to a flexible cloud solution. This workshop showcases how Amazon WorkSpaces Core Managed Instance (CMI) integrates seamlessly with Citrix Cloud to simplify desktop delivery. Master proven strategies for efficient cloud migration, reduced infrastructure overhead, and optimized costs at scale. Through hands-on exercises, deploy and configure a Citrix Cloud desktop environment powered by WorkSpaces CMI. Gain practical experience with architectural patterns and best practices to drive your organization's VDI modernization. Leave equipped to implement a hybrid desktop solution that leverages your existing investments.
tags: Management & Governance; Well-Architected Framework; Innovation & Transformation; End-User Computing; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Financial Services; Government; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

Gain hands-on experience with production-grade migration techniques using CLI tools for existing applications. You'll develop practical expertise in automated deployment strategies, monitoring solutions, and best practices for managing web applications at scale. Leave equipped with the knowledge to streamline your deployment processes, enhance application performance, and effectively manage complex web environments using Elastic Beanstalk's powerful features.

Attendees will explore a real-world application of GenAI in SecDevOps and cybersecurity for telecommunications. We’ll illustrate how security teams can leverage Generative AI to gain significant operational improvements and minimize manual effort in resolving access issues. This lightning talk equips telecommunications organizations facing similar challenges with practical strategies for implementing Agentic AI-powered solutions in security operations for both customer-facing and internal IT networks.

Join this session to learn how vLLM optimized AWS Deep Learning Containers revolutionize the way we deploy large language models like DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-32B on Amazon EKS. Learn how purpose-built containers simplify complex setups, optimize GPU utilization, and leverage EFA networking for distributed inference. Through live demonstrations, you'll learn to leverage vLLM DLCs with FSx Lustre and EKS for production-ready AI infrastructure. Leave with practical insights on security, performance tuning, and cost optimization that you can implement immediately. Join us to master enterprise-grade LLM deployment that scales effortlessly.

Experience a workflow that enhances collaboration, maintainability, and documentation accuracy.

Learn to build AI-enhanced observability systems using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q that automatically explain failures, correlate events, and provide predictive recommendations. Explore techniques for creating AI agents that simulate scenarios and stress-test architectures, enabling proactive insights with clear traceability. Attendees will gain practical knowledge to enhance their automation and incident response capabilities through AI-driven observability.

description: Transform your Lambda functions through this practical builder's session focused on modern security and performance optimization techniques. You'll work step-by-step to evolve a basic function into a robust, production-ready solution, implementing crucial security controls and performance enhancements using the latest AWS features. This practical experience goes beyond just "how" to make changes, delving into the "why" behind each best practice, ensuring you gain a deep understanding of serverless architecture principles. You'll leave with actionable insights to fine-tune your Lambda functions across security, performance, and cost dimensions, all grounded in real-world implementation.

tags: Application Security; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Enhance your Lambda development experience with Hono, a TypeScript-friendly framework that brings familiar web patterns to serverless functions. This lightweight framework enables clean, intuitive routing while leveraging Lambda's full scalability potential. This lightning talk demonstrates how Hono's unified router simplifies development, reduces cold-start times, and complements existing AWS tooling. Through live examples, you'll learn practical patterns for building maintainable, production-grade APIs that enhance developer experience without compromising performance.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

description: How do you turn diverse logging data into actionable AI insights? This session explores how OCSF enables unified logging across complex environments and powers next-generation generative AI analytics. Discover best practices for implementing OCSF, real-world benefits, and how to prepare your logging data for AI-powered analysis.
speakers: Sushovan Basak; Pratima Singh; Allan Umandap
tags: Generative AI; Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: Supercharge ML and Inference on Apple Silicon with EC2 Mac
description: Take your machine learning workflows to the next level with EC2 Mac instances powered by Apple silicon. In this session, learn how to accelerate inference by tapping into the Apple Neural Engine (ANE) and Core ML framework. Discover how to efficiently deploy PyTorch and TensorFlow models, optimize for performance on M-series chips, and reduce development and operational costs. Whether you're building for iOS or scaling cloud-native ML, this session offers practical guidance for unlocking the full ML potential of Apple silicon�right from the cloud.
tags: Generative AI; Compute; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Supercharge Serverless APIs with Powertools for AWS Lambda
description: In this workshop, learn how to implement request and response validation, dynamic routing, exception handling, middleware and OpenAPI schema generation and Pub/Sub notifications with AppSync Events. This workshop starts with an existing application and progressively improve your API event handler using Powertools for AWS Lambda. To complete this workshop, you must bring your laptop.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Supercharge Serverless testing: Accelerate development with Amazon Q
description: Struggling with serverless testing? The secret isn't just better tests - it's better architecture. In this interactive code talk, discover how GenAI transforms from a code generator to your architectural guide, accelerating serverless development through clean design patterns and strategic testing approaches. Through live demonstrations, you'll see how GenAI guides the evolution of Lambda functions to a testable architecture, generates maintainable test suites that scale across teams, and uses strategic insights to provide proactive architectural recommendations. Walk away with practical techniques to achieve faster test execution, test reliability, and architectural insights that prevent future technical debt.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Developer Tools; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Supercharge your SaaS with agentic insights
description: SaaS is meant to be a data-driven model. The choices you make when architecting a multi-tenant system are driven by specific metrics, goals, and outcomes that are expected to enable growth, innovation, and efficiency. This builder session will look at how agents and GenAI can be used to enrich this metrics experience, exploring new techniques that can be used to capture, surface, and analyze the multi-tenant metrics. We’ll explore actionable insights like customer usage patterns, cost-per-tenant, and churn rate, giving you a clearer view into the data that can impact the success of your SaaS business.
speakers: Maheswaran S; Frederic Schoenberger; Hoseong Seo; Dhammika Sriyananda; Daniel Wirjo
tags: Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Independent Software Vendor; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Supercharge your well-architected reviews with AWS Generative AI
description: Learn how Koch Industries revolutionized their AWS Well-Architected reviews using generative AI. We'll demonstrate how combining Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base and MCP automates architectural assessments that previously took weeks. Discover how to scale best practice reviews and optimize cloud workloads in minutes instead of days.
tags: Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: Sustainable and cost-efficient generative AI with agentic workflows
description: Building sustainable, cost-effective generative AI on AWS requires integrating agentic AI, efficient architecture, and cloud-native optimization. Agentic systems using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore employ contextual memory, asynchronous execution, and on-demand tool invocation to minimize compute waste. MCP enables secure connections between AI agents, AWS services, and custom tools. Efficiency increases through AWS's Trainium and Inferentia2 silicon (50% better performance per watt), Amazon SageMaker for scalable development, and optimization techniques like quantization and speculative decoding. Auto-scaling, batch processing, and spot instances prevent over-provisioning. Combined with CloudWatch and Cost Explorer monitoring, this approach delivers high-performance, low-carbon generative AI solutions.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Software & Internet; Digital Native Business; Lecture-style

title: Sustainable computing for climate solutions
description: High Performance Computing (HPC) is crucial for solving complex environmental challenges such as air pollution and extreme weather forecasting, yet HPC workloads are traditionally computationally intensive. This session explores patterns and key AWS services like AWS Batch, ParallelCluster, EC2 Spot Instances, Graviton processors, FSx for Lustre, and Cloudwatch that help optimize the balance between computational performance and environmental sustainability. Attendees will explore a real-world example of how researchers from University of Oxford are using sustainable HPC solutions for community air quality improvement through large-scale geospatial data processing and machine learning.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS Batch; AWS ParallelCluster
tags: Generative AI; Tech for Impact; Machine Learning; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Solution / Systems Architect; Education; Nonprofit; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Swift for AI: Developing Agents and MCP-Compatible Tools
description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) enables AI-native developer workflows across multiple programming languages. This session demonstrates how to leverage Swift in creating MCP-compatible tools and agents, integrating them with existing clients like the Amazon Q Developer CLI. The presentation covers defining tool schemas, handling invocations, and interacting with foundation models using the Swift MCP SDK and modern async patterns. Through practical examples, the session illustrates Swift's capabilities for constructing intelligent agents and tools, providing developers with powerful options for AI development.
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Tech Explorer; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Symbolic AI in the age of LLMs
description: While generative AI captures headlines, the untapped potential lies in combining it with decades-proven symbolic AI techniques. This session explores how organizations can leverage symbolic AI, such as ontologies and logic-based reasoning to build knowledge graphs and to enhance their AI capabilities. Dive deep into these topics to understand what ontologies look like, where semantics comes from, and what it means to build working knowledge graphs. Learn concrete strategies for defining and adopting ontologies and how to use reasoning for your benefit.
tags: Generative AI; Databases; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Symbolic Execution for Better Cloud Governance
description: Symbolic execution is an automated reasoning technique for analyzing all possible executions of a program. First invented in the 1970s, symbolic execution has found a modern application in AWS cloud governance. Given a control which assesses the security posture of cloud resources, symbolic execution gives us a way to analyze all possible resource configurations and their compliance state. Come learn how we use this technique inside AWS to accelerate the development and verification of cloud controls. See how we move beyond individual test cases to systematically explore every possible behavior of a cloud control.
services: AWS Config; AWS Control Tower; AWS Security Hub
tags: Governance, Risk & Compliance; Innovation & Transformation; Identity & Access Management; Security & Identity; Academic / Researcher; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Sysco's Digital Transformation: Platform Engineering with Amazon Q
description: Discover how you can combine platform engineering practices with Amazon Q Developer to revolutionize your organization's software delivery capabilities. In this session, you will learn how Sysco, a global food services distribution leader, transformed its platform engineering process and built a robust internal developer platform, enhancing self-service capabilities and the developer experience. Explore real-world implementation strategies and dive deep into enterprise-specific challenges: legacy modernization without specialized talent, AI assisted knowledge sharing, contextual code generation using existing APIs, and leveraging MCP for context and actions. You will leave understanding how to build a more efficient, standardized, developer-friendly environment with Amazon Q.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Developer Tools; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Retail & Consumer Goods; Travel & Hospitality; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Tackling Anti-patterns with AI-Driven Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC)
description: In a world where developers grapple with legacy systems, shifting requirements, brittle architectures, and never-ending backlogs, the real bottleneck isn't coding, but decision-making, validation, and providing oversight to AI. The AI-Driven Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC) reimagines software engineering methodology. Through real-world examples and best practices, learn how to solve the hardest developer challenges by applying AI as a core collaborator in the SDLC. Discover how AI-DLC addresses common development anti-patterns and transforms your engineering practices.
tags: Automation; Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Tag like a pro: Optimize multi-account resource tracking [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations struggle with inconsistent tagging and poor resource visibility across their growing AWS footprint. In this chalk talk, explore advanced strategies to overcome these challenges using AWS Organizations, AWS Config, AWS Resource Explorer, and AWS Resource Groups. Learn to implement scalable, automated tagging solutions that enforce consistent policies and streamline governance across thousands of resources and multiple accounts. Our AWS experts will demonstrate real-world architectures for discovering untagged resources, organizing assets into applications, and improving overall resource management. Join us to address your specific challenges, gain insights from practical examples, and optimize your organization's approach to multi-account resource management.

description: Many nonprofits' journeys with AI begins with unstructured data; however, more organizations are exploring use cases with structured data in databases and data warehouses. This session showcases two approaches for talking with your data using natural language query (NLQ) powered by Amazon Q for Business and Amazon Bedrock. Participants will get hands-on experience with the Amazon Q for Business integration with Amazon QuickSight for no-code NLQ and structured text-to-SQL capabilities in Bedrock knowledge bases to chat with data in AWS data stores. You'll discover how to harness the power of unstructured data to build the next generation of intelligent applications.

title: Teaching your AI tools custom languages and libraries
description: Enterprises often develop custom libraries, tools, and domain-specific languages to power their operations. Integrating these proprietary assets within your AI tools can be a challenge. In this talk, I will share how to use Kiro, an agentic AI tool, to understand and work with custom libraries. I'll demonstrate the power of combining steering files and Model Context Protocol to teach Kiro new skills, establish best practices, and keep its knowledge up-to-date. Attendees will learn a repeatable approach to empower their AI tools to seamlessly work with the specialized services that drive their business
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Developer Tools; Lecture-style

title: Telemetry forensics: Debugging event systems with metrics & traces
description: With high-throughput event-driven architectures, anomalies manifest as subtle shifts — throttled shards, cold starts, partial batch retries, or schema decode failures. This session guides you through debugging real-world streaming workloads built on AWS Lambda, Kinesis, SQS, Kafka or EventBridge. We'll analyze CloudWatch metrics, X-Ray traces, structured logs, and schema diffs to investigate scenarios like silent drops in throughput, poisoned events, and misrouted payloads. Learn how to correlate observations across services, identify system bottlenecks, and build observability into event-driven pipelines. If you love solving puzzles with graphs, this session is your crime scene!
speakers: Rohan Mangal; Aneel Murari; Rahul Popat; Pawan Puthran; Mohamed Salah; Nithin Vommi
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Testing GuardDuty’s Runtime Detections:Hands-on with real world attack scenarios
description: Join this lightning talk to learn how to validate Amazon GuardDuty's runtime threat detection capabilities using test cases that reflect realworld threats. We'll demonstrate practical examples of executing controlled MITRE ATT&CK-mapped tests to verify GuardDuty's ability to detect common attack techniques, including execution, privilege escalation, persistence and impact. Through live demonstrations, discover how to safely simulate threats in your AWS environment, interpret GuardDuty's findings, and gain confidence in your security controls. Leave with practical knowledge to implement your own GuardDuty validation testing strategy using realistic test scenarios.
tags: Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: The agent-enabled workplace: How AI assistants are transforming the way we work
description: The workplace is undergoing a fundamental shift as AI agents become integrated into our daily workflows. In this Innovation Talk, Dilip Kumar will explore how organizations can effectively implement AI assistants to enhance employee experience and productivity. Drawing from Amazon's experience with tools like Amazon Q Business and QuickSight, we'll examine real-world examples of AI transforming work patterns. Key principles for building effective AI assistants will be discussed, including leveraging enterprise data, balancing automation with human oversight, designing intuitive AI workspaces, and measuring productivity gains. Attendees will gain a practical framework for evaluating and implementing AI agents in their organizations, focusing on creating value while maintaining security and trust.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Business Executive; IT Executive; Lecture-style

title: The AI revolution in customer support: Building predictive service systems
description: Discover how AWS is using Generative AI to transform customer support from reactive to proactive. We'll show how large language models and AI agents are improving customer satisfaction and efficiency. Topics include smart case routing, context-aware support, early problem detection, and responsible AI use. We'll share real results and discuss balancing AI capabilities with human touch.
speakers: Tipu Qureshi; Saurabh Saxena; Dwight Biddle
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Security & Identity; Lecture-style

title: The Art of Embracing Failures in Serverless Architectures
description: Serverless architectures offer the immense power of distributed systems wrapped in irresistible simplicity. But that simplicity is an illusion. Explore hidden pitfalls in distributed systems and practical strategies to build resilience, illustrated with real-world examples using AWS Lambda and Amazon Kinesis. Above all, embrace failures. In the words of Dr. Werner Vogels: everything fails, all the time.
tags: Resilience; DevOps; Serverless; Architecture; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: The Art of Managing Trade-Offs for your AWS Network Design
description: Every AWS network design decision involves careful trade-off considerations. In this session, master the art of making critical AWS network design decisions through real-world scenarios. Learn how to evaluate key trade-offs between centralized and distributed architectures while balancing security, performance, and cost requirements. Whether you're building a global network, managing multi-account environments, or implementing hybrid connectivity to on-premises locations, attendees will leave with actionable insights and practical decision-making tools to optimize network infrastructure architecture designs.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Interactive

title: The AWS Security Incident Response Challenge: Defend the Cake!
description: Our precious Magic Unicorn Cake recipe is under threat from the notorious Grumpy Cats! In this high-stakes workshop, you'll step into the role of an AWS Security Engineer tasked with defending our digital delicacies. You'll implement real-time threat detection, configure security defenses, establish comprehensive monitoring, and create incident response processes. Through this immersive experience, you'll master the art of rapid security response while protecting our precious recipe vault from crafty cyber-cats. Join us to learn practical AWS security methodologies that translate directly to real-world scenarios observed by the AWS Customer Incident Response Team. You must bring your laptop to participate.
services: Amazon GuardDuty; AWS CloudTrail; AWS IAM Identity Center
tags: Threat Detection & Incident Response; DevSecOps; Security & Identity; Hands-on; Interactive

title: The bill shock that taught me cost optimization
description: Serverless feels financially safe – you only pay for what you use, right? Wrong. Hidden costs lurk everywhere: cold starts, data transfer, inefficient functions, and more. This session reveals the serverless cost traps that catch even experienced developers and equips you with battle-tested strategies to avoid them. You'll learn monitoring techniques that prevent surprises, architectural choices that slash bills, and optimization patterns that keep your applications lean. Perfect for any developer who wants predictable serverless costs without sacrificing performance.
tags: Serverless & Containers; Lecture-style

title: The Frugal Architect GameDay: Building cost-aware architectures
description: Compete to implement cost efficiency improvements across multiple AWS services in this interactive GameDay. Tackle real-world challenges spanning compute, networking, storage, serverless, and observability domains while applying the Laws of the Frugal Architect. Transform high-cost infrastructure into efficient, sustainable architectures through practical quests involving Graviton processors, serverless optimizations, and database fine-tuning. Learn to reduce cloud unit costs and improve profitability without compromising service quality. Gain hands-on experience with production-ready solutions that align infrastructure costs to business objectives, making cost optimization a fundamental architectural requirement.
tags: Cost Optimization; DevOps; Architecture; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: The Frugal Architect in a Chaotic World [REPEAT]
description: In a world of runaway cloud bills and mounting tech debt, how do you build optimized systems that make sense? This session puts Werner Vogels Frugal Architect principles into practice using AWS Graviton, Amazon EC2 Spot, Karpenter, Generative AI, and open-source tools. See how we optimize a shopping cart with AI, then use flame graphs to trace improvements down to CPU cycles. It's not about cutting corners itis about engineering smarter. You will learn how to scale with Karpenter, optimize with Graviton, and analyze with AI + flame graphs, so you can build leaner, faster, and more cost-efficient systems by design.
services: Amazon EC2 - Graviton; Amazon EC2 Spot; Amazon Q Developer

This session explores how leading organizations use generative AI and intelligent agents to unlock new business models and pioneer innovative customer experiences. Through real-world examples, learn how to democratize AI capabilities across your organization while ensuring responsible implementation through security and governance frameworks. title: The future of AWS Serverless in 2025 and beyond

title: The incident is over: Now what?
description: Optimal operational practice defines how to handle inevitable incidents and recover quickly. What about the aftermath? How do we ensure that the true root cause is tracked down and that effective preventive actions are planned for implementation? How do we turn every incident into an organization-wide learning opportunity? How do the shared responsibility model and third-party software vendors come into play? We'll share our mental models and decades-long experience around Root Cause Analysis and Correction of Error (COE), so you can drive an effective practice in your own organization.

description: Security teams face an ever-evolving landscape of threats, making it crucial to stay ahead with advanced detection capabilities. In this session, we'll peel back the layers of Amazon GuardDuty Extended Threat Detection to show you how it ingests and processes various security signals, and how protection plans work together to create a comprehensive security net. title: The Mirage of Benchmarks: Foundations of LLM Evaluation Reliability
description: Benchmarks drive LLM development decisions, yet their signals are fundamentally fragile due to theoretical limitations critical at scale. Current evaluation spans pointwise metrics, pairwise preferences (Arena, MT-Bench), and agentic evaluations, extending to multi-modal models and autonomous agents. Large-scale evaluation reveals scores shift with decoding parameters, prompt templates, seeds, and inference precision, showing evaluation signals lack mathematical stability. Public benchmarks suffer contamination and memorization that corrupt capability measurement, while pairwise methods inherit systematic biases. This talk examines evaluation paradigm limitations, explores contamination detection methods, and presents frameworks separating genuine capability from benchmark artifacts.
speakers: Mahdi Namazifar; Swastik Roy; Morteza Ziyadi
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Data Scientist; Developer / Engineer; Interactive

Learn why this media giant chose to make the switch and explore the best practices that ensured a seamless transition of some of the internet's most popular pages and games. We'll delve into the journey from Google's Datastore, App Engine, and GKE to Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service(EKS) and Amazon DynamoDB. Uncover how this strategic move not only modernized The Times' tech stack but also significantly enhanced performance, scalability, and operational efficiency.

tags: Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Transforming AI storage economics with Amazon S3 Vectors
description: Amazon S3 Vectors introduces native support for vector data in S3, allowing you to store, retrieve, and query vectors directly alongside objects and tables. We’ll cover architecture design, performance considerations, and how S3 Vectors supports scalable AI agent memory, multimodal retrieval, and real-time inference workflows—all with the durability and scale of S3.

title: Transforming Apache Kafka into a Scalable Message Queue
description: Event streaming in Apache Kafka is powerful, but sometimes a queue-based model is more suited for workloads where parallel consumption is more important than ordering. KIP-932 introduces share groups, a feature that allows consumers to cooperatively consume data from Kafka topics, akin to how message queues work. This enables per-message acknowledgment, retries, and load distribution without the complexities of partition management. Ideal for independent work items, this approach simplifies message handling and enhances scalability. Join us to learn how KIP-932 brings queuing semantics to Kafka, enabling more flexible, efficient processing in event-driven architectures.
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Analytics; Application Integration; Open Source; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Lecture-style

title: Troubleshooting database performance issues at scale
description: Managing database fleets at scale means finding that one problematic instance among hundreds before it impacts customers. This lightning talk demonstrates how to rapidly identify and resolve performance bottlenecks across diverse Aurora and RDS database engines. Learn to leverage CloudWatch Database Insights for fleet-wide monitoring, SQL-level diagnostics with execution plans and lock analysis, and performance trend analysis. The session reveals practical techniques for correlating application signals with database metrics, analyzing slow queries, performance troubleshooting workflows.
tags: Monitoring & Observability; DevOps; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Troubleshooting in the cloud with Amazon Q
description: Learn how to troubleshoot large-scale AWS environments by combining conventional techniques with cutting-edge generative AI technologies. We'll begin by examining time-tested troubleshooting methodologies and tools, including log and metrics analysis through Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Config, and AWS X-Ray. Then, through hands-on scenarios, you'll learn how Amazon Q transforms the troubleshooting experience by providing contextual AI-powered diagnostics tailored to your specific environment. Choose your preferred domain - networking, containers, databases, or serverless/DevOps - and work on triaging real-world issues using generative AI and best practices shared during the workshop. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Bhavani Kanneganti; David Schliemann; Mohammad Shafiullah
tags: Cloud Operations; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Trust and Transparency: Implementing Scalable Data Lineage for AI/ML
description: In the age of AI, can you prove where your data came from, how it was transformed and its quality? Join us for an immersive workshop where you’ll master data lineage and quality in AWS. Get hands-on with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio and the OpenLineage standard as you build transparent, traceable data pipelines that tell the complete story of your data’s journey. You’ll learn techniques for tracking data flow across complex workflows to support compliance, impact analysis, and troubleshooting. Walk away with practical strategies to implement enterprise-grade data lineage and quality that builds stakeholder confidence in your AI systems and data assets. Perfect for data engineers and architects who want to elevate their practices from a black box to a glass box of transparency and trust.
speakers: Santiago Abarca Arroyo; Jose Romero; Ming Zhu
tags: Partner Enablement; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Turbocharge the mainframe to cloud journey with AWS Transform's agentic AI
description: Join leaders from ADP and Itau as they share how they reimagined their mainframe-based mission-critical systems. Dive deep into their transformation journey, exploring crucial architectural decisions, risk mitigation strategies, and lessons learned. Discover how they leveraged AWS Transform's automated code analysis, documentation, and business rules extraction, paired with other AWS developer tools, to achieve efficiency gains in reverse engineering, forward engineering, and testing. Whether you're at that starting line or already moving through your modernization journey, this session offers valuable insights from organizations that have successfully accelerated from legacy systems with AWS Transform.
speakers: Paulo Vitor Pereira; Douglas Santos; Anuradha Verma
tags: Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Turn unstructured data in Amazon S3 into AI-ready assets with SageMaker Catalog
description: Unstructured data often holds untapped value, and Amazon SageMaker makes it possible to turn that data into insights and AI-ready assets. In this session, you'll learn how to bring unstructured data from Amazon S3 into SageMaker, create searchable assets, and build knowledge bases for Amazon Bedrock to improve retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) accuracy. Discover how teams can collaborate across roles, data users can self-serve to find and understand the right data, and governance ensures that the right people get the right access. Bayer will share how they use these capabilities to unlock unstructured data and accelerate research and innovation.

tags: Generative AI; Governance, Risk & Compliance; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Artificial Intelligence; IT Administrator; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: UC San Diego Health modernizes patient engagement with Amazon Connect
description: Healthcare organizations struggle with disconnected administrative systems and manual processes that create inefficient patient experiences and operational bottlenecks. Join UC San Diego Health to learn how they implemented an AI-powered patient engagement solution using Amazon Connect to address complex administrative processes through a unified patient engagement journey across the health system. We'll demonstrate the implementation of Amazon Connect with Epic EHR integration to enable self-service patient authentication and appointment information retrieval.
speakers: Ken Daugherty; Chris Rallo; Josh Glandorf
tags: Business Applications; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Lecture-style

title: Under the hood with Amazon EBS: Achieving sub-millisecond latency at scale
description: Amazon EBS powers mission-critical applications with consistent sub-millisecond latency across millions of volumes. This session offers a behind-the-scenes look at the architectural innovations and engineering practices that make this possible. Learn how EBS leverages the AWS Nitro System, purpose-built hardware, and advanced I/O path optimizations to deliver reliable low-latency performance at hyperscale. Gain insights into how these capabilities translate into performance benefits for databases, analytics platforms, and latency-sensitive workloads.
services: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS); Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)

description: Amazon EKS continues to push the boundaries of what's possible. Join this session to understand the engineering principles and design decisions that drive Amazon EKS's evolution to support massive scale while maintaining simplicity and reliability. We'll highlight key Kubernetes control plane performance improvements and storage layer optimizations made to support ultra-scale clusters of up to 100k nodes. We'll also share our approach to providing customers more flexibility and choice over their control plane's performance and capacity.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Kubernetes; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Understanding AWS Lambda event source mapping [REPEAT]
description: Gain a deep understanding of how AWS Lambda uses event source mapping to retrieve items from streams and queues. Explore the inner workings of event source mapping and how its behavior differs across seven different streaming and queuing services, such as Amazon Kinesis and Amazon SQS. Leave this talk with practical insights into optimizing your serverless data pipelines by making the most of event source mapping's capabilities and service-specific nuances.

description: Generative AI applications have captured widespread attention; however, they have also introduced new security challenges, especially around the handling of customer data. Organizations want to ensure that their data remains safe and secure while working with foundation models (FMs) and don�t want to worry about their data being used to train an FM. Amazon Q Business provides comprehensive data protection and privacy. In this chalk talk, explore architectures and data flows while you learn about the security-related capabilities of Amazon Q Business.
tags: Business Applications; Interactive

title: Unified knowledge access: Bridging data with generative AI agents [REPEAT]
description: As organizations mature their generative AI strategy, more complex use cases emerge. Originally focused on unstructured data, organizations now require structured data as a source of knowledge for AI applications. This session will showcase a method for storing and accessing structured and unstructured data in tandem through an AI agent. Learn how to put text data into a vector store and create a text-to-SQL system with advanced knowledge bases, then efficiently direct user questions using AI agents for a smooth user experience. This approach demonstrates how to leverage both structured and unstructured data sources to enhance the capabilities of generative AI systems in enterprise environments.

description: Multicloud environments present unique observability challenges such as enabling end-to-end visibility of distributed applications and dealing with fragmented tools. This lightning talk will showcase implementation patterns using both open source and cloud-native tooling. You'll leave with clear selection criteria for choosing the right pattern based on your organization's scale, technical constraints, and operational maturity.

title: Unified Namespace: Simplifying Manufacturing Data Integration
description: A Unified Namespace (UNS) serves as a standardized architecture that connects disparate manufacturing systems, enabling seamless communication and real-time data integration across the factory floor. This session explores UNS implementation in manufacturing, focusing on three critical areas: desiging namespace hierarchies, establishing data flow patterns, and integrating existing systems. Using AWS IoT Core, Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK), AWS IoT SiteWise, and Amazon S3 Tables, we demonstrate proven solutions for data latency, scaling, and security challenges. Join us for an open discussion that will help shape your approach to UNS implementation.
tags: Edge Computing; Event-Driven Architecture; Internet of Things; Industry Solutions; Advisor / Consultant; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Energy & Utilities; Manufacturing & Industrial; Interactive

title: Unifying AI/ML operations with SageMaker HyperPod and Amazon EKS
description: As organizations scale AI/ML operations, they can leverage the optimized infrastructure of SageMaker HyperPod or build custom workflows on Amazon EKS. In this session, we'll demonstrate how these approaches represent complementary paths to AI success. While SageMaker HyperPod provides pre-configured, optimized environments for distributed training with seamless integration into the SageMaker ecosystem, Amazon EKS offers the flexibility to build custom AI/ML infrastructures with granular control. We'll explore real-world architectures showing how organizations can leverage both HyperPod's automated cluster management and optimized libraries alongside EKS's extensible Kubernetes foundation.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon SageMaker AI
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Scientist; Entrepreneur (Founder/Co-Founder); Solution / Systems Architect; Games; Healthcare & Life Sciences; Software & Internet; Enterprise; Interactive

In this chalk talk, we'll architect solutions that integrate existing AWS native and AWS partners data platform with AWS Glue Data Catalog, AWS Lake Formation, and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Together, we'll walk through patterns using Iceberg REST API to unify metadata federation and create seamless data views across systems. Attendees will leave with a better understanding of architectural patterns that transform fragmented data environments into an intelligent, unified platform ready for generative AI at scale.

description: Educational institutions face challenges extracting actionable insights from disparate lecture recordings, learning materials, and student-generated content. In this session, discover how to orchestrate coordinated, cross-modal analysis by leveraging multi-agent architectures with Amazon Strands SDK, powered by Amazon Bedrock and Nova models. Learn how specialized agents can collaboratively process and synthesize video, audio, and text data, unlocking deeper insights into student engagement and comprehension. Through real-world examples and step-by-step demonstrations, gain hands-on experience building unified, agentic AI solutions that transform your institution’s educational analytics.

This session provides practical insights and hands-on experience to migrate your Apache Kafka cluster to Amazon MSK, optimize your Kafka deployments for different types of workloads, enabling you to make informed decisions for your streaming needs. By the end of this session, you'll build efficient and scalable data streaming solutions.

title: Unleash Rust's potential on AWS
description: Rust's safety, performance, and reliability make it an ideal choice for cloud applications on AWS. From Amazon Aurora DSQL to AWS Firecracker and AWS Bottlerocket, AWS has demonstrated Rust's capabilities in critical infrastructure. This session explores practical applications of Rust, demonstrating serverless implementations and concurrent processing patterns. Discover how Rust's memory safety and efficient abstractions enhance AWS applications. From AWS Lambda functions to distributed systems, learn to build high-performance solutions with Rust.

description: In this session, discover how to leverage Terraform to streamline infrastructure provisioning on AWS. Learn to define your desired AWS resource state using Terraform's human-readable configuration files, enabling consistent and repeatable deployments. Explore the power of Terraform modules for code reuse, organization, and maintainability. Understand how to structure your Terraform codebase into reusable modules, promoting collaboration and standardization across your organization. Unlock the full potential of Terraform on AWS, enabling you to build, change, and version your infrastructure with confidence, agility, and scalability.
tags: DevOps; Cloud Operations; Developer Tools; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Interactive

title: Unleashing Generative AI for Amazon Ads at Scale
description: Discover how Amazon Ads harnesses the power of large language models (LLMs) to enhance shopper discovery and drive better outcomes for advertisers. This session explores the AWS-based machine learning infrastructure that fuels these innovations, including fine-tuning, model serving, and real-time inference at scale. Learn how we optimized cost, latency, and reliability to deliver LLM-powered solutions across the Amazon Ads ecosystem while maintaining the high performance our customers expect.
tags: Learning from Amazon; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: Unlock carbon & cost insights: Optimize spend and drive sustainability
description: Since the early days of cloud adoption, many AWS customers have developed FinOps best practices to manage and optimize costs. While the AWS Cost and Usage Reports (CUR) are commonly used, their usage data contains untapped insights. In this two-hour, hands-on workshop, you’ll learn how to query and analyze emissions and CUR data efficiently. We’ll introduce the Cloud Intelligence Dashboards and demonstrate how to customize them. Through practical examples and interactive exercises, you’ll learn to visualize cloud usage, uncover optimization opportunities, and make data-driven decisions that support both cost efficiency and sustainability goals.
tags: Business Intelligence; Sustainability; Cost Optimization; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Energy & Utilities; Financial Services; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Hands-on; Interactive

description: Join this interactive session to master Amazon Connect's built-in reporting capabilities to extract valuable insights from your contact center data. Learn to analyze key performance indicators and visualize trends using native features, enabling data-driven decisions without external systems. You'll gain practical knowledge to optimize operations, enhance agent performance, and improve customer experiences through effective use of both historical and real-time reporting tools.
tags: SaaS; Business Applications; Interactive

title: Unlock Cost Efficiency with AWS Graviton Savings Dashboard
description: The Graviton Savings Dashboard offers a comprehensive analysis of your compute usage, identifying prime candidates for Graviton migration. The Graviton Savings Dashboard now provides deeper analytics for workload modernization, helping customers maximize their migration investments. Organizations using Graviton continue to achieve up to 40% better price performance, with new features enabling granular workload analysis and simplified migration planning. Learn how to leverage advanced dashboard capabilities to accelerate your cost optimization journey, identify new optimization opportunities, and create data-driven migration strategies that deliver measurable business impact. This lightning talk demonstrates how to turn efficiency insights into actionable migration plans.

tags: Business Intelligence; Cost Optimization; Compute; Migration & Modernization; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Unlock development value in the age of AI-driven strategies
description:
Development teams are under pressure to deliver more and faster but recent studies show developers report losing over 22% of their time to inefficiencies, leading to mediocre developer experience and costing enterprises millions in lost productivity and delayed innovation. With the introduction of developer focused AI tooling and autonomous AI agents the situation gets even more complex.
In this chalk talk we explore the value of a structured approach to showing the value of your development organization. Taking guidance from frameworks like DORA, SPACE and Amazons Cost To Serve - Software, this talk provides you with the insights you need to accelerate your journey to show the value of developer experience.

You'll learn how EKS Hybrid Nodes enables seamless integration between the cloud and your on-prem or edge environments. We’ll also explore a real-world scenario, showcasing how on-premises GPUs can be integrated into EKS clusters to accelerate GenAI inferencing.

AWS data stores. title: Unveiling Amazon ECS workloads with AWS observability and agentic AI
description: As containerized workloads grow in complexity, traditional observability approaches struggle to keep pace. Discover how generative AI transforms Amazon ECS workload observability by turning overwhelming data into actionable insights. This chalk talk demonstrates Amazon CloudWatch Investigations' AI capabilities that automatically analyze container telemetry, generate root-cause hypotheses, and provide targeted remediation suggestions, dramatically reducing MTTR. We'll showcase seamless integration between CloudWatch Investigations, Container Insights, and Amazon Managed Prometheus, building unified solutions that transform reactive monitoring into proactive, intelligent observability of your workloads on Amazon ECS.

Amazon SageMaker Catalog is built-on DataZone with broader analytics and AI capabilities, while preserving governance and continuity. We’ll walk through how to move curated assets, metadata, glossaries, and subscriptions into SageMaker Catalog while keeping both the DataZone and SageMaker portals available during rollout. title: Use Amazon DynamoDB to enhance agentic AI workflows
description: Managing multiple AI agents in production can lead to data inconsistencies, security vulnerabilities, and system failures. Join us in this hands-on session where you will build an agent governance framework using Amazon DynamoDB. You will explore proven patterns for state management, audit logging, and policy enforcement. Learn practical approaches to implementing rate limiting, access controls, and real-time monitoring. You will walk away with practical strategies for monitoring agent behavior and maintaining system integrity in production environments. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Varma Gottumukkala; Anamika Kesharwani; Robert McCauley; Puneet Rawal; Arjan Schaaf
tags: Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Use an AI agent to launch your Aurora DSQL project with Amazon Q & MCP
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to enhance your Amazon Aurora DSQL development process using Amazon Q and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Explore business scenarios and architect design solutions that show how AI agents can launch Aurora DSQL clusters, design database schemas, and build database clients through natural language interactions. The talk includes a whiteboarding session on architectural patterns and decision points to get Aurora DSQL projects launched and running efficiently with conversational AI interfaces.
services: Amazon Q Developer; Amazon Aurora DSQL
tags: Agentic AI; DevOps; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Use GraphRAG with Amazon Neptune to improve generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) applications use the power of generative AI to analyze private datasets. GraphRAG combines knowledge graphs with RAG to produce explainable responses that are grounded in the semantic relationships between concepts, entities, and the underlying content. In this builders' session, learn how to use the open source AWS GraphRAG Toolkit to transform unstructured and semi-structured data into a catalog of domain-specific GraphRAG tools that can be used in RAG applications and agentic workflows for tackling complex information tasks. You must bring your laptop to participate.
speakers: Dave Bechberger; Melissa Kwok; Kelvin Lawrence; Taylor Riggan; Ian Robinson
tags: Generative AI; Open Data; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Use serverless knowledge graphs for hybrid search with Amazon Neptune
description: In this chalk talk, explore how to build a scalable serverless hybrid search application that combines vectors and graph data. Learn how this approach empowers you to leverage the benefits of vector-based search with the rich relationships defined in graphs to provide more comprehensive and explainable answers. Discover how to use Amazon Neptune Serverless to architect a hybrid search application and learn multiple approaches for combining vectors with graph data and the associated trade-offs. Leave this talk understanding the power of combining vectors and graph data to build scalable serverless hybrid search applications.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Neptune; Amazon OpenSearch Service
tags: Generative AI; Serverless; Analytics; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Learn to use Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with your proprietary data and business context stored in Amazon S3 and Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. This approach enables more relevant, context-specific, and accurate customer responses. Gain hands-on experience using AWS serverless services with FSx for ONTAP and Amazon Bedrock to enable automatic scaling, event-driven compute, and API interfaces for gen AI applications. Explore how enterprise customers leverage S3 and ONTAP file systems with Bedrock to transform corporate data into powerful gen AI solutions.
speakers: Madhu Balaji; Saptarshi Banerjee; Varun Jasti; Sean Phuphanich; Mahesh Ramamurthy

title: Using AI  to bridge the multicloud skills gap in IT operations
description: Organizations with multicloud environments often face a skills gap when running production-grade IT operations in multiple clouds. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll share practical approaches to addressing this skills gap using agentic AI to augment and assist your IT operations team. Through demos and architectural discussions, we'll explore building agents with Amazon Bedrock and developing IT operation pipelines with Amazon Q Developer. Bring your DevOps or IT operational challenges as we design solutions to bridge the multicloud operations skills gap.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon CloudWatch; AWS Systems Manager
tags: Workforce Development; Automation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Hybrid Cloud & Multicloud; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Using AI to improve humanitarian workload resilience
description: Almost everyone has experienced a bad IT day, when systems fail in unpredictable ways. For organizations operating in a humanitarian crisis, contextual continuity is mission critical. In this code talk, we'll explore how generative AI can help build more resilient humanitarian systems. Drawing from Werner Vogels' wisdom that "everything fails, all the time, so plan for failure and nothing will fail", we'll demonstrate practical techniques for identifying and mitigating potential system failures. Through live coding, attendees will learn to leverage AI to anticipate and address vulnerabilities, ensuring more robust and reliable humanitarian technology.
tags: Resilience; Tech for Impact; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Nonprofit; Interactive

title: Using Amazon Q to Cost Optimize Your Containerized Workloads
description: Are you looking to cost optimize your containerized workloads? Adopting Amazon EKS with Karpenter on AWS Graviton can help you get up to 40% better price performance. In this workshop, you�ll use Amazon Q to accelerate migrating an app running on x86 to Graviton. You'll start with local performance tests followed by the CI/CD pipeline modifications to build and deploy multi architecture application to EKS using Karpenter. With Amazon Q, you'll identify improvement opportunities to get better performance on Graviton. You�ll also dive deep into efficiently deploying your application to an EKS cluster using Karpenter. Requires laptop to participate.
services: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); Amazon Q; Amazon EC2 - Graviton
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Containers; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Using Amazon S3 Batch Operations to operate on up to billions of objects
description: Learn how S3 Batch Operations enables you to manage massive-scale workloads of up to 20 billion objects through a single request. In this chalk talk, we’ll explore practical implementations of S3 Batch Operations, including copying objects between staging and production buckets, restoring archived backups from Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes, and verifying the content of stored datasets using the compute checksum operation. You’ll learn architectural best practices, performance optimization techniques, and the underlying mechanisms that make these large-scale operations possible. Join us to share your own use cases and learn how other customers are using S3 Batch Operations to solve complex data management challenges.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)
tags: Management & Governance; Well-Architected Framework; Cost Optimization; Cloud Operations; Storage; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Using event-driven architectures to modernize legacy applications at scale
description: Want to modernize your monolithic applications but unsure where to start? Event-driven architecture (EDA) offers a powerful approach to decomposing complex systems into small, decoupled services that can scale independently.  In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for distributed systems and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by real-world examples, learn how to apply integration patterns in complex use cases.
services: Amazon EventBridge; AWS Lambda; AWS Step Functions
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Serverless; Application Integration; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Using GenAI to profile, scale, and optimize your multi-tenant SaaS architecture
description: SaaS builders have always relied heavily on metrics and profiling data to assess the real-time profile of their SaaS architecture. How efficiently the system is consuming resources, how tenants are applying loads, where noisy neighbor conditions are surfacing—these are amongst a long list of insights that SaaS architects rely on. This session will look at how GenAI can be brought to this experience, enabling builders to get richer views into how their multi-tenant strategies and policies are working. GenAI opens all new paths into interrogating the footprint of a SaaS environment, including analyzing key experience insights (time to value, throttling patters, over-provisioning, etc.). The goal is to look at how/where these GenAI mechanisms can be introduced into your architecture and how they can be analyzed with various GenAI tools.
tags: SaaS; Agentic AI; DevOps; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: Using generative AI to accelerate database modernization with AWS DMS
description: Does the thought of modernizing your application and database architecture fill you with concern? In this code talk, learn how to overcome common migration issues and concerns that arise during modernization projects. See live coding examples to learn how to use generative AI and the AWS DMS Schema Conversion feature to successfully modernize your database.
services: AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS); AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT)
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Databases; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Using generative AI to automate architectural guidance
description: AI-powered systems are revolutionizing how organizations develop and verify architectural guidance, replacing time-intensive manual processes. This chalk talk demonstrates how AI technologies generate strategic recommendations, design principles, and best practices at scale. Explore real-world patterns for AI-driven guidance systems, examining their benefits and limitations. Learn effective strategies for building knowledge bases, maintaining human oversight, ensuring accuracy, and addressing ethical considerations in AI-generated architectural guidance. Discover practical approaches to implementing automated guidance while maintaining governance and quality.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Q Business; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Architecture; Advisor / Consultant; IT Executive; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Using graphs over your data lake to power generative AI applications
description: In this session, learn about new Amazon Neptune capabilities for high-performance graph analytics and queries over data lakes to unlock the implicit and explicit relationships in your data, driving more accurate, trustworthy generative AI responses. We'll demonstrate building knowledge graphs from structured and unstructured data, combining graph algorithms (PageRank, Louvain clustering, path optimization) with semantic search, and executing Cypher queries on Parquet and Iceberg formats in Amazon S3. Through code samples and benchmarks, learn advanced architectures to use Neptune for multi-hop reasoning, entity linking, and context enrichment at scale. This session assumes familiarity with graph concepts and data lake architectures.
tags: Generative AI; Open Data; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: Using Strands Agents to build autonomous, self-improving AI agents
description: Explore the cutting edge of AI with Strands Agents—autonomous systems that evolve and learn continuously. We'll demonstrate advanced agents that can identify knowledge gaps, self-modify reasoning strategies, and dynamically build tools. These systems learn from interactions, improving decision-making without human intervention while communicating through multiple protocols and real-time, bi-directional streaming. Using Strands' model-driven approach, agents operate independently for extended periods, continuously enhancing effectiveness. Through real-world examples, see how self-improving agents have transformed business processes by adapting to changing requirements automatically. Join us to challenge conventional thinking about agent limitations and reshape your approach to building truly autonomous AI systems.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

description: With Amazon OpenSearch Service’s vector database capabilities you can implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with Large Language Models (LLMs). Join this session to build a RAG-based, contextually aware, conversational search solution using OpenSearch vector database for document embedding and LLM content generation with context.
speakers: Sean Bjurstrom; Aruna Govindaraju; Soujanya Konka; Alex Tarasov; Luis Tiani

title: Version lifecycle management at scale with AWS Health: from EKS to RDS
description: Discover how organizations manage critical lifecycle events including EKS Kubernetes version upgrades and RDS Aurora database updates using AWS Health and ITSM tools. Learn proven strategies for managing these changes at scale, from early detection to change completion. Through customer success stories, see how enterprises have reduced upgrade-related running costs by 60% using the AWS Health toolkit for cluster and database updates. We'll showcase new ITSM integrations with AWS Health, featuring automated change request routing and escalation management for version-critical resources. Join us to define your new organization-wide strategy for version change enablement.
tags: Cloud Operations; Lecture-style

title: Vibe coding production-ready containerized applications [REPEAT]
description: In this session, explore how Amazon Q integrated with the Amazon ECS Model Context Protocol (MCP) server streamlines application development and cloud deployments. Participants will create production-ready, well-architected environments using natural language prompts—no manual configuration or lengthy IaC manual templates required. Experience how this groundbreaking integration automatically implements AWS best practices while accelerating deployment timelines. You must bring your laptop to participate.

description: In this session master practical Amazon DynamoDB data modeling through an innovative "vibe modeling" approach using Model Context Protocol (MCP). Learn to architect complex data models that use sophisticated techniques right inside an AI-powered IDE. Through guided exercises, optimize access patterns and leverage secondary indexes effectively. Build models by expressing application requirements in natural language, documented by AI to generate a DynamoDB data model for review. In this session, learn how AI-assisted database design can accelerate complex NoSQL modeling decisions. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Vibe modernize your .NET applications using AWS Transform and Kiro
description: Looking to make your .NET development faster and easier? Join this live coding session to see how AWS Transform for .NET and Kiro can make your daily coding much smoother! We'll take you through the whole process - starting with a legacy .NET Framework application and porting it into modern .NET using AWS Transform. Then, we'll use Kiro to refactor your codebase leveraging vibe coding and spec driven development. You'll see the entire end-to-end process of modernizing .NET applications, learning practical techniques to enhance your development productivity and efficiently upgrade your existing codebase.
tags: Generative AI; Microsoft & .NET; Agentic AI; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

description: Master the art of AI pair programming by building a complete application using Anthoropic Claude, with zero prior CDK knowledge. In this hands-on session, participants will learn advanced prompting techniques, MCP integration, and research tools to guide Claude through creating a production-ready serverless application. Starting with just a business requirement, you'll discover how to leverage Claude to build and deploy an application that includes multiple AWS services, and also how to handle complex tasks like AWS IAM permissions, environment configurations, and CI/CD pipelines. By the end, you'll have gained practical skills to help realize productivity gains in AWS development.
speakers: Jawhny Cooke; Chris Lott; Jason Nicholls; Maggie Osude; Court Schuett
