title: Video sampling & search using in-memory DBs & multimodal embeddings
description: Multimodal embeddings enable a wide range of video analysis capabilities, from content understanding and summarization to classification and recommendations. In this code talk, learn how to use smart sampling and video search, generating multimodal embeddings in Amazon Bedrock and using in-memory databases. See live coding examples to discover how to build delightful video experiences for your customers.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon ElastiCache; Amazon MemoryDB
tags: Generative AI; Artificial Intelligence; Databases; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Virtualization Architecture Behind AgentCore's Runtime Security Model
description: Journey into the sophisticated virtualization architecture that powers AgentCore's runtime security model. This session examines the intricate mechanics of session isolation at the virtualization layer, exploring advanced techniques in compute and memory virtualization, virtual machine snapshot optimization, and virtual memory deduplication. Drawing from operating systems research and systems security principles, we'll demonstrate how these components work together to create robust security boundaries for agent workloads. Attendees will gain deep technical insights into the mathematical and systems-level concepts that position AWS at the forefront of secure agent runtime architectures, showcasing our industry-leading approach to securing code execution in agent environments.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Academic / Researcher; Interactive

title: Visualize data lake insights with S3 Tables and AWS analytics [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build powerful data visualization solutions using Amazon S3 Tables with AWS analytics services. S3 Tables bring fully managed Apache Iceberg tables to Amazon S3, making it easier to query and visualize open data in your data lake. Through interactive discussion and whiteboarding, explore how S3 Tables simplify data access and accelerate queries. See how to structure data for efficient analytics without additional metadata layers, and integrate with Amazon QuickSight and Grafana for rich dashboards. This chalk talk demonstrates practical patterns for implementing self-service analytics, optimizing query performance, and creating scalable visualization solutions.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon QuickSight; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Business Intelligence; Monitoring & Observability; Open Data; Analytics; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: vLLM on AWS: testing to production and everything in between
description: This session explores practical architectural patterns for deploying and scaling large language models (LLMs) in production environments. We'll walk through a comprehensive journey from initial testing to production deployment, covering essential steps including model evaluation with vLLM, performance benchmarking, and optimization techniques. Attendees will learn how to implement efficient autoscaling solutions using Ray and vLLM, compare different inference servers like Triton and vLLM, and understand their trade-offs. The session concludes with a deep dive into productionalization using AIBrix, providing attendees with actionable insights for building robust, scalable LLM infrastructures. Suitable for ML engineers and architects working on LLM deployments.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Open Source; Data Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Developer Community; Lecture-style

title: VMware to AWS modernization blueprint: Migrate, containerize, scale
description: Ready to move beyond VMware? This hands-on workshop delivers the technical blueprint to successfully migrate and modernize workloads on AWS. We'll take you through migrating an application from VMware to Amazon EC2 to containers. Starting with AWS Transform, you'll discover how to leverage agentic AI to migrate VMware workloads to AWS faster and at scale. Then, using Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS), you'll learn to containerize applications, implement microservices, and build scalable, resilient cloud-native solutions. With guidance from AWS experts who successfully helped VMware customers, this workshop help you reimagine your application architecture, optimize infrastructure, and accelerate innovation.
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS); AWS Transform
tags: VMware; Containers; Kubernetes; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Hands-on; Interactive

title: VMware to AWS Readiness: Foundational decisions before your migration
description: Join this interactive session to explore critical decisions that set successful VMware to AWS migrations apart. We'll examine how early choices across licensing optimization, operating models, technology architecture, and organizational readiness impact your migration timeline, costs, and long-term success. Discover how to assess your VMware environment comprehensively, identifying dependencies and business constraints that guide your cloud strategy. Learn a practical decision framework to build stakeholder alignment, ensure flexibility for future transformation, and avoid critical pitfalls in your migration. Regardless of your pathway to the cloud, this session will help you gain the strategic foundation essential for migration success.
speakers: Nits Jeganathan; Senay Swinney; Ron Wedel
tags: Microsoft & .NET; VMware; Well-Architected Framework; Migration & Modernization; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Interactive

title: Vodafone Romania BSS Modernization on AWS
description: Vodafone Romania's journey to modernize their BSS infrastructure showcases a strategic partnership with AWS and Amdocs. This chalk talk details the successful migration of Vodafone's legacy Amdocs BSS stack from on-premises to AWS, with Vodafone managing their own infrastructure. The phased approach began with Billing and Charging systems, followed by an integration layer, and ultimately encompassing Catalogue, CRM, and other critical applications. Despite initial challenges, the three-way collaboration between Vodafone, AWS, and Amdocs overcame numerous obstacles. This transformation highlights the scalability, flexibility, and cost-effectiveness of AWS for telecom operators modernizing their BSS ecosystems.
speakers: Domenico Bille; Don Mani; Alexandru Ionescu
services: Amazon CloudWatch; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
tags: SaaS; Well-Architected Framework; Innovation & Transformation; Business Applications; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Telecommunications; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Voice AI restaurant ordering platform powered by Amazon Nova Sonic
description: Build a serverless voice AI restaurant ordering system that harnesses the power of Amazon Nova Sonic and key AWS services. Create an intuitive platform that processes natural voice commands using Amazon Bedrock's AI capabilities, while implementing secure user authentication with Amazon Cognito and robust frontend development through AWS Amplify. The architecture seamlessly integrates Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB to simulate real-world restaurant ordering system APIs. By session's end, you'll master the implementation of a functional voice-powered ordering solution using cutting-edge AI technology and serverless services.
tags: Front-End Web & Mobile; Generative AI; Business Applications; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Professional Services; Retail & Consumer Goods; Enterprise; Interactive

title: Volkswagen Group's custom GenAI models for global brand consistency
description: Discover how Volkswagen Group, delivering 9.0 million vehicles annually across 115 global facilities, ensures brand consistency while scaling global marketing operations. Learn how VW transformed their marketing pipeline through two innovations: custom-finetuned image generation models creating on-brand visual content at scale, and pioneering work with Amazon Nova to automatically evaluate marketing assets against brand guidelines. As Nova's launch partner for customization, VW implemented preference tuning aligning AI with marketing experts' judgment. See how this intelligent system applies VW's unique brand standards across diverse markets, revolutionizing how a leading automaker maintains brand integrity while driving localized engagement.
speakers: Liam Byrne; Kim Robins; Weiran Zhang
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Nova
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Data Scientist; Tech Explorer; Advertising & Marketing; Manufacturing & Industrial; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Weather emergency advisor with Amazon Bedrock and Location Service
description: Explore advanced architectural patterns for AI-powered emergency response systems using Amazon Bedrock and serverless technologies. Dive deep into building resilient, scalable, and secure platforms. Discuss sophisticated prompt engineering for emergency context understanding, multi-modal foundation model orchestration, and complex data ingestion for real-time feeds. Examine advanced caching and query optimization for location services and high-availability patterns for mission-critical systems. Through collaborative whiteboarding, address real-world challenges including data consistency, distributed state management, and fault-tolerant notifications. Bring complex architectural questions for in-depth technical discussions on building robust, mission-ready emergency response solutions that can save lives and mitigate disaster impacts.
tags: Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Government; Public Sector; Interactive

title: Web3 + AI: Agents that mean business
description: AWS is accelerating Web3 development across diverse use cases, including AI agents entering the digital economy, through core infrastructure, specialized offerings, and partner solutions. Join AWS and Coinbase to dive deep into the fundamental building blocks and full-stack architecture where AI agents, powered by Amazon Bedrock, execute digital assets payments using open payment protocols over a public blockchain. To ensure transaction security, these agents are equipped with wallets built on AWS Nitro Enclaves. Join this session to learn how to leverage AWS and Coinbase technologies to shape the future of autonomous online payments.
speakers: Arvind Raghu; Joshua Smith; Erik Reppel
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Nova
tags: Blockchain; Culture of Security; Agentic AI; Application Integration; Artificial Intelligence; Security & Identity; Cloud Security Specialist; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Lecture-style

title: What's new in AWS cost Optimization
description: Discover the latest advancements in AWS cost optimization strategies and tools designed to help you operate cost-effectively while maintaining high performance. AWS continues to enhance its suite of management tools that monitor resource performance and costs, while providing recommendations for rightsizing and optimizing purchasing decisions. Join us to stay current with the latest best practices and tools for managing your AWS spending efficiently.
speakers: Mary Nachimov; Rick Ochs; Bonnie Firnstahl
services: AWS Billing and Cost Management; AWS Compute Optimizer; AWS Savings Plans
tags: Management & Governance; Cost Optimization; Cloud Operations; IT Administrator; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: What's new in AWS Data Processing
description: Explore the latest advancements in AWS Analytics designed to transform your data processing landscape. This session unveils powerful new capabilities across key services, including Amazon EMR for scalable big data processing, AWS Glue for seamless data integration, Amazon Athena for optimized querying, and Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) for workflow orchestration. Discover how these innovations can supercharge performance, optimize costs, and streamline your data ecosystem. Whether you're looking to enhance scalability, improve data integration, accelerate queries, or refine workflow management, join us to gain actionable insights that will position your organization at the forefront of data processing innovation.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon EMR; AWS Glue
tags: Generative AI; Cost Optimization; Analytics; Business Executive; Data Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: What's new with Amazon EBS
description: Stay ahead with the cutting-edge capabilities of Amazon's robust block storage solution in Amazon EBS. Join this session for a comprehensive overview of the latest advancements and features in Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS). Learn about recent performance improvements, cost optimization strategies, new features that enhance data resiliency and storage efficiency, and practical insights for leveraging EBS in modern cloud environments. You will gain a deeper understanding of how to maximize the potential of Amazon EBS for your workloads.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Architecture; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: What's new with Amazon QuickSight
description: Join this session to explore the latest innovations and features in Amazon Quicksight that are revolutionizing generative AI in BI. Expert presenters guide you through the exciting developments in Amazon QuickSight that are empowering organizations to establish robust enterprise Business Intelligence platforms.
tags: Lecture-style

title: What's new with Amazon S3
description: Amazon S3 consistently delivers new innovations to help you store, manage, analyze, and protect any amount of data for virtually any use case. Discover S3's latest breakthroughs including S3 Tables enhancements delivering fully managed Apache Iceberg support, S3 Vectors with native vector support at scale for AI applications, S3 Metadata for instant data discovery, and S3 Express One Zone's ultra-low latency performance. Learn how these innovations optimize for different data types and workloads, increase performance, simplify operations, and lower costs for analytics, AI/ML, and high-performance computing applications. This session provides implementation strategies, live demonstrations, and practical insights to immediately optimize your data architecture.
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: What's new with Amazon SageMaker in the era of unified data and AI
description: Learn the latest in data and AI development with the next generation of Amazon SageMaker. In this session, we'll cover new innovations that are transforming how enterprises build, deploy, and scale AI solutions. Dive deep into the features of SageMaker Unified Studio, discover the latest catalog capabilities, and see how our lakehouse architecture is breaking down silos between data, analytics, and AI. From streamlined development experiences to enterprise-grade governance, you'll discover why forward-looking organizations are making Amazon SageMaker their center for data, analytics, and AI.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon SageMaker; Amazon Q Developer
tags: Generative AI; Innovation & Transformation; Analytics; Business Executive; Data Engineer; Lecture-style

title: What's New with AWS Cost Management
description: Join us and learn new features in the AWS Cloud Financial Management portfolio that can transform how your organizations analyze, plan, and manage your cloud spending. In this session, explore new advanced data analytics capabilities, enhanced cost allocation features, and improved reporting tools that enable deeper financial insights. Learn how AWS is expanding its FinOps toolset with new AI-powered solutions and sophisticated data management features to support your cloud financial maturity journey.
speakers: Matt Berk; Bowen Wang (AWS); Matt Cowsert; Corey Quinn
tags: Management & Governance; Cost Optimization; Artificial Intelligence; Cloud Operations; Advisor / Consultant; IT Administrator; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: What's new with AWS File Storage
description: Amazon file storage services continue to deliver innovations to help enterprise customers and storage admins manage their file data more effectively. Dive into the latest capabilities designed to enhance file data accessibility and integration with modern cloud applications. Discover how shared file storage from Amazon EFS and Amazon FSx is evolving to meet the needs of compute-intensive and data-heavy workloads. Learn actionable insights on optimizing storage, improving data accessibility, and supporting growing enterprise application demands. Join us and move your business ahead with the cutting-edge capabilities of Amazon FSx and Amazon EFS.
services: Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS); Amazon FSx
tags: Global Infrastructure; Architecture; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Administrator; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: What's new with AWS Lambda
description: Discover the latest innovations in AWS Lambda that go beyond traditional event-driven applications. In this lightning talk, we'll showcase the game-changing capabilities that we just launched at re:Invent. Learn how these features can accelerate your development process and scale your applications effortlessly. Whether you're building proof-of-concept or production-ready solutions, see how Lambda's simplicity and power can help you deliver faster results for web applications, AI solutions, and event processing workloads.
tags: Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: What’s new in search, observability, and vector databases with OpenSearch
description: Discover the latest Amazon OpenSearch Service launches and capabilities that enable and quickly deploy agentic AI applications and vector search operations. Learn how new integrations with Amazon Q enable intelligent data discovery and automated insights, while enhanced Amazon S3 connectivity streamlines data management. This session showcases how our latest vector database optimizations accelerate AI/ML workloads for efficient development of agentic AI, semantic search, and recommendation systems. We'll demonstrate new cost optimization features and performance enhancements across all OpenSearch use cases, including significant updates to Observability. Whether you're building next-generation AI applications or scaling your existing search infrastructure, join us for a comprehensive update on new launches and releases that can transform your search and analytics capabilities.
speakers: Mukul Karnik; Carl Meadows; Corey Nolet
tags: Generative AI; Agentic AI; Analytics; Business Executive; Data Engineer; Data Scientist; Lecture-style

title: When security becomes fashionable: Gymshark's cloud security evolution
description: Learn how Gymshark protects its digital retail assets from emerging threats. We'll explore real-world attacks targeting e-commerce platforms, customer data, and intellectual property. Get practical insights on building a security strategy using Security Improvement Plans, AWS Backup, and modern access management to safeguard both creative and customer data.
tags: Cloud Operations; Interactive

title: Why customers choose AWS as their transformation partner for SAP
description: For decades, SAP has been the business process backbone for leading companies across nearly every industry,, and thousands of customers trust AWS for SAP. However, many customers who are still on-premises, and their impending SAP migration is part of a broader transformation they are undertaking– where SAP is a critical application, but just one of the components of something bigger. In this session, customers will walk through their cloud roadmaps, reflect on their ongoing journeys to RISE with SAP on AWS, and share how they are partnering with Amazon to chart the future for their organization.
services: Amazon Bedrock; Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); AWS SDK for SAP ABAP
tags: Generative AI; SAP; Innovation & Transformation; Business Applications; Migration & Modernization; Business Executive; IT Executive; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Lecture-style

title: Winning the DDoS Battle with AWS WAF
description: Join this hands-on workshop to learn how to defend your web applications against DDoS attacks and malicious bots using AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront. You'll build and deploy real-world protections - writing WAF rules to block bot traffic, mitigate volumetric attacks, and apply anti-DDoS resilience patterns at the edge. Walk through threat response strategies, configuration best practices, and monitoring techniques. This session is ideal for builders managing web apps, CDN architectures, and security controls. Bring your laptop - you�ll leave ready to fight back.
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Working with S3 Metadata: From basic queries to custom metadata
description: Explore practical applications of S3 Metadata's live inventory and journal tables to enhance data discovery and management. Join this technical discussion to understand how these Apache Iceberg tables track object changes and provide current bucket snapshots. Learn to write effective SQL queries using Amazon Athena and other analytics tools, then dive into strategies for integrating your own custom metadata with S3 object attributes. Share your use cases as we examine patterns for combining standard object metadata with application-specific information to build comprehensive data insights. Discuss real-world scenarios for implementing metadata-driven workflows at scale.
services: Amazon Athena; Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
tags: Business Intelligence; Management & Governance; Automation; Analytics; Storage; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Wrangling chaos: Atoms of emergence
description: Distributed systems are made up of protocols, requests, retries, and feedback loops that can lead to emergent behaviors and metastable failures—even at surprisingly small scales. Through dependent probability, simulation, control theory, and other modeling techniques, discover precisely how counter-intuitive behaviors emerge in websystems. Learn to build stable systems that can wrangle these behaviors in production environments.
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Architecture; Academic / Researcher; Advisor / Consultant; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Write Deploy and Monitor CloudFront Functions & Key Value Store
description: Get hands-on with the latest features of Amazon CloudFront Functions in this interactive builder session. You'll write and deploy real-time JavaScript powered by the Key Value Store, enabling ultra-low latency logic at the edge. Explore this year's newest capabilities, learn how to monitor and troubleshoot your functions in production, and harness Amazon Q Developer to accelerate development with AI-powered assistance. Bring your laptop and walk away with practical skills to build, deploy, and optimize edge compute solutions confidently
tags: Networking & Content Delivery; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Write less code: Building applications with a serverless mindset [REPEAT]
description: Building with a serverless mindset focuses on business value. You can derive more value by using built-in integrations between AWS services set up through configuration than by writing glue code. This hands-on session explores patterns for using direct service integrations using Amazon API Gateway, AWS Step Functions, and Amazon EventBridge. Discover the efficiency of utilizing configuration to streamline development tasks, and push the heavy lifting to AWS.
speakers: Yossi Chai; Nati Goldberg; Maya Morav Freiman; James Ngai; Uri Segev
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Write less code: Building applications with a serverless mindset [REPEAT]
description: Building with a serverless mindset focuses on business value. You can derive more value by using built-in integrations between AWS services set up through configuration than by writing glue code. This hands-on session explores patterns for using direct service integrations using Amazon API Gateway, AWS Step Functions, and Amazon EventBridge. Discover the efficiency of utilizing configuration to streamline development tasks, and push the heavy lifting to AWS.
speakers: Yossi Chai; Nati Goldberg; Maya Morav Freiman; James Ngai; Uri Segev
tags: Event-Driven Architecture; Lambda-Based Applications; Serverless; Application Integration; Serverless & Containers; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Your data is your moat: Integrating AWS-native tools into agents
description: Agents are only as useful as the tools they can access. This session will teach you how to extend your agents with first-party AWS tools such as Browser, Code Interpreter, and—most importantly—data access primitives like Aurora, Redshift, and vector-enabled S3. We’ll demonstrate how these services unlock enterprise use cases by giving agents secure, direct access to structured and semi-structured data. Learn how to register these tools with AgentCore Gateway, manage access through Identity, and invoke them via Runtime, all while maintaining compliance and observability. Join us for a deep dive into tool-enabled, data-rich agent design.
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Interactive

title: Zero to launch: Deploy identity-aware agents with Amazon Bedrock
description: Transform your AI prototypes into secure, scalable enterprise applications. This hands-on workshop teaches you to deploy enterprise-grade agents using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Runtime, which seamlessly scales from zero to thousands of concurrent sessions while maintaining complete session isolation. You'll use AgentCore Identity to integrate with existing providers for authentication and access control. Through practical exercises, you'll build reliable, secure agents ready for large-scale deployment—all without the complexity of managing infrastructure or developing custom authentication systems.
speakers: Jared Dean; Maira Ladeira Tanke; Vadim Omeltchenko; Shreyas Subramanian
tags: Generative AI; Machine Learning; Artificial Intelligence; Business Applications; Business Executive; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Financial Services; Software & Internet; Developer Community; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Zero to production: Simplify AI deployments with Amazon EKS Auto Mode
description: Ready to run GenAI workloads on Kubernetes without the operational complexity? Join this chalk talk to learn how Amazon EKS Auto Mode simplifies the journey from concept to production for your GenAI projects. Through whiteboarding, we will explore real-world implementations for LLM inference, training pipelines, and RAG applications. Learn how EKS Auto Mode's built-in GPU support, automatic scaling, and managed infrastructure eliminate operational overhead, allowing teams to focus on innovation.
tags: Generative AI; Automation; Kubernetes; Artificial Intelligence; Compute; Serverless & Containers; DevOps Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Interactive

title: Zero-Downtime at Scale: Migrating Peacock's Global Streaming to EKS
description: Journey through the strategic migration of a major streaming platform from self-managed Kubernetes to Amazon EKS. Learn how, in less than 12 months, a multi-region transition was orchestrated spanning 200+ applications with zero service disruption for more than 41M subscribers. We'll explore the technical patterns, infrastructure automation, and collaboration strategies that enabled seamless cutover while maintaining developer productivity. Discover practical insights for planning large-scale EKS migrations and building resilient multi-region architectures.
tags: Global Infrastructure; Resilience; Industry Solutions; Developer / Engineer; DevOps Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Media & Entertainment; Enterprise; Lecture-style

title: Zero-Training Visual Defect Detection Using Amazon Nova
description: Transform your visual quality inspection process using Amazon Nova generative AI models, with no extensive image training required. This workshop covers core prompting techniques for quality inspection, defect detection with overlay visualization, and end-to-end solution integration. We will also cover Amazon Bedrock Model Distillation for cost optimization and integration with AWS IoT Greengrass to support low-latency applications and shopfloor deployment. You will leave with practical skills to implement visual quality inspection immediately with no computer vision or data science expertise required. Participants are welcome to bring their own image dataset to test.
tags: Generative AI; Internet of Things; Machine Learning; Industry Solutions; Data Engineer; Developer / Engineer; Solution / Systems Architect; Automotive; Energy & Utilities; Manufacturing & Industrial; Hands-on; Interactive

title: Zoox: Building Machine Learning Infrastructure for Autonomous Vehicles
description: Discover how Zoox leverages AWS Machine Learning infrastructure to revolutionize autonomous vehicle development. Learn how we process thousands of multi-modal sequences daily using Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, SLURM, FSx, S3, and EKS in a streamlined machine learning environment that supports both rapid experimentation and production-scale training. We'll share how our integrated monitoring solution reduced manual analysis by 85% while scaling to support thousands of vehicle analysis use cases.
speakers: Avinash Kolluri; Jim Robinson-Bohnslav; Anindya Saha
tags: Learning from Amazon; Architecture; Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style

title: 3x faster data migration with AWS Data Transfer Terminal
description: Discover how AWS Data Transfer Terminal is transforming large-scale data migrations in this dynamic lightning talk. Through 100 Gbps fiber optic connections, secure private facilities, and customer-controlled devices, Data Transfer Terminal delivers unprecedented efficiency and security for your most demanding data transfer needs. Through real-world case studies and comparisons with existing AWS transfer services, you'll learn how Data Transfer Terminal can advance your enterprise data migration strategy, enabling faster, more secure, and scalable transfers.
services: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3); AWS DataSync; AWS Data Transfer Terminal
tags: Innovation & Transformation; Customer Enablement; Migration & Modernization; Storage; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; System Administrator; Lecture-style

title: 4x faster workload modernization with agentic AI
description: Discover how to transform enterprise workloads up to 4x faster through the strategic implementation of agentic AI. This lightning talk demonstrates how to evolve your architectural practice from periodic updates to a dynamic, continuous discipline leveraging the AWS Well-Architected Tool and AWS Transform. Learn to systematically evaluate your infrastructure using the AWS Well-Architected Framework's proven methodologies, develop comprehensive data-driven modernization roadmaps, and expedite transformations through AWS Transform's capabilities.
tags: Well-Architected Framework; Innovation & Transformation; Agentic AI; Artificial Intelligence; Migration & Modernization; Developer / Engineer; IT Professional / Technical Manager; Solution / Systems Architect; Lecture-style

title: 5-Star Customer Service: Duolingo's Path to Compute Savings
description: Amazon was founded over offering customers low prices across our wide selection of services. When Duolingo looked to optimize their cloud investments, they experienced this firsthand through their Technical Account Manager (TAM). In this session, Duolingo leaders and their TAM will share their journey: from the TAM’s approach to identifying cost savings to Duolingo’s experience implementing AWS Graviton processors. You’ll hear how the methodology—from cost analysis and proof of concept, through enterprise-wide implementation—led to significant savings. Together, they’ll demonstrate how the TAM’s focus on customer success exemplifies AWS’s commitment to 5-star service, resulting in business value for Duolingo.
speakers: Brent Everman; Seth Fox; Jean-Paul Bonny
services: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2); Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS); Amazon EC2 - Graviton
tags: Cost Optimization; Innovation & Transformation; Compute; Migration & Modernization; Lecture-style

title: 5k Race
description:
Participate in the AWS re:Invent 5K, an invigorating dawn run, or walk, full of excitement including a DJ, breakfast stations, and photo opportunities. 
Mandalay Bay, Michelob Ultra Arena

title: 800GB of AI data: Lessons from a failed project
description: What happens when an ambitious AI project runs into scale, cost, and data hurdles? This session examines the attempt to process 800GB of gameplay data with AI and the technical roadblocks that prevented completion. Learn about the infrastructure bottlenecks, data preparation issues, and cost overruns that derailed the effort. Discover practical lessons to apply when managing large-scale AI workloads on AWS.
tags: Artificial Intelligence; Lecture-style
